At the risk of her own, was the telling rejoinder of his interlocutor, none the less effective for the moderate and measured tone in which it was delivered. At the Royal Canal bridge, from his hoarding, Mr Eugene Stratton, his blub lips agrin, bade all comers welcome to Pembroke township. At the same time he inwardly chuckled over his gentle repartee to the blood and ouns champion about his god being a jew. At the siege of Ross did my father fall. At the siege of Ross his father, at Gorey all his brothers fell. At this intelligence, in which he seemingly evinced little interest, Mr Bloom gazed abstractedly for the space of a half a second or so in the direction of a bucketdredger, rejoicing in the farfamed name of Eblana, moored alongside Customhouse quay and quite possibly out of repair, whereupon he observed evasively: —Everybody gets their own ration of luck, they say. At this pertinent suggestion Mr Bloom, to change the subject, looked down but in a quandary, as he couldn’t tell exactly what construction to put on belongs to which sounded rather a far cry. At this remark passed obviously in the spirit of where ignorance is bliss Mr B. and Stephen, each in his own particular way, both instinctively exchanged meaning glances, in a religious silence of the strictly entre nous variety however, towards where Skin-the-Goat, alias the keeper, not turning a hair, was drawing spurts of liquid from his boiler affair. A wandering crone, lowly form of an immortal serving her conqueror and her gay betrayer, their common cuckquean, a messenger from the secret morning. Aware of their greed and cunning he shook the powdery crumb from his hands. A wariness of mind he would answer as fitted all and, laying hand to jaw, he said dissembling, as his wont was, that as it was informed him, who had ever loved the art of physic as might a layman, and agreeing also with his experience of so seldomseen an accident it was good for that mother Church belike at one blow had birth and death pence and in such sort deliverly he scaped their questions. Bannon in a cut bob which are now in with dance cloaks of Kendal green that was new got to town from Mullingar with the stage where his coz and Mal M’s brother will stay a month yet till Saint Swithin and asks what in the earth he does there, he bound home and he to Andrew Horne’s being stayed for to crush a cup of wine, so he said, but would tell him of a skittish heifer, big of her age and beef to the heel, and all this while poured with rain and so both together on to Horne’s. BEAUFOY: Shouts. BEAUFOY: You low cad! Beautiful! Beautiful on that tre her voice is: weeping tone. Beautiful weather it was, delightful indeed. Beauty and peace have not done it away. Beauty and the beast. Beauty is not there. Beauty: it curves: curves are beauty. Beauty of music you must hear twice. Be a warm day I fancy. Be back in a minute. Be candid for once. Because a nature full and volatile in its free state, was alternately the agent and reagent of attraction. Because at the critical turningpoint of human existence he desired to amend many social conditions, the product of inequality and avarice and international animosity. Because attraction between agents and reagents at all instants varied, with inverse proportion of increase and decrease, with incessant circular extension and radial reentrance. Because he closed my carriage door outside sir Thornley Stoker’s one sleety day during the cold snap of February ninetythree when even the grid of the wastepipe and the ballstop in my bath cistern were frozen. Because he comes from Oxford. Because he had forgotten and because he remembered that he had reminded himself twice not to forget. Because he had observed with augmenting frequency in the preceding members of the same series the same concupiscence, inflammably transmitted, first with alarm, then with understanding, then with desire, finally with fatigue, with alternating symptoms of epicene comprehension and apprehension. Because he more than suspected he had his father’s voice to bank his hopes on which it was quite on the cards he had so it would be just as well, by the way no harm, to trail the conversation in the direction of that particular red herring just to. Because he no pay me my moneys? Because he saw me on the polo ground of the Phoenix park at the match All Ireland versus the Rest of Ireland. Because he was up one time in a knacker’s yard. Because I did. Because if they didn’t believe they’d go straight to heaven when they die they’d try to live better, at least so I think. Because I’m away from. Because in immature impatience he had treated with disrespect certain beliefs and practices. Because in middle youth he had often sat observing through a rondel of bossed glass of a multicoloured pane the spectacle offered with continual changes of the thoroughfare without, pedestrians, quadrupeds, velocipedes, vehicles, passing slowly, quickly, evenly, round and round and round the rim of a round and round precipitous globe. Because it’s all arranged. Because it was a little canarybird that came out of its little house to tell the time that Gerty MacDowell noticed the time she was there because she was as quick as anything about a thing like that, was Gerty MacDowell, and she noticed at once that that foreign gentleman that was sitting on the rocks looking was Cuckoo Cuckoo Cuckoo. Because it was a task for a superior intelligence to substitute other more acceptable phenomena in the place of the less acceptable phenomena to be removed. Because life is a stream. Because mostly they appeared to imagine he came from Carrick-on-Shannon or somewhereabouts in the county Sligo. Because of course uptodate tourist travelling was as yet merely in its infancy, so to speak, and the accommodation left much to be desired. Because of his fluctuating incertitude as to whether this observation had or had not been already made by him to Stephen or by Stephen to him. Because of the surety of the sense of touch in his firm full masculine feminine passive active hand. —Because she never let them in, Mr Deasy said solemnly. Because she wished to goodness they’d take the snottynosed twins and their babby home to the mischief out of that so that was why she just gave a gentle hint about its being late. Because some years previously in 1886 when occupied with the problem of the quadrature of the circle he had learned of the existence of a number computed to a relative degree of accuracy to be of such magnitude and of so many places, e.g., the 9th power of the 9th power of 9, that, the result having been obtained, 33 closely printed volumes of 1000 pages each of innumerable quires and reams of India paper would have to be requisitioned in order to contain the complete tale of its printed integers of units, tens, hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, hundreds of thousands, millions, tens of millions, hundreds of millions, billions, the nucleus of the nebula of every digit of every series containing succinctly the potentiality of being raised to the utmost kinetic elaboration of any power of any of its powers. Because the acoustics, the resonance changes according as the weight of the water is equal to the law of falling water. Because the controlled contemplation of the fluctuation of attraction produced, if desired, a fluctuation of pleasure. Because their wombs. Because the odour inhaled corresponded to other odours inhaled of other ungual fragments, picked and lacerated by Master Bloom, pupil of Mrs Ellis’s juvenile school, patiently each night in the act of brief genuflection and nocturnal prayer and ambitious meditation. Because the poor animals suffer and experts say and the best known remedy that doesn’t cause pain to the animal and on the sore spot administer gently. Because the theme of the false or the usurping or the adulterous brother or all three in one is to Shakespeare, what the poor are not, always with him. Because the way to daughter led through mother, the way to mother through daughter. Because the weight of the water, no, the weight of the body in the water is equal to the weight of the what? Because they are imbued with the proper spirit. Because they want it themselves. Because those spice islands, Cinghalese this morning, smell them leagues off. —Because you don’t save, Mr Deasy said, pointing his finger. Because you get it out of all holes and corners. Because you have the cursed jesuit strain in you, only it’s injected the wrong way. —Because, you see, says Bloom, for an advertisement you must have repetition. Because you were so foreign from the others. Become invisible. Bed: ed. Beefeaters reply, winding clarions of welcome. Beef to the heel. Been to the seaside. Been walking in muck somewhere. Beer beef battledog buybull businum barnum buggerum bishop. Beer, beef, business, bibles, bulldogs battleships, buggery and bishops. Beer, beef, trample the bibles. Beerpull. Before. Before and after. Before born bliss babe had. Before departing he requested that it should be told to his dear son Patsy that the other boot which he had been looking for was at present under the commode in the return room and that the pair should be sent to Cullen’s to be soled only as the heels were still good. Before him Father Conroy and the reverend John Hughes S. J. bend low. Before him the gunwale of a boat, sunk in sand. Before my patience are exhausted. Before Rudy was born. Before sitting down he peered through a chink up at the nextdoor windows. Before the huge high door of the Irish house of parliament a flock of pigeons flew. Before the mirror the matrimonial gift of Alderman John Hooper with a clear melancholy wise bright motionless compassionate gaze regarded Bloom while Bloom with obscure tranquil profound motionless compassionated gaze regarded the matrimonial gift of Luke and Caroline Doyle. Beg. Beggar. Beggar my neighbour is his motto. Beggar’s bush. Beggar somewhere. Begin! Begin all right: then hear chords a bit off: feel lost a bit. Beginning to tell on him now: that backache of his, I fear. Begins and ends morally. Begins to feel cold and clammy. Begin to be forgotten. Begin to get ready. Beg up! —Beg your pardon, says he. Behind. Behind a bull: in front of a horse. Behind her lord, his helpmate, bing awast to Romeville. Being afraid to marry on earth They masturbated for all they were worth. Being a levelheaded individual who could give points to not a few in point of shrewd observation he also remarked on his very dilapidated hat and slouchy wearing apparel generally testifying to a chronic impecuniosity. Besides they don’t know. Besides they have so little taste in dress, most of them, which greatly enhances a woman’s natural beauty, no matter what you say. Besides they say if the flower withers she wears she’s a flirt. Besides, though taste latterly had deteriorated to a degree, original music like that, different from the conventional rut, would rapidly have a great vogue as it would be a decided novelty for Dublin’s musical world after the usual hackneyed run of catchy tenor solos foisted on a confiding public by Ivan St Austell and Hilton St Just and their genus omne. White’s, the pawnbroker’s, at the corner of Arran street west stroking his nose with his forefinger, undecided whether he should arrive at Phibsborough more quickly by a triple change of tram or by hailing a car or on foot through Smithfield, Constitution hill and Broadstone terminus. Between the Saxon smile and yankee yawp. Between this point and the high at present unlit warehouses of Beresford place Stephen thought to think of Ibsen, associated with Baird’s the stonecutter’s in his mind somehow in Talbot place, first turning on the right, while the other who was acting as his fidus Achates inhaled with internal satisfaction the smell of James Rourke’s city bakery, situated quite close to where they were, the very palatable odour indeed of our daily bread, of all commodities of the public the primary and most indispensable. Bloom, having the advantage of ten seconds at the initiation and taking, from the concave surface of a spoon along the handle of which a steady flow of heat was conducted, three sips to his opponent’s one, six to two, nine to three. Bloom, holding the hat and ashplant, stands erect. Bloom holds his high grade hat over his genital organs. Bloom holds up his right hand on which sparkles the Koh-i-Noor diamond. BLOOM: How? BLOOM: Humbly kisses her long hair. BLOOM: Hurriedly. BLOOM: I? BLOOM: I am going to scream. BLOOM: I beg. BLOOM: I beg. BLOOM: I can give you... BLOOM: I have forgotten for the moment. BLOOM: I mean, Leopardstown. BLOOM: Impassionedly. BLOOM: In alderman’s gown and chain. BLOOM: In an oatmeal sporting suit, a sprig of woodbine in the lapel, tony buff shirt, shepherd’s plaid Saint Andrew’s cross scarftie, white spats, fawn dustcoat on his arm, tawny red brogues, fieldglasses in bandolier and a grey billycock hat. BLOOM: In a seamless garment marked I. Bloom in a torn frockcoat stained with whitewash, dinged silk hat sideways on his head, a strip of stickingplaster across his nose, talks inaudibly. BLOOM: In babylinen and pelisse, bigheaded, with a caul of dark hair, fixes big eyes on her fluid slip and counts its bronze buckles with a chubby finger, his moist tongue lolling and lisping. BLOOM: In caubeen with clay pipe stuck in the band, dusty brogues, an emigrant’s red handkerchief bundle in his hand, leading a black bogoak pig by a sugaun, with a smile in his eye. BLOOM: In court dress. BLOOM: In dalmatic and purple mantle, to the bishop of Down and Connor, with dignity. BLOOM: Indistinctly. BLOOM: Infatuated. BLOOM: In flunkey’s prune plush coat and kneebreeches, buff stockings and powdered wig. Bloom, in gloom, looms down. BLOOM: In housejacket of ripplecloth, flannel trousers, heelless slippers, unshaven, his hair rumpled: softly. BLOOM: In red fez, cadi’s dress coat with broad green sash, wearing a false badge of the Legion of Honour, picks up the card hastily and offers it. BLOOM: In Svengali’s fur overcoat, with folded arms and Napoleonic forelock, frowns in ventriloquial exorcism with piercing eagle glance towards the door. BLOOM: In tattered mocassins with a rusty fowlingpiece, tiptoeing, fingertipping, his haggard bony bearded face peering through the diamond panes, cries out. BLOOM: In triumph. BLOOM: In workman’s corduroy overalls, black gansy with red floating tie and apache cap. BLOOM: In youth’s smart blue Oxford suit with white vestslips, narrowshouldered, in brown Alpine hat, wearing gent’s sterling silver waterbury keyless watch and double curb Albert with seal attached, one side of him coated with stiffening mud. Bloom is a cod. —Bloom is at the telephone, he said. BLOOM: I saw him, kipkeeper! BLOOM: I say, look... BLOOM: I stand for the reform of municipal morals and the plain ten commandments. BLOOM: Is this Mrs Mack’s? BLOOM: It overpowers me. BLOOM: I wanted then to have now concluded. BLOOM: I want to tell you a little secret about how I came to be here. BLOOM: I was indecently treated, I... BLOOM: I was just going back for that lotion whitewax, orangeflower water. BLOOM: I was just going home by Gardiner street when I happened to... BLOOM: I was precocious. BLOOM: I will but is it wise? BLOOM: Justice! BLOOM: Keep to the right, right, right. BLOOM: Lapses are condoned. BLOOM: Laughing witch! BLOOM: Let’s walk on. BLOOM: Lifts a turtle head towards her lap. Bloom listened. Bloom looked at the head of a horse not worth anything like sixtyfive guineas, suddenly in evidence in the dark quite near so that it seemed new, a different grouping of bones and even flesh because palpably it was a fourwalker, a hipshaker, a blackbuttocker, a taildangler, a headhanger putting his hind foot foremost the while the lord of his creation sat on the perch, busy with his thoughts. Bloom looked, unblessed to go. BLOOM: Looks behind. BLOOM: Looks downwards and perceives her unfastened bootlace. BLOOM: Looks down with a sheepish grin. Bloom looped, unlooped, noded, disnoded. BLOOM: Low, secretly, ever more rapidly. BLOOM: Mamma! BLOOM: Meaningfully dropping his voice. BLOOM: Miriam. BLOOM: Mixed races and mixed marriage. BLOOM: Molly! BLOOM: Mumbles. Bloom, mumbling, his eyes downcast, begins to bestow his parcels in his filled pockets but desists, muttering. Bloom mur: best references. BLOOM: Murmurs lovingly. BLOOM: Murmurs with hangdog meekness glum. BLOOM: My beloved subjects, a new era is about to dawn. BLOOM: My spine’s a bit limp. BLOOM: My subjects! BLOOM: Nes. BLOOM: Night. BLOOM: No, but... Bloom, nodding, said he perfectly understood and begged him to go on by all means which he did. BLOOM: Nods rapidly. BLOOM: No, in Sandycove, I believe, from what he let drop. BLOOM: No, no. BLOOM: No, no, no. BLOOM: No thoroughfare. BLOOM: Not I! BLOOM: Not likely. BLOOM: Not to lace the wrong eyelet as I did the night of the bazaar dance. BLOOM: Obdurately. Bloom of Crawford’s journal sitting snug with a covey of wags, likely brangling fellows, Dixon jun., scholar of my lady of Mercy’s, Vin. BLOOM: Offhandedly. BLOOM: Off side. BLOOM: O, I know. BLOOM: O, I so want to be a mother. Bloom, only born male transubstantial heir of Rudolf Virag subsequently Rudolph Bloom of Szombathely, Vienna, Budapest, Milan, London and Dublin and of Ellen Higgins, second daughter of Julius Higgins born Karoly and Fanny Higgins born Hegarty. BLOOM: On this day twenty years ago we overcame the hereditary enemy at Ladysmith. BLOOM: O. Shocked, on weak hams, he halts. BLOOM: Over Stephen’s shoulder. Bloom, parting them swiftly, draws his caliph’s hood and poncho and hurries down the steps with sideways face. Bloom passes. Bloom pats with parcelled hands watch, fobpocket, bookpocket, pursepoke, sweets of sin, potato soap. BLOOM: Pawing the heather abjectly. BLOOM: Pay them, my friend. BLOOM: Peering over the crowd. Bloom picks it up and throws it in the grate. BLOOM: Pigeonbreasted, bottleshouldered, padded, in nondescript juvenile grey and black striped suit, too small for him, white tennis shoes, bordered stockings with turnover tops and a red schoolcap with badge. BLOOM: Placing his right hand on his testicles, swears. BLOOM: Plaintively. Bloom, pleading not guilty and holding a fullblown waterlily, begins a long unintelligible speech. BLOOM: Pleased to hear from you, Chris. Bloom plodges forward again through the sump. BLOOM: Poetry. BLOOM: Points to his hand. BLOOM: Points to the navvy. BLOOM: Poor man! BLOOM: Produces from his heartpocket a crumpled yellow flower. BLOOM: Propping him. Bloom puts out her timid head. BLOOM: Quickly. BLOOM: Quickly. BLOOM: Quietly. BLOOM: Quietly lays a half sovereign on the table between Bella and Florry. Bloom raises his head. Bloom, raising a policeman’s whitegloved hand, blunders stifflegged out of the track. BLOOM: Reflecting. BLOOM: Reflects precautiously. BLOOM: Regretfully. Bloom releases his hand and writes idly on the table in backhand, pencilling slow curves. BLOOM: Repentantly. BLOOM: Rosemary also did I understand you to say or willpower over parasitic tissues. BLOOM: Rubs his hands cheerfully. BLOOM: Runs to Lynch. BLOOM: Runs to Stephen. BLOOM: Rushes to the hall, rushes back. Bloom’s acts? —Bloom, says he. —Bloom, says he. Bloom’s bodyguard distribute Maundy money, commemoration medals, loaves and fishes, temperance badges, expensive Henry Clay cigars, free cowbones for soup, rubber preservatives in sealed envelopes tied with gold thread, butter scotch, pineapple rock, billets doux in the form of cocked hats, readymade suits, porringers of toad in the hole, bottles of Jeyes’ Fluid, purchase stamps, 40 days’ indulgences, spurious coins, dairyfed pork sausages, theatre passes, season tickets available for all tramlines, coupons of the royal and privileged Hungarian lottery, penny dinner counters, cheap reprints of the World’s Twelve Worst Books: Froggy And Fritz politic, Care of the Baby infantilic, 50 Meals for 7/6 culinic, Was Jesus a Sun Myth? historic, Expel that Pain medic, Infant’s Compendium of the Universe cosmic, Let’s All Chortle hilaric, Canvasser’s Vade Mecum journalic, Loveletters of Mother Assistant erotic, Who’s Who in Space astric, Songs that Reached Our Heart melodic, Pennywise’s Way to Wealth parsimonic. Bloom’s boys run amid the bystanders with branches of hawthorn and wrenbushes. BLOOM’S BOYS: The wren, the wren, The king of all birds, Saint Stephen’s his day Was caught in the furze. BLOOM: Scared. BLOOM: Scared, hats himself, steps back, then, plucking at his heart and lifting his right forearm on the square, he gives the sign and dueguard of fellowcraft. BLOOM: Science. BLOOM: Screams. Bloom’s decision? BLOOM: Seizes her wrist with his free hand. Bloom set the candlestick on the floor. Bloom’s features relax. BLOOM: Shakes Cissy Caffrey’s shoulders. BLOOM: Shakes hands with both of the watch in turn. Bloom shakes his head in mute mirthful reply. BLOOM: Shaking hands with a blind stripling. BLOOM: She counterassaulted. BLOOM: She is rather lean. BLOOM: Shifts from foot to foot. BLOOM: Shocked. BLOOM: Shoot him! BLOOM: Shoves them back, loudly. BLOOM: Shrinks. BLOOM: Shuddering, shrinking, joins his hands: with hangdog mien. Bloom signed to Pat, bald Pat is a waiter hard of hearing, to set ajar the door of the bar. BLOOM: Simply satisfying a need I... BLOOM: Smiles, nods slowly. BLOOM: Smiles yellowly at the three whores. BLOOM: Snatches up Stephen’s ashplant. BLOOM: Solemnly. BLOOM: Solemnly. Bloom squeals, turning turtle. BLOOM: Squire of dames, in dinner jacket with wateredsilk facings, blue masonic badge in his buttonhole, black bow and mother-of-pearl studs, a prismatic champagne glass tilted in his hand. BLOOM: Stammers. Bloom stands aside. Bloom stands, smiling desirously, twirling his thumbs. Bloom starts forward involuntarily and, half closing the door as he passes, takes the chocolate from his pocket and offers it nervously to Zoe. BLOOM: Starts up, seizes her hand. Bloom stays with nurse a thought to send a kind word to happy mother and nurseling up there. Bloom, stifflegged, aging, bends over her hoof and with gentle fingers draws out and in her laces. Bloom surveys uncertainly the three whores then gazes at the veiled mauve light, hearing the everflying moth. Bloom’s weather. Bloom takes J. J. O’Molloy’s hand and raises it to his lips. BLOOM: Takes the chocolate. BLOOM: Ten and six. BLOOM: Terrified. BLOOM: Thank you, mistress. BLOOM: Thank you, sir. BLOOM: Thank you, sir. BLOOM: That is one pound six and eleven. BLOOM: The friend of man. BLOOM: The just man falls seven times. Bloom there for a languor he had but was now better, he having dreamed tonight a strange fancy of his dame Mrs Moll with red slippers on in a pair of Turkey trunks which is thought by those in ken to be for a change and Mistress Purefoy there, that got in through pleading her belly, and now on the stools, poor body, two days past her term, the midwives sore put to it and can’t deliver, she queasy for a bowl of riceslop that is a shrewd drier up of the insides and her breath very heavy more than good and should be a bullyboy from the knocks, they say, but God give her soon issue. BLOOM: Tries to laugh. BLOOM: Turns to the gallery. BLOOM: Uncloaks impressively, revealing obesity, unrolls a paper and reads solemnly. Bloom uncovers himself but, seeing them, frowns, then smiles, preoccupied. BLOOM: Undecided. Bloom ungyved his crisscrossed hands and with slack fingers plucked the slender catgut thong. Bloom unwound slowly the elastic band of his packet. BLOOM: Urgently. Bloom viewed a gallant pictured hero in Lionel Marks’s window. Bloom walks on a net, covers his left eye with his left ear, passes through several walls, climbs Nelson’s Pillar, hangs from the top ledge by his eyelids, eats twelve dozen oysters shells included, heals several sufferers from king’s evil, contracts his face so as to resemble many historical personages, Lord Beaconsfield, Lord Byron, Wat Tyler, Moses of Egypt, Moses Maimonides, Moses Mendelssohn, Henry Irving, Rip van Winkle, Kossuth, Jean Jacques Rousseau, Baron Leopold Rothschild, Robinson Crusoe, Sherlock Holmes, Pasteur, turns each foot simultaneously in different directions, bids the tide turn back, eclipses the sun by extending his little finger. Bloom walks on with Mrs Breen. BLOOM: Warding off a blow. Bloom was pointing out all the stars and the comets in the heavens to Chris Callinan and the jarvey: the great bear and Hercules and the dragon, and the whole jingbang lot. Bloom was talking and talking with John Wyse and he quite excited with his dunducketymudcoloured mug on him and his old plumeyes rolling about. BLOOM: Weakly. BLOOM: Wearing a purple Napoleon hat with an amber halfmoon, his fingers and thumb passing slowly down to her soft moist meaty palm which she surrenders gently. BLOOM: Well, I follow a literary occupation, author-journalist. Bloom went by Barry’s. BLOOM: What? BLOOM: What is that? BLOOM: What railway opera is like a tramline in Gibraltar? BLOOM: When my progenitor of sainted memory wore the uniform of the Austrian despot in a dank prison where was yours? BLOOM: When you made your present choice they said it was beauty and the beast. Bobbob lapping it for the inner alderman. Bob Cowley lent him his for the Wicklow regatta concert last year and never heard tidings of it from that good day to this. Bonsoir la compagnie. Boody asked. Boody asked. Boody, breaking big chunks of bread into the yellow soup, added: —Our father who art not in heaven. Boody cried angrily: —Crickey, is there nothing for us to eat? Boody sat down at the table and said hungrily: —Give us it here. Boody stamped her foot and threw her satchel on the table. Boof! —Boohoo! Books you were going to write with letters for titles. Book through to eternity junction, the nonstop run. Boomed crashing chords. Boosed at five o’clock. Booted the twain and staved. Boots giving evidence. Bopeep! Bored Bloom tambourined gently with I am just reflecting fingers on flat pad Pat brought. Bore this. Bore this funeral affair. Born all in the dark wormy earth, cold specks of fire, evil, lights shining in the darkness. Born courtesan. Born out of bedlock hereditary epilepsy is present, the consequence of unbridled lust. Born with a knife. Born with a silver knife in his mouth. —Bosh! Bosom I saw, both full, throat warbling. Bosses the show. Both. Both admitted the alternately stimulating and obtunding influence of heterosexual magnetism. Both are masked with Matthew Arnold’s face. Both babe and parent now glorify their Maker, the one in limbo gloom, the other in purgefire. Both ends meet. Bothered, he wanted Power and cider. Both indurated by early domestic training and an inherited tenacity of heterodox resistance professed their disbelief in many orthodox religious, national, social and ethical doctrines. Both preferred a continental to an insular manner of life, a cisatlantic to a transatlantic place of residence. Both salute with fierce hostility. Both satisfied. Both then were silent? Both unconscious. Both were sensitive to artistic impressions, musical in preference to plastic or pictorial. Bottle of lager. —Bottles out there, say. Bottle with story of a treasure in it, thrown from a wreck. Bought it at the governor’s auction. Bought the Irish Field now. Bought to hide her face, meeting someone might know her, bend down or carry a bunch of flowers to smell. Bound for their troughs. Bound thee forth, my booklet, quick To greet the callous public. Bous Stephanoumenos. Bout ship. Bovril, by James. Bow, bondslave, before the throne of your despot’s glorious heels so glistening in their proud erectness. Bowel trouble. Bowls them over. Bowsing nowt but claretwine. —Boyd? BOYLAN: A merry twinkle in his eye. BOYLAN: Clasps himself. Boylan, eyed, eyed. BOYLAN: Holding up four thick bluntungulated fingers, winks. BOYLAN: Jumps surely from the car and calls loudly for all to hear. Boylan plunged two quid on my tip Sceptre for himself and a lady friend. BOYLAN: Sated, smiles. BOYLAN’S VOICE: Sweetly, hoarsely, in the pit of his stomach. BOYLAN: To Bloom, over his shoulder. BOYLAN: Tosses him sixpence. Boys are they? Boys, do it now. Boys from High school are perched on the lampposts, telegraph poles, windowsills, cornices, gutters, chimneypots, railings, rainspouts, whistling and cheering. Boys will be boys. Boys will be boys and our two twins were no exception to this golden rule. Brainfogfag. Brains on their sleeve like the statue in Glasnevin. Brain thinks. Braintipped, cheek touched with flame, they listened feeling that flow endearing flow over skin limbs human heart soul spine. Brasses braying asses through uptrunks. Brats’ clamour. Brave. Bravely he bore his stumpy body forward on spatted feet, squaring his shoulders. —Bravo! Bravo! Bravo, Simon! Breach of promise. Bread and butter, four, sugar, spoon, her cream. Bread, butter, honey. Bread cast on the waters. —Breadsoda is very good, Davy Byrne said. Bread, the staff of life, earn your bread, O tell me where is fancy bread, at Rourke’s the baker’s it is said. Breakdown. —Breakdown, Martin Cunningham said. Breakfast is ready. Breaking down, he began to weep to himself quietly, stumbling a little in his walk. Break my spirit, all of you, if you can! Break the news to her gently, Aubrey! Break your neck and we’ll break our sides. Breath? Breathe a prayer, drop a tear. Breathe a prayer, drop a tear, good men, good people. Breathe evenly! Breathe it deep into thee. Breathlessly. Bred in the bone. Breen. —Breen, says Alf. Brewery barge with export stout. Bridebed, childbed, bed of death, ghostcandled. Bridie! BRIDIE: Hatch street. Bridie Kelly! Brief exposure. Briefly, as well as I can bring them to mind, his words were these. Briefly, putting two and two together, six sixteen which he pointedly turned a deaf ear to, Antonio and so forth, jockeys and esthetes and the tattoo which was all the go in the seventies or thereabouts even in the house of lords because early in life the occupant of the throne, then heir apparent, the other members of the upper ten and other high personages simply following in the footsteps of the head of the state, he reflected about the errors of notorieties and crowned heads running counter to morality such as the Cornwall case a number of years before under their veneer in a way scarcely intended by nature, a thing good Mrs Grundy, as the law stands, was terribly down on though not for the reason they thought they were probably whatever it was except women chiefly who were always fiddling more or less at one another it being largely a matter of dress and all the rest of it. Brigade! Brightly the keys, all twinkling, linked, all harpsichording, called to a voice to sing the strain of dewy morn, of youth, of love’s leavetaking, life’s, love’s morn. Bright midges dance on walls. Brighton, Margate. Bright’s! Bright’s bright eye. Brilliant ide. Brimstone fires spring up. Brimstone they called it raining down: the cities of the plain: Sodom, Gomorrah, Edom. Bring all your powers of fascination to bear on them. Bring a stranger within thy tower it will go hard but thou wilt have the secondbest bed. Bringing his host down and kneeling he heard twine with his second bell the first bell in the transept he is lifting his and, rising, heard now I am lifting their two bells he is kneeling twang in diphthong. Bring in our chippendale chair. Brings back her girlhood. Brings on white fluxions. Brings out the darkness of her eyes. Bring Starkey. Brings you a bit nearer every time. Bring the camera whenever you like. Bring your own bread and butter. BRINI, PAPAL NUNCIO: In papal zouave’s uniform, steel cuirasses as breastplate, armplates, thighplates, legplates, large profane moustaches and brown paper mitre. Brisk in a galliard he was off, out. Bristow, at Whitehall lane, London: Carr, Stoke Newington, of gastritis and heart disease: Cockburn, at the Moat house, Chepstow... British Beatitudes! Broad daylight. Broke his glasses? Broken heart. Broken hoops on the shore; at the land a maze of dark cunning nets; farther away chalkscrawled backdoors and on the higher beach a dryingline with two crucified shirts. Broke them yesterday. Bronze and rose. Bronze by a weary gold, anear, afar, they listened. [ 11 ] Bronze by gold heard the hoofirons, steelyringing. Bronze by gold, miss Douce’s head by miss Kennedy’s head, over the crossblind of the Ormond bar heard the viceregal hoofs go by, ringing steel. Bronze by gold, Miss Kennedy’s head by Miss Douce’s head, appeared above the crossblind of the Ormond hotel. Bronze by gold they whisper. Bronze by the window, watched, bronze from afar. Bronzedouce communing with her rose that sank and rose sought Blazes Boylan’s flower and eyes. Bronze gazed far sideways. Bronze, listening, by the beerpull gazed far away. Bronzelydia by Minagold. Bronze whiteness. Broo! Brood of mockers: Photius, pseudomalachi, Johann Most. Brother Buzz. BROTHER BUZZ: Invests Bloom in a yellow habit with embroidery of painted flames and high pointed hat. BROTHER BUZZ: Then perform a miracle like Father Charles. Brothers and sisters had he none. Brothers-in-law: relations. Brothers of the great white lodge always watching to see if they can help. Brother Swan was the person to see. Broth of a boy. Brown brillantined hair over his collar. Brown, Robinson and Co. Brown scapulars in tatters, defending her both ways. Brrfoo! B. R. Slattery, O. M. I.; the very rev. Brummagem England was toppling already and her downfall would be Ireland, her Achilles heel, which he explained to them about the vulnerable point of Achilles, the Greek hero, a point his auditors at once seized as he completely gripped their attention by showing the tendon referred to on his boot. Brunswick street. Brutal, why not? Bubble and squeak. Bubbly jock! Bubbly jock! —Buccinator muscle is... Buckled he is. Buck Mulligan answered. Buck Mulligan asked. Buck Mulligan asked. Buck Mulligan asked impatiently. Buck Mulligan at once put on a blithe broadly smiling face. Buck Mulligan attacked the hollow beneath his underlip. Buck Mulligan bent across the table gravely. Buck Mulligan bent across to Stephen and said with coarse vigour: —You put your hoof in it now. Buck Mulligan brought up a florin, twisted it round in his fingers and cried: —A miracle! Buck Mulligan cried. Buck Mulligan cried. Buck Mulligan cried, jumping up from his chair. Buck Mulligan erect, with joined hands before him, said solemnly: —He who stealeth from the poor lendeth to the Lord. Buck Mulligan flaunted his slip and panama. Buck Mulligan frowned at the lather on his razorblade. Buck Mulligan frowned quickly and said: —What? Buck Mulligan gleefully bent back, laughing to the dark eavesdropping ceiling. Buck Mulligan, hewing thick slices from the loaf, said in an old woman’s wheedling voice: —When I makes tea I makes tea, as old mother Grogan said. Buck Mulligan, his pious eyes upturned, prayed: —Blessed Margaret Mary Anycock! Buck Mulligan kicked Stephen’s foot under the table and said with warmth of tone: —Wait till you hear him on Hamlet, Haines. Buck Mulligan laid it across his heaped clothes. Buck Mulligan made way for him to scramble past and, glancing at Haines and Stephen, crossed himself piously with his thumbnail at brow and lips and breastbone. Buck Mulligan peeped an instant under the mirror and then covered the bowl smartly. Buck Mulligan rapped John Eglinton’s desk sharply. Buck Mulligan’s again heavy face eyed Stephen awhile. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said. Buck Mulligan said in the same tone. Buck Mulligan sat down in a sudden pet. Buck Mulligan sat down to unlace his boots. Buck Mulligan’s face smiled with delight. Buck Mulligan’s gay voice went on. BUCK MULLIGAN: Shakes his curling capbell. BUCK MULLIGAN: She’s beastly dead. Buck Mulligan showed a shaven cheek over his right shoulder. Buck Mulligan sighed and, having filled his mouth with a crust thickly buttered on both sides, stretched forth his legs and began to search his trouser pockets. Buck Mulligan sighed tragically and laid his hand on Stephen’s arm. Buck Mulligan slit a steaming scone in two and plastered butter over its smoking pith. Buck Mulligan slung his towel stolewise round his neck and, bending in loose laughter, said to Stephen’s ear: —O, shade of Kinch the elder! Buck Mulligan’s primrose waistcoat shook gaily to his laughter. Buck Mulligan stood on a stone, in shirtsleeves, his unclipped tie rippling over his shoulder. Buck Mulligan stood up from his laughing scribbling, laughing: and then gravely said, honeying malice: —I called upon the bard Kinch at his summer residence in upper Mecklenburgh street and found him deep in the study of the Summa contra Gentiles in the company of two gonorrheal ladies, Fresh Nelly and Rosalie, the coalquay whore. Buck Mulligan suddenly linked his arm in Stephen’s and walked with him round the tower, his razor and mirror clacking in the pocket where he had thrust them. Buck Mulligan suspired amorously. Buck Mulligan’s voice sang from within the tower. Buck Mulligan’s watchful eyes saw the waitress come. Buck Mulligan swung round on his heel. Buck Mulligan thought, puzzled: —Shakespeare? he said. Buck Mulligan tossed the fry on to the dish beside him. Buck Mulligan turned suddenly for an instant towards Stephen but did not speak. Buck Mulligan, walking forward again, raised his hands. Buck Mulligan went on hewing and wheedling: —So I do, Mrs Cahill, says she. Buck Mulligan wiped again his razorblade. Buck Mulligan wiped the razorblade neatly. Buddha their god lying on his side in the museum. Buenas noches, señorita. Bugger off, Harry. Built on bread and onions. Bulbul! Bulldog on the premises. Bulldosing the public! Bullockbefriending. Bullockbefriending bard. Bully about the muzzle he looks. Bumboosers, save your stamps. Burblblburblbl! Burgundy. Burial friendly society pays. Buried the poor husband but progressing favourably on the premium. Burke’s! Burke’s! Burke’s! outflings my lord Stephen, giving the cry, and a tag and bobtail of all them after, cockerel, jackanapes, welsher, pilldoctor, punctual Bloom at heels with a universal grabbing at headgear, ashplants, bilbos, Panama hats and scabbards, Zermatt alpenstocks and what not. Bursting with money and indigestion. Burst open. Burst sideways like a sheep in clover Dedalus says he will. Bury him cheap in a whatyoumaycall. Burying him. Burying his grandmother. Burying the dead. Bury the dead. Bushe defended him. —Bushe? the editor said. Buss her, wap in rogues’ rum lingo, for, O, my dimber wapping dell! Busy looking. But... But act. But all those twenty years what do you suppose poor Penelope in Stratford was doing behind the diamond panes? But a long threatening comes at last, they say. —But a lovely mummer! he murmured to himself. But anon they were overcome with grief and clasped their hands for the last time. But are you sure of that? But as before the lightning the serried stormclouds, heavy with preponderant excess of moisture, in swollen masses turgidly distended, compass earth and sky in one vast slumber, impending above parched field and drowsy oxen and blighted growth of shrub and verdure till in an instant a flash rives their centres and with the reverberation of the thunder the cloudburst pours its torrent, so and not otherwise was the transformation, violent and instantaneous, upon the utterance of the word. But as for that the two misdemeanants, wrapped up as they largely were in one another, could safely afford to ignore it as they very largely did till the matter was put in the hands of a solicitor who filed a petition for the party wronged in due course. But as he confidently anticipated there was not a sign of a Jehu plying for hire anywhere to be seen except a fourwheeler, probably engaged by some fellows inside on the spree, outside the North Star hotel and there was no symptom of its budging a quarter of an inch when Mr Bloom, who was anything but a professional whistler, endeavoured to hail it by emitting a kind of a whistle, holding his arms arched over his head, twice. But as luck would have it the jarvey got the nag’s head round the other way and off with him. But a step in the required direction it was beyond yea or nay and both monetarily and mentally it contained no reflection on his dignity in the smallest and it often turned in uncommonly handy to be handed a cheque at a muchneeded moment when every little helped. But, because loss is his gain, he passes on towards eternity in undiminished personality, untaught by the wisdom he has written or by the laws he has revealed. But be damned but they smelt her out and swore her in on the spot a master mason. But begob I was just lowering the heel of the pint when I saw the citizen getting up to waddle to the door, puffing and blowing with the dropsy, and he cursing the curse of Cromwell on him, bell, book and candle in Irish, spitting and spatting out of him and Joe and little Alf round him like a leprechaun trying to peacify him. But, begob, Joe was equal to the occasion. But being brought back to life no. But being lost they fear. But beshrew me, he cried, clapping hand to his forehead, tomorrow will be a new day and, thousand thunders, I know of a marchand de capotes, Monsieur Poyntz, from whom I can have for a livre as snug a cloak of the French fashion as ever kept a lady from wetting. But by and by, as said, this evening after sundown, the wind sitting in the west, biggish swollen clouds to be seen as the night increased and the weatherwise poring up at them and some sheet lightnings at first and after, past ten of the clock, one great stroke with a long thunder and in a brace of shakes all scamper pellmell within door for the smoking shower, the men making shelter for their straws with a clout or kerchief, womenfolk skipping off with kirtles catched up soon as the pour came. But one evening, says Mr Dixon, when the lord Harry was cleaning his royal pelt to go to dinner after winning a boatrace he had spade oars for himself but the first rule of the course was that the others were to row with pitchforks he discovered in himself a wonderful likeness to a bull and on picking up a blackthumbed chapbook that he kept in the pantry he found sure enough that he was a lefthanded descendant of the famous champion bull of the Romans, Bos Bovum, which is good bog Latin for boss of the show. But the slap and the blessing stood him friend, says Mr Vincent, for to make up he taught him a trick worth two of the other so that maid, wife, abbess and widow to this day affirm that they would rather any time of the month whisper in his ear in the dark of a cowhouse or get a lick on the nape from his long holy tongue than lie with the finest strapping young ravisher in the four fields of all Ireland. By them, the man with my voice and my eyes and a ghostwoman with ashes on her breath. By the narrator a limitation of activity, mental and corporal, inasmuch as complete mental intercourse between himself and the listener had not taken place since the consummation of puberty, indicated by catamenic hemorrhage, of the female issue of narrator and listener, 15 September 1903, there remained a period of 9 months and 1 day during which, in consequence of a preestablished natural comprehension in incomprehension between the consummated females listener and issue, complete corporal liberty of action had been circumscribed. Horne Lic. in Midw., F. K. Q. C. P. I. is the able and popular master, he is reported by eyewitnesses as having stated that once a woman has let the cat into the bag an esthete’s allusion, presumably, to one of the most complicated and marvellous of all nature’s processes—the act of sexual congress she must let it out again or give it life, as he phrased it, to save her own. Ce pif qu’il a! —Certainly, certainly, certainly. Certainly in every public work which in it anything of gravity contains preparation should be with importance commensurate and therefore a plan was by them adopted whether by having preconsidered or as the maturation of experience it is difficult in being said which the discrepant opinions of subsequent inquirers are not up to the present congrued to render manifest whereby maternity was so far from all accident possibility removed that whatever care the patient in that allhardest of woman hour chiefly required and not solely for the copiously opulent but also for her who not being sufficiently moneyed scarcely and often not even scarcely could subsist valiantly and for an inconsiderable emolument was provided. C., 5 Dame street, Dublin, Jerusalem, the holy city with mosque of Omar and gate of Damascus, goal of aspiration, the straits of Gibraltar the unique birthplace of Marion Tweedy, the Parthenon containing statues of nude Grecian divinities, the Wall street money market which controlled international finance, the Plaza de Toros at La Linea, Spain where O’Hara of the Camerons had slain the bull, Niagara over which no human being had passed with impunity, the land of the Eskimos eaters of soap, the forbidden country of Thibet from which no traveller returns, the bay of Naples to see which was to die, the Dead Sea. Childish device. Child, man, effigy. Children. Children always want to throw things in the sea. Children fighting for the scrapings of the pot. Children’s hands always round them. Ci rifletta. —Ci rifletterò, Stephen said, glancing down the solid trouserleg. CISSY CAFFREY: Alarmed, seizes Private Carr’s sleeve. Cissy Caffrey bent over to him to tease his fat little plucks and the dainty dimple in his chin. Cissy Caffrey cuddled the wee chap for she was awfully fond of children, so patient with little sufferers and Tommy Caffrey could never be got to take his castor oil unless it was Cissy Caffrey that held his nose and promised him the scatty heel of the loaf or brown bread with golden syrup on. CISSY CAFFREY: Her voice soaring higher. CISSY CAFFREY: I gave it to Molly Because she was jolly, The leg of the duck, The leg of the duck. CISSY CAFFREY: I was in company with the soldiers and they left me to do—you know, and the young man run up behind me. CISSY CAFFREY: More luck to me. Cissy Caffrey played with baby Boardman till he crowed with glee, clapping baby hands in air. CISSY CAFFREY: Pulling Private Carr. CISSY CAFFREY: Shrill. Cissy Caffrey’s voice, still young, sings shrill from a lane. CISSY CAFFREY: They’re going to fight. CISSY CAFFREY: To the crowd. Cissy Caffrey whistled, imitating the boys in the football field to show what a great person she was: and then she cried: —Gerty! CISSY CAFFREY: With expectation. CISSY CAFFREY: Yes, to go with him. Cissy came up along the strand with the two twins and their ball with her hat anyhow on her to one side after her run and she did look a streel tugging the two kids along with the flimsy blouse she bought only a fortnight before like a rag on her back and a bit of her petticoat hanging like a caricature. Cissy queried. Cissy said thanks and came back with her tongue out and said uncle said his waterworks were out of order. Cissy said to excuse her would he mind please telling her what was the right time and Gerty could see him taking out his watch, listening to it and looking up and clearing his throat and he said he was very sorry his watch was stopped but he thought it must be after eight because the sun was set. Cissy’s quick motherwit guessed what was amiss and she whispered to Edy Boardman to take him there behind the pushcar where the gentleman couldn’t see and to mind he didn’t wet his new tan shoes. Cissy’s your girl. Cissy wiped his little mouth with the dribbling bib and wanted him to sit up properly and say pa pa pa but when she undid the strap she cried out, holy saint Denis, that he was possing wet and to double the half blanket the other way under him. Comfortress of the afflicted. Coming. Coming all that way: Spain, Gibraltar, Mediterranean, the Levant. Coming down here ragging after the boatraces and paying nothing. Coming up redheaded curates from the county Leitrim, rinsing empties and old man in the cellar. Commendatore Beninobenone having been extricated from underneath the presidential armchair, it was explained by his legal adviser Avvocato Pagamimi that the various articles secreted in his thirtytwo pockets had been abstracted by him during the affray from the pockets of his junior colleagues in the hope of bringing them to their senses. Concluding by inspection but erroneously that his silent companion was engaged in mental composition he reflected on the pleasures derived from literature of instruction rather than of amusement as he himself had applied to the works of William Shakespeare more than once for the solution of difficult problems in imaginary or real life. Concussion. Condense Stephen’s commentary. Condole with her. Conductor’s legs too, bagstrousers, jiggedy jiggedy. Confession. Confidence in himself, an equal and opposite power of abandonment and recuperation. Confused light confuses memory. Con.: Honourable members are already in possession of the evidence produced before a committee of the whole house. Conmee himself! Conmee: Martin Cunningham knows him: distinguishedlooking. Connoisseurs. Conscience. Conscious that the human organism, normally capable of sustaining an atmospheric pressure of 19 tons, when elevated to a considerable altitude in the terrestrial atmosphere suffered with arithmetical progression of intensity, according as the line of demarcation between troposphere and stratosphere was approximated from nasal hemorrhage, impeded respiration and vertigo, when proposing this problem for solution, he had conjectured as a working hypothesis which could not be proved impossible that a more adaptable and differently anatomically constructed race of beings might subsist otherwise under Martian, Mercurial, Veneral, Jovian, Saturnian, Neptunian or Uranian sufficient and equivalent conditions, though an apogean humanity of beings created in varying forms with finite differences resulting similar to the whole and to one another would probably there as here remain inalterably and inalienably attached to vanities, to vanities of vanities and to all that is vanity. Contemporaneously, a heated argument having arisen between Mr Delegate Madden and Mr Candidate Lynch regarding the juridical and theological dilemma created in the event of one Siamese twin predeceasing the other, the difficulty by mutual consent was referred to Mr Canvasser Bloom for instant submittal to Mr Coadjutor Deacon Dedalus.
