CORNY KELLEHER: Ah, well, he’ll get over it. Corny Kelleher and the boy followed with their wreaths. Corny Kelleher, asquint, drawls at the horse. Corny Kelleher closed his long daybook and glanced with his drooping eye at a pine coffinlid sentried in a corner. Corny Kelleher fell into step at their side. CORNY KELLEHER: From the car, standing. Corny Kelleher gave one wreath to the boy and one to the brother-in-law. CORNY KELLEHER: Good night, men. Corny Kelleher he has Harvey Duff in his eye. CORNY KELLEHER: I’ll see to that. CORNY KELLEHER: Laughs. CORNY KELLEHER: Laughs, pointing his thumb over his right shoulder to the car brought up against the scaffolding. Corny Kelleher, laying a wreath at each fore corner, beckoned to the boy to kneel. CORNY KELLEHER: Leave it to me, sergeant. Corny Kelleher locked his largefooted boots and gazed, his hat downtilted, chewing his blade of hay. CORNY KELLEHER: Nudges the second watch. Corny Kelleher on the sideseat sways his head to and fro in sign of mirth at Bloom’s plight. Corny Kelleher opened the sidedoors and the gravediggers came in, hoisted the coffin again, carried it out and shoved it on their cart. Corny Kelleher replies with a ghastly lewd smile. Corny Kelleher returns to the outside car and mounts it. Corny Kelleher said. CORNY KELLEHER: Scratches his nape. Corny Kelleher sped a silent jet of hayjuice arching from his mouth while a generous white arm from a window in Eccles street flung forth a coin. Corny Kelleher stepped aside from his rank and allowed the mourners to plod by. Corny Kelleher stood by the opened hearse and took out the two wreaths. CORNY KELLEHER: Sure it was Behan our jarvey there that told me after we left the two commercials in Mrs Cohen’s and I told him to pull up and got off to see. CORNY KELLEHER: To the watch, with drawling eye. Corny Kelleher, weepers round his hat, a death wreath in his hand, appears among the bystanders. CORNY KELLEHER: Winking. —Corny might have given us a more commodious yoke, Mr Power said. Corpse. Corpse brought in through a secret door in the wall. Corpse of milk. Corpus: body. Corpuscle islands. Corpus meum. Corpus paradisum. Correct me but I always understood that the act so performed by skittish humans with glimpses of lingerie appealed to you in virtue of its exhibitionististicicity. Corsets for men. Costive. Cosy curtains. Cosy smell of her bathwater. Cot’s plood and prandypalls, none! Couch a hogshead with me then. Cough it up. Cough it up, man. Could ask him. —Could a swim duck? says I. Could Bloom of 7 Eccles street foresee Bloom of Flowerville? Could buy one of those silk petticoats for Molly, colour of her new garters. Could do it myself. Could have given that address too. Could have made oceans of money. Could hear a pin drop. Could hear them all at it. Could he walk in a beeline if he hadn’t that cane? Could I go to see Leah tonight, I wonder. Could make a kind of pun on that. Could meet one Sunday after the rosary. Could never like it again after Rudy. Couldn’t ask him at a funeral, though. Couldn’t eat a morsel here. Couldn’t hear what the band played. Couldn’t he fly a bit higher than that, eh? Couldn’t loosen her farting strings but old cod’s eye was waltzing around her showing her how to do it. Couldn’t sink if you tried: so thick with salt. —Couldn’t, Stephen contrived to get out, his mental organs for the moment refusing to dictate further. Couldn’t swallow it all however. Couldn’t they invent something automatic so that the wheel itself much handier? Couldn’t you do the Yeats touch? Could see her in the bedroom from the hearth unclamping the busk of her stays: white. Could whistle in his own ear. Could you? Could you try your hand at it yourself? COUNCILLOR LORCAN SHERLOCK: Carried unanimously. COUNCILLOR NANNETTI: Alone on deck, in dark alpaca, yellowkitefaced, his hand in his waistcoat opening, declaims. Counted them. —Count me out, he managed to remark, meaning work. Countrybred chawbacon. Country bumpkin’s queries. Country roads. Cours de mains! Course. Course everything is dear if you don’t want it. Course hundreds of times you think of a person and don’t meet him. Course I never could throw anything straight at school. Course it was a bloody barney. Course nerves a bit. Course then you’d have all the cranks pestering. Course they do. Course they were on the wrong side. Cours la Reine. Court dresses of all descriptions in castle chambers dancing. Courteous offer a fair trial. Courtesy or an inward light? Courthouse my eye and your pockets hanging down with gold and silver. Courting death. Cousin. Cousin Stephen, you will never be a saint. Covered with kisses! Cowley, he stuns himself with it: kind of drunkenness. Cowley it is. Cowley lay back. Cowley sang: —M’appari tutt’amor: Il mio sguardo l’incontr... Cowley’s red lugs and bulging apple in the door of the sheriff’s office. Cows in Connacht have long horns. CRAB: In bushranger’s kit. —Cracked lookingglass of a servant! Cracking curriculum. Cracking his jokes too: warms the cockles of his heart. Cramped in this carriage. Cranly, I his mute orderly, following battles from afar. Cranly’s arm. Cranly’s eleven true Wicklowmen to free their sireland. Crape weepers. Crates lined up on the quayside at Jaffa, chap ticking them off in a book, navvies handling them barefoot in soiled dungarees. Crawford will follow. Creaky wardrobe. Cream. Cream sunshades. Creation from nothing. Creation from nothing and miracles and a personal God. Cremation better. Cribbed out of Meredith. Cricket weather. Crickey, I’m about sprung. Cries of sellers in the streets. Cries of valour. Criminal diversion? Crished! Crème de la crème. Croak of vast manless moonless womoonless marsh. Crocodile tears! Crofton? CROFTON: This is indeed a festivity. Croisé! Crooked as a ram’s horn. Crooked botched print. Crooked skirt swinging, whack by. Croppies lie down. Crossbuns. Crosseyed Walter sir I did sir. Crossguns bridge: the royal canal. Crosslegged under an umbrel umbershoot he thrones an Aztec logos, functioning on astral levels, their oversoul, mahamahatma. Cross Ringabella haven mooncarole. Crotthers was there at the foot of the table in his striking Highland garb, his face glowing from the briny airs of the Mull of Galloway. Crouching by a patient cow at daybreak in the lush field, a witch on her toadstool, her wrinkled fingers quick at the squirting dugs. Crowded on the spit of land silent shapes appeared, white, sorrowful, holding out calm hands, knelt in grief, pointing. Crowding together they strapped and buckled their satchels, all gabbling gaily: —A riddle, sir? Crown of thorns and cross. Crows and touts, hoarse bookies in high wizard hats clamour deafeningly. Crucial moment. Crucifix not thick enough? Cruel. Cruel. Cruel it seems. Cruel one! Cruelty behind it all. Cruelty to animals so it is to let that bloody povertystricken Breen out on grass with his beard out tripping him, bringing down the rain. Crumbs? Crumbs adhered to the tissue of his lips. Crush, crack, crick, crick. Crushing in the winepress grapes of Burgundy. Crusted toenails too. Crusty old topers in wigs. Crybabby! —Cry you mercy, gentlemen, he said humbly. C’était le sacré pigeon, Philippe. Cubicle number so and so. Cuck Mulligan clucked lewdly. —Cuckoo! Cuckoo! Cuckoo. Cuckoo. Cuckoo. Cuffe sold them about twentyseven quid each. Cui bono? Culo rotto! Cult of the beautiful. Cunning old Scotch hunks. CUNTY KATE: Blushing deeply. CUNTY KATE: I did. CUNTY KATE: Indeed, yes. CUNTY KATE: The brave and the fair. Cup of tea now. Cup of tea soon. Cuprani too, printer. Cure for a red nose. Curiosity. Curiosity like a nun or a negress or a girl with glasses. Curious. —Curious coincidence, Mr Bloom confided to Stephen unobtrusively. Curious, fifteenth of the month too. Curious longing I. Curiously they are on the right. Curious mice never squeal. Curious she an only child, I an only child. Curious the life of drifting cabbies. Curious types. Curly cabbage à la duchesse de Parme. Curlycues of chords. Curran, ten guineas. Cursed by God. Cursed dog I met. Curse it. Curse me for a fool that didn’t buy that lot Craig and Gardner told me about. Curse seems to dog it. —Curse your bloody blatant soul, Mr Dedalus cried, turning on him. Curse your noisy pugnose. Curtain up. Custom his country perhaps. Cut and come again. Cute as a shithouse rat. Cute old codger. Cuts off their diddies when they can’t bear no more children. Cut up! Cut with grass or paper worst. Cut your hand open. Cypherjugglers going the highroads. Cyril Sargent: his name and seal. Daly’s. DAMES DONATE DUBLIN’S CITS SPEEDPILLS VELOCITOUS AEROLITHS, BELIEF —It gives them a crick in their necks, Stephen said, and they are too tired to look up or down or to speak. Damn all else they are good for. Damn all they know or care about anything with their long noses stuck in nosebags. Damn bad ad. Damn dangerous thing. Damn death. Damned glad I didn’t do it in the bath this morning over her silly I will punish you letter. Damned hard to answer. Damned Irish language, language of our forefathers. Damned old tub pitching about. Damn good gin that was. Damn her. Damn it. Damn it! Damn like him. Damn that fellow’s noise in the street. Damn your lithia water. Damp night reeking of hungry dough. Dance! Dance! Dance. —Dan Dawson’s land Mr Dedalus said. Dander along all day. Dandruff on his shoulders. Dandy tan shoe of dandy Boylan socks skyblue clocks came light to earth. Dane vikings, torcs of tomahawks aglitter on their breasts when Malachi wore the collar of gold. Dangle that before her. Dan Occam thought of that, invincible doctor. Dans ce bordel où tenons nostre état. Dare it. Daren’t joke about the dead for two years at least. Daresay Corny Kelleher bagged the job for O’Neill’s. Daresay he writes him an odd shaky cheque or two on gale days. Daresay lots of officers are in the swim too. Daresay she felt I. Dark caves of carpet shops, big man, Turko the terrible, seated crosslegged, smoking a coiled pipe. Dark devilish appearance. Dark dome received, reverbed. Dark lady and fair man. Darkly they are there behind this light, darkness shining in the brightness, delta of Cassiopeia, worlds. Dark men they call them. Darkness is in our souls do you not think? Dark poplars, rare white forms. Darkshawled figures of the circumcised, in sackcloth and ashes, stand by the wailing wall. —Darling! Darling, I saw, your. Dash it all. Daughter engaged to that chap in the inland revenue office with the motor. —Daughter of the regiment. Daughter working the machine in the parlour. Davy Byrne asked, coming from his book. Davy Byrne came forward from the hindbar in tuckstitched shirtsleeves, cleaning his lips with two wipes of his napkin. Davy Byrne said... Davy Byrne said. Davy Byrne said. Davy Byrne, sated after his yawn, said with tearwashed eyes: —And is that a fact? Davy Byrne smiledyawnednodded all in one: —Iiiiiichaaaaaaach! DAVY BYRNE: Yawning. DAVY STEPHENS: Messenger of the Sacred Heart and Evening Telegraph with Saint Patrick’s Day supplement. Davy Stephens, minute in a large capecoat, a small felt hat crowning his ringlets, passed out with a roll of papers under his cape, a king’s courier. Davy Stephens, ringletted, passes with a bevy of barefoot newsboys. Day!... Day!... Day. Day. Day by day: night by night: lifted, flooded and let fall. —Day, gentlemen. Day I caught her in the street pinching her cheeks to make them red. —Day, Mr Byrne. Day: then the night. Day the wheel of the black Maria peeled off my shoe at Leonard’s corner. Day we went out for the pleasure cruise in the Erin’s King, throwing them the sack of old papers. D. B. Murphy. D. B. Murphy of Carrigaloe. —Dead! Dead animal even sadder. Dead: an old woman’s: the grey sunken cunt of the world. Dead breaths I living breathe, tread dead dust, devour a urinous offal from all dead. Dead cod! Dead drunk on the porter. Deaden the gnaw of hunger that way. Dead he wasn’t. Deadhouse handy underneath. Deadly agony. Dead March from Saul. Dead meat trade. Dead noise. —Dead! says Alf. Dead side of the street this. Deaf bald Pat brought pad knife took up. Deaf beetle he is. Deaf, bothered. Deaf wait while they wait. Dear, dear, dear. DEAR DIRTY DUBLIN Dubliners. Dearer far than song or wine. Dearer than the whole world would she be to him and gild his days with happiness. Dearest Papli. Dearest Papli. Dearest Papli Thanks ever so much for the lovely birthday present. Dear Ger, that you? Dear Henry fled. Dear Henry I got your last letter to me and thank you very much for it. Dear Henry, when will we meet? Dear Henry wrote: dear Mady. Dear Mr Editor, what is a good cure for flatulence? Dear, O dear! Dear old friends! Death. Death by misadventure. Death is the highest form of life. Deathmoths. Deaths. Death’s number. Death, that is. Debating societies. Debit £. s. d. De boys up in de hayloft. Debts of honour. Decamping. Decent fellow Joe when he has it but sure like that he never has it. Decent fellow, John O’Connell, real good sort. —Decent little soul he was, Mr Power said to the stalwart back of long John Fanning ascending towards long John Fanning in the mirror. Decent quiet man he is. Decent soul. Deciduously! Declare misery. Declare to God he does. Declare to God I could hear it hit the pit of my stomach with a click. Declare to my aunt he’d talk about it for an hour so he would and talk steady. Decline, despair. Decline, poor chap. Decoy. Decoy duck. —Decree nisi, says J. J. And Bloom letting on to be awfully deeply interested in nothing, a spider’s web in the corner behind the barrel, and the citizen scowling after him and the old dog at his feet looking up to know who to bite and when. Dedalus! —Dedalus, come down, like a good mosey. Dedalus’ daughter there still outside Dillon’s auctionrooms. —Dedalus has it, Buck Mulligan said. Dee. Deep as a drawwell. Deep in Leinster street by Trinity’s postern a loyal king’s man, Hornblower, touched his tallyho cap. Deepsounding. Deep voice that fellow Dlugacz has. Defrauding widows and orphans. Deine Kuh Trübsal melkest Du. Delahunt of Camden street had the catering and yours truly was chief bottlewasher. Delayed. Delirium all you hid all your life. Demesne situate in the townland of Rosenallis, barony of Tinnahinch. Demimondaine. Demimondaines nicely handsome sparkling of diamonds very amiable costumed. Demme, does not Doctor O’Gargle chuck the nuns there under the chin. De mortuis nil nisi prius. Denis Breen in skimpy frockcoat and blue canvas shoes shuffled out of Harrison’s hugging two heavy tomes to his ribs. Denis Breen, whitetallhatted, with Wisdom Hely’s sandwichboards, shuffles past them in carpet slippers, his dull beard thrust out, muttering to right and left. Denis Breen with his tomes, weary of having waited an hour in John Henry Menton’s office, led his wife over O’Connell bridge, bound for the office of Messrs Collis and Ward. Denis Carey. Denis Florence M’Carthy’s Poetical Works copper beechleaf bookmark at p. Denis will be like that one of these days. Dense clouds roll past. Denzille lane this way. Depends on the time they were born I suppose. Depends on where. Deploying to the left our light horse swept across the heights of Plevna and, uttering their warcry Bonafide Sabaoth, sabred the Saracen gunners to a man. Deportment. Descende, calve, ut ne nimium decalveris. Describe the alterations effected in the disposition of the articles of furniture. Describe them. [ 14 ] Deshil Holles Eamus. Deshil Holles Eamus. Deshil Holles Eamus. Desire’s wind blasts the thorntree but after it becomes from a bramblebush to be a rose upon the rood of time. Desire to grig people. Desolation. Destiny. Destiny. Destitution: the inmate of Old Man’s House Royal Hospital, Kilmainham, the inmate of Simpson’s Hospital for reduced but respectable men permanently disabled by gout or want of sight. Destruction! Deus in adiutorium. Deux irlandais, nous, Irlande, vous savez ah, oui! Developing waterways. —Devil a much, says I. Devil a sweet fear! Devil in that picture of sinner’s death showing him a woman. Devilled crab. Devilling for the other firm. Devil of a job it was collecting accounts of those convents. Devils if they lose sixpence. Devils they are when that’s coming on them. Devil to open them too. Devil you are. Devour contents in the street. Dewdrop coming down again. Dew falling. —Dialectic, Stephen answered: and from his mother how to bring thoughts into the world. Diaphane, adiaphane. —Dice lui, però! Dicers and thimbleriggers we hurried by after the hoofs, the vying caps and jackets and past the meatfaced woman, a butcher’s dame, nuzzling thirstily her clove of orange. —Di che? Dick Adams, the besthearted bloody Corkman the Lord ever put the breath of life in, and myself. Dick Tivy bald? Dictates of common sense. Did Bloom accept the invitation to dinner given then by the son and afterwards seconded by the father? Did Bloom discover common factors of similarity between their respective like and unlike reactions to experience? Diddlediddle dumdum Diddlediddle... Diddleiddle addleaddle ooddleooddle. Did either openly allude to their racial difference? Did, faith. Did he? Did heart leap to heart? Did he attribute this homonymity to information or coincidence or intuition? Did he depict the scene verbally for his guest to see? Did he fall? Did he find four separating forces between his temporary guest and him? Did he find the problems of the inhabitability of the planets and their satellites by a race, given in species, and of the possible social and moral redemption of said race by a redeemer, easier of solution? Did he not lie in bed, the gross boar, gloating over a nauseous fragment of wellused toilet paper presented to him by a nasty harlot, stimulated by gingerbread and a postal order? Did he remain? Did he see only a second coincidence in the second scene narrated to him, described by the narrator as A Pisgah Sight of Palestine or The Parable of the Plums? Did he then accept as an article of belief the theory of astrological influences upon sublunary disasters? Did I forget to write address on that letter like the postcard I sent to Flynn? —Did I kill him, says he, or what? Did I not take it up? Did I pull the chain? —Did I say that? he asked. Did it flow? —Did it hurt much doing it? one asked the sailor. Did I write Ballsbridge on the envelope I took to cover when she disturbed me writing to Martha? Did me good all the same. Did not: no, no: believe: Lidlyd. Didn’t catch me napping that wheeze. Didn’t cost him a red like Maginni the dancing master self advertisement. Didn’t he...? Didn’t hear. —Didn’t he, miss Kennedy? Didn’t I tell you? Didn’t let her see me in profile. Didn’t look back when she was going down the strand. Didn’t see me. Didn’t see me perhaps. Didn’t take a feather out of her my handling them. Didn’t you see him look at his watch? Did Roberts pay you yet? —Did she? —Did she fall or was she pushed? he asked her. Did she know what I? Did she know where the lord lieutenant was going? Did something happen? Did Stephen obey his sign? Did Stephen participate in his dejection? Did that first division, portending a second division, afflict him? Did the guest comply with his host’s request? Did the host encourage his guest to chant in a modulated voice a strange legend on an allied theme? Did their conversation on the subject of these reminiscences reveal a third connecting link between them? Did the man reappear elsewhere? Did the process of divestiture continue? Did they find their educational careers similar? —Did Tom Kernan turn up? Did too. Did ums blubble bigsplash crytears cos fren Padney was took off in black bag? —Did you? Did you ever hear such an idea? Did you, faith? —Did you finish it? he asked. —Did you get any money? Did you hear Miss Mitchell’s joke about Moore and Martyn? Did you hear my brain go snap? —Did you hear that one, he asked them, about Mulcahy from the Coombe? Did you leave anything on the fire? Did you meet him? Did you not know that? —Did you put in the books? —Did you read Dan Dawson’s speech? Did you read that report by a man what’s this his name is? Did you read that skit in the United Irishman today about that Zulu chief that’s visiting England? Did you, says I. Did you see anything of your artist brother Stephen lately? Did you see his eye? Did you see that bloody chimneysweep near shove my eye out with his brush? —Did you see that bloody lunatic Breen round there? says Alf. Did you try the borax with the cherry laurel water? Die, dog. Dietary: concerning the respective percentage of protein and caloric energy in bacon, salt ling and butter, the absence of the former in the lastnamed and the abundance of the latter in the firstnamed. Different feel perhaps. Differently, because of different possible returns to the inhabitants or to the habitation. Different ways of bringing off a coup. Different with me. Dignam. Dignam. Dignam. Dignam. Dignam carted off. Dignam dead? Dignam is there now. Dignam laid in clay of an apoplexy and after hard drought, please God, rained, a bargeman coming in by water a fifty mile or thereabout with turf saying the seed won’t sprout, fields athirst, very sadcoloured and stunk mightily, the quags and tofts too. —Dignam, Mr Bloom said. Dignam of Menton’s office that was, Martin Cunningham said. Dignam, Patrick T, deceased. Dignam son, Bernard Corrigan brother-in-law, Jno. Dignam’s potted meat. Dignam’s soul... Dignam’s voice, muffled, is heard baying under ground: Dignam’s dead and gone below. Dignam used to be in his office. Digs up near the Mater. Dillon’s lacquey rings his handbell. Dilly asked. Dilly Dedalus, loitering by the curbstone, heard the beats of the bell, the cries of the auctioneer within. Dilly followed quickly and pulled his coat. Dilly said. Dilly’s high shoulders and shabby dress. Dilly shrugged her shoulders. DIMINISHED DIGITS PROVE TOO TITILLATING FOR FRISKY FRUMPS. ANNE WIMBLES, FLO WANGLES—YET CAN YOU BLAME THEM? —Onehandled adulterer, he said smiling grimly. Dimsey, wife of David Dimsey, late of the admiralty: Miller, Tottenham, aged eightyfive: Welsh, June 12, at 35 Canning street, Liverpool, Isabella Helen. Diningroom. Dinna forget the cowslips for hersel. Dinner fit for a prince. Dinner of thirty courses. Dinners fit for princes. Dion Boucicault business with his harvestmoon face in a poky bonnet. Directly. —Directly, said he, creaking to go, albeit lingering. Dirt gets rolled up in your navel. Dirty cleans. Dirty Dan the dodger’s son off Island bridge that sold the same horses twice over to the government to fight the Boers. Dirty married man! Discussing these and kindred topics they made a beeline across the back of the Customhouse and passed under the Loop Line bridge where a brazier of coke burning in front of a sentrybox or something like one attracted their rather lagging footsteps. Disgrace him, I will! Disguises, clutched at, gone, not here. Dislike carrying bottles like that hag this morning. Dislike dressing together. Dislike rough and tumble. Dislike that job. Disorderly houses. Dist. Distance. Distance no object. Distantly behind him a blind stripling tapped his way by the wall of College park. DISTANT VOICES: Dublin’s burning! Distractions, rookshooting, the Erse language he recited some, laudanum he raised the phial to his lips, camping out. Dittoh. —Ditto MacAnaspey, says I. Divorced Spanish American. Divorce, not now. Dixon follows giving them sharp language but raps out an oath, he too, and on. DLUGACZ: Hoarsely. Do. Do! Do. Do and do. Do anything you like with figures juggling. Do, Ben, do. Doc. blames the sanitary conditions in which our greylunged citizens contract adenoids, pulmonary complaints etc. by inhaling the bacteria which lurk in dust. Dockrell’s, one and ninepence a dozen. Doc., P. L. G., F. T. C. D., F. R. U. I., F. R. C. P. I. and F. R. C. S. I. Doctor Diet and Doctor Quiet. Doctor Finucane pronounced life extinct when I succumbed to the disease from natural causes. Doctor Swift says one man in armour will beat ten men in their shirts. Doctor Whack. Documents: the birth certificate of Leopold Paula Bloom: an endowment assurance policy of £ 500 in the Scottish Widows’ Assurance Society, intestated Millicent Milly Bloom, coming into force at 25 years as with profit policy of £ 430, £ 462-10-0 and £ 500 at 60 years or death, 65 years or death and death, respectively, or with profit policy paidup of £ 299-10-0 together with cash payment of £ 133-10-0, at option: a bank passbook issued by the Ulster Bank, College Green branch showing statement of a/c for halfyear ending 31 December 1903, balance in depositor’s favour: £ 18-14-6 eighteen pounds, fourteen shillings and sixpence, sterling, net personalty: certificate of possession of £ 900, Canadian 4% inscribed government stock free of stamp duty: dockets of the Catholic Cemeteries’ Glasnevin Committee, relative to a graveplot purchased: a local press cutting concerning change of name by deedpoll. Dodge round by Greek street. —Do, do, they begged in one. Does anybody really? —Does he? Does he ever think of the hole waiting for himself? Does he write anything for your movement? Does himself well. Does no harm. Doesn’t. Doesn’t bring in any business either. Doesn’t give them any of it: shew wine: only the other. Doesn’t go properly. Doesn’t half know I’m. Doesn’t hear. Doesn’t see. Doesn’t see me. Does really. Does that to all. Do fish ever get seasick? —Do, for Jesus’ sake, Buck Mulligan said. Dogbiscuits. Dogdays. Dog in the manger. Dog of a christian! Dog of my enemy. Dogs at each other behind. Dogs’ cold noses. Dogs’ home over there. Dogskull, dogsniff, eyes on the ground, moves to one great goal. Dogs licking the blood off the street when the lord lieutenant’s wife drove by in her noddy. Do him one in the eye. Do I contradict myself? Doing a double shuffle with the town travellers. —Doing any singing those times? Doing her hair, humming: voglio e non vorrei. Doing his level best to say it. Doing its level best to speak. Doing the indignant: a girl of good family like me, respectable character. Doing the rapparee and Rory of the hill. Do it in the bath. Do it in the shake of a lamb’s tail. Do it standing, sir! Do like us. Dollard and Cowley still urged the lingering singer out with it. —Dollard, murmured tankard. Dollard, was it? Dollard, yes. DOLLY GRAY: From her balcony waves her handkerchief, giving the sign of the heroine of Jericho. Dolor! Dolphin’s Barn. Dolphin’s Barn, the charades. Dominenamine. Dominie Deasy kens them a’. Dominus! —Dominus vobiscum. Dona nobis pacem. Done. Done. Done. Done anyhow. Done half by design. DON EMILE PATRIZIO FRANZ RUPERT POPE HENNESSY: In medieval hauberk, two wild geese volant on his helm, with noble indignation points a mailed hand against the privates. Done to a turn. Don Giovanni, thou hast me invited To come to supper tonight, The rum the rumdum. DON JOHN CONMEE: Now, Father Dolan! Don John Conmee walked and moved in times of yore. Donnerwetter! Donnez le petit bouquet à votre dame! Donnybrook fair more in their line. Do not deny my request. Don’t! Don’t! Don’t! Don’t ask. Don’t attract attention. Don’t be all night before the polis in plain clothes sees us. Don’t be greedy. Don’t be talking! —Don’t carry it like that, Mr Deasy said. Don’t cast your nasturtiums on my character. Don’t do so on any account, Mrs Talboys! Don’t eat a beefsteak. Don’t fall upstairs. Don’t forget to pray for him. Don’t give me away. Don’t know their danger. Don’t know what death is at that age. Don’t know what poetry is even. Don’t let see. Don’t like all the smells in it waiting to rush out. —Don’t make half so free, said she, till we are better acquainted. Don’t manhandle him! Don’t maul them pieces, young one. Don’t mention it. Don’t miss this chance. Don’t run amok! Don’t see him. Don’t stain my brandnew sitinems. Don’t strike him when he’s down! Don’t tear my... —Don’t tell anyone, says the citizen. —Don’t tell anyone, says the citizen, letting a bawl out of him. Don’t tell me! Don’t tell them he was nine years old when it was quenched. Don’t want it they throw it at you. Don’t you forget! Don’t you forget that! —Don’t you know he’s dead? says Joe. Don’t you play the giddy ox with me! Don’t you see what I mean? —Don’t you think his face is like Our Saviour? Door closed. Door of the stables near Cecilia street. Do others see me so? Doped animals. Dope is my only hope... Do ptake some ptarmigan. Doran Lyons in Conway’s. Do right to hide them. Dos à dos! Dosing it with Edwards’ desiccated soup. Dost envy Darby Dullman there with his Joan? Dost love, Miriam? Dost love thy man? Do the grand. Do they know what they cart out here every day? Do they notice I’m in mourning? Do they snapshot those girls or is it all a fake? —Do, Tom Rochford said. Dotty. Doublebasses helpless, gashes in their sides. Doubled up inside her trying to butt its way out blindly, groping for the way out. Double four... Double marriage of sisters celebrated. Doubles them up black and blue in convulsions. Doubly, by appending his signature in Irish and Roman characters. Douce gave full vent to a splendid yell, a full yell of full woman, delight, joy, indignation. Douce Lydia. Douce now. —Doughy Daw! he cried. Dowden believes there is some mystery in Hamlet but will say no more. Do we yield? Down, baldynoddle, or we’ll wool your wool. Down in the vaults of saint Werburgh’s lovely old organ hundred and fifty they have to bore a hole in the coffins sometimes to let out the bad gas and burn it. —Down in Westmeath. Down she sat. —Down, sir! Down stage he strode some paces, grave, tall in affliction, his long arms outheld. Down the edge of his Freeman baton ranged Bloom’s, your other eye, scanning for where did I see that. Down there. Down there Emmet was hanged, drawn and quartered. Down, up, forward, back. Down went Tom Rochford anyhow, booky’s vest and all, with the rope round him. Down with Bloom! —Down with his aunt Sally, I suppose, Mr Dedalus said, the Goulding faction, the drunken little costdrawer and Crissie, papa’s little lump of dung, the wise child that knows her own father. Downy hair there too. Do you? Do you believe your own theory? —Do you consider, by the by, he said, thoughtfully selecting a faded photo which he laid on the table, that a Spanish type? Do you despise? —Do you ever see anything of Mrs Beaufoy? Do you follow me? Do you follow me? Do you intend to pay it back? Do you know anything about Pyrrhus? Do you know him? Do you know that? Do you know that he’s balmy? Do you know that some mornings he has to get his hat on with a shoehorn. —Do you know that story about chief baron Palles? Do you know that the orange lodges agitated for repeal of the union twenty years before O’Connell did or before the prelates of your communion denounced him as a demagogue? Do you know what? Do you know what he did last night? Do you know what I’m going to tell you? Do you know what I’m telling you? Do you know what is the pride of the English? Do you know what is the proudest word you will ever hear from an Englishman’s mouth? Do you know what it is? Do you know what you are talking about? Do you know what you look like? Do you like cocoa? Do you mean he... —Do you mean he died so? Do you not think it, Stephen? —Do you now? Do you remember? Do you remember a long long time, years and years ago, just after Milly, Marionette we called her, was weaned when we all went together to Fairyhouse races, was it? Do you remember, harking back in a retrospective arrangement, Old Christmas night, Georgina Simpson’s housewarming while they were playing the Irving Bishop game, finding the pin blindfold and thoughtreading? Do you remember her, Vincent? Do you see any green in the white of my eye? Do you see that straw? Do you see the tide flowing quickly in on all sides, sheeting the lows of sand quickly, shellcocoacoloured? —Do you tell me so? Do you think he has genius really? —Do you think it is only a paradox? the quaker librarian was asking. Do you think she was? Do you think that’s a good idea? Do you think the writer of Antony and Cleopatra, a passionate pilgrim, had his eyes in the back of his head that he chose the ugliest doxy in all Warwickshire to lie withal? Do you think they are genuine? —Do you understand how to do them now? he asked. —Do you understand now? —Do you understand what he says? Do you want another? —Do you want the blind up? Do you want three girls? —Do you want to cross? Do you want to cross? Do you want to go to Molesworth street? —Do you wish me to tell you? he asked. Drago’s shopbell ringing. —Drain? Drained all the manhood out of me, little wretch. Drat the man! Drawers: little kick, taking them off. Drawing back and pointing, Stephen said with bitterness: —It is a symbol of Irish art. Drawing back his head and gazing far from beneath his vailed eyelids he saw the bright fawn skin shine in the glare, the braided drums. Drawn on a guncarriage. Dr Bloom is bisexually abnormal. Dr Bloom, Leopold, dental surgeon. Dr Bob Kenny is attending her. DR CROTTHERS: I have examined the patient’s urine. DR DIXON: Reads a bill of health. Dreadful. Dreadful life sailors have too. Dreadful old case. Dreadful simply! Dream he had, a nightmare. Dream of the girl you left behind and she will dream of you. Dreams all night. Dreamt last night? Dreamy, cloudy, symbolistic. Dreck! Dress does it. Dressed up to the nines for somebody. Dressing in mother’s clothes. Dressing, undressing. Dress they look at. Dress up and look and suggest and let you see and see more and defy you if you’re a man to see that and, like a sneeze coming, legs, look, look and if you have any guts in you. Dressy fellow he was once. Dr Horne got her in. Dr Hy Franks. Dr Hy Franks. Dribbling a quiet message from his bladder came to go to do not to do there to do. Dringadring! Dringdring! Dringdring! Drink. Drinkers, drinking, laughed spluttering, their drink against their breath. —Drinking his own stuff? says Joe. Drink like the devil till it turns adelite. Drink, man, an udderful! Drink me piping hot. Drink that, citizen. —Drink! the editor cried. Drink themselves bloated as big as a collie floating. Drink till they puke again like christians. Drink water scented with fennel, sherbet. Drive ahead. Driver in John Long’s. Driving before it a loose drift of rubble, fanshoals of fishes, silly shells. Dr John Alexander Dowie restorer of the church in Zion is coming. Dr Lucas. DR MADDEN: Hypsospadia is also marked. DR MULLIGAN: In motor jerkin, green motorgoggles on his brow. Droop shoulders. Drop him like a hot potato. Drop in on Keyes. Drop in some evening and have a glass of old Burgundy. Drop into the D.B.C. probably for his coffee, play chess there. Drop in whenever you like. Dropping down lock by lock to Dublin. Drops. —Drown Barabbas! Drowning his grief. Drowning they say is the pleasantest. DR PUNCH COSTELLO: The fetor judaicus is most perceptible. Drugs age you after mental excitement. Drum? Drummond of Hawthornden helped you at that stile. Drunk about the place and capering with Martin’s umbrella. Drunkards bawl. Drunkards out to shake up their livers. Drunken ranters what I said about his God made him wince. Drunks cover distance double quick. Dry. Dth! Dth! Dth, dth, dth! Dublin. Dublin Bakery Company’s tearoom. Dublin’s burning! Dublin’s prime favourite. Duck for six wickets. Du de la is French. Duel by combat, no. Duke street. Dull business by day, land agents, temperance hotel, Falconer’s railway guide, civil service college, Gill’s, catholic club, the industrious blind. Dull eye: collar tight on his neck, pressing on a bloodvessel or something. Dull, gloomy: hate this hour. Dullthudding Guinness’s barrels. Dun for a nun. Dunlop, Judge, the noblest Roman of them all, A.E., Arval, the Name Ineffable, in heaven hight: K.H., their master, whose identity is no secret to adepts. Dunne, says he. Dunphy’s corner. —Dunphy’s, Mr Power announced as the carriage turned right. Dunsink time. Dunsink time. During the past four minutes or thereabouts he had been staring hard at a certain amount of number one Bass bottled by Messrs Bass and Co at Burton-on-Trent which happened to be situated amongst a lot of others right opposite to where he was and which was certainly calculated to attract anyone’s remark on account of its scarlet appearance. During the recent war whenever the enemy had a temporary advantage with his granados did this traitor to his kind not seize that moment to discharge his piece against the empire of which he is a tenant at will while he trembled for the security of his four per cents? Dusk and the light behind her. Dust. Dust darkened the toiling fingers with their vulture nails. Dust slept on dull coils of bronze and silver, lozenges of cinnabar, on rubies, leprous and winedark stones. Dust webbed the window and the showtrays. Dusty Rhodes. Dutch courage. Dwarf’s body, weak as putty, in a whitelined deal box. Dwarfs ride them, rustyarmoured, leaping, leaping in their, in their saddles. D’ye ken bare socks? —Dying, he said again, if not dead by now. Dying to embrace her in his shirt. Each, and for other, plash and silent roar. Each dish harmless might mix inside. —Each graceful look... Each has his banjo slung. Each has his name printed in legible letters on his shirtfront: Nasodoro, Goldfinger, Chrysostomos, Maindorée, Silversmile, Silberselber, Vifargent, Panargyros. Each is equally important. Each lays hand on Bloom’s shoulder. Each person too. Each street different smell. Earnestly. Earnestly. Earth, fire, water. Earth for instance pulling this and being pulled. Easier than the dreamy creamy stuff. Easier to enlist and drill. Easily flew. Easily twig a man used to uniform. East of the sun, west of the moon: Tir na n-og. Easy now. Eat. Eat and be merry for tomorrow. Eat drink and be merry. Eaten a bad egg. —Eaten alive? a third asked the sailor. Eaten by birds. Eat first. Eating off his cold plate. Eating orangepeels in the park. Eating your groatsworth of mou en civet, fleshpots of Egypt, elbowed by belching cabmen. Eat it and get all pigsticky. Eat or be eaten. Eat pig like pig. Eat you out of house and home. Eccles street. Ecco! —Eccolo, Almidano Artifoni said in friendly haste. Echo. Economics. Ed egli avea del cul fatto trombetta. Edward Guelph-Wettin! Edward the Seventh appears in an archway. EDWARD THE SEVENTH: Dances slowly, solemnly, rattling his bucket, and sings with soft contentment. EDWARD THE SEVENTH: Levitates over heaps of slain, in the garb and with the halo of Joking Jesus, a white jujube in his phosphorescent face. Edward the Seventh lifts his bucket graciously in acknowledgment. EDWARD THE SEVENTH: Slowly, solemnly but indistinctly. Edy began to get ready to go and it was high time for her and Gerty noticed that that little hint she gave had had the desired effect because it was a long way along the strand to where there was the place to push up the pushcar and Cissy took off the twins’ caps and tidied their hair to make herself attractive of course and Canon O’Hanlon stood up with his cope poking up at his neck and Father Conroy handed him the card to read off and he read out Panem de coelo praestitisti eis and Edy and Cissy were talking about the time all the time and asking her but Gerty could pay them back in their own coin and she just answered with scathing politeness when Edy asked her was she heartbroken about her best boy throwing her over. Edy Boardman asked Tommy Caffrey was he done and he said yes so then she buttoned up his little knickerbockers for him and told him to run off and play with Jacky and to be good now and not to fight. EDY BOARDMAN: Bickering. Edy Boardman, sniffling, crouched with Bertha Supple, draws her shawl across her nostrils. Edy Boardman was noticing it too because she was squinting at Gerty, half smiling, with her specs like an old maid, pretending to nurse the baby. Edy straightened up baby Boardman to get ready to go and Cissy tucked in the ball and the spades and buckets and it was high time too because the sandman was on his way for Master Boardman junior. Edy told him no, no and to be off now with him and she told Cissy Caffrey not to give in to him. —E...eleven, Mr Bloom answered. Eeltraps, lobsterpots, fishingrods, hatchet, steelyard, grindstone, clodcrusher, swatheturner, carriagesack, telescope ladder, 10 tooth rake, washing clogs, haytedder, tumbling rake, billhook, paintpot, brush, hoe and so on. E’en so. Effect on the sexual. Egging raw youths on to get in the know all the time drawing secret service pay from the castle. Eggs on the bottles. Egg two evidently demolished, he nodded and winked, adding bloodthirstily: —Buffalo Bill shoots to kill, Never missed nor he never will. Eglintoneyes, quick with pleasure, looked up shybrightly. Egomen. E grazie. Egypt. Eh? —Eh? Eh? Eh... —Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh? Eh! Eh! Eh, come here till I stiffen it for you. Eh, what? Eight children he has anyway. Eight for a penny! Eighth and ninth book of Moses. —Eight plums a penny! Eightyseven that was. Either he petered out too tamely of acute pneumonia just when his various different political arrangements were nearing completion or whether it transpired he owed his death to his having neglected to change his boots and clothes after a wetting when a cold resulted and failing to consult a specialist he being confined to his room till he eventually died of it amid widespread regret before a fortnight was at an end or quite possibly they were distressed to find the job was taken out of their hands. Either you believe or you don’t, isn’t it? Elbow, arm. Electors of Arran Quay, Inns Quay, Rotunda, Mountjoy and North Dock, better run a tramline, I say, from the cattlemarket to the river. Electric. Electric dishscrubbers. Electuary or emulsion. Eleven. Eleven, is it? —Eleven, I think, he answered. Elfin riders sat them, watchful of a sign. El hombre ama la muchacha hermosa. Elijah! ELIJAH: In rolledup shirtsleeves, black in the face, shouts at the top of his voice, his arms uplifted. Elijah is com. Elijah is coming. Elijah is coming! ELIJAH: No yapping, if you please, in this booth. Elijah, skiff, light crumpled throwaway, sailed eastward by flanks of ships and trawlers, amid an archipelago of corks, beyond new Wapping street past Benson’s ferry, and by the threemasted schooner Rosevean from Bridgwater with bricks. Elijah thirtytwo feet per sec is com. Elixir of life. Elizabethan London lay as far from Stratford as corrupt Paris lies from virgin Dublin. Elk and yak, the bulls of Bashan and of Babylon, mammoth and mastodon, they come trooping to the sunken sea, Lacus Mortis. ELLEN BLOOM: In pantomime dame’s stringed mobcap, widow Twankey’s crinoline and bustle, blouse with muttonleg sleeves buttoned behind, grey mittens and cameo brooch, her plaited hair in a crispine net, appears over the staircase banisters, a slanted candlestick in her hand, and cries out in shrill alarm. Ellis’s Three Trips to Madagascar brown cloth, title obliterated. Elster Grimes Opera Company. El, yes: house of: Aleph, Beth. Embalming in catacombs, mummies the same idea. Embedded ore. Embedded ore. Emblem of luck. Embrace me tight, dear. Embroider. —Emigrants, Mr Power said. Emigration Swindle. Emperor’s horses. Emperor’s horses at Mürzsteg, lower Austria. Empress! Empty vessels make most noise. En avant, mes enfants! Encore! Encore! Encore! Encore! Encore! Encore deux minutes. Encore, enclap, said, cried, clapped all, Ben Dollard, Lydia Douce, George Lidwell, Pat, Mina Kennedy, two gentlemen with two tankards, Cowley, first gent with tank and bronze Miss Douce and gold Miss Mina. Encore vingt sous. Encouraged by this use of her christian name she kissed passionately all the various suitable areas of his person which the decencies of prison garb permitted her ardour to reach. End it peacefully. Endless, would it be mine, form of my form? —End of Pyrrhus, sir? End of school. Enemas too I have administered. Enemy? Enfin ce sont vos oignons. England. England is in the hands of the jews. English. Engulfed with wailing creecries, whirled, whirling, they bewail. Enjoy a bath now: clean trough of water, cool enamel, the gentle tepid stream. Enjoyed her holidays? Enjoying nature now. Enormously I desiderate your domination. Enough. Enough bother wading through fortyfour of them. Enough of the inflated windbag! Enough of this place. Enough stuff here to chloroform you. En route to his taciturn and, not to put too fine a point on it, not yet perfectly sober companion Mr Bloom who at all events was in complete possession of his faculties, never more so, in fact disgustingly sober, spoke a word of caution re the dangers of nighttown, women of ill fame and swell mobsmen, which, barely permissible once in a while though not as a habitual practice, was of the nature of a regular deathtrap for young fellows of his age particularly if they had acquired drinking habits under the influence of liquor unless you knew a little jiujitsu for every contingency as even a fellow on the broad of his back could administer a nasty kick if you didn’t look out. Enter a ghost and hobgoblins. Entered into rest the protestants put it. Enter, gentleman, to see in mirror every positions trapezes all that machine there besides also if desire act awfully bestial butcher’s boy pollutes in warm veal liver or omlet on the belly pièce de Shakespeare. Entering the bedroom he halfclosed his eyes and walked through warm yellow twilight towards her tousled head. Enter Magee Mor Matthew, a rugged rough rugheaded kern, in strossers with a buttoned codpiece, his nether stocks bemired with clauber of ten forests, a wand of wilding in his hand. Entertainment for man and beast. Entertainments. Enter that antechamber of birth where the studious are assembled and note their faces. Enthusiast. Entr’acte. —Entrez, mes enfants! Entweder transubstantiality oder consubstantiality but in no case subsubstantiality. Envel. —En ventre sa mère, says J. J. —Do you call that a man? says the citizen. Envy? Envy, jealousy, abnegation, equanimity. Epi oinopa ponton. Epi oinopa ponton. Eppoi mi sono convinto che il mondo è una bestia. E quando vede l’uomo l’attosca. Equanimity? Erin. ERIN, GREEN GEM OF THE SILVER SEA —The ghost walks, professor MacHugh murmured softly, biscuitfully to the dusty windowpane. Escargots! Esperanto. Esprit de corps. Established 1763. Esthetes they are. Esthetics and cosmetics are for the boudoir. —Et cum spiritu tuo. Et erant valde bona. —Eternal punishment, Haines said, nodding curtly. Etiquette is etiquette. Et laqueo se suspendit. —Et ne nos inducas in tentationem. Et omnes ad quos pervenit aqua ista. Et vidit Deus. Euge! Eugene Stratton. Eulogy in a country churchyard it ought to be that poem of whose is it Wordsworth or Thomas Campbell. Eunuch. —Eureka! Eureka! European conflagration. Evans, conduct this gentleman... Eve. Even admire themselves. Even comb and tissuepaper you can knock a tune out of. Even if he was a protestant or methodist she could convert him easily if he truly loved her. Evening. Evening hours, girls in grey gauze. Evening like this, but clear, no clouds. Evening Telegraph here... Evening will find itself. Even money Fair Rebel. —Even money, Lenehan said returning. Even more he liked an old German song of Johannes Jeep about the clear sea and the voices of sirens, sweet murderers of men, which boggled Bloom a bit: Von der Sirenen Listigkeit Tun die Poeten dichten. Even Parnell. Even Phyllis could not contain herself. Even so did they come and set them, those willing nymphs, the undying sisters. Even that brute today. Even the allwisest Stagyrite was bitted, bridled and mounted by a light of love. Even the bones and cornerman at the Livermore christies. Even the Grand Turk sent us his piastres. Even the great Napoleon when measurements were taken next the skin after his death... Even their wax model Raymonde I visited daily to admire her cobweb hose and stick of rhubarb toe, as worn in Paris. Even to sit where a woman has sat, especially with divaricated thighs, as though to grant the last favours, most especially with previously well uplifted white sateen coatpans. Eventually, however, both their eyes met and as soon as it began to dawn on him that the other was endeavouring to help himself to the thing he involuntarily determined to help him himself and so he accordingly took hold of the neck of the mediumsized glass recipient which contained the fluid sought after and made a capacious hole in it by pouring a lot of it out with, also at the same time, however, a considerable degree of attentiveness in order not to upset any of the beer that was in it about the place. Ever he would wander, selfcompelled, to the extreme limit of his cometary orbit, beyond the fixed stars and variable suns and telescopic planets, astronomical waifs and strays, to the extreme boundary of space, passing from land to land, among peoples, amid events. Every bullet has its billet. Every cove to his gentry mort. Every day we must do homage to her. Every fellow for his own, tooth and nail. Every Friday buries a Thursday if you come to look at it. Every jolt the bloody car gave I had her bumping up against me. Every knot says a lot. Every lady in the audience was presented with a tasteful souvenir of the occasion in the shape of a skull and crossbones brooch, a timely and generous act which evoked a fresh outburst of emotion: and when the gallant young Oxonian the bearer, by the way, of one of the most timehonoured names in Albion’s history placed on the finger of his blushing fiancée an expensive engagement ring with emeralds set in the form of a fourleaved shamrock the excitement knew no bounds. Every life is many days, day after day. Every man his price. Everyman or Noman. Every morsel. Every mortal day a fresh batch: middleaged men, old women, children, women dead in childbirth, men with beards, baldheaded businessmen, consumptive girls with little sparrows’ breasts. Every nerve in my body aches like mad! Everyone according to his needs or everyone according to his deeds. Everyone dying to know what she’s writing. Everyone says I am quite the belle in my new tam. Everyone thought the world of her for her gentle ways. Everyone to his taste as Morris said when he kissed the cow. Everyone wants to. Every phase of the situation was successively eviscerated: the prenatal repugnance of uterine brothers, the Caesarean section, posthumity with respect to the father and, that rarer form, with respect to the mother, the fratricidal case known as the Childs Murder and rendered memorable by the impassioned plea of Mr Advocate Bushe which secured the acquittal of the wrongfully accused, the rights of primogeniture and king’s bounty touching twins and triplets, miscarriages and infanticides, simulated or dissimulated, the acardiac foetus in foetu and aprosopia due to a congestion, the agnathia of certain chinless Chinamen cited by Mr Candidate Mulligan in consequence of defective reunion of the maxillary knobs along the medial line so that as he said one ear could hear what the other spoke, the benefits of anesthesia or twilight sleep, the prolongation of labour pains in advanced gravidancy by reason of pressure on the vein, the premature relentment of the amniotic fluid as exemplified in the actual case with consequent peril of sepsis to the matrix, artificial insemination by means of syringes, involution of the womb consequent upon the menopause, the problem of the perpetration of the species in the case of females impregnated by delinquent rape, that distressing manner of delivery called by the Brandenburghers Sturzgeburt, the recorded instances of multiseminal, twikindled and monstrous births conceived during the catamenic period or of consanguineous parents—in a word all the cases of human nativity which Aristotle has classified in his masterpiece with chromolithographic illustrations. Every phenomenon has a natural cause. Everything on it? Everything pointed to the fact that it behoved him to avail himself to the full of the opportunity, all things considered. Everything speaks in its own way. Everything was going swimmingly ... —Everything went off A1, he said. Every word is so deep, Leopold. Every year you get a sending of the crop. Ex! Exactly: and that is the ineluctable modality of the audible. Example? Excellent. Excellent for shade, fuel and construction. Excellent people, no doubt, but distressingly shortsighted in some matters. Except Guinness’s barges. —Except it simply amounts to one thing and he is what they call picking your brains, he ventured to throw out. Except scales up and down, girls learning. Except the east: Mary, Martha: now as then. Excitement. Excites them also when they’re. Excuse... Excuse bad writing. Excuse me. Excuse me. —Excuse me, councillor, he said. Excuse me, he said over his shoulder, the dictates of common sense. —Excuse me, J. J. O’Molloy said, entering. —Excuse me, sir, Mr Bloom said beside them. Excuse, miss, there’s a whh! just a whh! fluff. Exercise your mnemotechnic. Exeunt severally. Exhausted, breathless, their shaken heads they laid, braided and pinnacled by glossycombed, against the counterledge. EXIT BLOOM —I’m just running round to Bachelor’s walk, Mr Bloom said, about this ad of Keyes’s. Exit Judas. —Expecting every moment will be his next, says Lenehan. Expect the chief consumes the parts of honour. Expect this is the. Expect we’ll pull up here on the way back to drink his health. Experienced hand. Explain better. Explain that: morning hours, noon, then evening coming on, then night hours. Explain the swansong too wherein he has commended her to posterity. Explain you then. Exploitable ground. Explos. Exposure by mechanical artifice automatic bed or individual testimony concealed ocular witnesses, not yet. Expresses nothing. —Ex quibus, Stephen mumbled in a noncommittal accent, their two or four eyes conversing, Christus or Bloom his name is or after all any other, secundum carnem. Exquisite contrast: bronzelid, minagold. —Exquisite contrast, miss Kennedy said. Exquisite variations he was now describing on an air Youth here has End by Jans Pieter Sweelinck, a Dutchman of Amsterdam where the frows come from. Extraordinary the interest they take in a corpse. Extremes meet. Exuberant female. Eyefocus bad for stomach nerves. Eye out for other fellow always. Eyes all over them. Eyes closed he totters. Eyes front. Eyes like that. Eyes of a toad too. Eyes, pale as the sea the wind had freshened, paler, firm and prudent. Eyes shut. Eyes, walk, voice. Fabled by mothers of memory. Fabled by the daughters of memory. F.A.B.P. Got that? Fabulous artificer. Face glistering tallow under her fustian shawl. Face like dip. Face of the all is lost. Face reminds me of his poor mother. Faces of hamadryads peep out from the boles and among the leaves and break, blossoming into bloom. Faces of Paris men go by, their wellpleased pleasers, curled conquistadores. Factory lasses with fancy clothes toss redhot Yorkshire baraabombs. Fading gold sky. Fag today. Failed to the tune of ten thousand pounds. Fair day and all the beef to the heels were in. Fair one of Egypt teased and sorted in the till and hummed and handed coins in change. Fair play, here. Fair play, madam. Fair Tyrants by James Lovebirch. Faithful departed. Faith, he was. Faith, no, he says, Frank that was his name, ’tis all about Kerry cows that are to be butchered along of the plague. Fall from cliff. Fall into flesh, don’t they? Fall of man. Fallopian tube. Fall quite flat. Falls back suddenly, frozen in stereoscope. Fall, surrender, lost. False lull. Falstaff was not a family man. Familiarly. Families of them. Famine, plague and slaughters. Famished ghosts. Fancy being his wife. Fancy dress balls arranged. Fancy of a friend of mine. Fang, I feel. Fanned by a constant updraught of ventilation between the kitchen and the chimneyflue, ignition was communicated from the faggots of precombustible fuel to polyhedral masses of bituminous coal, containing in compressed mineral form the foliated fossilised decidua of primeval forests which had in turn derived their vegetative existence from the sun, primal source of heat radiant, transmitted through omnipresent luminiferous diathermanous ether. Far. Far. Far. Far. Far. —Farabutto! Far away a donkey brayed. Far away in the west the sun was setting and the last glow of all too fleeting day lingered lovingly on sea and strand, on the proud promontory of dear old Howth guarding as ever the waters of the bay, on the weedgrown rocks along Sandymount shore and, last but not least, on the quiet church whence there streamed forth at times upon the stillness the voice of prayer to her who is in her pure radiance a beacon ever to the stormtossed heart of man, Mary, star of the sea. Far away now past. Far be it from candour to violate the bedchamber of a respectable lady, the daughter of a gallant major, or to cast the most distant reflections upon her virtue but if he challenges attention there as it was indeed highly his interest not to have done then be it so. Fare. Fare thee well. Farewell. Farewell. Farewell. Far in the grey a bell chimed. Farmhouse, wall round it, blurred cattle cropping. Far out in the bay between Bailey and Kish lights the Erin’s King sails, sending a broadening plume of coalsmoke from her funnel towards the land. Far out over the sands the coming surf crept, grey. Fascinating little book that is of sir Robert Ball’s. Fascination. Fashion part of their charm. Fast and furious it was. Fate. Fate. Fate. Fate. Fate that is. Fat folds of neck, fat, neck, fat, neck. Father Bernard Vaughan’s sermon first. Father Bob Cowley played. Father Coffey. FATHER COFFEY: Yawns, then chants with a hoarse croak. Father Conmee at the altarrails placed the host with difficulty in the mouth of the awkward old man who had the shaky head. Father Conmee began to walk along the North Strand road and was saluted by Mr William Gallagher who stood in the doorway of his shop. Father Conmee blessed both gravely and turned a thin page of his breviary. Father Conmee crossed to Mountjoy square. Father Conmee doffed his silk hat and smiled, as he took leave, at the jet beads of her mantilla inkshining in the sun. Father Conmee drew off his gloves and took his rededged breviary out. Father Conmee gave a letter from his breast to Master Brunny Lynam and pointed to the red pillarbox at the corner of Fitzgibbon street. Father Conmee greeted them more than once benignly. Father Conmee, having read his little hours, walked through the hamlet of Donnycarney, murmuring vespers. Father Conmee liked cheerful decorum. Father Conmee passed H. J. O’Neill’s funeral establishment where Corny Kelleher totted figures in the daybook while he chewed a blade of hay. Father Conmee perceived her perfume in the car. Father Conmee raised his hat to the Blessed Sacrament. Father Conmee, reading his office, watched a flock of muttoning clouds over Rathcoffey. Father Conmee read in secret Pater and Ave and crossed his breast. Father Conmee saluted Mr William Gallagher and perceived the odours that came from baconflitches and ample cools of butter. Father Conmee sat in a corner of the tramcar, a blue ticket tucked with care in the eye of one plump kid glove, while four shillings, a sixpence and five pennies chuted from his other plump glovepalm into his purse. Father Conmee smelt incense on his right hand as he walked. Father Conmee smiled and nodded and smiled and walked along Mountjoy square east. Father Conmee stopped three little schoolboys at the corner of Mountjoy square. Father Conmee thought of that tyrannous incontinence, needed however for man’s race on earth, and of the ways of God which were not our ways. Father Conmee thought of the souls of black and brown and yellow men and of his sermon on saint Peter Claver S. J. and the African mission and of the propagation of the faith and of the millions of black and brown and yellow souls that had not received the baptism of water when their last hour came like a thief in the night. Father Conmee turned the corner and walked along the North Circular road. Father Conmee walked and, walking, smiled for he thought on Father Bernard Vaughan’s droll eyes and cockney voice. Father Conmee walked down Great Charles street and glanced at the shutup free church on his left. Father Conmee walked through Clongowes fields, his thinsocked ankles tickled by stubble. Father Conmee, walking, thought of his little book Old Times in the Barony and of the book that might be written about jesuit houses and of Mary Rochfort, daughter of lord Molesworth, first countess of Belvedere. Father Conmee was very glad indeed to hear that. Father Conmee was very glad to see the wife of Mr David Sheehy M.P. Iooking so well and he begged to be remembered to Mr David Sheehy M.P. Yes, he would certainly call. Father Conmee was wonderfully well indeed. Father Conmee went by Daniel Bergin’s publichouse against the window of which two unlabouring men lounged. Father Cowley asked. Father Cowley blushed to his brilliant purply lobes. Father Cowley brushed his moustache often downward with a scooping hand. Father Dineen wants... FATHER DOLAN: Any boy want flogging? FATHER FARLEY: He is an episcopalian, an agnostic, an anythingarian seeking to overthrow our holy faith. Fatherhood, in the sense of conscious begetting, is unknown to man. Father is a wellknown highly respected citizen. Father John Conmee stepped into the Dollymount tram on Newcomen bridge. Father Malachi O’Flynn in a lace petticoat and reversed chasuble, his two left feet back to the front, celebrates camp mass. FATHER MALACHI O’FLYNN: Introibo ad altare diaboli. FATHER MALACHI O’FLYNN: Takes from the chalice and elevates a blooddripping host. Father O’Flynn would make hares of them all. Father, Son and Holy Ghost and Jakes M’Carthy. Father, Word and Holy Breath. —Fat of death, Simon, Ben Dollard growled. Faugh a ballagh! Faultfinding being a proverbially bad hat Mr Bloom thought well to stir or try to the clotted sugar from the bottom and reflected with something approaching acrimony on the Coffee Palace and its temperance and lucrative work. Faunman he met in Clamart woods, brandishing a winebottle. Faut pas le dire à mon père. Faut que jeunesse se passe. Fawcett. Fbhracht! Fear injects juices make it tender enough for them. Fear not them that sell the body but have not power to buy the soul. Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel. Featherbed mountain. Feathered his nest well anyhow. Fecking matches from counters to save. Fed and feeding brains about me: under glowlamps, impaled, with faintly beating feelers: and in my mind’s darkness a sloth of the underworld, reluctant, shy of brightness, shifting her dragon scaly folds. Feefawfum. Feel. Feel! Feel. Feel a gap. Feel as if I had been eaten and spewed. Feel better. Feel better then. Feel fresh then all the day. Feeling of white. Feel it myself too. Feel live warm beings near you. Feel my entire weight. Feel my feet quite clean. Feel my royal weight. Feel no more. Feels locked out of it. 32 feet per second. Felicitously he ceased and held a meek head among them, auk’s egg, prize of their fray. Felix Bartholdy Mendelssohn composer, Baruch Spinoza philosopher, Mendoza pugilist, Ferdinand Lassalle reformer, duellist. Fell and cut it twentytwo years ago. Fell asleep then. Fellow always like that, mortified if women are by. Fellowchristians and antiBloomites, the man called Bloom is from the roots of hell, a disgrace to christian men. Fellowcountrymen, sgenl inn ban bata coisde gan capall. Fellow hid behind a door, come up behind him. Fellow might damn easy get a nasty fall there coming along tight in the dark. Fellow sharpening knife and fork to eat all before him, old chap picking his tootles. Fellows run up a bill on the slate and then slinking around the back streets into somewhere else. Fellows shell out the dibs. Fellow, the name of Antonio, done that. Felt for the curves inside her déshabillé. Felt heavier myself stepping out of that bath. Felt so off colour. Femininum! Fergus now And pierce... wood’s woven shade?... Ferguson, I think I caught. Fergus’ song: I sang it alone in the house, holding down the long dark chords. Fermé. Fertiliser and Incubator. Fever near her mouth. Few lines will do. Few years’ time half of them magistrates and civil servants. Fff! Fff. Fff! Ffoo! Fields of undersea, the lines faint brown in grass, buried cities. Fierce Italian with carriagewhip. Fiercely she slaps his haunch, her goldcurb wristbangles angriling, scolding him in Moorish. Fifteen. Fifteen. Fifteen. Fifteen children he had. Fifteen millions of barrels of porter. Fifteen multiplied by. Fifteen she told me. Fifty yards measured. Figne toi trop. Figures wander, lurk, peer from warrens. Figures wind serpenting in slow woodland pattern around the treestems, cooeeing. —Filberts I believe they were, Mr Dedalus said, as he dropped his glasses on his coatfront, following them. Filled with his god, he thrones, Buddh under plantain. Filling my belly with husks of swine. Fill it up with wind. Fill me. Fill us out some more tea, Kinch. Filthy shells. Filthy trip. Find damn all of himself that morning. —Find out, miss Douce retorted, leaving her spyingpoint. Find out what they imagine they know. Find the way in. —Fine. —Fine! Fine! Fine! Fine dashing young nobleman. Fine eyes she had, clear. —Fine lump of a woman all the same, the soi-disant townclerk Henry Campbell remarked, and plenty of her. Fine morning. Fine poem that is: Ingram. Fine voice that fellow had. Fingering still the letter in his pocket he drew the pin out of it. Fingers. Fingers was made before forks. Finish. —Finished? Fire away number one on the gun. Firebrands of Europe and they always were. Fire lit. First catch your hare. First communicants. First gentleman told Mina that was so. First he got a bit of a start but it turned out to be only something about somebody named H. du Boyes, agent for typewriters or something like that. First he tickled her Then he patted her Then he passed the female catheter For he was a medical Jolly old medi... First I heard of it. First I’ll have a go at you myself. First I must. First I saw. First it was strictly Platonic till nature intervened and an attachment sprang up between them till bit by bit matters came to a climax and the matter became the talk of the town till the staggering blow came as a welcome intelligence to not a few evildisposed, however, who were resolved upon encompassing his downfall though the thing was public property all along though not to anything like the sensational extent that it subsequently blossomed into. First kiss does the trick. First Lid, De, Cow, Ker, Doll, a fifth: Lidwell, Si Dedalus, Bob Cowley, Kernan and big Ben Dollard. Firstly, in order to exercise mnemotechnic: secondly, because after an interval of amnesia, when, seated at the central table, about to consult the work in question, he remembered by mnemotechnic the name of the military engagement, Plevna. Firstly, oscillation between events of imperial and of local interest, the anticipated diamond jubilee of Queen Victoria born 1820, acceded 1837 and the posticipated opening of the new municipal fish market: secondly, apprehension of opposition from extreme circles on the questions of the respective visits of Their Royal Highnesses the duke and duchess of York real and of His Majesty King Brian Boru imaginary: thirdly, a conflict between professional etiquette and professional emulation concerning the recent erections of the Grand Lyric Hall on Burgh Quay and the Theatre Royal in Hawkins street: fourthly, distraction resultant from compassion for Nelly Bouverist’s non-intellectual, non-political, non-topical expression of countenance and concupiscence caused by Nelly Bouverist’s revelations of white articles of non-intellectual, non-political, non-topical underclothing while she Nelly Bouverist was in the articles: fifthly, the difficulties of the selection of appropriate music and humorous allusions from Everybody’s Book of Jokes 1000 pages and a laugh in every one: sixthly, the rhymes, homophonous and cacophonous, associated with the names of the new lord mayor, Daniel Tallon, the new high sheriff, Thomas Pile and the new solicitorgeneral, Dunbar Plunket Barton. —First my riddle, Lenehan said. First night when first I saw her at Mat Dillon’s in Terenure. First of the month it must have been or the second. —First, our little financial settlement, he said. First place murderer makes for. First rate, sir. —First round Dunphy’s, Mr Dedalus said, nodding. First, saved from waters of old Nile, among bulrushes, a bed of fasciated wattles: at last the cavity of a mountain, an occulted sepulchre amid the conclamation of the hillcat and the ossifrage. First sweet then savoury. First the stiff: then the friends of the stiff. First thing strikes anybody. First thoughts are best. First to the meet and in at the death. First turn to the left. FIRST WATCH: Caught in the act. FIRST WATCH: Come. FIRST WATCH: Draws his truncheon. FIRST WATCH: He is a marked man. FIRST WATCH: Infernal machine with a time fuse. FIRST WATCH: It is not in the penny catechism. FIRST WATCH: It was only in case of corporal injuries I’d have to report it at the station. FIRST WATCH: Laughs. FIRST WATCH: Name and address. FIRST WATCH: O. I understand, sir. FIRST WATCH: Profession or trade. FIRST WATCH: Proof. FIRST WATCH: Reads. FIRST WATCH: Regiment. FIRST WATCH: Sternly. FIRST WATCH: Takes out his notebook. FIRST WATCH: The King versus Bloom. FIRST WATCH: The offence complained of? FIRST WATCH: Turns to the crowd. FIRST WATCH: What do you tax him with? FIRST WATCH: What’s wrong here? Fishgluey slime her heaving embonpoint!. Fish’s face, bloodless and livid. Fit as a fiddle only he has a lot of adipose tissue concealed about his person. Fit for a prince’s. Fits me down to the ground. Fitted her like a glove, shoulders and hips. Fitter for him go home to the little sleepwalking bitch he married, Mooney, the bumbailiff’s daughter, mother kept a kip in Hardwicke street, that used to be stravaging about the landings Bantam Lyons told me that was stopping there at two in the morning without a stitch on her, exposing her person, open to all comers, fair field and no favour. Fitzharris. —Five. Five bob I gave. Five Dig. Five fathoms out there. Five guineas about. Five guineas a jugular. Five lines of text and ten pages of notes about the folk and the fishgods of Dundrum. Five months. Five number ones. Five, seven, nine. Five shillings. Five, six: the nacheinander. Five tallwhitehatted sandwichmen between Monypeny’s corner and the slab where Wolfe Tone’s statue was not, eeled themselves turning H. E. L. Y.’S and plodded back as they had come. Five to three. Five young children. Fizz and Red bank oysters. Flag of distress. Flakes of pastry on the gusset of her dress: daub of sugary flour stuck to her cheek. Flapdoodle to feed fools on. Flap ears to match. Flashing white Kaffir eyes and tusks they rattle through a breakdown in clumsy clogs, twinging, singing, back to back, toe heel, heel toe, with smackfatclacking nigger lips. Flat Dublin voices bawled in his head. Flat I see, then think distance, near, far, flat I see, east, back. Flatter. Flatters them. Flattery where least expected. Flaw in the glass, fresh Vartry water. Flaxseed tea. Flayed glasseyed sheep hung from their haunches, sheepsnouts bloodypapered snivelling nosejam on sawdust. Flea having a good square meal. Fleet was his foot on the bracken: Patrick of the beamy brow. Fleshhotpots of Egypt to hanker after. Fleshpots of Egypt. Flesh yielded amply amid rumpled clothes: whites of eyes swooning up. Flicker, flicker: the laceflare of her hat in the sun: flicker, flick. Flies come before he’s well dead. Flies’ picnic too. Flimsy China silks. Flipperty Jippert. Flood, gush, flow, joygush, tupthrob. Flood of warm jamjam lickitup secretness flowed to flow in music out, in desire, dark to lick flow invading. Florence MacCabe takes a crubeen and a bottle of double X for supper every Saturday. Florry and Bella push the table towards the fireplace. FLORRY: And me? FLORRY: And the song? FLORRY: Are you out of Maynooth? Florry Christ, Stephen Christ, Zoe Christ, Bloom Christ, Kitty Christ, Lynch Christ, it’s up to you to sense that cosmic force. FLORRY: Dreams goes by contraries. Florry follows, spilling water from her tilted tumbler. FLORRY: Give him some cold water. FLORRY: Hiding her with her gown. FLORRY: I will. FLORRY: Nods. FLORRY: Nods. FLORRY: Offended. FLORRY: Strives heavily to rise. Florry Talbot, a blond feeble goosefat whore in a tatterdemalion gown of mildewed strawberry, lolls spreadeagle in the sofacorner, her limp forearm pendent over the bolster, listening. Florry whispers to her. FLORRY: With a glass of water, enters. Flowers her eyes were, take me, willing eyes. Flowers, incense, candles melting. Flowers of idleness. Foghorns hoot. Fol. Folded away in the memory of nature with her toys. Folding the page into his pocket he turned into Eccles street, hurrying homeward. Follow. Followed by the whining dog he walks on towards hellsgates. Following the pointing of her finger he took up a leg of her soiled drawers from the bed. Follow me up to Carlow. Folly. Folly am I writing? Fontenoy, eh? Foodheated faces, sweating helmets, patting their truncheons. Fool and his money. Fool someone else, not me. Foot and mouth? —Foot and mouth. Foot and Mouth. Foot and mouth disease. —Foot and mouth disease! the editor cried in scornful invective. Footdrill stopped. Footmarks are stamped over it in all senses, heel to heel, heel to hollow, toe to toe, feet locked, a morris of shuffling feet without body phantoms, all in a scrimmage higgledypiggledy. Footstool! Foot to foot, knee to knee, belly to belly, bubs to breast! For a cat. —For a few days tell him, Father Cowley said anxiously. For aged and virtuous females. —For a guinea, Stephen said, you can publish this interview. For all these knotty points see the seventeenth book of my Fundamentals of Sexology or the Love Passion which Doctor L. B. says is the book sensation of the year. For all things dying, for all things born. For an instant she was silent with rather sad downcast eyes. For another: a constable off duty cuddling her in Eccles’ Lane. For answer Mr Mulligan, in a gale of laughter at his smalls, smote himself bravely below the diaphragm, exclaiming with an admirable droll mimic of Mother Grogan the most excellent creature of her sex though ’tis pity she’s a trollop: There’s a belly that never bore a bastard. For answer Tom Rochford pressed his hand to his breastbone and hiccupped. For a plump of pressmen. For a woman who was no better than she should be, Helen, the runaway wife of Menelaus, ten years the Greeks made war on Troy. For being so nice, eh? For Bloom. Force, hatred, history, all that. Force of habit. For creamy dreamy. For England, home and beauty. For entire colts and fillies. For every newbegotten thou shalt gather thy homer of ripe wheat. For example one of those policemen sweating Irish stew into their shirts you couldn’t squeeze a line of poetry out of him. For Gerty had her dreams that no-one knew of. Forget. Forget: a dispossessed. Forget, forgive. Forget not Madam Grissel Steevens nor the suine scions of the house of Lambert. Forgive! Forgive him his trespasses. For God’ sake, doctor. —For God’s sake!
