For Helen, the runaway wife of Menelaus, ten years the Greeks. For her birthday perhaps. For him! For him then not for. For Hindu widows only. For his nutriment he shewed how he would feed himself exclusively upon a diet of savoury tubercles and fish and coneys there, the flesh of these latter prolific rodents being highly recommended for his purpose, both broiled and stewed with a blade of mace and a pod or two of capsicum chillies. For identification, bucket in my hand. For if my master he did hear He’d make it a sorry ball.” She took him by the lilywhite hand And led him along the hall Until she led him to a room Where none could hear him call. For instance eunuchs. For instance if you go into a cellar where it’s dark. For instance M’Auley’s down there: n. g. as position. For instance some fellow that died when I was in Wisdom Hely’s. For instance there was the case of O’Callaghan, for one, the halfcrazy faddist, respectably connected though of inadequate means, with his mad vagaries among whose other gay doings when rotto and making himself a nuisance to everybody all round he was in the habit of ostentatiously sporting in public a suit of brown paper a fact. For instance when she asked you would you have some more Chinese tea and jaspberry ram and when she drew the jugs too and the men’s faces on her nails with red ink make you split your sides or when she wanted to go where you know she said she wanted to run and pay a visit to the Miss White. For instance when the evicted tenants question, then at its first inception, bulked largely in people’s mind though, it goes without saying, not contributing a copper or pinning his faith absolutely to its dictums, some of which wouldn’t exactly hold water, he at the outset in principle at all events was in thorough sympathy with peasant possession as voicing the trend of modern opinion a partiality, however, which, realising his mistake, he was subsequently partially cured of and even was twitted with going a step farther than Michael Davitt in the striking views he at one time inculcated as a backtothelander, which was one reason he strongly resented the innuendo put upon him in so barefaced a fashion by our friend at the gathering of the clans in Barney Kiernan’s so that he, though often considerably misunderstood and the least pugnacious of mortals, be it repeated, departed from his customary habit to give him metaphorically one in the gizzard though, so far as politics themselves were concerned, he was only too conscious of the casualties invariably resulting from propaganda and displays of mutual animosity and the misery and suffering it entailed as a foregone conclusion on fine young fellows, chiefly, destruction of the fittest, in a word. For instance who? Fork and steel. For keeps? For Liverpool probably. For many happy returns. For me. For me! For men. For me this. Formless spiritual. Forms more frequent, white shapes thronged amid the trees, white forms and fragments streaming by mutely, sustaining vain gestures on the air. For my sake and for all our sakes. For my son Leopold. For my wife. —For near a month, man, before it came off. For nonperishable goods bought of Moses Herzog, of 13 Saint Kevin’s parade in the city of Dublin, Wood quay ward, merchant, hereinafter called the vendor, and sold and delivered to Michael E. Geraghty, esquire, of 29 Arbour hill in the city of Dublin, Arran quay ward, gentleman, hereinafter called the purchaser, videlicet, five pounds avoirdupois of first choice tea at three shillings and no pence per pound avoirdupois and three stone avoirdupois of sugar, crushed crystal, at threepence per pound avoirdupois, the said purchaser debtor to the said vendor of one pound five shillings and sixpence sterling for value received which amount shall be paid by said purchaser to said vendor in weekly instalments every seven calendar days of three shillings and no pence sterling: and the said nonperishable goods shall not be pawned or pledged or sold or otherwise alienated by the said purchaser but shall be and remain and be held to be the sole and exclusive property of the said vendor to be disposed of at his good will and pleasure until the said amount shall have been duly paid by the said purchaser to the said vendor in the manner herein set forth as this day hereby agreed between the said vendor, his heirs, successors, trustees and assigns of the one part and the said purchaser, his heirs, successors, trustees and assigns of the other part. For one thing he mightn’t what you call jump at the idea, if approached, and what mostly worried him was he didn’t know how to lead up to it or word it exactly, supposing he did entertain the proposal, as it would afford him very great personal pleasure if he would allow him to help to put coin in his way or some wardrobe, if found suitable. For only her he waited. For Raoul! For Raoul!. For Raoul. For Raoul. For regarding Believe-on-Me they said it was nought else but notion and they could conceive no thought of it for, first, Two-in-the-Bush whither she ticed them was the very goodliest grot and in it were four pillows on which were four tickets with these words printed on them, Pickaback and Topsyturvy and Shameface and Cheek by Jowl and, second, for that foul plague Allpox and the monsters they cared not for them for Preservative had given them a stout shield of oxengut and, third, that they might take no hurt neither from Offspring that was that wicked devil by virtue of this same shield which was named Killchild. For shame! For, sirs, he said, our lust is brief. For some man. For such a one she yearns this balmy summer eve. For such favours knights of old laid down their lives. Fort Camden and Fort Carlisle. For terms apply: E. Dowden, Highfield house... For that are you pining, the bark of their applause? For that lot. For that matter so are we. For the Caliph. For the enlightenment of those who are not so intimately acquainted with the minutiae of the municipal abattoir as this morbidminded esthete and embryo philosopher who for all his overweening bumptiousness in things scientific can scarcely distinguish an acid from an alkali prides himself on being, it should perhaps be stated that staggering bob in the vile parlance of our lowerclass licensed victuallers signifies the cookable and eatable flesh of a calf newly dropped from its mother. For the guest: security of domicile and seclusion of study. For the hoi polloi. For the honour of God! For the hostess: disintegration of obsession, acquisition of correct Italian pronunciation. For the host: rejuvenation of intelligence, vicarious satisfaction. —For the moment, no, Stephen answered. For them the earth is not an exploitable ground but the living mother. For them too history was a tale like any other too often heard, their land a pawnshop. For them unheeding him he banged on the counter his tray of chattering china. For the nonce he was rather nonplussed but inasmuch as the duty plainly devolved upon him to take some measures on the subject he pondered suitable ways and means during which Stephen repeatedly yawned. For the old hag with the yellow teeth. —For the old woman of Prince’s street, says the citizen, the subsidised organ. For the rest Eve’s sovereign remedy. For the rest let look who will. For the rest there is that English invention, pamphlet of which I received some days ago, incorrectly addressed. For they garner the succulent berries of the hop and mass and sift and bruise and brew them and they mix therewith sour juices and bring the must to the sacred fire and cease not night or day from their toil, those cunning brothers, lords of the vat. For they were right witty scholars. Forth from the skirt of his coat Mr Dedalus brought pouch and pipe. For this relief much thanks. For this relief much thanks. For those words, Stephen: love’s bitter mystery. For through that tube he saw that he was in the land of Phenomenon where he must for a certain one day die as he was like the rest too a passing show. For Tommy and Jacky Caffrey were twins, scarce four years old and very noisy and spoiled twins sometimes but for all that darling little fellows with bright merry faces and endearing ways about them. For trading without a licence, says he. —Fortune, he wished, lifting his bubbled ale. —Fortune, Joe, says I. For Ulster will fight And Ulster will be right. Forward to the ribbon counter. Forward, woozy wobblers! For what creature was the door of egress a door of ingress? For what personal purpose could Bloom have applied the water so boiled? For what reason did he meditate on schemes so difficult of realisation? For what we have already received may the Lord make us. For which and further reasons he felt it was his interest and duty even to wait on and profit by the unlookedfor occasion though why he could not exactly tell being as it was already several shillings to the bad having in fact let himself in for it. For which reason he encouraged Stephen to proceed with his eyes while he did the honours by surreptitiously pushing the cup of what was temporarily supposed to be called coffee gradually nearer him. For who is there who anything of some significance has apprehended but is conscious that that exterior splendour may be the surface of a downwardtending lutulent reality or on the contrary anyone so is there unilluminated as not to perceive that as no nature’s boon can contend against the bounty of increase so it behoves every most just citizen to become the exhortator and admonisher of his semblables and to tremble lest what had in the past been by the nation excellently commenced might be in the future not with similar excellence accomplished if an inverecund habit shall have gradually traduced the honourable by ancestors transmitted customs to that thither of profundity that that one was audacious excessively who would have the hardihood to rise affirming that no more odious offence can for anyone be than to oblivious neglect to consign that evangel simultaneously command and promise which on all mortals with prophecy of abundance or with diminution’s menace that exalted of reiteratedly procreating function ever irrevocably enjoined? For whom? For why should the dainty scented jewelled hand, the hand that rules...? —For Willie Hughes, is it not? the quaker librarian asked. For you, please? For yourselves just. Foundation stone for Parnell. Found drowned. Found in the riverbed clutching rushes. Four? Four and nine. —Four bootlaces for a penny. Fourbottle men. Four buglers on foot blow a sennet. Four for sixpence. Four now. Four o’clock’s all’s well! Four omnipotent sovereigns. —Fourpence, sir. Four polygonal fragments of two lacerated scarlet betting tickets, numbered 8 87, 88 6. Four quid? —Four shining sovereigns, Buck Mulligan cried with delight. Fourteen hands high. Four umbrellas, her raincloak. Four winners yesterday and three today. Fox and geese. Fr. Fragments of shapes, hewn. Fraidrine. Frail from the housetops two plumes of smoke ascended, pluming, and in a flaw of softness softly were blown. Frailty, thy name is marriage. Frailty, thy name is Sceptre. Framed around the walls images of vanished horses stood in homage, their meek heads poised in air: lord Hastings’ Repulse, the duke of Westminster’s Shotover, the duke of Beaufort’s Ceylon, prix de Paris, 1866. France produces the finest flower of corruption in Mallarmé but the desirable life is revealed only to the poor of heart, the life of Homer’s Phæacians. Francis was reminding Stephen of years before when they had been at school together in Conmee’s time. Frankly, though she had her advisers or admirers, I never cared much for her style. Frantic hearts. FREDDY: Ah, ma, you’re dragging me along! Fred Ryan, two shillings. Fred Ryan wants space for an article on economics. Free! Free ad. Freeman. Freeman’s Journal? Freeman’s Journal 1—7—6 Loan Stephen Dedalus 1—7—0 ————— 2—19—3 Did the process of divestiture continue? Freeman’s Urinal and Weekly Arsewipe here. Free medical and legal advice, solution of doubles and other problems. Free money, free rent, free love and a free lay church in a free lay state. Freer in air. Freeze them up with that eye of his. French letter still in my pocketbook. Fresh air helps memory. Fresh thing was never touched. Friction of the position. Fried everything in the best butter all the same. Fried with butter, a shake of pepper. Friend of the family. —Friend of yours, says Alf. Friends here. Frightened she was when her nature came on her first. Frightening them with masks too. Fro. Frockcoats. Frogmore memorial mourning. From a bulge of window curtains a gramophone rears a battered brazen trunk. From a child this Frank had been a donought that his father, a headborough, who could ill keep him to school to learn his letters and the use of the globes, matriculated at the university to study the mechanics but he took the bit between his teeth like a raw colt and was more familiar with the justiciary and the parish beadle than with his volumes. From a corner the morning hours run out, goldhaired, slimsandalled, in girlish blue, waspwaisted, with innocent hands. From a hill above a corpsestrewn plain a general speaking to his officers, leaned upon his spear. From Ailesbury road, Clyde road, artisans’ dwellings, north Dublin union, lord mayor in his gingerbread coach, old queen in a bathchair. From a long face a beard and gaze hung on a chessboard. From an open box on the majolicatopped table he extracted a black diminutive cone, one inch in height, placed it on its circular base on a small tin plate, placed his candlestick on the right corner of the mantelpiece, produced from his waistcoat a folded page of prospectus illustrated entitled Agendath Netaim, unfolded the same, examined it superficially, rolled it into a thin cylinder, ignited it in the candleflame, applied it when ignited to the apex of the cone till the latter reached the stage of rutilance, placed the cylinder in the basin of the candlestick disposing its unconsumed part in such a manner as to facilitate total combustion. From before the ages He willed me and now may not will me away or ever. From Butler’s monument house corner he glanced along Bachelor’s walk. From Cahill’s corner the reverend Hugh C. Love, M. A., made obeisance unperceived, mindful of lords deputies whose hands benignant had held of yore rich advowsons. From Chickabiddy’s owny Mumpsypum. From clergyman, British naval officer, wellknown author, city man, hospital nurse, lady, mother of five, absentminded beggar. From drains, clefts, cesspools, middens arise on all sides stagnant fumes. From everything in the least indelicate her finebred nature instinctively recoiled. From farther away, walking shoreward across from the crested tide, figures, two. From Gibraltar by long sea long ago. From Gillen’s hairdresser’s window a composite portrait shows him gallant Nelson’s image. From his arm a folded dustcoat, a stick and an umbrella dangled to his stride. From his forehead arise starkly the Mosaic ramshorns. From his girdle hung a row of seastones which jangled at every movement of his portentous frame and on these were graven with rude yet striking art the tribal images of many Irish heroes and heroines of antiquity, Cuchulin, Conn of hundred battles, Niall of nine hostages, Brian of Kincora, the ardri Malachi, Art MacMurragh, Shane O’Neill, Father John Murphy, Owen Roe, Patrick Sarsfield, Red Hugh O’Donnell, Red Jim MacDermott, Soggarth Eoghan O’Growney, Michael Dwyer, Francy Higgins, Henry Joy M’Cracken, Goliath, Horace Wheatley, Thomas Conneff, Peg Woffington, the Village Blacksmith, Captain Moonlight, Captain Boycott, Dante Alighieri, Christopher Columbus, S. Fursa, S. Brendan, Marshal MacMahon, Charlemagne, Theobald Wolfe Tone, the Mother of the Maccabees, the Last of the Mohicans, the Rose of Castile, the Man for Galway, The Man that Broke the Bank at Monte Carlo, The Man in the Gap, The Woman Who Didn’t, Benjamin Franklin, Napoleon Bonaparte, John L. Sullivan, Cleopatra, Savourneen Deelish, Julius Caesar, Paracelsus, sir Thomas Lipton, William Tell, Michelangelo Hayes, Muhammad, the Bride of Lammermoor, Peter the Hermit, Peter the Packer, Dark Rosaleen, Patrick W. Shakespeare, Brian Confucius, Murtagh Gutenberg, Patricio Velasquez, Captain Nemo, Tristan and Isolde, the first Prince of Wales, Thomas Cook and Son, the Bold Soldier Boy, Arrah na Pogue, Dick Turpin, Ludwig Beethoven, the Colleen Bawn, Waddler Healy, Angus the Culdee, Dolly Mount, Sidney Parade, Ben Howth, Valentine Greatrakes, Adam and Eve, Arthur Wellesley, Boss Croker, Herodotus, Jack the Giantkiller, Gautama Buddha, Lady Godiva, The Lily of Killarney, Balor of the Evil Eye, the Queen of Sheba, Acky Nagle, Joe Nagle, Alessandro Volta, Jeremiah O’Donovan Rossa, Don Philip O’Sullivan Beare. From hour to hour it rots and rots. From house to house, giving his everwelcome double knock, went the nine o’clock postman, the glowworm’s lamp at his belt gleaming here and there through the laurel hedges. From hypnotic suggestion: once, waking, he had not recognised his sleeping apartment: more than once, waking, he had been for an indefinite time incapable of moving or uttering sounds. From inexistence to existence he came to many and was as one received: existence with existence he was with any as any with any: from existence to nonexistence gone he would be by all as none perceived. From infancy to maturity he had resembled his maternal procreatrix. From inside information extending over a series of years Mr Bloom was rather inclined to poohpooh the suggestion as egregious balderdash for, pending that consummation devoutly to be or not to be wished for, he was fully cognisant of the fact that their neighbours across the channel, unless they were much bigger fools than he took them for, rather concealed their strength than the opposite. From its sluice in Wood quay wall under Tom Devan’s office Poddle river hung out in fealty a tongue of liquid sewage. From left upper entrance with two gliding steps Henry Flower comes forward to left front centre. From maturity to senility he would increasingly resemble his paternal procreator. From me. —From me, Kinch, he said. From one extreme to the other. From on high the voice of Adonai calls. From on high the voice of Adonai calls. From outrage matrimony to outrage adultery there arose nought but outrage copulation yet the matrimonial violator of the matrimonially violated had not been outraged by the adulterous violator of the adulterously violated. From Roundwood reservoir in county Wicklow of a cubic capacity of 2400 million gallons, percolating through a subterranean aqueduct of filter mains of single and double pipeage constructed at an initial plant cost of £ 5 per linear yard by way of the Dargle, Rathdown, Glen of the Downs and Callowhill to the 26 acre reservoir at Stillorgan, a distance of 22 statute miles, and thence, through a system of relieving tanks, by a gradient of 250 feet to the city boundary at Eustace bridge, upper Leeson street, though from prolonged summer drouth and daily supply of 12 1/2 million gallons the water had fallen below the sill of the overflow weir for which reason the borough surveyor and waterworks engineer, Mr Spencer Harty, C. E., on the instructions of the waterworks committee had prohibited the use of municipal water for purposes other than those of consumption envisaging the possibility of recourse being had to the impotable water of the Grand and Royal canals as in 1893 particularly as the South Dublin Guardians, notwithstanding their ration of 15 gallons per day per pauper supplied through a 6 inch meter, had been convicted of a wastage of 20,000 gallons per night by a reading of their meter on the affirmation of the law agent of the corporation, Mr Ignatius Rice, solicitor, thereby acting to the detriment of another section of the public, selfsupporting taxpayers, solvent, sound. From shoulder to shoulder he measured several ells and his rocklike mountainous knees were covered, as was likewise the rest of his body wherever visible, with a strong growth of tawny prickly hair in hue and toughness similar to the mountain gorse Ulex Europeus. From Six Mile Point, Flathouse, Nine Mile Stone follow the footpeople with knotty sticks, hayforks, salmongaffs, lassos, flockmasters with stockwhips, bearbaiters with tomtoms, toreadors with bullswords, grey negroes waving torches. From somnambulism: once, sleeping, his body had risen, crouched and crawled in the direction of a heatless fire and, having attained its destination, there, curled, unheated, in night attire had lain, sleeping. From the belfries far and near the funereal deathbell tolled unceasingly while all around the gloomy precincts rolled the ominous warning of a hundred muffled drums punctuated by the hollow booming of pieces of ordnance. From the cellar grating floated up the flabby gush of porter. From the cool shadow of the doorway he saw the horses pass Parliament street, harness and glossy pasterns in sunlight shimmering. From the curbstone he darted a keen glance through the door of the postoffice. From the door of the Red Bank the white disc of a straw hat flashed reply: spruce figure: passed. FROM THE FATHERS It was revealed to me that those things are good which yet are corrupted which neither if they were supremely good nor unless they were good could be corrupted. From the forsaken shell miss Mina glided to her tankards waiting. From the Freeman. From the high barbacans of the tower two shafts of light fall on the smokepalled altarstone. From the hoardings Mr Eugene Stratton grimaced with thick niggerlips at Father Conmee. From the left arrives a jingling hackney car. From the liberties, out for the day. From the milkwoman or from him. From the playfield the boys raised a shout. From the reports of eyewitnesses it transpires that the seismic waves were accompanied by a violent atmospheric perturbation of cyclonic character. —From the rock of Gibraltar... all the way. From the saloon a call came, long in dying. From these words Mr Best turned an unoffending face to Stephen. From the sidemirrors two mourning Masters Dignam gaped silently. From the sublime to the ridiculous is but a step. From the sundial towards James’s gate walked Mr Kernan, pleased with the order he had booked for Pulbrook Robertson, boldly along James’s street, past Shackleton’s offices. From the suttee pyre the flame of gum camphire ascends. From the top of a tower Buck Mulligan, in particoloured jester’s dress of puce and yellow and clown’s cap with curling bell, stands gaping at her, a smoking buttered split scone in his hand. From the top spur he slides down. From under a wideleaved sombrero the figure regards him with evil eye. From which if any of these mental or physical disorders was he not totally immune? From whom? Fro, to: to, fro: over the polished knob she knows his eyes, my eyes, her eyes her thumb and finger passed in pity: passed, reposed and, gently touching, then slid so smoothly, slowly down, a cool firm white enamel baton protruding through their sliding ring. Fruitarians. —F sharp major, Ben Dollard said. —F to P is the route Skin-the-Goat drove the car for an alibi, Inchicore, Roundtown, Windy Arbour, Palmerston Park, Ranelagh. F. T. Purcell, O. P.; the very rev. Fuit Ilium! Full as a tick. Full fathom five thy father lies. Full gluey woman’s lips. Full of a dure. Full of his son. —Full of hope and all delighted... Full of the best liqueurs. Full she drad that God the Wreaker all mankind would fordo with water for his evil sins. —Full stop, Mr Deasy bade his keys. Full throb. Full tup. Full voice of perfume of what perfume does your lilactrees. Fumbally’s lane that night: the tanyard smells. Funeral be rather glum. Funeral of the late Mr Patrick Dignam. Funerals all over the world everywhere every minute. Funeral was this morning. Funny I don’t remember that. Funny little beggar. Funny my watch stopped at half past four. Funny she looked soaped all over. Funny sight two of them together, their bellies out. Funny the way those newspaper men veer about when they get wind of a new opening. Funny, very! Fun on the Bristol. Furthermore he had a row with Lenehan and called him to Stephen a mean bloody swab with a sprinkling of a number of other uncalledfor expressions. Furthermore, silly Milly, she dreamed of having had an unspoken unremembered conversation with a horse whose name had been Joseph to whom which she had offered a tumblerful of lemonade which it he had appeared to have accepted cf hearthdreaming cat. Fuseblue peer from barrel rev. evensong Love on hackney jaunt Blazes blind coddoubled bicyclers Dilly with snowcake no fancy clothes. Futility. Gabble of geese. Gabriel Conroy’s brother is curate. Gad’s bud, immensely so, said Mr Lynch. —Gadzooks! cried the last speaker. Gaelic league spy, sent by that fireeater. Ga ga ga ga Gara. Ga Ga Gara. Gaily miss Douce polished a tumbler, trilling: —O, Idolores, queen of the eastern seas! Gaily they went past before his cool unfriendly eyes, not quickly. Gain time. Gallaher. Gallaher, that was a pressman for you. Galleys of the Lochlanns ran here to beach, in quest of prey, their bloodbeaked prows riding low on a molten pewter surf. Gallons. Gallop of hoofs. Gambling. Gaming at Daly’s. Gammon and spinach. Gap in their voices too. Gaptoothed Kathleen, her four beautiful green fields, the stranger in her house. Gara. Garbage, sewage they feed on. Garibaldi. Garn! GARRETT DEASY: Bolt upright, his nailscraped face plastered with postagestamps, brandishes his hockeystick, his blue eyes flashing in the prism of the chandelier as his mount lopes by at schooling gallop. Garryowen! Gasballs spinning about, crossing each other, passing. Gas of graves. Gassy thing that cider: binding too. Gas: then solid: then world: then cold: then dead shell drifting around, frozen rock, like that pineapple rock. Gasworks. Gate. Gathering figs, I think. Gaudium magnum annuntio vobis. Gaudy colour warns you off. Gaudy dollwomen loll in the lighted doorways, in window embrasures, smoking birdseye cigarettes. Gave her that song Winds that blow from the south. Gave it to someone. —Gave it to them on a hot plate, Myles Crawford said, the whole bloody history. Gave Reuben J a great strawcalling. Gawds teruth, Chawley. Gaze. Gaze. Gaze in your omphalos. Gazelles are leaping, feeding on the mountains. Gazing upon those features with a world of tenderness, Ah, Monsieur, he said, had you but beheld her as I did with these eyes at that affecting instant with her dainty tucker and her new coquette cap a gift for her feastday as she told me prettily in such an artless disorder, of so melting a tenderness, ’pon my conscience, even you, Monsieur, had been impelled by generous nature to deliver yourself wholly into the hands of such an enemy or to quit the field for ever. Gee! Geese stuffed silly for them. Gee up! Gelded too: a stump of black guttapercha wagging limp between their haunches. Geld him. Gelid light and air were in the kitchen but out of doors gentle summer morning everywhere. Gelindo risolve di non amare S. D. —What is that, Mr Dedalus? the quaker librarian asked. Gemini. General amnesty, weekly carnival with masked licence, bonuses for all, esperanto the universal language with universal brotherhood. General applause. General Bobrikoff. General chorus off for a swill to wash it down. General commotion and compassion. General laughter. General paralysis of the insane! General thirst. Generous to a fault of course, temperamental, no economising or any idea of the sort, always snapping at the bone for the shadow. Gentleman. Gentleman, patriot, scholar and judge of impostors. GENTLEMEN OF THE PRESS Grossbooted draymen rolled barrels dullthudding out of Prince’s stores and bumped them up on the brewery float. —Gentlemen, Stephen said. Gentlemen that pay the rent. Gentle sweet air blew round the bared heads in a whisper. —Gentle Will is being roughly handled, gentle Mr Best said gently. Gently does it. GEORGE FOTTRELL: Clerk of the crown and peace, resonantly. George Lidwell, eyelid well expressive, fullbusted satin. George Lidwell held its murmur, hearing: then laid it by, gently. George Lidwell, suave, solicited, held a lydiahand. George Lidwell told her really and truly: but she did not believe. George R Mesias, Bloom’s tailor, appears, a tailor’s goose under his arm, presenting a bill. George Roberts is doing the commercial part. Ger. Gerald Molloy, D. D.; the rev. Germans making their way everywhere. Gerty! Gerty could picture the whole scene in the church, the stained glass windows lighted up, the candles, the flowers and the blue banners of the blessed Virgin’s sodality and Father Conroy was helping Canon O’Hanlon at the altar, carrying things in and out with his eyes cast down. Gerty had an idea, one of love’s little ruses. Gerty is Tommy’s sweetheart. Gerty just took off her hat for a moment to settle her hair and a prettier, a daintier head of nutbrown tresses was never seen on a girl’s shoulders—a radiant little vision, in sooth, almost maddening in its sweetness. Gerty MacDowell bent down her head and crimsoned at the idea of Cissy saying an unladylike thing like that out loud she’d be ashamed of her life to say, flushing a deep rosy red, and Edy Boardman said she was sure the gentleman opposite heard what she said. Gerty MacDowell loves the boy that has the bicycle. Gerty MacDowell who was seated near her companions, lost in thought, gazing far away into the distance was, in very truth, as fair a specimen of winsome Irish girlhood as one could wish to see. Gerty MacDowell yearns in vain. Gerty’s lips parted swiftly to frame the word but she fought back the sob that rose to her throat, so slim, so flawless, so beautifully moulded it seemed one an artist might have dreamed of. Gerty smiled assent and bit her lip. Gerty stifled a smothered exclamation and gave a nervous cough and Edy asked what and she was just going to tell her to catch it while it was flying but she was ever ladylike in her deportment so she simply passed it off with consummate tact by saying that that was the benediction because just then the bell rang out from the steeple over the quiet seashore because Canon O’Hanlon was up on the altar with the veil that Father Conroy put round his shoulders giving the benediction with the Blessed Sacrament in his hands. Gerty’s were of the bluest Irish blue, set off by lustrous lashes and dark expressive brows. GERTY: To Bloom. Gerty was dressed simply but with the instinctive taste of a votary of Dame Fashion for she felt that there was just a might that he might be out. Gerty winced sharply. Gerty wished to goodness they would take their squalling baby home out of that and not get on her nerves, no hour to be out, and the little brats of twins. GERTY: With all my worldly goods I thee and thou. Get a glass of milk for yourself and a bun or a something. Get a grip of them by the stomach. Get a light snack in Davy Byrne’s. Get another of Paul de Kock’s. Get a queer old tailend of corned beef off of that one, what? Get a spurt on. Get back, stand back! Get back then by the Poolbeg road to the strand there. Get Dilly to make you that boiled rice every night after your brainwork. Get down and push, mister. Get down, baldpoll! Get him away, you. Get it out in bits. Get it out in bits. Get on. —Getonouthat, you bloody old pedagogue! the editor said in recognition. Get out before the end. Get out of this. Get outside of a baron of beef. Get rid of him quickly. Get shut of it. Gets on your nerves. Get thee a breechpad. Get the pull over him that way. Get those policemen to move those loafers back. —Getting it up? he said. Getting on like a house on fire. Getting on to sundown. Getting up in a minute. Get twenty of them round you if you stare at nothing. Get up! Get up. Get ye gone. Ghaghahest. Ghostly light on the tortured face. Ghoul! Già. Già. Giants, though that is rather a far cry, you see once in a way, Marcella the midget queen. Gibraltar. Gibraltar. Giddy. Giddy Elijah. Già: di lui. Gift of nature. Gilbert in his old age told some cavaliers he got a pass for nowt from Maister Gatherer one time mass he did and he seen his brud Maister Wull the playwriter up in Lunnon in a wrastling play wud a man on’s back. Ginger cordial. Girl friends at school, arms round each other’s necks or with ten fingers locked, kissing and whispering secrets about nothing in the convent garden. Girlgold she read and did not glance. Girl in Eustace street hallway Monday was it settling her garter. Girl in Meath street that night. Girl in the monkeyhouse. Girl in Tranquilla convent that nun told me liked to smell rock oil. Girl’s face stained with dirt and tears, holding the woman’s arm, looking up at her for a sign to cry. Girls of the Prison Gate Mission, joining hands, caper round in the opposite direction. Girl’s sweet light lips. Girl there civil. Girl touched it. Give a bleeding whore a chance. Give and have done with it. Give hands, traverse, bow to partner: so: imps of fancy of the Moors. Give her beefsteaks, red, raw, bleeding! Give her too much meat she won’t mouse. Give her your blessing for me. Give him a rousing fine kick now and again where it wouldn’t blind him. Give him ginger. Give him the key too. Give him twopence tip. —Give it a name, citizen, says Joe. Give it to him too on the same place as quick as I’d look at him. —Give it up, father, Dilly said. Give me back that potato, will you? Give me in charge. Give me more than that. Give me my Wordsworth. Give me the fidgets to look. Give my love to mummy and to yourself a big kiss and thanks. Given a guarantee equal to the sum sought, the support, by deed of gift and transfer vouchers during donor’s lifetime or by bequest after donor’s painless extinction, of eminent financiers Blum Pasha, Rothschild, Guggenheim, Hirsch, Montefiore, Morgan, Rockefeller possessing fortunes in 6 figures, amassed during a successful life, and joining capital with opportunity the thing required was done. Given at this our loyal city of Dublin in the year 1 of the Paradisiacal Era. Given away with the Easter number of Photo Bits: Splendid masterpiece in art colours. Give’s a breather. Give’s a shake of peppe, you there. Give shade on languorous days, trees of Ireland! Gives him a sense of power seeing all the others go under first. Gives you second wind. Give the devil his due. Give them something with a bite in it. Give the paw. Give the paw, doggy! Give the paw here! Give up the moody brooding. Give us a bloody chance. Give us a breather! Give us a ditty. —Give us a squint at her, says I. —Give us a squint at that literature, grandfather, the ancient mariner put in, manifesting some natural impatience. Give us a touch, Poldy. Give us back them papers. —Give us one of your prime stinkers, Terry, says Joe. Give us some parleyvoo. Give us that biscuitbox here. Give us your blessing. —Give you good den, my masters, said he with an obsequious bow. Give you the creeps after a bit. Give you the needle that would. Glad after she was that ere adread was. Glad I avoided. Glad I didn’t know it when she was on show. Glad I took that bath. Gladly glancing, a merry puritan, through the twisted eglantine. Glad to get away from other chap’s wife. Glad to hear that, old man. Glad to see us go we give them such trouble coming. Glasnevin this morning... poor little... what do you call him... Glass. Glass flashing. Glass of bitter? Glass of bitter, please, and a sloegin for me. Glauber salts. Gleaming silks, petticoats on slim brass rails, rays of flat silk stockings. Glendalough, the lovely lakes of Killarney, the ruins of Clonmacnois, Cong Abbey, Glen Inagh and the Twelve Pins, Ireland’s Eye, the Green Hills of Tallaght, Croagh Patrick, the brewery of Messrs Arthur Guinness, Son and Company Limited, Lough Neagh’s banks, the vale of Ovoca, Isolde’s tower, the Mapas obelisk, Sir Patrick Dun’s hospital, Cape Clear, the glen of Aherlow, Lynch’s castle, the Scotch house, Rathdown Union Workhouse at Loughlinstown, Tullamore jail, Castleconnel rapids, Kilballymacshonakill, the cross at Monasterboice, Jury’s Hotel, S. Patrick’s Purgatory, the Salmon Leap, Maynooth college refectory, Curley’s hole, the three birthplaces of the first duke of Wellington, the rock of Cashel, the bog of Allen, the Henry Street Warehouse, Fingal’s Cave—all these moving scenes are still there for us today rendered more beautiful still by the waters of sorrow which have passed over them and by the rich incrustations of time. Glimpses of the moon. Glittereyed his rufous skull close to his greencapped desklamp sought the face bearded amid darkgreener shadow, an ollav, holyeyed. Gloomily. Gloomy gardens then went by: one by one: gloomy houses. Glorious and immaculate virgin. Glorious, pious and immortal memory. Glorious tone he has still. Glory be to God. Glory be to God. Glowing wine on his palate lingered swallowed. Glowworm’s la-amp is gleaming, love. Glue em well. Gluttons, tall, long legs. Gnashing her teeth in sleep. Gnawing their vitals. Go and lose more. Go and see life. —Go away! Go back. Gob, he’d adorn a sweepingbrush, so he would, if he only had a nurse’s apron on him. Gob, he’d have a soft hand under a hen. Gob, he’d let you pour all manner of drink down his throat till the Lord would call him before you’d ever see the froth of his pint. Gob, he golloped it down like old boots and his tongue hanging out of him a yard long for more. Gob, he had his mouth half way down the tumbler already. Gob, he’ll come home by weeping cross one of those days, I’m thinking. Gob, he near burnt his fingers with the butt of his old cigar. Gob, he near sent it into the county Longford. Gob, he organised her. Gob, he’s a prudent member and no mistake. Gob, he’s like Lanty MacHale’s goat that’d go a piece of the road with every one. Gob, he’s not as green as he’s cabbagelooking. Gob, if he got that lottery ticket on the side of his poll he’d remember the gold cup, he would so, but begob the citizen would have been lagged for assault and battery and Joe for aiding and abetting. Gob, it’d turn the porter sour in your guts, so it would. Gob, Jack made him toe the line. Gobstuff. Gob, that’d be a good pucking match to see. Gob, that puts the bloody kybosh on it if old sloppy eyes is mucking up the show. Gob, the citizen made a plunge back into the shop. Gob, the devil wouldn’t stop him till he got hold of the bloody tin anyhow and out with him and little Alf hanging on to his elbow and he shouting like a stuck pig, as good as any bloody play in the Queen’s royal theatre: —Where is he till I murder him? Gob, there’s many a true word spoken in jest. Gob, they ought to drown him in the sea after and electrocute and crucify him to make sure of their job. Gob, we won’t be let even do that much itself. God. God! —God Almighty couldn’t make him drunk, Nosey Flynn said firmly. God becomes man becomes fish becomes barnacle goose becomes featherbed mountain. God be with old times. God fuck old Bennett. —God grant he doesn’t upset us on the road, Mr Power said. —God! he cried. God, he gave him one last puck in the wind, Queensberry rules and all, made him puke what he never ate. God help his gamekeeper. God help your head, he knows more than you have forgotten. —God! he said quietly. God, I’d give anything to hear him before a judge and jury. God ild you. God, I’ll tell him anyhow. God, I’m dying for it. —God, isn’t he dreadful? he said frankly. God, I thank thee, as the Author of my days! God, Kinch, if you and I could only work together we might do something for the island. Going under the railway arch he took out the envelope, tore it swiftly in shreds and scattered them towards the road. Gold. Gone the nine men’s morrice with caps of indices. —Gone to meet father, Maggy said. Gone too from the world, Averroes and Moses Maimonides, dark men in mien and movement, flashing in their mocking mirrors the obscure soul of the world, a darkness shining in brightness which brightness could not comprehend. Good God he never heard in all his life a note like that he never did then false one we had better part so clear so God he never heard since love lives not a clinking voice lives not ask Lambert he can tell you too. Good, good to hear: sorrow from them each seemed to from both depart when first they heard. Good health, citizen. —Good health, Ned, says J. J. —-There he is again, says Joe. Good heart. Good: he left her and gained the world of men. Good hidingplace for treasure. Good house, however: just the end of the city traffic. Good hunting. Good idea a postmortem for doctors. Good puzzle would be cross Dublin without passing a pub. —Good, Stephen said. Good stock, of course. Good stroke. Good system for criminals. Good to rest once in a way. Good voice he has still. Go on. —Go on! —Go on, blast you! —Go on, pressed Lenehan. —Go on, Simon. Go on, Talbot. —Go on then, Talbot. Go or turn? Goosestep. Go out of mourning first. Go quick. Gordon Bennett. Gordon Bennett cup. —Gorgeous, she said. Gorgonzola, have you? Gospeltrue. Gospodi pomilyou. Got a dinge in the side of his hat. Got a match on you? Got a pectoral trauma, eh, Dix? Got a prime pair of mincepies, no kid. Got a short knock. Got bet be a boomblebee whenever he wus settin sleepin in hes bit garten. Got big then. Got fellows to stick them up or stick them up himself for that matter on the q. t. running in to loosen a button. Got here before us, dead as he is. Got her hand crushed by old Tom Wall’s son. Got her it once. Go the whole hog. Got his majority for the heroic defence of Rorke’s Drift. Got his rag out that evening on the bowlinggreen because I sailed inside him. Go thou and do likewise. Got me? Got money somewhere. Got my own back there. Go to! Got off lightly with illnesses compared. Go to hell! Got round him all right. Gott... dein... —Got the horn or what? he said. Got the job in Wisdom Hely’s year we married. Got the provinces now. Got the run. Got the shove, all of them. Got up as a young bride, man, veil, orangeblossoms, drove out the road to Malahide. Got up to kill: on eighteen bob a week. Got up wrong side of the bed. Got wind of Dignam. Got your lett and flow. Goulding a chance. Goulding, a flush struggling in his pale, told Mr Bloom, face of the night, Si in Ned Lambert’s, Dedalus house, sang ’Twas rank and fame. Goulding, Collis and Ward he calls the firm. Goulding, Collis, Ward. Government offices are temporarily transferred to railway sheds. Grab at all that offer. Grace after meals. Grace after meals. Grace Darling. Gradually changes your character. Graft, my dear sir. Grafton street gay with housed awnings lured his senses. Grain supplies through the narrow waters of the channel. —Grandest number in the whole opera, Goulding said. Grandfather ape gloating on a stolen hoard. —Grand is no name for it, said Buck Mulligan. Grave Bloom regards Zoe’s neck. Gravediggers bury Hamlet père and Hamlet fils. Gravediggers in Hamlet. Grave Gladstone sees him level, Bloom for Bloom. Gravy’s rather good fit for a. Grease. Greasy black rope. Greasy I knows. Great battle, Tokio. Great card he was. Great chorus that. Greater love than this, he said, no man hath that a man lay down his wife for his friend. Great man’s brother: his brother’s brother. Great nationalist meeting in Borris-in-Ossory. Great song of Julia Morkan’s. Great success of laughing. Great topers too. Great unjust God! Great voice Richie Goulding said, a flush struggling in his pale, to Bloom soon old. Great weapon in their hands. Greek ee. Green apples. Green by Drumleck. Green Chartreuse. Greeneyed monster. Green eyes, I see you. Green rag to a bull. Green starving faces eating dockleaves. Green twinkling stone. —Greetings from the famous son of a famous father. Gregor Grey made the design for it. Grey. Grey horror seared his flesh. Greyish over the ears. Grey sprouting beard. Grhahute! Gridiron. Griffith’s paper is on the same tack now: an army rotten with venereal disease: overseas or halfseasover empire. Grin and bear it. Grinding poverty did have that effect and he more than conjectured that, high educational abilities though he possessed, he experienced no little difficulty in making both ends meet. Gripe, yes. Grizzled moustache. Groangrousegurgling Toft’s cumbersome whirligig turns slowly the room right roundabout the room. Growl angry, then shriek cursing want to have wadding or something in his no don’t she cried, then all of a soft sudden wee little wee little pipy wind. Growling and grousing and his eye all bloodshot from the drouth is in it and the hydrophobia dropping out of his jaws. Grow peas in that corner there. Grows all the same after. Grub. Guesswork it reduced itself to eventually. Guinea to a goosegog. Gulfer of souls, engulfer. Gulls. Gulp. Gulp. Gum he’s a champion. Gum, I’m jiggered. —Gumley? he said. —Gurrhr! she cried, running to lap. —Ha. Ha? Ha. Ha! Habeas corpus. Habemus carneficem. Habsburg. Hackney cars, cabs, delivery waggons, mailvans, private broughams, aerated mineral water floats with rattling crates of bottles, rattled, rolled, horsedrawn, rapidly. Had a good breakfast. Had any special agility been his in earlier youth? Had Bloom and Stephen been baptised, and where and by whom, cleric or layman? Had Bloom discussed similar subjects during nocturnal perambulations in the past? Had Bloom’s coin returned? Had enough of it. Had he ever been a spectator of those phenomena? Had he found their solution? Had he performed any special corporal work of mercy for her? Had her father only avoided the clutches of the demon drink, by taking the pledge or those powders the drink habit cured in Pearson’s Weekly, she might now be rolling in her carriage, second to none. Had his office in Hume street. Had it? Had kind fate but willed her to be born a gentlewoman of high degree in her own right and had she only received the benefit of a good education Gerty MacDowell might easily have held her own beside any lady in the land and have seen herself exquisitely gowned with jewels on her brow and patrician suitors at her feet vying with one another to pay their devoirs to her. Had me decked. Had Pyrrhus not fallen by a beldam’s hand in Argos or Julius Caesar not been knifed to death. Had slipped down to the foot of the bed. Had the Queen’s hotel in Ennis. Had the time of their lives. Had the winner today till I tipped him a dead cert. Had this latter or any cognate phenomenon declared itself in any member of his family? Had time equally but differently obliterated the memory of these migrations in narrator and listener? Had to be. Had to look the other way. Had, too. Had to refuse the Greystones concert. Ha, give! Ha ha! —Ha ha, Alf, says Joe. Ha ha ha ha. Hah, hah, hah! Hai, boy! Haihoop! Hail fellow well met the next moment. Hail Mary and Holy Mary. Hail, Sisyphus. Haines! Haines asked. Haines asked: —Do you pay rent for this tower? Haines asked Stephen. Haines asked, twisting round in his seat. Haines called to them from the doorway: —Are you coming, you fellows? Haines came in from the doorway and said quietly: —That woman is coming up with the milk. Haines, come in. Haines detached from his underlip some fibres of tobacco before he spoke. Haines from the corner where he was knotting easily a scarf about the loose collar of his tennis shirt spoke: —I intend to make a collection of your sayings if you will let me. Haines helped himself and snapped the case to. Haines is apologising for waking us last night. —Haines is gone, he said. Haines laughed and, as he took his soft grey hat from the holdfast of the hammock, said: —I don’t know, I’m sure. —Haines missed you, he said. Haines opened his newbought book. Haines, open that door, will you? Haines said. Haines said again. Haines said, beginning to point at Stephen. Haines said to her: —Have you your bill? Haines sat down on a stone, smoking. Haines sat down to pour out the tea. Haines spoke to her again a longer speech, confidently. Haines stood at the doorway, looking out. Haines stopped to take out a smooth silver case in which twinkled a green stone. Haines was the third brother. Haines, who had been laughing guardedly, walked on beside Stephen and said: —We oughtn’t to laugh, I suppose. Hair? Hair braided over: shell with seaweed. Hair on end. Hair streaming: lovelorn. Hair strong in rut. —Hairy Iopas, says the citizen, that exploded volcano, the darling of all countries and the idol of his own. Hajajaja. —Haja ja ja haja. Hak! Halcyon days. Halcyon days, high school boys in blue and white football jerseys and shorts, Master Donald Turnbull, Master Abraham Chatterton, Master Owen Goldberg, Master Jack Meredith, Master Percy Apjohn, stand in a clearing of the trees and shout to Master Leopold Bloom. —Half a crown, Stephen responded. Half a league onward! Half a mo. —Half and half I mean, says the citizen. Half baked they look: hypnotised like. —Half day, sir. Half dream. Halffed enthusiasts. Half of one ear, all the nose and both thumbs are ghouleaten. —Half one, says Ned. —Half one, Terry, says John Wyse, and a hands up. Half ten and eleven. Half the catch of oysters they throw back in the sea to keep up the price. Half the town was there. Half time, Ben. Half twelve. Hallstand too full. Halt. Halt! Halted, below me, a quizzer looks at me. Halted, he peered down the dark winding stairs and called out coarsely: —Come up, Kinch! Ham and eggs, no. Ham and his descendants musterred and bred there. Hamilton Long’s, founded in the year of the flood. Hamlet, I am thy father’s gimlet! Hamlet, I am thy father’s spirit Doomed for a certain time to walk the earth. Hamlet ou... Hamlet ou Le Distrait Pièce de Shakespeare He repeated to John Eglinton’s newgathered frown: —Pièce de Shakespeare, don’t you know. Hamlet, revenge! Hamlet she played last night. Hamlet, the black prince, is Hamnet Shakespeare. Hammam. Handed down from father to, mother to daughter, I mean. Handed him the father and mother of a beating. Handel. Hand hurts me slightly. Handicapped as he was by lack of poundage, Dublin’s pet lamb made up for it by superlative skill in ringcraft. Hand in hand. Handker. Handkerchief too. Handle hrim. Hand on his heart. Hands felt for the opulent. Hands felt for the opulent. Hands moving. Handsome building. Handsome is and handsome does. Handsome yes, pretty in a way you find but what I’m talking about is the female form. Hands stuck in his trousers’ pockets, jarvey off for the day, singing. Hands up to De Wet. Handy man wants job. Hangende Hunger, Fragende Frau, Macht uns alle kaputt. Hanging? Hanging by his heels in the odour of sanctity. Hanging Harry, your Majesty, the Mersey terror. Hanging on to a plank or astride of a beam for grim life, lifebelt round him, gulping salt water, and that’s the last of his nibs till the sharks catch hold of him. Hanging over the bloody paper with Alf looking for spicy bits instead of attending to the general public. Hangmen’s letters. Happier then. Happy. Happy. Happy. Happy chairs under them. Hard. Hard after them Myles Crawford appeared on the steps, his hat aureoling his scarlet face, talking with J. J. O’Molloy. Hard as nails at a bargain, old Tweedy. Hard by the block stood the grim figure of the executioner, his visage being concealed in a tengallon pot with two circular perforated apertures through which his eyes glowered furiously. Hard earned on the flat of my back. Hard lines. Hard time she must have with him. Hard to breathe and all the young quicks clean consumed without sprinkle this long while back as no man remembered to be without. Hard to imagine his funeral. Hardy annuals he presents her with. Hark! Hark! Haroun al Raschid. Haroun Al Raschid. Harpooning flitches and hindquarters out of it. Harriers, father. Harsh gargoyle face that warred against me over our mess of hash of lights in rue Saint-André-des-Arts. Harshly, his pupils waxing. Has a good pair of boots on him today. Has all vanished since? Has anybody here seen? Has anybody here seen Kelly? —Has been? the more experienced of the two objected, sticking to his original point with a smile of unbelief. Has he forgotten? Has he forgotten this as he forgets all benefits received? Has he not nearer home a seedfield that lies fallow for the want of the ploughshare? Has her roses probably. Has his own ideas of justice in the recorder’s court. Has little mousey any tickles tonight? Has nobody...? Has no-one made him out to be an Irishman? Hasn’t lost them anyhow. Hasn’t the soldier a right to go with his girl? Hasn’t your landlord distrained for rent? Has poor little hubby cold feet waiting so long? —Has still, Ned Lambert said. Hast aught to give us? Has that silk hat ever since. Has the fidgets. Has the laugh at him now. Has the wrong sow by the lug. Has to change or they might think it a house. Hast thou found me, O mine enemy? Hate. Hate at first sight. Hate company when you. Hate people all round you. Hates sewing. Hatpin: ought to have a guard on those things. Hats off! Hat, tie, overcoat, nose. Hauding Sara by the wame. Hauled stark over the gunwale he breathes upward the stench of his green grave, his leprous nosehole snoring to the sun. Haunting face. Have a finger in the pie. Have a glint, do. Have a gramophone in every grave or keep it in the house. Have an eggnog or a prairie oyster. Have another quart of goosegrease before it gets too cold. Have a notion I was here before. —Have a shot at it now, he ventured to say of the coffee after being stirred. Have birds no smell? —Have I heard all? Have it now or wait till you get it? Have mercy on Stephen, Lord, for my sake! Have no fear. Haven’t seen her for ages. Haven’t seen you for a month of Sundays. Haven’t you lifted enough off him? Have rows all the same. Have that in your nose in the dark, whiff of stale boose. Have their own secrets between them. Have to be spoonfed first. Have to let fly. Have to stand a drink or two. Have we cold feet about the cosmos? —Have you a cheese sandwich? Have you a little present for me there? Have you a swaggerroot? Have you a way with them? Have you brought a bottle? Have you cash for a short time? Have you drunk the four quid? Have you ever seen a ghost? Have you forgotten me? —Have you found those six brave medicals, John Eglinton asked with elder’s gall, to write Paradise Lost at your dictation? Have you good artists? Have you got an old testament? Have you got that? Have you got that? Have you no soul? Have your daughters inveigling them to your house. Have you read his F? O yes, but I prefer Q. Yes, but W is wonderful. Have you seen him lately? —Have you seen the rock of Gibraltar? Have you the? Have you the? Have you the? Have you the? Have you the design? —Have you the key? a voice asked. —Have you time for a brief libation, Martin? says Ned. Have you Weekly Freeman of 17 March? Having a wet. Having delivered himself of this rebuke he saluted those present on the by and repaired to the door. Having read it all he took it from the newspaper and put it back in his sidepocket. Having requested a quart of buttermilk this was brought and evidently afforded relief. Having set it to draw he took off the kettle, crushed the pan flat on the live coals and watched the lump of butter slide and melt. Having set the halffilled kettle on the now burning coals, why did he return to the stillflowing tap? Haw. Haw haw have you the horn? Haw haw horn. Hawhorn. H. Dennany, monumental builder and sculptor. He. He. He acts and is acted on. He added in a preacher’s tone: —For this, O dearly beloved, is the genuine Christine: body and soul and blood and ouns. Head like a prize pumpkin. He admires him all the more. Head nodding in time. Head, redconecapped, buffeted, brineblinded. Heads bandaged. Headshake. Heads I win tails you lose. Head up! Head up! He affirmed his significance as a conscious rational animal proceeding syllogistically from the known to the unknown and a conscious rational reagent between a micro and a macrocosm ineluctably constructed upon the incertitude of the void. He aint half balmy. He also yielded to none in his admiration of Rossini’s Stabat Mater, a work simply abounding in immortal numbers, in which his wife, Madam Marion Tweedy, made a hit, a veritable sensation, he might safely say, greatly adding to her other laurels and putting the others totally in the shade, in the jesuit fathers’ church in upper Gardiner street, the sacred edifice being thronged to the doors to hear her with virtuosos, or virtuosi rather. Health all! —Health, Joe, says I. Healthy perhaps absorb all the. Healthy too, chanting, regular hours, then brew liqueurs. He always walks outside the lampposts. He ambled Dollard, bulky slops, before them hold that fellow with the: hold him now into the saloon. He ambles near with disgruntled hindquarters. He and I behind. He announced his presence by that gentle Rumboldian cough which so many have tried unsuccessfully to imitate—short, painstaking yet withal so characteristic of the man. He applies his handkerchief to his mouth and scrutinises the galloping tide of rosepink blood. He approached a bench and seated himself in its corner, nursing his hat and newspaper. He approached Larry O’Rourke’s. Hear. Hear! Hear! Heard? Heard as a boy. Heard from behind. Heard he then in that clap the voice of the god Bringforth or, what Calmer said, a hubbub of Phenomenon? Hear, hear! —Hear, hear to that, says John Wyse. Hear his voice in the house. Heart. Heart. —Heart as big as a lion, says Ned. Heartbeats: her breath: breath that is life. Heart of gold really. Heart of mine! Heart on his sleeve. Heart to heart talks. Heart trouble, I believe. He ascends and stands on the stone of destiny. He asked. He asked about Glaucon, Alcibiades, Pisistratus. He asked me to. He asked me to ask you to ask somebody named Boylan, a billsticker, to give him a job as a sandwichman. He assumes the avine head, foxy moustache and proboscidal eloquence of Seymour Bushe. Heat brought it out. Heat convected, a mode of motion developed by such combustion, was constantly and increasingly conveyed from the source of calorification to the liquid contained in the vessel, being radiated through the uneven unpolished dark surface of the metal iron, in part reflected, in part absorbed, in part transmitted, gradually raising the temperature of the water from normal to boiling point, a rise in temperature expressible as the result of an expenditure of 72 thermal units needed to raise 1 pound of water from 50° to 212° Fahrenheit. He ate off the crescent of water biscuit he had been nibbling and, hungered, made ready to nibble the biscuit in his other hand. Heatwave. Heavenly weather really. He averts his face. Heave to. Heavier, I suppose. Heaviness: hot day coming. Heavy Gatling guns boom. Heavy greasy smell there always is in those works. Heavy of the past. He backed towards the door. He bared slightly his left forearm. He bares his arm and plunges it elbowdeep in Bloom’s vulva. He bears in his arms an umbrella sceptre. He beat his hand upon his breast, confessing: mea culpa. He began: —Mr Chairman, ladies and gentlemen: Great was my admiration in listening to the remarks addressed to the youth of Ireland a moment since by my learned friend. He began to check it silently. He began to mazurka in swift caricature across the floor on sliding feet past the fireplace to J. J. O’Molloy who placed the tissues in his receiving hands. He began to remember that this had happened or had been mentioned as having happened before but it cost him no small effort before he remembered that he recognised in the sentry a quondam friend of his father’s, Gumley. He began to scribble on a slip of paper. He begins to lilt simply. He belches. He believed in animal heat. He believed then that human life was infinitely perfectible, eliminating these conditions? He bends again and, hesitating, brings his mouth near the face of the prostrate form. He bends again and undoes the buttons of Stephen’s waistcoat. He bends down and calls to Stephen. He bends sideways and squeezes his mount’s testicles roughly, shouting. He, B, enjoyed the distinction of being close to Erin’s uncrowned king in the flesh when the thing occurred on the historic fracas when the fallen leader’s, who notoriously stuck to his guns to the last drop even when clothed in the mantle of adultery, leader’s trusty henchmen to the number of ten or a dozen or possibly even more than that penetrated into the printing works of the Insuppressible or no it was United Ireland a by no means by the by appropriate appellative and broke up the typecases with hammers or something like that all on account of some scurrilous effusions from the facile pens of the O’Brienite scribes at the usual mudslinging occupation reflecting on the erstwhile tribune’s private morals. He bent down to her, his hands on his knees. He bent down to regard a lean file of spearmint growing by the wall. He bent to make a bundle of the other books, hugged them against his unbuttoned waistcoat and bore them off behind the dingy curtain. He bet them what they liked. He bites his thumb. He bit off a soft piece hungrily. He blew through the flue two husky fifenotes. He blotted quick on pad of Pat. He blows into Bloom’s ear. He boomed that workaday worker tack for all it was worth. He bore in his hand with grace a notebook, new, large, clean, bright. He bore in mind secrets confessed and he smiled at smiling noble faces in a beeswaxed drawingroom, ceiled with full fruit clusters. He bore no hate. He brands his initial C on Bloom’s croup. He breathes in deep agitation, swallowing gulps of air, questions, hopes, crubeens for her supper, things to tell her, excuse, desire, spellbound. He breathes softly. He brightens the earth. He broke away. He broke off and lathered again lightly his farther cheek. He broke off in alarm, feeling his side under his flapping shirt. He brought it near his eyes and peered. He brought out of his coat a pocketbook bound by a leather thong. He brushes a mudflake from his cheek with a parcelled hand. He brushes the woodshavings from Stephen’s clothes with light hand and fingers. He burst her tympanum. He called her little one in a strangely husky voice and snatched a half kiss the first! but it was only the end of her nose and then he hastened from the room with a remark about refreshments. He called me a jew and in a heated fashion offensively. He calls again. He calls again. He came a step a sinkapace forward on neatsleather creaking and a step backward a sinkapace on the solemn floor. He came forward a pace and stood by the table. He came, he came, he did not stay. He came in quickly and bumped against Lenehan who was struggling up with the second tissue. He came nearer and heard a crunching of gilded oats, the gently champing teeth. He came out into clearer air and turned back towards Grafton street. He came over to the gunrest and, thrusting a hand into Stephen’s upper pocket, said: —Lend us a loan of your noserag to wipe my razor. He came to the table, pinning together his sheets. He came towards them at an amble, scratching actively behind his coattails. —He can find no trace of hell in ancient Irish myth, Haines said, amid the cheerful cups. He can never be a poet. He can’t make you out. He can’t sing for tall hats. —He can’t wear them, Buck Mulligan told his face in the mirror. He capered before them down towards the fortyfoot hole, fluttering his winglike hands, leaping nimbly, Mercury’s hat quivering in the fresh wind that bore back to them his brief birdsweet cries. He caressed his beard, adding: —Well, nearly all of us. He carried a memory in his wallet as he trudged to Romeville whistling The girl I left behind me. He carried it upstairs, his thumb hooked in the teapot handle. He carries a large portfolio labelled Matcham’s Masterstrokes. He carries a silverstringed inlaid dulcimer and a longstemmed bamboo Jacob’s pipe, its clay bowl fashioned as a female head. He catches sight of the navvy lurching through the crowd at the farther side of Talbot street. He caught himself in the act: looked at all: refrained. He ceased. He ceased and looked at them, enjoying a silence. He ceases suddenly and holds up a forefinger. He changed his name to De Wet, the Boer general. He changed it by deedpoll, the father did. He chases his tail. He checked his tale a moment but broke out in a wheezy laugh. He cheers feebly. He chose badly? He chuckles. He clacks his tongue loudly. He clapped the hat on his head again. He clasped his hands between his knees and, satisfied, sent his vacant glance over their faces. He clasped his paunchbrow with both birthaiding hands. He climbed over the sedge and eely oarweeds and sat on a stool of rock, resting his ashplant in a grike. He closed his left eye. He closed his long thin lips an instant but, eager to be on, raised an outspanned hand to his spectacles and, with trembling thumb and ringfinger touching lightly the black rims, steadied them to a new focus. He closes his eyes an instant. He clutches her veil. He coasted them, walking warily. He comes from his dark corner. He comes, pale vampire, through storm his eyes, his bat sails bloodying the sea, mouth to her mouth’s kiss. He compressed between 2 fingers the flesh circumjacent to a cicatrice in the left infracostal region below the diaphragm resulting from a sting inflicted 2 weeks and 3 days previously 23 May 1904 by a bee. He conjured up the scene before them. He consoles a widow. He corantos by. He coughs and, bending his brow, rubs his nose thoughtfully with a scooping hand. He coughs encouragingly. He coughs thoughtfully, drily. He could hear, of course, all kinds of words changing colour like those crabs about Ringsend in the morning burrowing quickly into all colours of different sorts of the same sand where they had a home somewhere beneath or seemed to. He could not leave his mother an orphan. He couldn’t get a connection. He could spin those yarns for hours on end all night long and lie like old boots. He counted the creases of rucked leather wherein another’s foot had nested warm. He counts. He covered himself. He crammed his mouth with fry and munched and droned. He creaked to and fro, tiptoing up nearer heaven by the altitude of a chopine, and, covered by the noise of outgoing, said low: —Is it your view, then, that she was not faithful to the poet? He creased out the letter at his side, reading it slowly as he chewed, sopping another die of bread in the gravy and raising it to his mouth. He cried above the clatter of the wheels: —I won’t have her bastard of a nephew ruin my son. He cries. He cries. He cries, his vulture talons sharpened. He crossed at Nassau street corner and stood before the window of Yeates and Son, pricing the fieldglasses. He crossed to the bright side, avoiding the loose cellarflap of number seventyfive. He crossed Townsend street, passed the frowning face of Bethel. He crossed under Tommy Moore’s roguish finger. He crossed Westmoreland street when apostrophe S had plodded by. He crouches juggling. He crows derisively. He crows with a black capon’s laugh. He curled them between his palms at whiles and swallowed them softly. He dances the Highland fling with grotesque antics. He dangles a hank of Spanish onions in one hand and holds with the other hand a telephone receiver nozzle to his ear. He darts to cross the road. He’d be about eighteen now, way I figure it. He declaimed in song, pointing sternly at professor MacHugh: ’Twas rank and fame that tempted thee, ’Twas empire charmed thy heart. He deposited the articles of clothing on a chair, removed his remaining articles of clothing, took from beneath the bolster at the head of the bed a folded long white nightshirt, inserted his head and arms into the proper apertures of the nightshirt, removed a pillow from the head to the foot of the bed, prepared the bedlinen accordingly and entered the bed. He deposited the quid in his gob and, chewing and with some slow stammers, proceeded: —We come up this morning eleven o’clock. He describes Hamlet given in a French town, don’t you know, a provincial town. He’d give the ad, I think. He did come a wallop, by George. He did, faith, sir Tom. He did not look in the bucket. He did not see. —He died dead drunk, Buck Mulligan capped. He died in his sleep. He died of a Tuesday. He died on Monday, poor fellow. He died quite suddenly, poor fellow. He disappears. He disappears into Olhausen’s, the porkbutcher’s, under the downcoming rollshutter. He disengages himself. He’d look nice on the city charger. He does canvassing for the Freeman. He does look balmy. —He doesn’t buy cream on the ads he picks up. He doesn’t chat. He doesn’t hear it. He doesn’t know what he’s saying. He doesn’t know who is here nor care. He doesn’t see my mourning. —He doesn’t see us, Mr Power said. He does some canvassing for ads. He dons the black cap. He doth rest anon. He drags Kitty away. He drank. He drank a draught of cooler tea to wash down his meal. He drank and strayed away. He drank at her bidding. He drank drugs to obliterate. He drank indeed at one draught to pluck up a heart of any grace for it thundered long rumblingly over all the heavens so that Master Madden, being godly certain whiles, knocked him on his ribs upon that crack of doom and Master Bloom, at the braggart’s side, spoke to him calming words to slumber his great fear, advertising how it was no other thing but a hubbub noise that he heard, the discharge of fluid from the thunderhead, look you, having taken place, and all of the order of a natural phenomenon. He drank needless to be told and it pointed only once more a moral when he might quite easily be in a large way of business if—a big if, however—he had contrived to cure himself of his particular partiality. He drank resignedly from his tumbler, running his fingers down the flutes. He draws the match away. He drew and plucked. He drew back and saw an instant of shower spray dots over the grey flags. He drew forth a handful of copper coins, nervously. He drew his watch. He drew Shylock out of his own long pocket. He drew the letter from his pocket and folded it into the newspaper he carried. He dried the page with a sheet of thin blottingpaper and carried his copybook back to his bench. He drink me my teas. He droned in vain. He drones bars of Ferrando’s aria di sortita. He ducks and wards off a blow clumsily. He dwelt, being a bit of an artist in his spare time, on the female form in general developmentally because, as it so happened, no later than that afternoon he had seen those Grecian statues, perfectly developed as works of art, in the National Museum. He eat me my sugars. He eats. He eats a raw turnip offered him by Maurice Butterly, farmer. Heehaw shesaw. Hee hee. Hee hee. Hee hee! Hee hee hee. Hee hee hee. Hee hee hee hee. Hee hee hee hee. Hee hee hee hee. Hee hee hee hee. Hee hee hee hee. Heel easily catch in track or bootlace in a cog. He employs a mechanical device to frustrate the sacred ends of nature. He emptied his pockets on to the table. Heenan and Sayers was only a bloody fool to it. He encircled his gadding hair with a coronal of vineleaves, smiling at Vincent. He entered Davy Byrne’s. He entered softly. He executes a daredevil salmon leap in the air and is engulfed in the coalhole. He exhales a putrid carcasefed breath. He exhibits to Dublin reporters traces of burning. He expires. He explodes in a loud phlegmy laugh. He extended elocutionary arms from frayed stained shirtcuffs, pausing: —What was their civilisation? He extends his portfolio. He extinguished the candle by a sharp expiration of breath upon its flame, drew two spoonseat deal chairs to the hearthstone, one for Stephen with its back to the area window, the other for himself when necessary, knelt on one knee, composed in the grate a pyre of crosslaid resintipped sticks and various coloured papers and irregular polygons of best Abram coal at twentyone shillings a ton from the yard of Messrs Flower and M’Donald of 14 D’Olier street, kindled it at three projecting points of paper with one ignited lucifer match, thereby releasing the potential energy contained in the fuel by allowing its carbon and hydrogen elements to enter into free union with the oxygen of the air. He eyed and saw afar on Essex bridge a gay hat riding on a jaunting car. He eyed the horseshoe poster over the gate of college park: cyclist doubled up like a cod in a pot. He eyes her. He faced about and back again. He faced about and blessed gravely thrice the tower, the surrounding land and the awaking mountains. He faced about and, standing between the awnings, held out his right hand at arm’s length towards the sun. He faced their silence. He falls back a pace. He fears the lancet of my art as I fear that of his. He feels his trouser pocket. He felt heavy, full: then a gentle loosening of his bowels. He felt here and there. He felt it incumbent on him to say a few words. He felt the flowing qualm spread over him. He filled his own moustachecup, sham crown Derby, smiling. He fingered shreds of hair, her maidenhair, her mermaid’s, into the bowl. He fitted his black hat gently on his left knee and, holding its brim, bent over piously. He fitted the book roughly into his inner pocket and, stubbing his toes against the broken commode, hurried out towards the smell, stepping hastily down the stairs with a flurried stork’s legs. He fixes the manhole with a resolute stare. He flourishes his ashplant, shivering the lamp image, shattering light over the world. He flung back pages of the files and stuck his finger on a point. He flung his wooden pen away. He flung the pages down. He flung up his hands and tramped down the stone stairs, singing out of tune with a Cockney accent: O, won’t we have a merry time, Drinking whisky, beer and wine! He folded his razor neatly and with stroking palps of fingers felt the smooth skin. He folded it under his armpit, went to the door and opened it. He followed his companions. He followed his guest to the outlet and then whirled his lath away among the pillars. He followed M’Coy out across the tiny square of Crampton court. He followed the hasty creaking shoes but stood by nimbly by the threshold, saluting forms, a bulky with a slender. He follows, followed by the sniffing terrier. He foresaw his pale body reclined in it at full, naked, in a womb of warmth, oiled by scented melting soap, softly laved. He forgot Hamlet. He found in the world without as actual what was in his world within as possible. He frowned sternly on the bright air. He frowns. He frowns a little just as this young man does now with a perhaps too conscious enjoyment of the danger but must needs glance at whiles towards where his mother watches from the piazzetta giving upon the flowerclose with a faint shadow of remoteness or of reproach alles Vergängliche in her glad look. He frowns mysteriously. He fumbled in his pocket pulling out the crushed typesheets. He fumbled out a picture postcard from his inside pocket which seemed to be in its way a species of repository and pushed it along the table. He fumbles again and takes out and hands her two crowns. He fumbles again in his pocket and draws out a handful of coins. He gasps, standing upright. He gave a sudden loud young laugh as a close. He gave him the coward’s blow. He gave them then a much admirable hymen minim by those delicate poets Master John Fletcher and Master Francis Beaumont that is in their Maid’s Tragedy that was writ for a like twining of lovers: To bed, to bed was the burden of it to be played with accompanable concent upon the virginals. He gazed about him in his toga and he said: It is meet to be here. He gazed after the last broad tunic. He gazed gravely at the ground till the coffincart wheeled off to the left. He gazed over Stephen’s shoulder at Goldsmith’s knobby poll. He gazed round the stooled and tabled eaters, tightening the wings of his nose. He gazes ahead, reading on the wall a scrawled chalk legend Wet Dream and a phallic design. He gazes far away mournfully. He gazes intently downwards on the water. He gazes in the tawny crystal of her eyes, ringed with kohol. He gets the plums, and I the plumstones. He gives his coat to a beggar. He gives the pilgrim warrior’s sign of the knights templars. He gives up the ghost. He glanced back through what he had read and, while feeling his water flow quietly, he envied kindly Mr Beaufoy who had written it and received payment of three pounds, thirteen and six. He glanced behind him to where a face with dark thinking eyes followed towards the cardinal’s mausoleum. He glanced round him. He glanced sideways in the sunlight at M’Coy. He glares. He gnashed in fury. He gnashed in fury. He gobbles gluttonously with turkey wattles. He goes back, weary of the creation he has piled up to hide him from himself, an old dog licking an old sore. He got it this morning. He got that kink, fascinated by sister’s stays. He greeted Mr Dedalus and got a nod. He grows to human size and shape. He guffaws again. He hacked through the fry on the dish and slapped it out on three plates, saying: —In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sancti. He had. He had a father, forty fathers. He had a few bob on Throwaway and he’s gone to gather in the shekels. —He had a good groatsworth of wit, Stephen said, and no truant memory. —He had a good slice of luck, Jack Mooney was telling me, over that boxingmatch Myler Keogh won again that soldier in the Portobello barracks. He had a portfolio full of Celtic literature in one hand, in the other a phial marked Poison. —He had a sudden death, poor fellow, he said. He had been meantime taking stock of the individual in front of him and Sherlockholmesing him up ever since he clapped eyes on him. He had been off as many times as a cat has lives and back again with naked pockets as many more to his father the headborough who shed a pint of tears as often as he saw him. He had cleaned his teeth, he knew, with arecanut paste. He had come nearer the edge of the sea and wet sand slapped his boots. He had doubled the cape a few odd times and weathered a monsoon, a kind of wind, in the China seas and through all those perils of the deep there was one thing, he declared, stood to him or words to that effect, a pious medal he had that saved him. He had his answer pat for everything. He had horns galore, a coat of cloth of gold and a sweet smoky breath coming out of his nostrils so that the women of our island, leaving doughballs and rollingpins, followed after him hanging his bulliness in daisychains. —He had no father, says Martin. He had not risked, he did not expect, he had not been disappointed, he was satisfied. He had no wed. He hadn’t a word to say for himself as everyone saw. He had reached the open backdoor of All Hallows. He had received the rhino for the labour of his muse. He had sometimes propelled her on warm summer evenings, an infirm widow of independent, if limited, means, in her convalescent bathchair with slow revolutions of its wheels as far as the corner of the North Circular road opposite Mr Gavin Low’s place of business where she had remained for a certain time scanning through his onelensed binocular fieldglasses unrecognisable citizens on tramcars, roadster bicycles equipped with inflated pneumatic tyres, hackney carriages, tandems, private and hired landaus, dogcarts, ponytraps and brakes passing from the city to the Phoenix Park and vice versa. He had spoken himself into boldness. He had two left feet. He halted.
