Ned Lambert, seated on the table, read on: —Or again, note the meanderings of some purling rill as it babbles on its way, tho’ quarrelling with the stony obstacles, to the tumbling waters of Neptune’s blue domain, ’mid mossy banks, fanned by gentlest zephyrs, played on by the glorious sunlight or ’neath the shadows cast o’er its pensive bosom by the overarching leafage of the giants of the forest. Ned Lambert sidled down from the table. Ned Lambert smiled. Ned Lambert tossed the newspaper aside, chuckling with delight. Need artificial irrigation. Needles in window curtains. Never tell you. Nevertheless he sat tight just viewing the slightly soiled photo creased by opulent curves, none the worse for wear however, and looked away thoughtfully with the intention of not further increasing the other’s possible embarrassment while gauging her symmetry of heaving embonpoint. Nevertheless, without going into the minutiae of the business, the eloquent fact remained that the sea was there in all its glory and in the natural course of things somebody or other had to sail on it and fly in the face of providence though it merely went to show how people usually contrived to load that sort of onus on to the other fellow like the hell idea and the lottery and insurance which were run on identically the same lines so that for that very reason if no other lifeboat Sunday was a highly laudable institution to which the public at large, no matter where living inland or seaside, as the case might be, having it brought home to them like that should extend its gratitude also to the harbourmasters and coastguard service who had to man the rigging and push off and out amid the elements whatever the season when duty called Ireland expects that every man and so on and sometimes had a terrible time of it in the wintertime not forgetting the Irish lights, Kish and others, liable to capsize at any moment, rounding which he once with his daughter had experienced some remarkably choppy, not to say stormy, weather. No prince charming is her beau ideal to lay a rare and wondrous love at her feet but rather a manly man with a strong quiet face who had not found his ideal, perhaps his hair slightly flecked with grey, and who would understand, take her in his sheltering arms, strain her to him in all the strength of his deep passionate nature and comfort her with a long long kiss. No pruningknife. No question but her name is puissant who aventried the dear corse of our Agenbuyer, Healer and Herd, our mighty mother and mother most venerable and Bernardus saith aptly that She hath an omnipotentiam deiparae supplicem, that is to wit, an almightiness of petition because she is the second Eve and she won us, saith Augustine too, whereas that other, our grandam, which we are linked up with by successive anastomosis of navelcords sold us all, seed, breed and generation, for a penny pippin. Not to inherit by right of primogeniture, gavelkind or borough English, or possess in perpetuity an extensive demesne of a sufficient number of acres, roods and perches, statute land measure valuation £ 42, of grazing turbary surrounding a baronial hall with gatelodge and carriage drive nor, on the other hand, a terracehouse or semidetached villa, described as Rus in Urbe or Qui si sana, but to purchase by private treaty in fee simple a thatched bungalowshaped 2 storey dwellinghouse of southerly aspect, surmounted by vane and lightning conductor, connected with the earth, with porch covered by parasitic plants ivy or Virginia creeper, halldoor, olive green, with smart carriage finish and neat doorbrasses, stucco front with gilt tracery at eaves and gable, rising, if possible, upon a gentle eminence with agreeable prospect from balcony with stone pillar parapet over unoccupied and unoccupyable interjacent pastures and standing in 5 or 6 acres of its own ground, at such a distance from the nearest public thoroughfare as to render its houselights visible at night above and through a quickset hornbeam hedge of topiary cutting, situate at a given point not less than 1 statute mile from the periphery of the metropolis, within a time limit of not more than 15 minutes from tram or train line e.g., Dundrum, south, or Sutton, north, both localities equally reported by trial to resemble the terrestrial poles in being favourable climates for phthisical subjects, the premises to be held under feefarm grant, lease 999 years, the messuage to consist of 1 drawingroom with baywindow 2 lancets, thermometer affixed, 1 sittingroom, 4 bedrooms, 2 servants’ rooms, tiled kitchen with close range and scullery, lounge hall fitted with linen wallpresses, fumed oak sectional bookcase containing the Encyclopaedia Britannica and New Century Dictionary, transverse obsolete medieval and oriental weapons, dinner gong, alabaster lamp, bowl pendant, vulcanite automatic telephone receiver with adjacent directory, handtufted Axminster carpet with cream ground and trellis border, loo table with pillar and claw legs, hearth with massive firebrasses and ormolu mantel chronometer clock, guaranteed timekeeper with cathedral chime, barometer with hygrographic chart, comfortable lounge settees and corner fitments, upholstered in ruby plush with good springing and sunk centre, three banner Japanese screen and cuspidors club style, rich winecoloured leather, gloss renewable with a minimum of labour by use of linseed oil and vinegar and pyramidically prismatic central chandelier lustre, bentwood perch with fingertame parrot expurgated language, embossed mural paper at 10/- per dozen with transverse swags of carmine floral design and top crown frieze, staircase, three continuous flights at successive right angles, of varnished cleargrained oak, treads and risers, newel, balusters and handrail, with steppedup panel dado, dressed with camphorated wax: bathroom, hot and cold supply, reclining and shower: water closet on mezzanine provided with opaque singlepane oblong window, tipup seat, bracket lamp, brass tierod and brace, armrests, footstool and artistic oleograph on inner face of door: ditto, plain: servants’ apartments with separate sanitary and hygienic necessaries for cook, general and betweenmaid salary, rising by biennial unearned increments of £ 2, with comprehensive fidelity insurance, annual bonus £ 1 and retiring allowance based on the 65 system after 30 years’ service, pantry, buttery, larder, refrigerator, outoffices, coal and wood cellarage with winebin still and sparkling vintages for distinguished guests, if entertained to dinner evening dress, carbon monoxide gas supply throughout. Nous ferons de petites cochonneries. 27 November 1893, to the birth on 29 December 1893 of second and only male issue, deceased 9 January 1894, aged 11 days, there remained a period of 10 years, 5 months and 18 days during which carnal intercourse had been incomplete, without ejaculation of semen within the natural female organ. No: vorrei e non. Now? Now? Now! Now. Now. Now! Now. No, wait: four. Now am I going to tram it out all the way and then catch him out perhaps. —Now, baby, Cissy Caffrey said. Now begging letters he sends his son with. Now could you make out a thing like that? Now dearest Gerald uses pinky greasepaint and gilds his eyelids. Now, don’t tell a big fib! Now drink we, quod he, of this mazer and quaff ye this mead which is not indeed parcel of my body but my soul’s bodiment. No wedding garment. Now for your punishment frock. Now he is himself paternal and these about him might be his sons. Nowhere in particular. Now he’s got in with Blumenfeld. Now he’s really what they call a dirty jew. Now he was laid to rest. Now I am defunct, the wall of the heart hypertrophied. Now I am speculating what it would be likely to be. Now I bet it makes them feel happy. Now I’d give a trifle to know who he is. Now I eat his salt bread. Now if he got paralysed there and no-one knew how to stop them they’d clank on and on the same, print it over and over and up and back. Now if I did that at a banquet. Now if they had made it round like a wheel. Now if you were trying to do that for a week on end you couldn’t. Now I have to answer that letter from my cousin. Now I’m going to try publicity. No wind could lift those waves, grey metal, poisonous foggy waters. Now in the Iveagh home. Now, isn’t that wit. Now it could bear no more. No wit, no wrinkles. Now let us speak of that fellowship that was there to the intent to be drunken an they might. Now, my miss. —Now, my miss, he said. No woman of any wit would wear one. No worry. Now photography. Now silent air. Now that I come to think of it that ball falls at Greenwich time. Now that’s a coincidence. Now that’s quite enough about that. Now that’s really a coincidence: second time. Now that was farseeing. —Now then, Mr Deasy said, rising. Now then our glory song. —Now touching a cup of coffee, Mr Bloom ventured to plausibly suggest to break the ice, it occurs to me you ought to sample something in the shape of solid food, say, a roll of some description. Now what were those two at? Now where the blue hell am I bringing her beyond the veil? Now who is he I’d like to know? Now who is that lankylooking galoot over there in the macintosh? Now won’t you? Now you mention it his face was familiar to me. Now your best French polish. Now, you’re talking straight, Mr Crimmins. No, you aren’t. Obvious analogy to my idea. Obviously mammal in weight of bosom you remark that she has in front well to the fore two protuberances of very respectable dimensions, inclined to fall in the noonday soupplate, while on her rere lower down are two additional protuberances, suggestive of potent rectum and tumescent for palpation, which leave nothing to be desired save compactness. Of a bodily and mental male organism specially adapted for the superincumbent posture of energetic human copulation and energetic piston and cylinder movement necessary for the complete satisfaction of a constant but not acute concupiscence resident in a bodily and mental female organism, passive but not obtuse. Of companions now in various manners in different places defunct: Percy Apjohn killed in action, Modder River, Philip Gilligan phthisis, Jervis Street hospital, Matthew F. Of course. —Of course an action would lie, says J. J. It implies that he is not compos mentis. Of course aristocrats, then the others copy to be in the fashion. Of course gambling eminently lent itself to that sort of thing though as the event turned out the poor fool hadn’t much reason to congratulate himself on his pick, the forlorn hope. Of course he is dead. Of course, he subjoined pensively, at the inward reflection of there being more languages to start with than were absolutely necessary, it may be only the southern glamour that surrounds it. Of course his infant majesty was most obstreperous at such toilet formalities and he let everyone know it: —Habaa baaaahabaaa baaaa. —Of course, if he wants a par, Red Murray said earnestly, a pen behind his ear, we can do him one. Of course if they ran a tramline along the North Circular from the cattlemarket to the quays value would go up like a shot. Of course, I grant you, to concede a point, you do knock across a simple soul once in a blue moon. —Of course I’m a Britisher, Haines’s voice said, and I feel as one. Of course I suppose some man is ultimately responsible for her condition. Of course it might. Of course it’s all paradox, don’t you know, Hughes and hews and hues, the colour, but it’s so typical the way he works it out. Of course it’s years ago. Of course it was frosty and the last tram. —Of course, Mr B. proceeded to stipulate, you must look at both sides of the question. Of course nobody being acquainted with his movements even before there was absolutely no clue as to his whereabouts which were decidedly of the Alice, where art thou order even prior to his starting to go under several aliases such as Fox and Stewart so the remark which emanated from friend cabby might be within the bounds of possibility. Of course the cells or whatever they are go on living. Of course the other senses are more. Of course they understand birds, animals, babies. Of course you didn’t notice as much as I did. Off an inward bound tram stepped the reverend Nicholas Dudley C. C. of saint Agatha’s church, north William street, on to Newcomen bridge. —Off Blackpitts, Stephen said. Off colour after Kiernan’s, Dignam’s. Offend her. Offend me still. Off her beat here. Off he sails with a scapular or a medal on him for luck. Off his chump. Off the drunks perhaps. Off to mammy. Off to the country: Broadstone probably. Off we pop! —Off with you, says Martin to the jarvey. Of good family too would one think it? Of him that walked the waves. O, fie! Of Ireland, the Dalcassians, of hopes, conspiracies, of Arthur Griffith now, A E, pimander, good shepherd of men. Of Israel’s folk was that man that on earth wandering far had fared. Of John Thomas, her spouse. Of lost leaders, the betrayed, wild escapes. O, flowers! Of me? Of Meyerbeer that is. O, for a fresh of breath air! Of others elsewhere in other times who, kneeling on one knee or on two, had kindled fires for him, of Brother Michael in the infirmary of the college of the Society of Jesus at Clongowes Wood, Sallins, in the county of Kildare: of his father, Simon Dedalus, in an unfurnished room of his first residence in Dublin, number thirteen Fitzgibbon street: of his godmother Miss Kate Morkan in the house of her dying sister Miss Julia Morkan at 15 Usher’s Island: of his aunt Sara, wife of Richie Richard Goulding, in the kitchen of their lodgings at 62 Clanbrassil street: of his mother Mary, wife of Simon Dedalus, in the kitchen of number twelve North Richmond street on the morning of the feast of Saint Francis Xavier 1898: of the dean of studies, Father Butt, in the physics’ theatre of university College, 16 Stephen’s Green, north: of his sister Dilly Delia in his father’s house in Cabra. Of Paul de Kock. Of sin. Of some one sole unique advertisement to cause passers to stop in wonder, a poster novelty, with all extraneous accretions excluded, reduced to its simplest and most efficient terms not exceeding the span of casual vision and congruous with the velocity of modern life. Often thought she was in the dumps till she began to lilt. Of that house A. Horne is lord. Of the eons of geological periods recorded in the stratifications of the earth: of the myriad minute entomological organic existences concealed in cavities of the earth, beneath removable stones, in hives and mounds, of microbes, germs, bacteria, bacilli, spermatozoa: of the incalculable trillions of billions of millions of imperceptible molecules contained by cohesion of molecular affinity in a single pinhead: of the universe of human serum constellated with red and white bodies, themselves universes of void space constellated with other bodies, each, in continuity, its universe of divisible component bodies of which each was again divisible in divisions of redivisible component bodies, dividends and divisors ever diminishing without actual division till, if the progress were carried far enough, nought nowhere was never reached. Of them? —Of the offence to me, Stephen answered. —Of the tribe of Reuben, he said. —Of the twoheaded octopus, one of whose heads is the head upon which the ends of the world have forgotten to come while the other speaks with a Scotch accent. Of Wexford. Of what did bellchime and handtouch and footstep and lonechill remind him? Of what did the duumvirate deliberate during their itinerary? Of what in the other devil’s name? O just wait till I see Molly! O, Kinch, thou art in peril. O. K. Seventyseven west sixtyninth street. Old. Old and secret she had entered from a morning world, maybe a messenger. Old Barbary ape that gobbled all his family. Old Betty’s joints are on the rack. Old Bloom. Old Bloom. Old Chatterton, the vicechancellor, is his granduncle or his greatgranduncle. Old Deasy’s letter. Old Dr Murren’s. Old England is dying. Oldfashioned way he used to bow Molly off the platform. Old Father Ocean. Old fellow asleep near that confessionbox. Old Garryowen started growling again at Bloom that was skeezing round the door. Old Glynn fifty quid a year. Old Glynn he knew how to make that instrument talk, the vibrato: fifty pounds a year they say he had in Gardiner street. Old Goodwin’s tall hat done up with some sticky stuff. Old Gummy Granny in sugarloaf hat appears seated on a toadstool, the deathflower of the potato blight on her breast. OLD GUMMY GRANNY: Rocking to and fro. OLD GUMMY GRANNY: Thrusts a dagger towards Stephen’s hand. Old hag with the yellow teeth. Old Kilkenny: saint Canice, Strongbow’s castle on the Nore. Old lardyface standing up to the business end of a gun. Old legal cronies cracking a magnum. Old man himself. Old men’s dogs usually are. Old Monks, the dayfather. Old Mother Hubbard went to the cupboard. Old Mrs Riordan with the rumbling stomach’s Skye terrier in the City Arms hotel. Old Mrs Thornton was a jolly old soul. Old Mr Verschoyle with the ear trumpet loves old Mrs Verschoyle with the turnedin eye. Old now. Old Russell with a smeared shammy rag burnished again his gem, turned it and held it at the point of his Moses’ beard. Old rusty pumps: damn the thing else. Old shrunken paps. Old Sleepy Hollow calls over the wold. Old style. Old thieves’ dodge. —Old Troy, says I, was in the force. Old wall where sudden lizards flash. Old Whatwhat. Old woman that lived in a shoe she had so many children. O, leave them there to simmer. O Leo! O, lest he forget. O let him! O, let it slide. O List! Olives are packed in jars, eh? O more. —O, Mr Bloom, how do you do? —O, Mr Bloom said. —O, Mr Bloom said. O! Mr Bloom watched her as she limped away. —O! Mr Dedalus cried, giving vent to a hopeless groan. O my! —O my! —O, my corns! he said plaintively. O, my dictionary. O, my foot’s tickling. O, my name for you is the best: Kinch, the knife-blade. O, my rib risible! On. On. On. On. On a field tenney a buck, trippant, proper, unattired. On a handsome mahogany table near him were neatly arranged the quartering knife, the various finely tempered disembowelling appliances specially supplied by the worldfamous firm of cutlers, Messrs John Round and Sons, Sheffield, a terra cotta saucepan for the reception of the duodenum, colon, blind intestine and appendix etc when successfully extracted and two commodious milkjugs destined to receive the most precious blood of the most precious victim. On an eminence, the centre of the earth, rises the fieldaltar of Saint Barbara. On another star. On a step a gnome totting among a rubbishtip crouches to shoulder a sack of rags and bones. Once a wooer, twice a wooer. Once by inadvertence twice by design he challenges his destiny. Once by the churchyard he had passed and for his mother’s rest he had not prayed. Once her in townhithe meeting he to her bow had not doffed. Once, in 1887, after a protracted performance of charades in the house of Luke Doyle, Kimmage, he had awaited with patience the apparition of the diurnal phenomenon, seated on a wall, his gaze turned in the direction of Mizrach, the east. Once in 1892 and once in 1893 with Julius Juda Mastiansky, on both occasions in the parlour of his Bloom’s house in Lombard street, west. Once is a dose. Once I was in the employ of Mr J. H. Menton, solicitor, commissioner for oaths and affidavits, of 27 Bachelor’s Walk. Once quick in the brains of men. Once spurned twice spurned. Once you are dead you are dead. On coronation, Coronation day! On coronation day, on coronation day, O, won’t we have a merry time, Drinking whisky, beer and wine! On Dignam now. One! One always feels that Goethe’s judgments are so true. One and eightpence too much. One and eightpence too much. —One and eightpence too much, Mr Dedalus said drily. One and four into twenty: fifteen about. One and nine. On earth as it is in heaven. One: a squat stuffed easychair, with stout arms extended and back slanted to the rere, which, repelled in recoil, had then upturned an irregular fringe of a rectangular rug and now displayed on its amply upholstered seat a centralised diffusing and diminishing discolouration. One bent to pluck from the haft a long tuft of grass. One body. One body. One born every second somewhere. One can see him, a model schoolboy with his diploma under his arm. One comfort me. —One corned and cabbage. One day in the national library we had a discussion. One dragged aside: an old woman peeping. One fellow told another and so on. One fine day it gets bunged up: and there you are. One flat. One good turn deserves another. One grain pour off odour for years. —Onehandled adulterer! the professor cried. One hope. One hour’s your time to live, your last. O’Neill Russell? One in a million my tailor, Mesias, says. One, leaving his mates, walked slowly on with shouldered weapon, its blade blueglancing. One life is all. One life is all. One love. One man was reading in fits and starts a stained by coffee evening journal, another the card with the natives choza de, another the seaman’s discharge. One meal and a collation for fear he’d collapse on the altar. One moment. One moment. One moment he had been there, fascinated by a loveliness that made him gaze, and the next moment it was the quiet gravefaced gentleman, selfcontrol expressed in every line of his distinguishedlooking figure. One morning you would open the paper, the cabman affirmed, and read: Return of Parnell. One must go first: alone, under the ground: and lie no more in her warm bed. One must outlive the other. One night they bring you home drunk as dog after spend your good money. One of all, the least of all, is the victim predestined. One of her sisterhood lugged me squealing into life. —One of the best, M’Coy said. One of the drunks spelt out the name: Terence Mulcahy. One of them lost two quid on the race. One of them mots that do be in the packets of fags Stoer smokes that his old fellow welted hell out of him for one time he found out. One of the old queen’s sons, duke of Albany was it? had only one skin. One of the old sweet songs. One of the urchins ran to it, picked it up and dropped it into the minstrel’s cap, saying: —There, sir. One of those chaps would make short work of a fellow. One of those fellows got his hand nailed to the table by a dagger. One of those manholes like a bloody gaspipe and there was the poor devil stuck down in it, half choked with sewer gas. One of those mixed middlings he is. One of those, my lord. One: one, one, one, one, one: two, one, three, four. One or two? One plus two plus six is seven. One pound seven. One pound seven, say. One puck in the wind from that fellow would knock you into the middle of next week, man. One rapped on a door, one tapped with a knock, did he knock Paul de Kock with a loud proud knocker with a cock carracarracarra cock. One rapped, one tapped, with a carra, with a cock. One, seven, eleven, and five. —One stew. One story good till you hear the next. One tablespoonful of honey will attract friend Bruin more than half a dozen barrels of first choice malt vinegar. One tabloid of cascara sagrada. —One thing I never understood, he said to be original on the spur of the moment. One thinks of Homer. One third of a pint of quassia to which add a tablespoonful of rocksalt. One time he would be a playactor, then a sutler or a welsher, then nought would keep him from the bearpit and the cocking main, then he was for the ocean sea or to hoof it on the roads with the romany folk, kidnapping a squire’s heir by favour of moonlight or fecking maids’ linen or choking chicken behind a hedge. One time I could read a book in the dark, manner of speaking. One tony relative in every family. One, two. One two tlee: tlee tlwo tlone. One umbrella, were it no bigger than a fairy mushroom, is worth ten such stopgaps. One was a ship, another was a house, another was a flower. One way of getting on in the world. One way out of it. One whiff of that and you’re a goner. One who has faded into impalpability through death, through absence, through change of manners. On fire, on fire! On fire, on fire! On Grattan bridge Lenehan and M’Coy, taking leave of each other, watched the carriages go by. On her feet are jewelled toerings. On her flower frowning miss Douce said: —Most aggravating that young brat is. On her left hand are wedding and keeper rings. On her stow he ere was living with dear wife and lovesome daughter that then over land and seafloor nine years had long outwandered. On his annual bend, M’Coy said. On his cheek, dull and bloodless, a soft stain of ink lay, dateshaped, recent and damp as a snail’s bed. On his head is perched an Egyptian pshent. On his suit he has diamond and ruby buttons. On his wise shoulders through the checkerwork of leaves the sun flung spangles, dancing coins. Onions. Onions of his breath came across the counter out of his ruined mouth. On its cooperative dial glow the twelve signs of the zodiac. On land, meridional, a bispherical moon, revealed in imperfect varying phases of lunation through the posterior interstice of the imperfectly occluded skirt of a carnose negligent perambulating female, a pillar of the cloud by day. On leaving the church of Saint Fiacre in Horto after the papal blessing the happy pair were subjected to a playful crossfire of hazelnuts, beechmast, bayleaves, catkins of willow, ivytod, hollyberries, mistletoe sprigs and quicken shoots. Onlookers see most of the game. Only a little burnt. Only a mother and deadborn child ever buried in the one coffin. Only a pauper. Only a year or so older than Molly. Only big words for ordinary things on account of the sound. —Only circumstantial, Martin Cunningham added. Only crows, priests and English coal are black. Only five she was then. Only for what happened him. Only God knew and she and he, her husband’s brother. Only in the halfpenny place. Only I was running after that... Only man buries. Only measles. Only my new hat and a carriage sponge. Only namesakes. Only now his father kept him in in the evenings studying hard to get an exhibition in the intermediate that was on and he was going to go to Trinity college to study for a doctor when he left the high school like his brother W. E. Wylie who was racing in the bicycle races in Trinity college university. Only once it comes. ONLY ONCE MORE THAT SOAP He went down the house staircase. Only one lump of sugar in my tea, if you please. —Only one, says Martin. Only Paddy was passing there, I tell you what. Only politeness perhaps. Only that once. Only the chimney’s broken. Only the ethereal. Only the harp. Only the two themselves. Only those two, sir, for Belfast and Liverpool. Only troubles wildfire and nettlerash. Only two there now. Only weggebobbles and fruit. Only, you know, sensation. Only your bounden duty. On me alone. On more than one occasion, a dozen at the lowest, near the North Bull at Dollymount he had remarked a superannuated old salt, evidently derelict, seated habitually near the not particularly redolent sea on the wall, staring quite obliviously at it and it at him, dreaming of fresh woods and pastures new as someone somewhere sings. On my way. On nags hogs bellhorses Gadarene swine Corny in coffin steel shark stone onehandled Nelson two trickies Frauenzimmer plumstained from pram falling bawling. On Newcomen bridge the very reverend John Conmee S. J. of saint Francis Xavier’s church, upper Gardiner street, stepped on to an outward bound tram. On Northumberland and Lansdowne roads His Excellency acknowledged punctually salutes from rare male walkers, the salute of two small schoolboys at the garden gate of the house said to have been admired by the late queen when visiting the Irish capital with her husband, the prince consort, in 1849 and the salute of Almidano Artifoni’s sturdy trousers swallowed by a closing door. On now. On O’Connell bridge many persons observed the grave deportment and gay apparel of Mr Denis J Maginni, professor of dancing &c. O’Nolan, clad in shining armour, low bending made obeisance to the puissant and high and mighty chief of all Erin and did him to wit of that which had befallen, how that the grave elders of the most obedient city, second of the realm, had met them in the tholsel, and there, after due prayers to the gods who dwell in ether supernal, had taken solemn counsel whereby they might, if so be it might be, bring once more into honour among mortal men the winged speech of the seadivided Gael. —O, no, Mr Bloom said. On Ormond quay Mr Simon Dedalus, steering his way from the greenhouse for the subsheriff’s office, stood still in midstreet and brought his hat low. O, no, she’s not here: the flower: no, no. O, not for worlds. O, not in the least. O no, Vincent Lenehan said, laying a hand on the shoulder near him. On quietly creaky boots he went up the staircase to the hall, paused by the bedroom door. On solitary hotel paper she writes. On swift sail flaming From storm and south He comes, pale vampire, Mouth to my mouth. On that mystery and not on the madonna which the cunning Italian intellect flung to the mob of Europe the church is founded and founded irremovably because founded, like the world, macro and microcosm, upon the void. On the altarstone Mrs Mina Purefoy, goddess of unreason, lies, naked, fettered, a chalice resting on her swollen belly. On the antlered rack of the hall hang a man’s hat and waterproof. —On the beeoteetom, laughed Cissy merrily. On the boil sure enough: a plume of steam from the spout. On the brewery float bumped dullthudding barrels rolled by grossbooted draymen out of Prince’s stores. On the contrary that stab in the back touch was quite in keeping with those italianos though candidly he was none the less free to admit those icecreamers and friers in the fish way not to mention the chip potato variety and so forth over in little Italy there near the Coombe were sober thrifty hardworking fellows except perhaps a bit too given to pothunting the harmless necessary animal of the feline persuasion of others at night so as to have a good old succulent tuckin with garlic de rigueur off him or her next day on the quiet and, he added, on the cheap. On the curbstone before Jimmy Geary, the sexton’s, an old tramp sat, grumbling, emptying the dirt and stones out of his huge dustbrown yawning boot. On the doorstep all the whores clustered talk volubly, pointing to the right where the fog has cleared off. On the doorstep he felt in his hip pocket for the latchkey. On the duke’s lawn, entreated by an English visitor, she declined to permit him to make and take away her photographic image objection not stated. On the Erin’s King that day round the Kish. On the farther side under the railway bridge Bloom appears, flushed, panting, cramming bread and chocolate into a sidepocket. On the hands down. On the hands down. On the hands down! On the lower shelf five vertical breakfast plates, six horizontal breakfast saucers on which rested inverted breakfast cups, a moustachecup, uninverted, and saucer of Crown Derby, four white goldrimmed eggcups, an open shammy purse displaying coins, mostly copper, and a phial of aromatic violet comfits. On the middle shelf a chipped eggcup containing pepper, a drum of table salt, four conglomerated black olives in oleaginous paper, an empty pot of Plumtree’s potted meat, an oval wicker basket bedded with fibre and containing one Jersey pear, a halfempty bottle of William Gilbey and Co’s white invalid port, half disrobed of its swathe of coralpink tissue paper, a packet of Epps’s soluble cocoa, five ounces of Anne Lynch’s choice tea at 2/- per lb in a crinkled leadpaper bag, a cylindrical canister containing the best crystallised lump sugar, two onions, one, the larger, Spanish, entire, the other, smaller, Irish, bisected with augmented surface and more redolent, a jar of Irish Model Dairy’s cream, a jug of brown crockery containing a naggin and a quarter of soured adulterated milk, converted by heat into water, acidulous serum and semisolidified curds, which added to the quantity subtracted for Mr Bloom’s and Mrs Fleming’s breakfasts, made one imperial pint, the total quantity originally delivered, two cloves, a halfpenny and a small dish containing a slice of fresh ribsteak. On the night of the seventeenth of February 1904 the prisoner was seen by two witnesses. On the other hand he had a distinct and painful recollection they paid his wife, Madam Marion Tweedy who had been prominently associated with it at one time, a very modest remuneration indeed for her pianoplaying. On the other hand he might be only bluffing, a pardonable weakness because meeting unmistakable mugs, Dublin residents, like those jarvies waiting news from abroad would tempt any ancient mariner who sailed the ocean seas to draw the long bow about the schooner Hesperus and etcetera. On the other hand it was altogether far and away too late for the Sandymount or Sandycove suggestion so that he was in some perplexity as to which of the two alternatives. On the other hand what incensed him more inwardly was the blatant jokes of the cabman and so on who passed it all off as a jest, laughing immoderately, pretending to understand everything, the why and the wherefore, and in reality not knowing their own minds, it being a case for the two parties themselves unless it ensued that the legitimate husband happened to be a party to it owing to some anonymous letter from the usual boy Jones, who happened to come across them at the crucial moment in a loving position locked in one another’s arms, drawing attention to their illicit proceedings and leading up to a domestic rumpus and the erring fair one begging forgiveness of her lord and master upon her knees and promising to sever the connection and not receive his visits any more if only the aggrieved husband would overlook the matter and let bygones be bygones with tears in her eyes though possibly with her tongue in her fair cheek at the same time as quite possibly there were several others. On the penultimate blank page of a book of inferior literary style, entituled Sweets of Sin produced by Bloom and so manipulated that its front cover came in contact with the surface of the table with a pencil supplied by Stephen Stephen wrote the Irish characters for gee, eh, dee, em, simple and modified, and Bloom in turn wrote the Hebrew characters ghimel, aleph, daleth and in the absence of mem a substituted qoph, explaining their arithmetical values as ordinal and cardinal numbers, videlicet 3, 1, 4, and 100. On the pig’s back. On the right smaller hob a blue enamelled saucepan: on the left larger hob a black iron kettle. On the road to Malahide. On the roadway which they were approaching whilst still speaking beyond the swingchains a horse, dragging a sweeper, paced on the paven ground, brushing a long swathe of mire up so that with the noise Bloom was not perfectly certain whether he had caught aright the allusion to sixtyfive guineas and John Bull. On the sideboard the tray of Stuart coins, base treasure of a bog: and ever shall be. On the slow weedy waterway he had floated on his raft coastward over Ireland drawn by a haulage rope past beds of reeds, over slime, mudchoked bottles, carrion dogs. On the smooth jutting beerpull laid Lydia hand, lightly, plumply, leave it to my hands. On the South Circular road in the company of Elsa Potter, followed by an individual of sinister aspect, she went half way down Stamer street and turned abruptly back reason of change not stated. On the spindle side. On the steps of the City hall Councillor Nannetti, descending, hailed Alderman Cowley and Councillor Abraham Lyon ascending. On the steps of the Paris stock exchange the goldskinned men quoting prices on their gemmed fingers. On the top of the Howth tram alone crying to the rain: Naked women! On the towpath by the lock a slacktethered horse. On the upper shelf a battery of jamjars empty of various sizes and proveniences. On the vigil of the 15th anniversary of her birth she wrote a letter from Mullingar, county Westmeath, making a brief allusion to a local student faculty and year not stated. On the wholesale orders perhaps. On the whole though favouring preferably light opera of the Don Giovanni description and Martha, a gem in its line, he had a penchant, though with only a surface knowledge, for the severe classical school such as Mendelssohn. On this knotty point however the views of the pair, poles apart as they were both in schooling and everything else with the marked difference in their respective ages, clashed. Onward to the dead sea they tramp to drink, unslaked and with horrible gulpings, the salt somnolent inexhaustible flood. —On which the sun never rises, says Joe. On whose soul Sweet Jesus have mercy. Opposite Pigott’s music warerooms Mr Denis J Maginni, professor of dancing &c, gaily apparelled, gravely walked, outpassed by a viceroy and unobserved. Opposite Ruggy O’Donohoe’s Master Patrick Aloysius Dignam, pawing the pound and a half of Mangan’s, late Fehrenbach’s, porksteaks he had been sent for, went along warm Wicklow street dawdling. Or is it the volume is equal to the weight? Or it is the same figure, a year or so gone over, in his first hard hat ah, that was a day!, already on the road, a fullfledged traveller for the family firm, equipped with an orderbook, a scented handkerchief not for show only, his case of bright trinketware alas! a thing now of the past! and a quiverful of compliant smiles for this or that halfwon housewife reckoning it out upon her fingertips or for a budding virgin, shyly acknowledging but the heart? tell me! his studied baisemoins. Other chap telling him something with his mouth full. Other comedown. Other dying every second. O, there! Other eyewitnesses depose that they observed an incandescent object of enormous proportions hurtling through the atmosphere at a terrifying velocity in a trajectory directed southwest by west. —O, there you are, Mr Bloom said, turning from the fire. Other fellow did it: other me. Other hand a sixfooter with a wifey up to his watchpocket. Other hoofs and creaking wheels started behind. Other I got pound. Others abide our question. Others in vessels, bit of a handkerchief sail, pitched about like snuff at a wake when the stormy winds do blow. Other steps into his shoes when he gets his notice to quit. Other stocking. Other three hundred born, washing the blood off, all are washed in the blood of the lamb, bawling maaaaaa. Otherwise I couldn’t have. Otherwise we would never have such inventions as X rays, for instance. Otherwise you couldn’t remember the face after fifteen years, say. Other world she wrote. O, the thunder of those loins! O thing of prudent nation not merely in being seen but also even in being related worthy of being praised that they her by anticipation went seeing mother, that she by them suddenly to be about to be cherished had been begun she felt! O, this is too monotonous! O, those transparent! —O, to be sure, John Henry Menton said. O, touch me soon, now. Ought I go to a dentist, I wonder, with that money? Oughtn’t to have given that child an empty teat to suck. Ought to attend to my appearance my age. Ought to be a hall or a place where inventors could go in and invent free. Ought to be flowers of sleep. Ought to be places for women. Ought to be sideways and red it should be painted like a real heart. Ought to be tough from exercise. Ought to go home and laugh at themselves. Ought to invent dummy pianos for that. Our. Our. Our cattle trade. Our envelopes. Our Father who art in purgatory. —Our friend Bloom turned in handy that night, Mr Dedalus said. Our friend noise in the street. Our gracious and popular vicereine. Our great day, she said. Our greatest living phonetic expert wild horses shall not drag it from us! has left no stone unturned in his efforts to delucidate and compare the verse recited and has found it bears a striking resemblance the italics are ours to the ranns of ancient Celtic bards. Our great sweet mother! Our harbours that are empty will be full again, Queenstown, Kinsale, Galway, Blacksod Bay, Ventry in the kingdom of Kerry, Killybegs, the third largest harbour in the wide world with a fleet of masts of the Galway Lynches and the Cavan O’Reillys and the O’Kennedys of Dublin when the earl of Desmond could make a treaty with the emperor Charles the Fifth himself. Our howitzers and camel swivel guns played on his lines with telling effect. Our interview of this morning has left on me a deep impression. Our Lady’s Hospice for the dying. Our lovely land. —Our mighty mother! Our Mr President, he twig the whole lot and he aint saying nothing. Our mutual faith. —Our mutual friend’s stories are like himself, Mr Bloom apropos of knives remarked to his confidante sotto voce. Our name was changed too, he added, pushing the socalled roll across. Our national epic has yet to be written, Dr Sigerson says. Our native Doric. Our old ancient ancestors, as we read in the first chapter of Guinness’s, were partial to the running stream. Our old friend caustic. Our own fault. Our players are creating a new art for Europe like the Greeks or M. Maeterlinck. Our prize titbit: Matcham’s Masterstroke. Our Saviour. Our Saviour: beardframed oval face: talking in the dusk. Our sister. Our soi-disant sailor munched heavily awhile hungrily before answering: —I’m tired of all them rocks in the sea, he said, and boats and ships. Our souls. Our souls, shamewounded by our sins, cling to us yet more, a woman to her lover clinging, the more the more. Our staple food. Ours the white death and the ruddy birth. —Our swim first, Buck Mulligan said. Our travellers reached the rustic hostelry and alighted from their palfreys. Our two champions claimed their plaything with lusty cries and to avoid trouble Cissy Caffrey called to the gentleman to throw it to her please. Our two inimitable drolls did a roaring trade with their broadsheets among lovers of the comedy element and nobody who has a corner in his heart for real Irish fun without vulgarity will grudge them their hardearned pennies. Our whatnot, our writingtable where we never wrote, aunt Hegarty’s armchair, our classic reprints of old masters. Our windingsheet. Our worthy acquaintance Mr Malachi Mulligan now appeared in the doorway as the students were finishing their apologue accompanied with a friend whom he had just rencountered, a young gentleman, his name Alec Bannon, who had late come to town, it being his intention to buy a colour or a cornetcy in the fencibles and list for the wars. —Our young Irish bards, John Eglinton censured, have yet to create a figure which the world will set beside Saxon Shakespeare’s Hamlet though I admire him, as old Ben did, on this side idolatry. O. U’s, wedding rings, watchchains, lockets, necklaces and bracelets are rapidly collected. Out. Out. Out. Outdoor: garden and fieldwork, cycling on level macadamised causeways, ascents of moderately high hills, natation in secluded fresh water and unmolested river boating in secure wherry or light curricle with kedge anchor on reaches free from weirs and rapids period of estivation, vespertinal perambulation or equestrian circumprocession with inspection of sterile landscape and contrastingly agreeable cottagers’ fires of smoking peat turves period of hibernation. Out for the waxies’ Dargle. Out half the night. Out he goes again. Out here in the dark with a man I don’t know raving and moaning to himself about shooting a black panther. Out it rushes: blue. Out of a flying machine. Out of an advertisement. Out of her clothes somewhere: pinned together. Out of her oakframe a nymph with hair unbound, lightly clad in teabrown artcolours, descends from her grotto and passing under interlacing yews stands over Bloom. Out of it out of it. Out of shells, periwinkles with a pin, off trees, snails out of the ground the French eat, out of the sea with bait on a hook. Out of sight, out of mind. Out of that, bloody curse to you! Out of that, you mongrel! Out of the fryingpan of life into the fire of purgatory. —Out of this with you, professor MacHugh said gruffly. Out on spec probably. Out on’t! Out on the rampage all night. Out quickly, quickly! Outside a shuttered pub a bunch of loiterers listen to a tale which their brokensnouted gaffer rasps out with raucous humour. Outside la Maison Claire Blazes Boylan waylaid Jack Mooney’s brother-in-law, humpy, tight, making for the liberties. Outside the Adelphi in London waited all the afternoon to get in. Outside the Dublin Distillers Company’s stores an outside car without fare or jarvey stood, the reins knotted to the wheel. Outside the gramophone begins to blare The Holy City. Outside them and through them ran raddled sheep bleating their fear. Outtohelloutofthat. Out with the oof. Over after over. Over against Dame gate Tom Rochford and Nosey Flynn watched the approach of the cavalcade. Over against the Rt. Over and done with. Over and over had she told herself that as she mused by the dying embers in a brown study without the lamp because she hated two lights or oftentimes gazing out of the window dreamily by the hour at the rain falling on the rusty bucket, thinking. Overcome with emotion. Overdose of laudanum. Overdrawn. Over his untastable apology for a cup of coffee, listening to this synopsis of things in general, Stephen stared at nothing in particular. Over their voices Dollard bassooned attack, booming over bombarding chords: —When love absorbs my ardent soul... Over the possing drift and choking breathcoughs, Elijah’s voice, harsh as a corncrake’s, jars on high. Over the stones. Over the stones. PADDY DIGNAM: By metempsychosis. —Paddy Dignam dead! says Alf. PADDY DIGNAM: Earnestly. PADDY DIGNAM: In a hollow voice. Paddy Dignam listens with visible effort, thinking, his tail stiffpointed, his ears cocked. PADDY DIGNAM: Pray for the repose of his soul. Paddy Dignam shot out and rolling over stiff in the dust in a brown habit too large for him. PADDY DIGNAM: With pricked up ears, winces. Paddy Hooper is there with Jack Hall. Paddy Leonard and Bantam Lyons came in. Paddy Leonard asked. Paddy Leonard asked. Paddy Leonard cried. Paddy Leonard eyed his alemates. Paddy Leonard said with scorn. PADDY LEONARD: Stage Irishman! PADDY LEONARD: Thank you. PADDY LEONARD: What am I to do about my rates and taxes? —Paddy? says Alf. Paff! Page of an old copybook. Pages will be torn from your handbook of astronomy to make them pipespills. Paid off this afternoon. Pain is far. Paint face behind on him then he’d be two. Pain, that was not yet the pain of love, fretted his heart. Pain to the animal too. Pa is dead. Palefaces. Palefaces: they hold their ribs with laughter, one clasping another. Palestrina for example too. Pallas Athena! Pallbearers, gold reins, requiem mass, firing a volley. Palm oil. Palpably he was one of his hangerson but for the matter of that it was merely a question of one preying on his nextdoor neighbour all round, in every deep, so to put it, a deeper depth and for the matter of that if the man in the street chanced to be in the dock himself penal servitude with or without the option of a fine would be a very rara avis altogether. Pal to pal. Paltry funeral: coach and three carriages. Pandemonium. Pander to their Gomorrahan vices. Pandybat. Pan’s hour, the faunal noon. Panther, the Roman centurion, polluted her with his genitories. Pap! Papa’s little bedpal. Paper. Paradise and the peri. Paradise of pretenders then and now. Paragoric poppysyrup bad for cough. Parallax. Parallax! Parallax stalks behind and goads them, the lancinating lightnings of whose brow are scorpions. Paralyse Europe. Parcels post. Pardies and rendered into Engliſh by John Harris D. D. London, printed for R. Knaplock at the Biſhop’s Head, MDCCXI, with dedicatory epiſtle to his worthy friend Charles Cox, eſquire, Member of Parliament for the burgh of Southwark and having ink calligraphed statement on the flyleaf certifying that the book was the property of Michael Gallagher, dated this 10th day of May 1822 and requeſting the perſon who should find it, if the book should be loſt or go aſtray, to reſtore it to Michael Gallagher, carpenter, Dufery Gate, Enniſcorthy, county Wicklow, the fineſt place in the world. Pardon! Pardon? Pardoned a classical allusion. —Pardon, monsieur, Lenehan said, clutching him for an instant and making a grimace. Paris and back. —Paris, past and present, he said. Paris rawly waking, crude sunlight on her lemon streets. Paris: the wellpleased pleaser. Par it’s Greek: parallel, parallax. Parked in North Prince’s street His Majesty’s vermilion mailcars, bearing on their sides the royal initials, E. R., received loudly flung sacks of letters, postcards, lettercards, parcels, insured and paid, for local, provincial, British and overseas delivery. Parleyvoo! Parlour games dominos, halma, tiddledywinks, spilikins, cup and ball, nap, spoil five, bezique, twentyfive, beggar my neighbour, draughts, chess or backgammon: embroidery, darning or knitting for the policeaided clothing society: musical duets, mandoline and guitar, piano and flute, guitar and piano: legal scrivenery or envelope addressing: biweekly visits to variety entertainments: commercial activity as pleasantly commanding and pleasingly obeyed mistress proprietress in a cool dairy shop or warm cigar divan: the clandestine satisfaction of erotic irritation in masculine brothels, state inspected and medically controlled: social visits, at regular infrequent prevented intervals and with regular frequent preventive superintendence, to and from female acquaintances of recognised respectability in the vicinity: courses of evening instruction specially designed to render liberal instruction agreeable. Parlour magic. —Parnell will never come again, he said. Parried again. Parrots. Parson Steve, apostates’ creed! Part. Part for the whole. Particular about his drink. Particularly nice old party for a cup of tea. Partly, I have mislaid... Part shares and part profits. Part shares and part profits. Pass a common remark. Pass by her. Passée. Passed. —Pass, friends, says he. Passing by Roger Greene’s office and Dollard’s big red printinghouse Gerty MacDowell, carrying the Catesby’s cork lino letters for her father who was laid up, knew by the style it was the lord and lady lieutenant but she couldn’t see what Her Excellency had on because the tram and Spring’s big yellow furniture van had to stop in front of her on account of its being the lord lieutenant. Passing now. Passing out he whispered to J. J. O’Molloy: —Incipient jigs. Passing the ivy church he reflected that the ticket inspector usually made his visit when one had carelessly thrown away the ticket. Passionate nature though he was Gerty could see that he had enormous control over himself. Pass round the consolation. Password. Password. Pastille that was fell. Past Richmond bridge at the doorstep of the office of Reuben J Dodd, solicitor, agent for the Patriotic Insurance Company, an elderly female about to enter changed her plan and retracing her steps by King’s windows smiled credulously on the representative of His Majesty. Past was is today. Pat! Pat! PAT: Advances with a tilted dish of spillspilling gravy. Pat Claffey, the pawnbroker’s daughter. Pater! Pater, ait. Paternity may be a legal fiction. Pat is a waiter hard of his hearing. Pat is a waiter who waits while you wait. Pat paid for diner’s popcorked bottle: and over tumbler, tray and popcorked bottle ere he went he whispered, bald and bothered, with miss Douce. Patrice Egan peeps from behind, his rabbitface nibbling a quince leaf. Patrice, home on furlough, lapped warm milk with me in the bar MacMahon. PATRICE: Socialiste! Patriotism, sorrow for the dead, music, future of the race. Patrons of your establishment. Pat served, uncovered dishes. Pat set with ink pen quite flat pad. Pat to and fro. Pat took plate dish knife fork. Pat, waiter, waited. Pat, waiter, waited, waiting to hear, for he was hard of hear by the door. Pat went. Pause. Pause. Pa was inside it and ma crying in the parlour and uncle Barney telling the men how to get it round the bend. Pawning his gold watch in Cummins of Francis street where no-one would know him in the private office when I was there with Pisser releasing his boots out of the pop. Paying game. Paying the piper. Payment at the rate of guinea per col. Payment at the rate of one guinea a column has been made to the writer. Payment at the rate of one guinea per column. Paysayenn. —Pay up and look pleasant, Haines said to him, smiling. Pay your Easter duty. Pay your money, take your choice. Pchp! P. C. N., you know: physiques, chimiques et naturelles. Pen something. People afraid of the dark. People could put up with being bitten by a wolf but what properly riled them was a bite from a sheep. —People do not know how dangerous lovesongs can be, the auric egg of Russell warned occultly. People in law perhaps. People knocking them up at all hours. People looking after her. People ought to help. People talk about you a bit: forget you. People were so queer. Pepper. Plup. £ 800 plus 2 1/2 % interest on the same, repayable quarterly in equal annual instalments until extinction by amortisation of loan advanced for purchase within a period of 20 years, amounting to an annual rental of £ 64, headrent included, the titledeeds to remain in possession of the lender or lenders with a saving clause envisaging forced sale, foreclosure and mutual compensation in the event of protracted failure to pay the terms assigned, otherwise the messuage to become the absolute property of the tenant occupier upon expiry of the period of years stipulated. 11 p.m. closing time. Positive: he included mention of a performance by Mrs Bandmann Palmer of Leah at the Gaiety Theatre, 46, 47, 48, 49 South King street, an invitation to supper at Wynn’s Murphy’s Hotel, 35, 36 and 37 Lower Abbey street, a volume of peccaminous pornographical tendency entituled Sweets of Sin, anonymous author a gentleman of fashion, a temporary concussion caused by a falsely calculated movement in the course of a postcenal gymnastic display, the victim since completely recovered being Stephen Dedalus, professor and author, eldest surviving son of Simon Dedalus, of no fixed occupation, an aeronautical feat executed by him narrator in the presence of a witness, the professor and author aforesaid, with promptitude of decision and gymnastic flexibility. Private Carr and Private Compton, swaggersticks tight in their oxters, as they march unsteadily rightaboutface and burst together from their mouths a volleyed fart. PRIVATE CARR: Bennett? PRIVATE CARR: Breaks loose. PRIVATE CARR: Here. PRIVATE CARR: His cap awry, advances to Stephen. PRIVATE CARR: I don’t give a bugger who he is. PRIVATE CARR: I’ll do him in. PRIVATE CARR: Loosening his belt, shouts. PRIVATE CARR: Lurches towards the watch. Private Carr, Private Compton and Cissy Caffrey pass beneath the windows, singing in discord.
