Queen of angels, queen of patriarchs, queen of prophets, of all saints, they prayed, queen of the most holy rosary and then Father Conroy handed the thurible to Canon O’Hanlon and he put in the incense and censed the Blessed Sacrament and Cissy Caffrey caught the two twins and she was itching to give them a ringing good clip on the ear but she didn’t because she thought he might be watching but she never made a bigger mistake in all her life because Gerty could see without looking that he never took his eyes off of her and then Canon O’Hanlon handed the thurible back to Father Conroy and knelt down looking up at the Blessed Sacrament and the choir began to sing the Tantum ergo and she just swung her foot in and out in time as the music rose and fell to the Tantumer gosa cramen tum. Queen’s Ho... Queens lay with prize bulls. Queens of Dublin society. Queenstown harbour full of Italian ships. —Queenstown harbour, Stephen replied. Queen was in her bedroom eating bread and. Queer because we both, I mean. Queer idea of Dublin he must have, tapping his way round by the stones. Queer I was just thinking that moment. Queer kind of chap. Queer lot of stuff he must have put through his hands in his time: obituary notices, pubs’ ads, speeches, divorce suits, found drowned. Queer the number of pins they always have. Queer the whole atmosphere of the. Queer up there in the cockloft, alone, with stops and locks and keys. Query. Quest for the philosopher’s stone. Questioned by his earthname as to his whereabouts in the heavenworld he stated that he was now on the path of prālāyā or return but was still submitted to trial at the hands of certain bloodthirsty entities on the lower astral levels. Question of mood you’re in. Que voulez-vous? Quick. Quick. Quick. Quick! Quick! Quick! Quicker. Quicker, darlint! Quick, far and daring. Quicklime feverpits to eat them. Quickly he does it. Quickly they were gone and from the lumberroom came the rattle of sticks and clamour of their boots and tongues. Quickly, warningfully Buck Mulligan bent down. Quick of him all the same. Quick round. Quick warm sunlight came running from Berkeley road, swiftly, in slim sandals, along the brightening footpath. Quiet brute. Quiet long days: pruning, ripening. Quietly he read, restraining himself, the first column and, yielding but resisting, began the second. Quietly, sure of his ground, he traversed the dismal fields. Quietly, unassumingly Rumbold stepped on to the scaffold in faultless morning dress and wearing his favourite flower, the Gladiolus Cruentus. Quietude of custody, rather, befitting their station in that house, the vigilant watch of shepherds and of angels about a crib in Bethlehem of Juda long ago. —Qui fecit cœlum et terram. Quills in the postoffice chewed and twisted. —Qui sdegno, Ben, said Father Cowley. Quite a boy. Quite an excellent repast consisting of rashers and eggs, fried steak and onions, done to a nicety, delicious hot breakfast rolls and invigorating tea had been considerately provided by the authorities for the consumption of the central figure of the tragedy who was in capital spirits when prepared for death and evinced the keenest interest in the proceedings from beginning to end but he, with an abnegation rare in these our times, rose nobly to the occasion and expressed the dying wish immediately acceded to that the meal should be divided in aliquot parts among the members of the sick and indigent roomkeepers’ association as a token of his regard and esteem. Quite a number of stories there were on that particular Alice Ben Bolt topic, Enoch Arden and Rip van Winkle and does anybody hereabouts remember Caoc O’Leary, a favourite and most trying declamation piece by the way of poor John Casey and a bit of perfect poetry in its own small way. Quite apart from that he disliked those careers of wrongdoing and crime on principle. Quite bad. Quite charming! Quite dark, regular brunette, black. Quite natural. Quite right. Quite right. Quite right. —Quite right, Martin Cunningham said, taking the list. Quite right to close it. —Quite right too, Mr Dedalus said, going out. Quite safe. —Quite so, Martin Cunningham said. —Quite so, Mr Bloom dittoed. —Quite well, thanks... Quitting all languor Lionel cried in grief, in cry of passion dominant to love to return with deepening yet with rising chords of harmony. —Qui vous a mis dans cette fichue position? Qui vous a mis dans cette fichue position, Philippe? Quotations every day in the year. Quote the textual terms in which the prospectus claimed advantages for this thaumaturgic remedy. Quote the textual terms of this notice. Quoth littlejohn Eglinton: —I was prepared for paradoxes from what Malachi Mulligan told us but I may as well warn you that if you want to shake my belief that Shakespeare is Hamlet you have a stern task before you. Rabbitpie we had that day. Race there, race back to Ennis. Rachel, is it? Racing card! Racing special! Raffle for large tender turkey. Ragged barefoot newsboys, jogging a wagtail kite, patter past, yelling. Rags and bones at midnight. Rahab. Railed off the altar get on to it at any cost. —Raimeis, says the citizen. Rain. Rain. Rain, exposure at dewfall on the searocks, a peccadillo at my time of life. Raise Cain. RAISING THE WIND —Nulla bona, Jack, he said, raising his hand to his chin. Rank heresy for them. Raoul darling, come and dry me. Rare lamps with faint rainbow fans. Rarely. Rarely smoke, dear. Rather a mess. Rather long to keep them in summer. —Rather lowsized. Rather stale smell that incense leaves next day. Rather strange he should have just that fixed idea. Rather upsets a man’s day, a funeral does. Rather warm. Rats! Rats get in too. Rats: vats. Rattle his bones. Rattle his bones. Rattling good place round there for pigs’ feet. Ravished over her I lay, full lips full open, kissed her mouth. Ravisher and ravished, what he would but would not, go with him from Lucrece’s bluecircled ivory globes to Imogen’s breast, bare, with its mole cinquespotted. Raw facebones under his peep of day boy’s hat. Rawhead and bloody bones. Raw head and bloody bones. Raw pastry I like myself. Rawthere! —... ray of hope is... Reaction. Reading, lying back now, counting the strands of her hair, smiling, braiding. Reading two pages apiece of seven books every night, eh? Read mine. Reads it backwards first. Read Tacitus and Ptolemy, even Giraldus Cambrensis. —Read that, she said. Read them. Read the Priest, the Woman and the Confessional. Read the revelations that’s going on in the papers about flogging on the training ships at Portsmouth. Read the skies. Read with their fingers. Ready? Read your own obituary notice they say you live longer. Really? Really he was. Really, Mr Bloom said though first he fancied he alluded to the archbishop till he added about foot and mouth with which there could be no possible connection overjoyed to set his mind at rest and a bit flabbergasted at Myles Crawford’s after all managing to. Really terrible. Reaping the whirlwind. Reason. Reassuringly, their place, where none could hear them talk, being secluded, reassured, the decocted beverages, allowing for subsolid residual sediment of a mechanical mixture, water plus sugar plus cream plus cocoa, having been consumed. Rebound of garter. Recant! Recent outrage. Recipe for white wine vinegar. Recite the first major part of this chanted legend. Recite the second part minor of the legend. Reclaim the whole place. Reclined against the area railings he perceived through the transparent kitchen panes a man regulating a gasflame of 14 CP, a man lighting a candle of 1 CP, a man removing in turn each of his two boots, a man leaving the kitchen holding a candle. Recommend it to your lady and gentlemen friends, lasts a lifetime. —Recorder, says Ned. Redbank oysters will shortly be upon us. Red carpet spread. Redcoats. Red face: grey now. Red influences lupus. Red Murray’s long shears sliced out the advertisement from the newspaper in four clean strokes. Red Murray whispered. Red rails fly spacewards. Red rays are longest. Reduce Bloom by cross multiplication of reverses of fortune, from which these supports protected him, and by elimination of all positive values to a negligible negative irrational unreal quantity. Reduplication of personality. Reedy freckled soprano. Refined birching to stimulate the circulation. Reflections on his vigour a bounder, corporal proportion a billsticker, commercial ability a bester, impressionability a boaster. Reflect, ponder, excogitate, reply. Reformed prostitute will address the meeting. Refracts is it? heat. Refuge of sinners. Refuse christian burial. Regaining new stable equilibrium he rose uninjured though concussed by the impact, raised the latch of the area door by the exertion of force at its freely moving flange and by leverage of the first kind applied at its fulcrum, gained retarded access to the kitchen through the subadjacent scullery, ignited a lucifer match by friction, set free inflammable coal gas by turning on the ventcock, lit a high flame which, by regulating, he reduced to quiescent candescence and lit finally a portable candle. Regular hotbed of it lately. Regularly engaged. Regular square feed for them. Regular world in itself. Rehearsing his band part. Reincarnation: that’s the word. Releasing his thumbs, he invokes grace from on high with large wave gestures and proclaims with bloated pomp: THE CARDINAL: Conservio lies captured He lies in the lowest dungeon With manacles and chains around his limbs Weighing upwards of three tons. Relics of old decency. Relieving office here. Religion pays. Religions. Relinquishing his symposiarchal right to the moustache cup of imitation Crown Derby presented to him by his only daughter, Millicent Milly, he substituted a cup identical with that of his guest and served extraordinarily to his guest and, in reduced measure, to himself the viscous cream ordinarily reserved for the breakfast of his wife Marion Molly. —Rely on me, says Joe. —Remanded, says J. J. One of the bottlenosed fraternity it was went by the name of James Wought alias Saphiro alias Spark and Spiro, put an ad in the papers saying he’d give a passage to Canada for twenty bob. Remedy where you least expect it. Remember. Remember. Remember? Remember about the mistake in the valuation when I was in Thom’s. Remember, Erin, thy generations and thy days of old, how thou settedst little by me and by my word and broughtedst in a stranger to my gates to commit fornication in my sight and to wax fat and kick like Jeshurum. Remember her laughing at the wind, her blizzard collar up. Remember him in your prayers. Remember if you do not I will punish you. Remembering thee, O Sion. Remember Limerick and the broken treatystone. Remember me to Molly, won’t you? Remember Pasiphae for whose lust my grandoldgrossfather made the first confessionbox. Remember: rosiny ropes, ships’ lanterns. Remember that till their dying day. Remember that time? Remember the summer morning she was born, running to knock up Mrs Thornton in Denzille street. Remember when we got home raking up the fire and frying up those pieces of lap of mutton for her supper with the Chutney sauce she liked. Remember write Greek ees. Remerciez! Remind him of home sweet home. Reminds me of strawberries and cream. Remind you of a mosque, redbaked bricks, the minarets. Remind you of the voice like the photograph reminds you of the face. Reminiscences of coincidences, truth stranger than fiction, preindicative of the result of the Gold Cup flat handicap, the official and definitive result of which he had read in the Evening Telegraph, late pink edition, in the cabman’s shelter, at Butt bridge. Remove him. Remove him, acushla. Renewed laughter. —Repeat that dose, says Joe. Repent! Repentance skindeep. Repent, Stephen. Reporters complain that they cannot hear. Repugnant wretch! Requiem mass. —Requiescat! Rescue of fallen women. Reserve better. Reserved about to yield. Resigned he passed out with grave words and gait, saying, wellnigh with sorrow: —And going forth he met Butterly. Respect. Respectable girl meet after mass. Respectable woman. Respect his liberty. Respect yourself. Resp. girl R.C. wishes to hear of post in fruit or pork shop. Resting his feet on the dwarf wall, he climbed over the area railings, compressed his hat on his head, grasped two points at the lower union of rails and stiles, lowered his body gradually by its length of five feet nine inches and a half to within two feet ten inches of the area pavement and allowed his body to move freely in space by separating himself from the railings and crouching in preparation for the impact of the fall. Restless. Rest rubble, sprawling suburbs, jerrybuilt. Rest suddenly possessed the discreet vaulted cell, rest of warm and brooding air. Result of the Gold Cup races! and from the door of Dignam’s house a boy ran out and called. Result of the rockinghorse races. Retaining the perpendicular. Retain your own. Retamplatan digidi boumboum. Retreating, at the terminus of the Great Northern Railway, Amiens street, with constant uniform acceleration, along parallel lines meeting at infinity, if produced: along parallel lines, reproduced from infinity, with constant uniform retardation, at the terminus of the Great Northern Railway, Amiens street, returning. Return and see. Returned Indian officer. Returned with thanks having fully digested the contents. Returning not the same. RETURN OF BLOOM —Yes, he said. Return, return, Clan Milly: forget me not, O Milesian. Reuben J. A florin I find him. Reuben J Antichrist, wandering jew, a clutching hand open on his spine, stumps forward. Reuben J Dodd, blackbearded Iscariot, bad shepherd, bearing on his shoulders the drowned corpse of his son, approaches the pillory. Reuben J’s son must have swallowed a good bellyful of that sewage. Reuben J was bloody lucky he didn’t clap him in the dock the other day for suing poor little Gumley that’s minding stones, for the corporation there near Butt bridge. REUBEN J: Whispers hoarsely. Reuben of that ilk. Reverently look at her as she reclines there with the motherlight in her eyes, that longing hunger for baby fingers a pretty sight it is to see, in the first bloom of her new motherhood, breathing a silent prayer of thanksgiving to One above, the Universal Husband. Rewarded by smiles he fell back and spoke with Corny Kelleher, accepting the dockets given him, turning them over and scanning them as he walked. £ 5 reward, lost, stolen or strayed from his residence 7 Eccles street, missing gent about 40, answering to the name of Bloom, Leopold Poldy, height 5 ft 9 1/2 inches, full build, olive complexion, may have since grown a beard, when last seen was wearing a black suit. Rhapsodies about damn all. Rhubarb tart with liberal fillings, rich fruit interior. RHYMES AND REASONS Mouth, south. Rhymes: two men dressed the same, looking the same, two by two. Rhythm begins, you see. Richard, a whoreson crookback, misbegotten, makes love to a widowed Ann what’s in a name?, woos and wins her, a whoreson merry widow. Richard the conqueror, third brother, came after William the conquered. Rich booty you brought back; Le Tutu, five tattered numbers of Pantalon Blanc et Culotte Rouge; a blue French telegram, curiosity to show: —Mother dying come home father. Richie, admiring, descanted on that man’s glorious voice. RICHIE: Best value in Dub. Richie cocked his lips apout. RICHIE: Goodgod. Richie Goulding and the legal bag. RICHIE GOULDING: Bagweighted, passes the door. Richie Goulding: he’s another. Richie Goulding listened. Richie Goulding, three ladies’ hats pinned on his head, appears weighted to one side by the black legal bag of Collis and Ward on which a skull and crossbones are painted in white limewash. Richie led on. Richie rift in the lute alone sat: Goulding, Collis, Ward. Richie turned. RICHIE: With a cry of pain, his hand to his back. Rich sound. Riddle me, riddle me, randy ro. Ride a cockhorse. Riding astride. Rien va plus! Rift in the lute I think. Right. Right. Right. Right. Right. Right. Right. Right and left parallel clanging ringing a doubledecker and a singledeck moved from their railheads, swerved to the down line, glided parallel. Right enough the harbours were there only no ships ever called. Right here it began. —Right, M’Coy said brightly. —Right, Mr Bloom said with a nod. —Right now? Righto, any old time. Righto, Isaacs, shove em out of the bleeding limelight. —Righto, Martin Cunningham said. Right outside the viceregal lodge, imagine! Right, Pat. —Right, says John Wyse. —Right, says Ned, taking up his John Jameson. Right, sir. Right, sir. —Right: thanks, Hynes said moving off. Rinderpest. —Ringabella and Crosshaven, a voice replied groping for foothold. Ringsend. Ringsend: wigwams of brown steersmen and master mariners. Ripening now. Rip: tear in Henny Doyle’s overcoat. Rip van Winkle! Rip van Winkle we played. Risk it. Rmm Rmm Rmm Rrrrrrmmmmm. —Roast and mashed here. —Roast beef and cabbage. Roastbeef for old England. Roast him! —Robbed, says he. Robbing Peter to pay Paul. Robert Emmet’s last words. Robert Emmet was buried here by torchlight, wasn’t he? Roberto ruba roba sua. Robinson Crusoe had to live on them. Rockbottom figure and cheap at the price. Rocket and breeches buoy and lifeboat. Rock, the head bailiff, standing at the bar blew the foamy crown from his tankard. Rollicking Richie once. Roll of Bensoulbenjamin rolled to the quivery loveshivery roofpanes. Rome boose for the Bloom toff. Romeo. Room whirls back. Rope which hanged the awful rebel. Rorke’s Drift! Rose of Castile. Roses, I think. Rot quick in damp earth. Rough weather outside. Round and round a moth flies, colliding, escaping. Round and round slow. Round him peered Lenehan. Round his neck hangs a rosary of corks ending on his breast in a corkscrew cross. Roundness you think good. Round Rabaiotti’s halted ice gondola stunted men and women squabble. Round their shores file shadows black of cedargroves. Round the Kish in eighty days. Round the side of the Evening Telegraph he just caught a fleeting glimpse of her face round the side of the door with a kind of demented glassy grin showing that she was not exactly all there, viewing with evident amusement the group of gazers round skipper Murphy’s nautical chest and then there was no more of her. Round to Menton’s office. Round towers. Roun wi the nappy. Rover cycleshop. Rows of cast. Rows of cast steel. Rows of grimy houses with gaping doors. Row with her in the XL Café about the bracelet. Royal and privileged Hungarian robbery. Royal Dublin Fusiliers. Royal sturgeon high sheriff, Coffey, the butcher, right to venisons of the forest from his ex. Roygbiv. Roygbiv Vance taught us: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, violet. Rrpr. Rrr. Rrrpr. Rrrrrr. Rrrrrrrsss. Rtststr! Rubber goods. Rubbing smartly in turn each welt against her stockinged calf. Rub in August: good idea: horseshow month. Rub off the microbes with your handkerchief. Ruby: the Pride of the Ring. Rudolph Bloom deceased narrated to his son Leopold Bloom aged 6 a retrospective arrangement of migrations and settlements in and between Dublin, London, Florence, Milan, Vienna, Budapest, Szombathely with statements of satisfaction his grandfather having seen Maria Theresia, empress of Austria, queen of Hungary, with commercial advice having taken care of pence, the pounds having taken care of themselves. RUDOLPH: Once! RUDOLPH: Second halfcrown waste money today. RUDOLPH: Severely. RUDOLPH: What you making down this place? RUDOLPH: With contempt. Rudy. Rudy. Rudy! RUDY: Gazes, unseeing, into Bloom’s eyes and goes on reading, kissing, smiling. Rugger. Ruins and tenements. Ruin them. Rule the world today. —Ruling passion strong in death, says Joe, as someone said. RUMBOLD, DEMON BARBER: Accompanied by two blackmasked assistants, advances with gladstone bag which he opens. RUMBOLD: I’m near it myself. RUMBOLD: To the recorder with sinister familiarity. Rum idea: eating bits of a corpse. Ruminants. Rummaging. Rumour had it though not proved that she descended from the house of the lords Talbot de Malahide in whose mansion, really an unquestionably fine residence of its kind and well worth seeing, her mother or aunt or some relative, a woman, as the tale went, of extreme beauty, had enjoyed the distinction of being in service in the washkitchen. Rumpled stockings, it may be, possibly is, a foible of mine but still it’s a thing I simply hate to see. Run. Runaway horse. Running after me. Running into cakeshops. —Run on, Stephen said. Run over by tram. Run, skelter, race. Runs, she runs to meet me, a girl with gold hair on the wind. Run the line out to the cemetery gates and have special trams, hearse and carriage and all. Run you through the small guts for nothing. Rush your order and you play a slick ace. Russell. Russell. Russell, one guinea, Cousins, ten shillings, Bob Reynolds, half a guinea, Koehler, three guineas, Mrs MacKernan, five weeks’ board. Rusty wreaths hung on knobs, garlands of bronzefoil. Rut. Ruth red him, love led on with will to wander, loth to leave. Ruttledge’s door: ee creaking. Révérence! —Ryefield, Mr Best said brightly, gladly, raising his new book, gladly, brightly. —Sabellius, the African, subtlest heresiarch of all the beasts of the field, held that the Father was Himself His Own Son. Sacred Heart of Mary, where were you at all at all? —Sacrifizio incruento, Stephen said smiling, swaying his ashplant in slow swingswong from its midpoint, lightly. Sacrilege! Sad about her lame of course but must be on your guard not to feel too much pity. Sad booser’s eyes. Sad case. SAD Cleverest fellow at the junior bar he used to be. Sad end of government printer’s clerk. Sad however because it lasts only a few years till they settle down to potwalloping and papa’s pants will soon fit Willy and fuller’s earth for the baby when they hold him out to do ah ah. Sadly missed. Sadly over the crossblind Lydia Douce and Mina Kennedy gaze. Sadly she twined in sauntering gold hair behind a curving ear. —Sad, Martin Cunningham said. Sad music. —Sad occasions, Mr Kernan began politely. Sad thing about poor Dignam, Mr O’Rourke. —Sad to lose the old friends, Mrs Breen’s womaneyes said melancholily. Sad too. Sad was the man that word to hear that him so heavied in bowels ruthful. Safe! Safe arrival of Antichrist. Safe home! Safe home to Dolly. Safe in a minute. Safe in one way. Safe in the arms of kingdom come. Safer to eat from his three hands. Saffron bun and milk and soda lunch in the educational dairy. Said he was going to paradise or is in paradise. Said that. —Said the ace of spades was walking up the stairs. Said thee fox too thee stork: Will you put your bill down inn my troath and pull upp ah bone? Saint Ambrose heard it, sigh of leaves and waves, waiting, awaiting the fullness of their times, diebus ac noctibus iniurias patiens ingemiscit. Saint Frusquin was her sire. Saint Joseph’s church, Portland row. Saint Leopold’s. Saint Patrick converted him to Christianity. —Saint Patrick would want to land again at Ballykinlar and convert us, says the citizen, after allowing things like that to contaminate our shores. —Saint Thomas, Stephen began... —Saint Thomas, Stephen smiling said, whose gorbellied works I enjoy reading in the original, writing of incest from a standpoint different from that of the new Viennese school Mr Magee spoke of, likens it in his wise and curious way to an avarice of the emotions. Salivation is insufficient, the patellar reflex intermittent. Saloon motor hearses. Salt green death. Salt in the Ormond damp. Salt junk all the time. Saltwhite crumbling mush of corpse: smell, taste like raw white turnips. Salty too. Salut! Salute. Salute! Salute! Saluting Ned Lambert and John Henry Menton he walked on at Martin Cunningham’s side puzzling two long keys at his back. Salvation army blatant imitation. Salvi facti sunt. —Same again, Terry, says Joe. Same as Citron’s house. Same bait. Same blue serge dress she had two years ago, the nap bleaching. Same here. Same house as Molly’s namesake, Tweedy, crown solicitor for Waterford. Same idea those jews they said killed the christian boy. Same notice on the door. Same old dingdong always. Same old six and eightpence. —Same only more so, says Lenehan. Same style of beauty. Same style of beauty. Same thing watered down. Same thing with ads. Same time doing it scraped her slipper on the floor so they wouldn’t hear. Same time might prefer a tie undone or something. Sand in the Red Sea done that. Sands and stones. Sandwich? Sandycove! Sandy shrivelled smell he seems to have. Sanktus! Sardines on the shelves. —Sargent! Sargent peered askance through his slanted glasses. Sargent who alone had lingered came forward slowly, showing an open copybook. Satan, you’ll sing no more lovesongs. Satirically. Satisfaction at the ubiquity in eastern and western terrestrial hemispheres, in all habitable lands and islands explored or unexplored the land of the midnight sun, the islands of the blessed, the isles of Greece, the land of promise, of adipose anterior and posterior female hemispheres, redolent of milk and honey and of excretory sanguine and seminal warmth, reminiscent of secular families of curves of amplitude, insusceptible of moods of impression or of contrarieties of expression, expressive of mute immutable mature animality. Saucebox. Sauce for the gander. Sauce for the goose, my gander O. BLOOM: They... Saucy knave! Sauntering sadly, gold no more, she twisted twined a hair. Save. Save. Save China’s millions. Save her. Save him from hell, O Divine Sacred Heart! Save it they can’t. Saves them. —Save them, says the citizen, the giant ash of Galway and the chieftain elm of Kildare with a fortyfoot bole and an acre of foliage. Save the trees of Ireland for the future men of Ireland on the fair hills of Eire, O. —Europe has its eyes on you, says Lenehan. —Save you kindly, says J. J. What’ll it be, Ned? Saving princes is a thank you job. Saw a pool near her foot. Saw her in the viceregal party when Stubbs the park ranger got me in with Whelan of the Express. Saw him looking at my frockcoat. Saw him out at the Three Jolly Topers marching along bareheaded and his eldest boy carrying one in a marketnet. Saw something in me. Say! Say a woman loses a charm with every pin she takes out. Sayest thou so? Say half a crown. Say he got ten per cent off. Say, how would it be, governor, if I was to bash in your jaw? Say, I am operating all this trunk line. Say it again. Say it cuts lo. Say it’s turn six. Say it was black, for instance. —Say nothing! Say out big, big. —Say papa, baby. Say pa pa pa pa pa pa pa. Say prunes and prisms forty times every morning, cure for fat lips. Say Robinson Crusoe was true to life. Says he found a sweet young thing down there. Says he’s your father, sir. Say something. Say something to him. Says that over everybody. Say they won’t eat pork. Say you never see them with three colours. —Scald the teapot. Scalp wants oiling. Scamp! Scandalous! Scandalous! Scaring eavesdropping boots croppy bootsboy Bloom in the Ormond hallway heard the growls and roars of bravo, fat backslapping, their boots all treading, boots not the boots the boy. Scarlatina, influenza epidemics. Scarlet runners. Scavenging what the quality left. Scene at Westland row. Scep. contentions would appear to prove him pretty badly addicted runs directly counter to accepted scientific methods. Scep. remark or should it be called an interruption? that an omnivorous being which can masticate, deglute, digest and apparently pass through the ordinary channel with pluterperfect imperturbability such multifarious aliments as cancrenous females emaciated by parturition, corpulent professional gentlemen, not to speak of jaundiced politicians and chlorotic nuns, might possibly find gastric relief in an innocent collation of staggering bob, reveals as nought else could and in a very unsavoury light the tendency above alluded to. Sceptre a shade heavier. —Sceptre will win in a canter, he said. Sceptre wins! Sceptre with O. Madden up. Schedule time. Schluss. Schorach ani wenowach, benoith Hierushaloim. Science. Science, it cannot be too often repeated, deals with tangible phenomena. Scissors and paste. Scoffing up stewgravy with sopping sippets of bread. Scoot. Scott of Dawson street. Scoundrel, said he, You’ll sing no more lovesongs. Scowl or smile. Scrape. Scrape: nearly gone. Scratch my head. Scratch the sole of my foot. Screams of newsboys barefoot in the hall rushed near and the door was flung open. Screened under ferns she laughed warmfolded. Screwed refusing to pay his fare. Scrum in. Scusi, eh? —Scutter! he cried thickly. S. D: sua donna. Sea air sours it, I heard. Sea and headland now grew dim. Seabedabbled, fallen, weltering. Seabloom, greaseabloom viewed last words. Seadeath, mildest of all deaths known to man. Seal of King David. Seal up all. Searchlight. Seas between. Sea serpent in the royal canal. Seaside girls. Seasonable weather we are having this time of year. Seated all day at the organ. Seat of the affections. Sea, wind, leaves, thunder, waters, cows lowing, the cattlemarket, cocks, hens don’t crow, snakes hissss. Second drink does it. Second gentleman paid. Secondleg they should be. Second nature to him. SECOND WATCH: All right, Mr Kelleher. SECOND WATCH: An alibi. SECOND WATCH: Another! SECOND WATCH: Awed, whispers. SECOND WATCH: Blesses himself. SECOND WATCH: Genially. Secret eyes, secretsearching. Secret of all secrets. Secrets for enlarging your private parts. Secrets, silent, stony sit in the dark palaces of both our hearts: secrets weary of their tyranny: tyrants, willing to be dethroned. Secured the verdict cleverly by a length. See. See. See? —See? See. See. See! See. See? See blank tee what domestic animal? Seed near free poun on un a spell ago a said war hisn. Seedy cuss in the Richmond? See her as she is spoil all. —See here, he said, showing Antonio. See her from here though. See her in her dishybilly. —See? he said. —See? he said. See him grow up. See him sometimes walking about trying to find out who played the trick. See his phiz then. —See if you can do anything with that, he said. Seeing her home after practice. Seeing that the ruse worked and the coast was clear they left the shelter or shanty together and the élite society of oilskin and company whom nothing short of an earthquake would move out of their dolce far niente. Seeing they were all looking at his chest he accommodatingly dragged his shirt more open so that on top of the timehonoured symbol of the mariner’s hope and rest they had a full view of the figure 16 and a young man’s sideface looking frowningly rather. See! it displodes for thee in abundance. See it in your eye. See it in your eye. See it in your face. Seekers on the great quest. Seek thou the light. See me he might. —Seems a long way off, Haines said, thoughtfully lifting his spoon. Seems anything but pleased. Seems a sort of a joke. Seems new. Seems not. Seems to a secret touch telling me memory. —Seems to be, J. J. O’Molloy said, taking out a cigarettecase in murmuring meditation, but it is not always as it seems. Seems to be what you call yashmak or I mean kismet. Seems to see with his fingers. Seem to like it. Seen him today at a runefal? Seen its best days. See, not be seen. See now. See now the last one I put in is over here: Turns Over. See ourselves as others see us. See ourselves as others see us. See real beauty of the eye when she not speaks. Sees me, does she? Sees me looking. See that? See the animals feed. See the eye that woman gave her, passing. See the little kipper not up to his navel and the big fellow swiping. See them sitting there stark ballocknaked eating a dead horse’s liver raw. See the wheeze? See the wide world. See things in their forehead perhaps: kind of sense of volume. See this. See, thy fleece is drenched. See what I meant, see? See ye here. See, you have forgotten. See you later. See your whole life in a flash. Selfish those t.t’s are. Self which it itself was ineluctably preconditioned to become. Selling bazaar tickets or what do you call it royal Hungarian privileged lottery. Selling new at two guineas. Selling tapes in my cousin, Peter Paul M’Swiney’s. Sell on easy terms to capture trade. Sell the monkey! Sell the monkey, boys! Sell your soul for that, do, dyed rags pinned round a squaw. S’elp me, honest injun. Semigrand open crocodile music hath jaws. Send her a postal order two shillings, half a crown. Send him back the half of a cow. —Send it at once, will you? he said. Sends them to the rightabout. Send us bright one, light one, Horhorn, quickening and wombfruit. Send us bright one, light one, Horhorn, quickening and wombfruit. Send us bright one, light one, Horhorn, quickening and wombfruit. Senhor Enrique Flor presided at the organ with his wellknown ability and, in addition to the prescribed numbers of the nuptial mass, played a new and striking arrangement of Woodman, spare that tree at the conclusion of the service. Sense of smell must be stronger too. Sensible of a benignant persistent ache in his footsoles he extended his foot to one side and observed the creases, protuberances and salient points caused by foot pressure in the course of walking repeatedly in several different directions, then, inclined, he disnoded the laceknots, unhooked and loosened the laces, took off each of his two boots for the second time, detached the partially moistened right sock through the fore part of which the nail of his great toe had again effracted, raised his right foot and, having unhooked a purple elastic sock suspender, took off his right sock, placed his unclothed right foot on the margin of the seat of his chair, picked at and gently lacerated the protruding part of the great toenail, raised the part lacerated to his nostrils and inhaled the odour of the quick, then, with satisfaction, threw away the lacerated ungual fragment. Sensitive. Sensitive plants. Sent his heir over to make the king an Austrian fieldmarshal now. —Separatio a mensa et a thalamo, bettered Buck Mulligan and was smiled on. Separation. Sermon by the very reverend John Conmee S. J. on saint Peter Claver S. J. and the African Mission. Serpents too are gluttons for woman’s milk. Serum and virus. Serve! Set down his glass. Set of dancing masters! Setting up house for her time after time and then pawning the furniture on him every Saturday almost. Settle my hat straight. Settling those napkins. Seven Davy Byrne’s. —Seven days in jail, Ben Dollard said, on bread and water. —Seven d., sir... Seven dwarf simian acolytes, also in red, cardinal sins, uphold his train, peeping under it. Seven is dear to the mystic mind. Seven last words. Seventh heaven. Seventy beds keeps he there teeming mothers are wont that they lie for to thole and bring forth bairns hale so God’s angel to Mary quoth. Several highly respectable Dublin ladies hold up improper letters received from Bloom. Several shopkeepers from upper and lower Dorset street throw objects of little or no commercial value, hambones, condensed milk tins, unsaleable cabbage, stale bread, sheep’s tails, odd pieces of fat. Several wellknown burgesses, city magnates and freemen of the city shake hands with Bloom and congratulate him. Sex breaking out even then. —Seymour a bleeding officer! Seymour Bushe got him off. —Seymour’s back in town, the young man said, grasping again his spur of rock. Shabby genteel. Shades of night hovering here with all the dead stretched about. Shadow of my mind. ... shadows... the woods ... white breast... dim sea. Shah of Persia liked that best. Shake a shake. Shake hands. Shake hands, brother. Shakes. Shakespeare Bacon’s wild oats. —Shakespeare has left the huguenot’s house in Silver street and walks by the swanmews along the riverbank. SHAKESPEARE: In dignified ventriloquy. Shakespeare is the happy huntingground of all minds that have lost their balance. Shakespeare said. Shakespeares were as common as Murphies. Shakespeare’s Works dark crimson morocco, goldtooled. SHAKESPEARE: With paralytic rage. Shaking sleep out of it. Shakti Shiva, darkhidden Father! Shaky on his pins, poor old sot. Shall I nevermore behold thee? Shall us? Shall we see you at Moore’s tonight? Shame all put on before third person. Shame of death. Shame really. Shandygaff? Shannon and all the boatclub swells never took his eyes off her. Shapely bathers on golden strand. Shapely goddesses, Venus, Juno: curves the world admires. Shapely too. Shark liver oil they use to clean. Sharp as needles they are. Shattered glass and toppling masonry. Shatter me you who can. Shatter them, one and both. Shaved off his moustache again, by Jove! She... She admired: a natural phenomenon having been explained by him to her she expressed the immediate desire to possess without gradual acquisition a fraction of his science, the moiety, the quarter, a thousandth part. She always kept things decent in The Hannigan famileye. She answered: —Miss Kennedy, was Mr Boylan in while I was upstairs? She answered, slighting: —Ask no questions and you’ll hear no lies. She arches her body in lascivious crispation, placing her forefinger in her mouth. She asked. She asked him was that so. She asked you who was in your room. She bent. She bestowed fat pears neatly, head by tail, and among them ripe shamefaced peaches. She bites his ear gently with little goldstopped teeth, sending on him a cloying breath of stale garlic. She blinked up out of her avid shameclosing eyes, mewing plaintively and long, showing him her milkwhite teeth. She blushes and makes a knee. She bore his children and she laid pennies on his eyes to keep his eyelids closed when he lay on his deathbed. She bows her old head to a voice that speaks to her loudly, her bonesetter, her medicineman: me she slights. She breaks off and nibbles a piece, gives a piece to Kitty Ricketts and then turns kittenishly to Lynch. She broke off suddenly. Shebronze, dealing from her oblique jar thick syrupy liquor for his lips, looked as it flowed flower in his coat: who gave him?, and syrupped with her voice: —Fine goods in small parcels. She brought back to his recollection the happy days of blissful childhood together on the banks of Anna Liffey when they had indulged in the innocent pastimes of the young and, oblivious of the dreadful present, they both laughed heartily, all the spectators, including the venerable pastor, joining in the general merriment. She buys dear and sells cheap. She calls her children home in their dark language. She calls the doctor sir Peter Teazle and picks buttercups off the quilt. She claps her hands. She climbed their crooked tree and I... She clutches again in her robe. She clutches the two crowns. She could almost see the swift answering flash of admiration in his eyes that set her tingling in every nerve. She could see at once by his dark eyes and his pale intellectual face that he was a foreigner, the image of the photo she had of Martin Harvey, the matinee idol, only for the moustache which she preferred because she wasn’t stagestruck like Winny Rippingham that wanted they two to always dress the same on account of a play but she could not see whether he had an aquiline nose or a slightly retroussé from where he was sitting. She could without difficulty, he said, have posed for the ensemble, not to dwell on certain opulent curves of the. She counts. She cries. She crosses the threshold. She cuffs them on, her streamers flaunting aloft. She curtseyed and went out, followed by Buck Mulligan’s tender chant: —Heart of my heart, were it more, More would be laid at your feet. She dances, capers, wagging her sowish haunches and her hips, on her gross belly flapping a ruby egg. She dances in a foul gloom where gum bums with garlic. She dare not bear the sunnygolden babe of day. She darted, bronze, to the backmost corner, flattening her face against the pane in a halo of hurried breath. She darts back to the table. She darts to the piano and bangs chords on it with crossed arms. She’d have won the money only for the other dog. She did. She did get flushed in the wind. She did it up all by herself and what joy was hers when she tried it on then, smiling at the lovely reflection which the mirror gave back to her! She did not mind. She didn’t know what to do To keep it up, To keep it up. She didn’t like her plate full. She didn’t like it because I sprained my ankle first day she wore choir picnic at the Sugarloaf. She didn’t mean it, Mr Bello. She didn’t want anything. She died, for literature at least, before she was born. —She died, Stephen retorted, sixtyseven years after she was born. She dies. She disliked umbrella with rain, he liked woman with umbrella, she disliked new hat with rain, he liked woman with new hat, he bought new hat with rain, she carried umbrella with new hat. She’d like scent of that kind. She does whack it, by George. She doubled a slice of bread into her mouth, asking: —What time is the funeral? She draws a poniard and, clad in the sheathmail of an elected knight of nine, strikes at his loins. She draws from behind, ogling, and shows coyly her bloodied clout. She drew down pensive why did he go so quick when I? about her bronze, over the bar where bald stood by sister gold, inexquisite contrast, contrast inexquisite nonexquisite, slow cool dim seagreen sliding depth of shadow, eau de Nil. She drew herself up to her full height. She drops two pennies in the slot. Sheer force of natural genius, that. Sheet kindly lent. Sheet of her music blew out of my hand against the High school railings. She fades from his side. She felt a kind of a sensation rushing all over her and she knew by the feel of her scalp and that irritation against her stays that that thing must be coming on because the last time too was when she clipped her hair on account of the moon. She felt the warm flush, a danger signal always with Gerty MacDowell, surging and flaming into her cheeks. She fixes her bluecircled hollow eyesockets on Stephen and opens her toothless mouth uttering a silent word. She folded the card into her untidy bag and snapped the catch. She followed not all, a part of the whole, gave attention with interest comprehended with surprise, with care repeated, with greater difficulty remembered, forgot with ease, with misgiving reremembered, rerepeated with error. She follows her mother with ungainly steps, a mare leading her fillyfoal. She frees herself, droops on a chair. She frowns with lowered head. She gave her moist a lady’s hand to his firm clasp. She gazed out towards the distant sea. She gazed straight before her, inhaling through her arched nostrils. She gets you a job on the paper and then you go and slate her drivel to Jaysus. She gives him the glad eye. She glanced at him as she bent forward quickly, a pathetic little glance of piteous protest, of shy reproach under which he coloured like a girl. She glances back. She glances round her at the couples. She glides away crookedly. She glides sidling and bowing, twirling japanesily. She goes to the chandelier and turns the gas full cock. She goes to the pianola. She goes to window. —She got the things, she said. She had. She had a gorgeous, simply gorgeous, time. She had cut it that very morning on account of the new moon and it nestled about her pretty head in a profusion of luxuriant clusters and pared her nails too, Thursday for wealth. She had fought the good fight and now she was very very happy. She had four dinky sets with awfully pretty stitchery, three garments and nighties extra, and each set slotted with different coloured ribbons, rosepink, pale blue, mauve and peagreen, and she aired them herself and blued them when they came home from the wash and ironed them and she had a brickbat to keep the iron on because she wouldn’t trust those washerwomen as far as she’d see them scorching the things. She had interrogated constantly at varying intervals as to the correct method of writing the capital initial of the name of a city in Canada, Quebec. She had loved him better than he knew. She had loved his weak watery blood drained from her own. She had no intention of being at their beck and call. She had no navel. She had no water, it appears, in her hold. She had outlived him. She had plenty of game in her then. She had red slippers on. She had saved him from being trampled underfoot and had gone, scarcely having been. She had that cream gown on with the rip she never stitched. She had to go but they would meet again, there, and she would dream of that till then, tomorrow, of her dream of yester eve. She half smiled at him wanly, a sweet forgiving smile, a smile that verged on tears, and then they parted. She has a bucket on the crook of her arm and a scouringbrush in her hand. She has a fine pair, God bless her. She has a good job if she minds it till Johnny comes marching home again. She has a sprouting moustache. She has it. She has it, she got it, Wherever she put it, The leg of the duck. She has large pendant beryl eardrops. She has something to put in them. She has the Spanish type. She hauls up a reef of her slip, revealing her bare thigh, and unrolls the potato from the top of her stocking. She hauls up a reef of skirt and ransacks the pouch of her striped blay petticoat. She heard old Royce sing in the pantomime of Turko the Terrible and laughed with others when he sang: I am the boy That can enjoy Invisibility. She held it to her own. She hiccups, then bends quickly her sailor hat under which her hair glows, red with henna. She holds a Scottish widow’s insurance policy and a large marquee umbrella under which her brood run with her, Patsy hopping on one shod foot, his collar loose, a hank of porksteaks dangling, Freddy whimpering, Susy with a crying cod’s mouth, Alice struggling with the baby. She holds his hand which is feeling for her nipple. She hurries out. She is a bad merchant. She is a hoary pandemonium of ills, enlarged glands, mumps, quinsy, bunions, hayfever, bedsores, ringworm, floating kidney, Derbyshire neck, warts, bilious attacks, gallstones, cold feet, varicose veins. She is coated with quite a considerable layer of fat. She is dressed in a threequarter ivory gown, fringed round the hem with tasselled selvedge, and cools herself flirting a black horn fan like Minnie Hauck in Carmen. She is drowning. She is more taking then. She is not the filly that she was. She is our great sweet mother. She is quite nicey comfy without her outcast man, madame in rue Gît-le-Cœur, canary and two buck lodgers. She is right, our sister. She is right, our sister. She is the bride of darkness, a daughter of night. She jumped up and called them and she ran down the slope past him, tossing her hair behind her which had a good enough colour if there had been more of it but with all the thingamerry she was always rubbing into it she couldn’t get it to grow long because it wasn’t natural so she could just go and throw her hat at it. She keens with banshee woe. She kicked the bucket. She kissed me. She kissed me. She knew at once. She knew from the first poor little Rudy wouldn’t live. She knew he meant the monkey was sick. She knew I, I think she knew by the way she. She knew right well, no-one better, what made squinty Edy say that because of him cooling in his attentions when it was simply a lovers’ quarrel. She lapped slower, then licking the saucer clean. She laughed: —O wept! She lays eggs for us. She lay still. She leads him towards the steps, drawing him by the odour of her armpits, the vice of her painted eyes, the rustle of her slip in whose sinuous folds lurks the lion reek of all the male brutes that have possessed her. She leaned back far to look up where the fireworks were and she caught her knee in her hands so as not to fall back looking up and there was no-one to see only him and her when she revealed all her graceful beautifully shaped legs like that, supply soft and delicately rounded, and she seemed to hear the panting of his heart, his hoarse breathing, because she knew too about the passion of men like that, hotblooded, because Bertha Supple told her once in dead secret and made her swear she’d never about the gentleman lodger that was staying with them out of the Congested Districts Board that had pictures cut out of papers of those skirtdancers and highkickers and she said he used to do something not very nice that you could imagine sometimes in the bed. She leaned on the sideboard watching. —She lies laid out in stark stiffness in that secondbest bed, the mobled queen, even though you prove that a bed in those days was as rare as a motorcar is now and that its carvings were the wonder of seven parishes. She liked mignonette. She limps over to the table. She listens. She listens with big dark soft eyes. She lives in Leeson park with a grief and kickshaws, a lady of letters. She’ll be good, sir. Shells. She loathed that sort of person, the fallen women off the accommodation walk beside the Dodder that went with the soldiers and coarse men with no respect for a girl’s honour, degrading the sex and being taken up to the police station. She longed to go. She looked. She looked at him a moment, meeting his glance, and a light broke in upon her. She looked back at him, mewing. She looked fine. She loosened many a man’s thighs. She loved to read poetry and when she got a keepsake from Bertha Supple of that lovely confession album with the coralpink cover to write her thoughts in she laid it in the drawer of her toilettable which, though it did not err on the side of luxury, was scrupulously neat and clean. Shelter, for the night. Shema Israel Adonai Elohenu. Shema Israel Adonai Elohenu Adonai Echad. She might be here with a ribbon round her neck and do the other thing all the same on the sly. She might like something tasty. She mightn’t like me to come that way without letting her know. She murmurs. She must. She must have been thinking of someone else all the time. —She never let them in, he cried again through his laughter as he stamped on gaitered feet over the gravel of the path. She nobly answered: with a gentleman friend. She nodded, reddening and closing tight her lips. She often looked at them dreamily when she went there for a certain purpose and felt her own arms that were white and soft just like hers with the sleeves back and thought about those times because she had found out in Walker’s pronouncing dictionary that belonged to grandpapa Giltrap about the halcyon days what they meant. She often said she’d like to visit. She ought to. She passed a remark. She passed out with her basket and a marketnet: and Father Conmee saw the conductor help her and net and basket down: and Father Conmee thought that, as she had nearly passed the end of the penny fare, she was one of those good souls who had always to be told twice bless you, my child, that they have been absolved, pray for me. She pats him. She pats him offhandedly with velvet paws. She paws his sleeve, slobbering. She peers at his hands abruptly. Shepherd his pipe. She plops splashing out of the water. She points. She points to his forehead. She poured again a measureful and a tilly. She poured in a teacup tea, then back in the teapot tea. She poured more tea into her cup, watching it flow sideways. She praised the goodness of the milk, pouring it out. She prays. She provided: at quarter day or thereabouts if or when purchases had been made by him not for her she showed herself attentive to his necessities, anticipating his desires. She puffs calmly at her cigarette. She put an arm round the little mariner and coaxed winningly: —What’s your name? She put on her hat so that she could see from underneath the brim and swung her buckled shoe faster for her breath caught as she caught the expression in his eyes. She put on nine pounds after weaning. She puts out her hand inquisitively. She puts the potato greedily into a pocket then links his arm, cuddling him with supple warmth. She put the comether on him, sweet and twentysix. She put the first nail in his coffin. She raised a gloved hand to her hair. She raised her small gloved fist, yawned ever so gently, tiptapping her small gloved fist on her opening mouth and smiled tinily, sweetly. She raises her blackened withered right arm slowly towards Stephen’s breast with outstretched finger. She ran with long gandery strides it was a wonder she didn’t rip up her skirt at the side that was too tight on her because there was a lot of the tomboy about Cissy Caffrey and she was a forward piece whenever she thought she had a good opportunity to show off and just because she was a good runner she ran like that so that he could see all the end of her petticoat running and her skinny shanks up as far as possible. She read or had read to her his chapbooks preferring them to the Merry Wives and, loosing her nightly waters on the jordan, she thought over Hooks and Eyes for Believers’ Breeches and The most Spiritual Snuffbox to Make the Most Devout Souls Sneeze. She reclines her head, sighing. She regards it and Bloom with dumb moist lips. She relegated her hoop and skippingrope to a recess. She remembered: on the 27th anniversary of his birth she presented to him a breakfast moustachecup of imitation Crown Derby porcelain ware. She rolled downhill at Rialto bridge to tempt me with her flow of animal spirits. She rose. She rose and closed her reading, rose of Castile: fretted, forlorn, dreamily rose. She rubbed her handglass briskly on her woollen vest against her full wagging bub. She rubs sides with him. She runs to Stephen. She runs to the pianola. She rushes out. She’s a. She’s a bit imbecillic. She’s a gamey mare and no mistake. She said it would look nice over the bed. She said that he had a fair sweet death through God His goodness with masspriest to be shriven, holy housel and sick men’s oil to his limbs. She said thereto that she had seen many births of women but never was none so hard as was that woman’s birth. She saw him into and out of the world. —She’s better where she is, he said kindly. She scaled just eleven stone nine. She scribbled three figures on an envelope. She’s drunk. She seems sad. She seizes Bloom’s coattail. She seizes Florry and waltzes her. —She’s engaged for a big tour end of this month. She serves me at his beck. She set free sudden in rebound her nipped elastic garter smackwarm against her smackable a woman’s warmhosed thigh. She set the brasses jingling as she raised herself briskly, an elbow on the pillow. She settles them down quickly. She’s game. She’s going to sing at a swagger affair in the Ulster Hall, Belfast, on the twentyfifth. She, she, she. She’s his wife. She shouted in his ear the tidings. She shouts. She sidles from her newlaid egg and waddles off. She sighs. She signs with a waggling forefinger. She sings. She’s in the lying-in hospital in Holles street. She sipped distastefully her brew, hot tea, a sip, sipped, sweet tea. She sits. She sits. She’s lame! She slipped a hand into her kerchief pocket and took out the wadding and waved in reply of course without letting him and then slipped it back. —She’s making for Bullock harbour. She smelt an onion. She smiled on him. She smilesmirked supercilious wept! aren’t men?, but, lightward gliding, mild she smiled on Boylan. She’s my own true wife I haven’t seen for seven years now, sailing about. She snakes her neck, nestling. She sneers. She’s not exactly witty. She’s not here. She’s not here. She’s not nicelooking, is she? She sold lovephiltres, whitewax, orangeflower. She’s on the job herself tonight with the vet her tipster that gives her all the winners and pays for her son in Oxford. She’s passed. She’s passing now. She’s right after all. She’s singing, yes. She’s taking it all in. She stands. She’s three days bad now. She stood outside the shop in sunlight and sauntered lazily to the right. She stood still, waiting, while the man, husband, brother, like her, searched his pockets for change. She stretches up to light the cigarette over the flame, twirling it slowly, showing the brown tufts of her armpits. She’s waiting for me, I know. She swallowed a draught of tea from her cup held by nothandle and, having wiped her fingertips smartly on the blanket, began to search the text with the hairpin till she reached the word. She’s well nourished, I tell you. She swishes her huntingcrop savagely in the air. She swore to him as they mingled the salt streams of their tears that she would ever cherish his memory, that she would never forget her hero boy who went to his death with a song on his lips as if he were but going to a hurling match in Clonturk park. She’s worth ten, fifteen, more, a pound. She takes his hand. She taunts him. She tendered a coin, smiling boldly, holding her thick wrist out. She thanked me. She thinks. She thinks. She thought she understood. She thought you wanted a cheese hollandais. She too. She took a folded postcard from her handbag. She took a penknife out of her pocket And cut off his little head. She took back the card, sighing. She took his first embraces. She took no notice while he read by rote a solfa fable for her, plappering flatly: —Ah fox met ah stork. She tosses a piece. She traces lines on his hand. She trudges, schlepps, trains, drags, trascines her load. She trusts me, her hand gentle, the longlashed eyes. She turned over sleepily that time. She turns and, holding out her hands, draws him over. She turns up Bloom’s hand. She twentythree. She understands all she wants to. She understood little of political complications, internal, or balance of power, external. She used to be a tasty dresser. She used to look over some nights when Molly was in the Coffee Palace. She used to say Ben Dollard had a base barreltone voice. She wails. She walked with a certain quiet dignity characteristic of her but with care and very slowly because—because Gerty MacDowell was... She was... She was about to retort but something checked the words on her tongue. —She was a daughter of... She was a finelooking woman. She was a nice old bag of tricks. She was a womanly woman not like other flighty girls unfeminine he had known, those cyclists showing off what they hadn’t got and she just yearned to know all, to forgive all if she could make him fall in love with her, make him forget the memory of the past. She was crying in her wretched bed. She was entitled to her widow’s dower At common law. She was glad that something told her to put on the transparent stockings thinking Reggy Wylie might be out but that was far away. She was humming. She was in a soft clinging white in a studied attitude and the gentleman was in chocolate and he looked a thorough aristocrat. She was leading the field. She was no more: the trembling skeleton of a twig burnt in the fire, an odour of rosewood and wetted ashes. She wasn’t in a hurry either. She was pronounced beautiful by all who knew her though, as folks often said, she was more a Giltrap than a MacDowell. She was reading the card, propped on her elbow. —She was taken bad on the Tuesday... She was wearing her black and it had the perfume of the time before. She was wearing the blue for luck, hoping against hope, her own colour and lucky too for a bride to have a bit of blue somewhere on her because the green she wore that day week brought grief because his father brought him in to study for the intermediate exhibition and because she thought perhaps he might be out because when she was dressing that morning she nearly slipped up the old pair on her inside out and that was for luck and lovers’ meeting if you put those things on inside out or if they got untied that he was thinking about you so long as it wasn’t of a Friday. She was well primed with a good load of Delahunt’s port under her bellyband. She waved about her outspread Independent, searching, the lord lieutenant, her pinnacles of hair slowmoving, lord lieuten. She waved her scarf and cried: Huzzah! She waved, unhearing Cowley, her veil, to one departing, dear one, to wind, love, speeding sail, return. She whips it off. She whirls it back in right circle. She whirls the prize in left circle. She will drown me with her, eyes and hair. She won in a thunderstorm, Rothschild’s filly, with wadding in her ears. She wore a coquettish little love of a hat of wideleaved nigger straw contrast trimmed with an underbrim of eggblue chenille and at the side a butterfly bow of silk to tone. She would care for him with creature comforts too for Gerty was womanly wise and knew that a mere man liked that feeling of hominess. She would fain have cried to him chokingly, held out her snowy slender arms to him to come, to feel his lips laid on her white brow, the cry of a young girl’s love, a little strangled cry, wrung from her, that cry that has rung through the ages. She would follow, her dream of love, the dictates of her heart that told her he was her all in all, the only man in all the world for her for love was the master guide. She would half confess if she had not all sinned as women did. She would have given worlds to know what it was. She would make the great sacrifice. She would marry another. She would try to understand him because men were so different. She writes. Shift stuck between the cheeks behind. Shilling a bottle of stout. SHINDY IN WELLKNOWN RESTAURANT —Good day, sir, Stephen answered blushing. Shining word! Shiny peels: polishes them up with a rag or a handkerchief. Shipahoy of course had his own say to say. Shirt is synechdoche. —Shirts, Maggy said. Shitbroleeth. Shite! Shite and onions! Shiver my timbers if I had. Shoals of them every evening poured out of offices. Shoe trick. Shoot! Shoot him to bloody bits with a bang shotgun, bits man spattered walls all brass buttons. Shop closes early on Thursday. SHORT BUT TO THE POINT —Whose land? Short but yet Plain Elements of Geometry written in French by F. Ignat. Short cut home here. Short little finger. Short snooze now if I had. Short time after man presents woman with pieces of jungle meat. Should a girl tell? Shouldering their bags they trudged, the red Egyptians. Shouldering the lamp he staggers away through the crowd with his flaring cresset. Shoulders. Shoulder to the wheel. Should have put on coldcream first make it brown. —Shout! Shout a few flying syllables as they pass. Shouting in his ear. Shout salvation in King Jesus. Shouts from the open window startling evening in the quadrangle. Shouts rang shrill from the boys’ playfield and a whirring whistle. Shove ahead. Shove him a joey and grahamise. Shovelling them under by the cartload doublequick. —Show. Show! Show! —Show here, she said. Showing long red pantaloons under his skirts. Showing their teeth at one another. Show me in. Show no surprise. Shows the profound knowledge of the human heart. Shows you the money to be made out of porter. Show this gentleman the door. Show us a minute. —Show us, Joe, says I. Show us one of them cushions. —Show us over the drink, says I. Show us over those apricots, meaning peaches. Show us the entrance out. Shreds. Shrieks of dying. Shrieks of silence. Shrill shriek of laughter sprang from miss Kennedy’s throat. Shrill, with deep laughter, after, gold after bronze, they urged each each to peal after peal, ringing in changes, bronzegold, goldbronze, shrilldeep, to laughter after laughter. Shrunken skull. Shrunken uncertain hand. Shut his blurry Dutch oven with a firm hand. Shuttered, tenantless, unweeded garden. Shut the book quick. Shut up. Shut your eyes and open your mouth. Shut your eyes and see. Shut your eyes, gents. Shut your obstropolos. Shy but willing like an ass pissing. Shy, deny thy kindred, the unco guid. Shylock chimes with the jewbaiting that followed the hanging and quartering of the queen’s leech Lopez, his jew’s heart being plucked forth while the sheeny was yet alive: Hamlet and Macbeth with the coming to the throne of a Scotch philosophaster with a turn for witchroasting. Shy, supping with the godless, he sneaks the cup. Si. Side by side Bloom, profiting by the contretemps, with Stephen passed through the gap of the chains, divided by the upright, and, stepping over a strand of mire, went across towards Gardiner street lower, Stephen singing more boldly, but not loudly, the end of the ballad. —Si Dedalus’ voice, he said. Sieurs et dames, faites vos jeux! Sighing Mr Dedalus came through the saloon, a finger soothing an eyelid. Signatures of all things I am here to read, seaspawn and seawrack, the nearing tide, that rusty boot. Sign a will and leave us any coin you have! Signed: Dedalus. Sign H. They like sad tail at end. Significances of similitude, of posture, of symbolism, of circumstantial evidence, of testimonial supermanence. Sign on long o’ me. Signor Maffei, passionpale, in liontamer’s costume with diamond studs in his shirtfront, steps forward, holding a circus paperhoop, a curling carriagewhip and a revolver with which he covers the gorging boarhound. SIGNOR MAFFEI: With a sinister smile. Signs of rain it is. Signs on a white field. Silence! Silence, all. Silence all round marked the termination of his finale. Silence with a yawn or two accompanied this thrilling announcement. Silent, each contemplating the other in both mirrors of the reciprocal flesh of theirhisnothis fellowfaces. Silentium! Silently at the gravehead another coiled the coffinband. Silently, in a dream she had come to him after her death, her wasted body within its loose brown graveclothes giving off an odour of wax and rosewood, her breath, that had bent upon him, mute, reproachful, a faint odour of wetted ashes. Silent, thoughtful, alert he stands on guard, his fingers at his lips in the attitude of secret master. Silent with awe and pity I went to her bedside. Silk flash rich stockings white. Silk, mistress said! Silk of the kine! Silk of the kine and poor old woman, names given her in old times. Silly billies: mob of young cubs yelling their guts out. Silly fish learn nothing in a thousand years. Silly, isn’t it? Silly lips of that chap. Silly man! Silly-Milly burying the little dead bird in the kitchen matchbox, a daisychain and bits of broken chainies on the grave. Silly Milly’s birthday gift. Silly season. Silly superstition that about thirteen. Silver means born rich. Silverpowdered olivetrees. Silver threads among the grey. Similarly? Similarly, because actuated by a secret purpose the quest of a new male Mullingar student or of a healing herb valerian. Simnel cakes those are, stuck together: cakes for the dead. Simon Dedalus said when they put him in parliament that Parnell would come back from the grave and lead him out of the house of commons by the arm. Simon Dedalus’ son. Simon Dedalus takes him off to a tee with his eyes screwed up. Simon Dedalus’ voice hilloes in answer, somewhat sleepy but ready. SIMON: That’s all right. SIMON: Think of your mother’s people! Simple bit of paper. Simples. Simply absconded somewhere. Simply fag out there for nothing. Sinbad the Sailor and Tinbad the Tailor and Jinbad the Jailer and Whinbad the Whaler and Ninbad the Nailer and Finbad the Failer and Binbad the Bailer and Pinbad the Pailer and Minbad the Mailer and Hinbad the Hailer and Rinbad the Railer and Dinbad the Kailer and Vinbad the Quailer and Linbad the Yailer and Xinbad the Phthailer. Since Easter he had cursed three times. Since I fed the birds five minutes. Since their names were coupled, though, since he was her declared favourite, where was the particular necessity to proclaim it to the rank and file from the housetops, the fact, namely, that he had shared her bedroom which came out in the witnessbox on oath when a thrill went through the packed court literally electrifying everybody in the shape of witnesses swearing to having witnessed him on such and such a particular date in the act of scrambling out of an upstairs apartment with the assistance of a ladder in night apparel, having gained admittance in the same fashion, a fact the weeklies, addicted to the lubric a little, simply coined shoals of money out of. Since the poor old woman told us that the French were on the sea and landed at Killala. Since when, for God’ sake? Sing, birdy, sing. Singing. Singing. Singing with his eyes shut. Singing wrong words. Sing out! Sings too: Down among the dead men. Singular, communed the guest with himself, the wonderfully unequal faculty of metempsychosis possessed by them, that the puerperal dormitory and the dissecting theatre should be the seminaries of such frivolity, that the mere acquisition of academic titles should suffice to transform in a pinch of time these votaries of levity into exemplary practitioners of an art which most men anywise eminent have esteemed the noblest. Sinned against the light and even now that day is at hand when he shall come to judge the world by fire. Sinn Fein. Sinn Fein amhain! —Sinn Fein! says the citizen. Sin: Principes persecuti sunt me gratis: et a verbis tuis formidavit cor meum. Siopold! Sips of his wine soothed his palate. Sir. Sir? Sir Bob, I said... Sir Frederick Falkiner going into the freemasons’ hall. Sir Leopold heard on the upfloor cry on high and he wondered what cry that it was whether of child or woman and I marvel, said he, that it be not come or now. Sir Lout’s toys. Sir Philip Crampton’s memorial fountain bust. Sirs, take notice that by the law of torts you are bound over in your own recognisances for six months in the sum of five pounds. Sir Thomas Deane designed. Sir Thomas Deane was the Greek architecture. Sir, to you my hand. Sir Walter Ralegh brought from the new world that potato and that weed, the one a killer of pestilence by absorption, the other a poisoner of the ear, eye, heart, memory, will, understanding, all. Sir Walter Raleigh, when they arrested him, had half a million francs on his back including a pair of fancy stays. Si sang ’Twas rank and fame: in Ned Lambert’s ’twas. Sister? Sister? Sister? Sister? Sister. Sister Agatha. —Sister Mary Patrick, Maggy said. Sister souls. Sister, speak! Sister, yes. Sit around under sunshades. Sit down. —Sit down. Sit down a moment. —Sit down or by the law Harry I’ll knock you down. Sit her horse like a man. Sit tight. Sit tight there. Sitting at his side Stephen solved out the problem. Sitting at home after pig’s cheek and cabbage nursing it in the armchair. Sitting on his throne sucking red jujubes white. Sitting or kneeling you couldn’t. Sitting there after till near two taking out her hairpins. Six. Six. Six. Six and a half per cent dividend. Six and eightpence, please. Six bob. Sixpences, halfcrowns. Six sharps? Sixteenth. Sixteen years ago. Sixteen years ago he was twentytwo too. Sixteen years ago I twentytwo tumbled. Sixtyseven is a bitch. Six weeks off, however. Six years. Sizeable for threepence. Sizing me up I daresay from my hand. Sjambok him! Skeleton horses, Sceptre, Maximum the Second, Zinfandel, the Duke of Westminster’s Shotover, Repulse, the Duke of Beaufort’s Ceylon, prix de Paris. Skin breeds lice or vermin. Skinfood. Skin tanned raw. Skin-the-Goat, assuming he was he, evidently with an axe to grind, was airing his grievances in a forcible-feeble philippic anent the natural resources of Ireland or something of that sort which he described in his lengthy dissertation as the richest country bar none on the face of God’s earth, far and away superior to England, with coal in large quantities, six million pounds worth of pork exported every year, ten millions between butter and eggs and all the riches drained out of it by England levying taxes on the poor people that paid through the nose always and gobbling up the best meat in the market and a lot more surplus steam in the same vein. —Skin-the-Goat, Mr O’Madden Burke said. Skunked? Slack hour: won’t be many there. Slaking his drouth. Slander, the viper, has wrongfully accused me. Slan leath. —Slan leat, says he. Slapbang! Slattery’s mounted foot. Slaughter of innocents. Slaves Chinese wall. Sleep! Sleeping draughts. Sleeping sickness in the air. Sleep reveals the worst side of everyone, children perhaps excepted. Sleep six months out of twelve. SLEEPY HOLLOW: Rip van Wink! Slide. Slide left foot one pace back! Slieve Bloom. ’Slife, I’ll be round with you. Slightly disturbed in his sentrybox by the brazier of live coke the watcher of the corporation stones who, though now broken down and fast breaking up, was none other in stern reality than the Gumley aforesaid, now practically on the parish rates, given the temporary job by Pat Tobin in all human probability from dictates of humanity knowing him before shifted about and shuffled in his box before composing his limbs again in to the arms of Morpheus, a truly amazing piece of hard lines in its most virulent form on a fellow most respectably connected and familiarised with decent home comforts all his life who came in for a cool £ 100 a year at one time which of course the doublebarrelled ass proceeded to make general ducks and drakes of. Slight spasm, full, chewing the cud. Slily. Slipping his words deftly into the pauses of the clanking he drew swiftly on the scarred woodwork. Slips off when the fun gets too hot. Sllt. Sllt. Sllt. Slobbers his food, I suppose. Slop about in slipperslappers for fear he’d wake. Sloping into the Empire. Slower the mare went up the hill by the Rotunda, Rutland square. Slowly, note by note, oriental music is played. Slowly three times, one after another, from a full crupper he mired. Slowly, without looking back she went down the uneven strand to Cissy, to Edy to Jacky and Tommy Caffrey, to little baby Boardman. Slow music, please. Slumming. Slung her hook, she did. Smack. Smack. Smaller from want of use. Small nines. Small wages. Small whisky and bottle of Allsop. Smart. Smart Boylan bespoke potions. Smart girls writing something catch the eye at once. —Smart idea, Nosey Flynn said, snuffling. Smarts they still, sickness soothing: in twelve moons thrice an hundred. Smash a man to atoms if they got him caught. Smell almost cure you like the dentist’s doorbell. Smelling the tail end of ports. Smell of burn. Smell of grilled beefsteaks to the starving. Smells of men. Smells on all sides, bunched together. Smell that. Smell that I did. Smile. Smile. Smile Cranly’s smile. Smiled: creamfruit smell. Smiling, a jew, he heard with pleasure and saw the unbroken kitchen window. Smith O’Brien. Smoke mermaids, coolest whiff of all. Smutty Moll for a mattress jig. Snakes of river fog creep slowly. —Snapshot, eh? Snapshot photography, comparative study of religions, folklore relative to various amatory and superstitious practices, contemplation of the celestial constellations. Snip off with horsehair under the denned neck. Snivel. Snotgreen, bluesilver, rust: coloured signs. Snuffy Dr Murren. Snug little room that was with the red wallpaper. So. So. So. So! So. So. So a fellow coming in late can see what turn is on and what turns are over. So and So, wheelwright. So anyhow in came John Wyse Nolan and Lenehan with him with a face on him as long as a late breakfast. So anyhow Terry brought the three pints Joe was standing and begob the sight nearly left my eyes when I saw him land out a quid. So anyhow when I got back they were at it dingdong, John Wyse saying it was Bloom gave the ideas for Sinn Fein to Griffith to put in his paper all kinds of jerrymandering, packed juries and swindling the taxes off of the government and appointing consuls all over the world to walk about selling Irish industries. Soap feeling rather sticky behind. So as neither of them were particularly pressed for time, as it happened, and the temperature refreshing since it cleared up after the recent visitation of Jupiter Pluvius, they dandered along past by where the empty vehicle was waiting without a fare or a jarvey. So begob the citizen claps his paw on his knee and he says: —Foreign wars is the cause of it. So be off now, says he, and do all my cousin german the lord Harry tells you and take a farmer’s blessing, and with that he slapped his posteriors very soundly. Sober hearsedrivers a speciality. Sober serious man with a bit in the savingsbank I’d say. So, bevelling around by Mullett’s and the Signal House which they shortly reached, they proceeded perforce in the direction of Amiens street railway terminus, Mr Bloom being handicapped by the circumstance that one of the back buttons of his trousers had, to vary the timehonoured adage, gone the way of all buttons though, entering thoroughly into the spirit of the thing, he heroically made light of the mischance. So Bloom lets on he heard nothing and he starts talking with Joe, telling him he needn’t trouble about that little matter till the first but if he would just say a word to Mr Crawford. So Bloom slopes in with his cod’s eye on the dog and he asks Terry was Martin Cunningham there. So Bob Doran comes lurching around asking Bloom to tell Mrs Dignam he was sorry for her trouble and he was very sorry about the funeral and to tell her that he said and everyone who knew him said that there was never a truer, a finer than poor little Willy that’s dead to tell her. Sociable. Society ladies lift their skirts above their heads to protect themselves. Society over the way papa went to for the conversion of poor jews. So Cissy said it was the very last time she’d ever bring them out. Sodachapped hands. So distinct. So excited. So far as he could see he was rather pale in the face so that it occurred to him as highly advisable to get a conveyance of some description which would answer in their then condition, both of them being e.d.ed, particularly Stephen, always assuming that there was such a thing to be found. Soft day, sir John! Soft day, your honour!... Soft day, your honour! Soft eyes. Softly. Softly he sang to a dusty seascape there: A Last Farewell.
