They. —They accuse, remarked he audibly. They acted according to their lights. They advertised it. They all admired to see the foresaid riches in such dearth of money as was herebefore. They all fall to the ground. They always build one door opposite another for the wind to. They always know. They appear on a redcarpeted staircase adorned with expensive plants. They are coming, waves. They are entwined in nethermost darkness, the willer with the willed, and in an instant fiat! light shall flood the world. They are followed by the Right Honourable Joseph Hutchinson, lord mayor of Dublin, his lordship the lord mayor of Cork, their worships the mayors of Limerick, Galway, Sligo and Waterford, twentyeight Irish representative peers, sirdars, grandees and maharajahs bearing the cloth of estate, the Dublin Metropolitan Fire Brigade, the chapter of the saints of finance in their plutocratic order of precedence, the bishop of Down and Connor, His Eminence Michael cardinal Logue, archbishop of Armagh, primate of all Ireland, His Grace, the most reverend Dr William Alexander, archbishop of Armagh, primate of all Ireland, the chief rabbi, the presbyterian moderator, the heads of the baptist, anabaptist, methodist and Moravian chapels and the honorary secretary of the society of friends. They are immediately appointed to positions of high public trust in several different countries as managing directors of banks, traffic managers of railways, chairmen of limited liability companies, vicechairmen of hotel syndicates. They are in grey gauze with dark bat sleeves that flutter in the land breeze. They are lovely. They are masked, with daggered hair and bracelets of dull bells. They are not Boyl: no, M’Glade’s men. They are not even registered. They are not going to get me this innings. They are not in my dictionary. They are not to be thought away. They are out, tumultuously, off for a minute’s race, all bravely legging it, Burke’s of Denzille and Holles their ulterior goal. They are practical and are proved to be so. They are still. —They are sundered by a bodily shame so steadfast that the criminal annals of the world, stained with all other incests and bestialities, hardly record its breach. They are waiting for him now. They asked for Mulcahy from the Coombe and were told where he was buried. They believed you could be changed into a tree from grief. They believe in chance because like themselves. They believe in rod, the scourger almighty, creator of hell upon earth, and in Jacky Tar, the son of a gun, who was conceived of unholy boast, born of the fighting navy, suffered under rump and dozen, was scarified, flayed and curried, yelled like bloody hell, the third day he arose again from the bed, steered into haven, sitteth on his beamend till further orders whence he shall come to drudge for a living and be paid. They bent their silk hats in concert and Hynes inclined his ear. They blow ickylickysticky yumyum kisses. They both, it seems, had been overtaken by the rain and for all their mending their pace had taken water, as might be observed by Mr Mulligan’s smallclothes of a hodden grey which was now somewhat piebald. They broke asunder, sidling out of their benches, leaping them. They bundled their books away, pencils clacking, pages rustling. They buy the place up with gold and still they have all the gold. They buy up all the juicy ones. They call it reincarnation. They call them stupid. They came down the steps from Leahy’s terrace prudently, Frauenzimmer: and down the shelving shore flabbily, their splayed feet sinking in the silted sand. They can live on. They can’t manage men’s intervals. They can’t play it here. They caught up on the others and walked abreast. They challenged me to a sprint. They charge! They cheer. They chose a small table near the window, opposite a longfaced man whose beard and gaze hung intently down on a chessboard. They clasped and sundered, did the coupler’s will. They clasped hands loudly outside Reddy and Daughter’s. They comprised astronomical kaleidoscopes exhibiting the twelve constellations of the zodiac from Aries to Pisces, miniature mechanical orreries, arithmetical gelatine lozenges, geometrical to correspond with zoological biscuits, globemap playing balls, historically costumed dolls. They cook in soda. They could: and watch it all the way down, swallow a pin sometimes come out of the ribs years after, tour round the body changing biliary duct spleen squirting liver gastric juice coils of intestines like pipes. They could easily have big establishments whole thing quite painless out of all the taxes give every child born five quid at compound interest up to twentyone five per cent is a hundred shillings and five tiresome pounds multiply by twenty decimal system encourage people to put by money save hundred and ten and a bit twentyone years want to work it out on paper come to a tidy sum more than you think. They could invent a handsome bier with a kind of panel sliding, let it down that way. They covered their heads. They cowered under their reef of counter, waiting on footstools, crates upturned, waiting for their teas to draw. They crossed to the metal bridge and went along Wellington quay by the riverwall. They did right to put him up over a urinal: meeting of the waters. They die. They do. They don’t care. They don’t care what man looks. They don’t seem to chew it: only swallow it down. They drank cool stout. They drink in order to say or do something or cherchez la femme. —They drove his wits astray, he said, by visions of hell. They drove off towards the Loop Line bridge, her rich gloved hand on the steel grip. They drove on past Brian Boroimhe house. The year returns. The year the missus was there... THE YEWS: Mingling their boughs. THE YEWS: Murmuring. THE YEWS: Rustling. THE YEWS: Ssh! THE YEWS: Ssh! THE YEWS: Sweeping downward. THE YEWS: Their leaves whispering. THE YEWS: Their silverfoil of leaves precipitating, their skinny arms aging and swaying. They examine him curiously from under their pencilled brows and smile to his hasty bow. They exchange in amity the pass of knights of the red cross and fight duels with cavalry sabres: Wolfe Tone against Henry Grattan, Smith O’Brien against Daniel O’Connell, Michael Davitt against Isaac Butt, Justin M’Carthy against Parnell, Arthur Griffith against John Redmond, John O’Leary against Lear O’Johnny, Lord Edward Fitzgerald against Lord Gerald Fitzedward, The O’Donoghue of the Glens against The Glens of The O’Donoghue. They fade, sad phantoms: all is gone. They feel all that. They fetched high prices too, Moisel told me. —They fit well enough, Stephen answered. They floated, fell: they faded. They followed. They followed round the corner towards James Kavanagh’s winerooms. They followed the winding path down to the creek. They gazed curiously an instant and turned quickly towards a Dalkey tram. They giggle. They give him a leg up. They give two threepenny bits to the gentleman at the turnstile and begin to waddle slowly up the winding staircase, grunting, encouraging each other, afraid of the dark, panting, one asking the other have you the brawn, praising God and the Blessed Virgin, threatening to come down, peeping at the airslits. They go, they come. They grab at each other’s hair, claw at each other and spit. They grab wafers between which are wedged lumps of coral and copper snow. They had a gay old time while it lasted. They had a proverb in the Carpathians in or about the year five thousand five hundred and fifty of our era. They had no idea it was that high. They halted about the door of the mortuary chapel. They halted by the bier and the priest began to read out of his book with a fluent croak. They halted, looking towards the blunt cape of Bray Head that lay on the water like the snout of a sleeping whale. They halted while Haines surveyed the tower and said at last: —Rather bleak in wintertime, I should say. They hark him on. They have forgotten Kevin Egan, not he them. They have no. They have no mercy on that here or infanticide. They have the dimensions of your other features, that’s all. They have tucked it safe mong the bulrushes. They hide. They hold and pinion Bloom. They jingled then in the air and against the wood as he locked his desk drawer. They kick out grand. They knew: had never learned nor ever been innocent. They know it all by heart. They laughed all three. They lay, were read quickly and quickly slid, disc by disc, into the till. They lend ear. They lifted. They like buttering themselves in and out. They like it because no-one can hear. They like them sizeable. They list. They list. They listened. They looked. They looked from Trinity to the blind columned porch of the bank of Ireland where pigeons roocoocooed. They look terrible the women. They love reading about it. They lowed about her whom they knew, dewsilky cattle. They made ready to cross O’Connell street. They make him welcome. They make you kaputt, Leopoldleben. They mistrust what you tell them. They moan, passing upon the clouds, horned and capricorned, the trumpeted with the tusked, the lionmaned, the giantantlered, snouter and crawler, rodent, ruminant and pachyderm, all their moving moaning multitude, murderers of the sun. They mock to try you. They move off with slow heavy tread. They murmur together. They must be starved. They never come back. They never expected that. They never forget an appointment. They nod vigorously in agreement. They offer to come over here. They ought to. They ought to have some law to pierce the heart and make sure or an electric clock or a telephone in the coffin and some kind of a canvas airhole. —They ought to have stuck up all the women he rode himself, says little Alf. They ought to invent something to stop that. The young are old. The young gentleman, his friend, overjoyed as he was at a passage that had late befallen him, could not forbear to tell it his nearest neighbour. The young man raised his cap abruptly: the young woman abruptly bent and with slow care detached from her light skirt a clinging twig. The young man’s face grew dark. The young man shoved himself backward through the water and reached the middle of the creek in two long clean strokes. The young May moon she’s beaming, love. The young person was treated by defendant as if she were his very own daughter. The young sparks, it is true, were as full of extravagancies as overgrown children: the words of their tumultuary discussions were difficultly understood and not often nice: their testiness and outrageous mots were such that his intellects resiled from: nor were they scrupulously sensible of the proprieties though their fund of strong animal spirits spoke in their behalf. —The youngster will be all right, Martin Cunningham said, as they passed out of the Castleyard gate. The young surgeon, however, rose and begged the company to excuse his retreat as the nurse had just then informed him that he was needed in the ward. The young woman with slow care detached from her light skirt a clinging twig. The youth who could not shiver and shake. They pass. They passed Dan Lowry’s musichall where Marie Kendall, charming soubrette, smiled on them from a poster a dauby smile. They passed from behind Mr Bloom along the curbstone. They passed the main entrance of the Great Northern railway station, the starting point for Belfast, where of course all traffic was suspended at that late hour and passing the backdoor of the morgue a not very enticing locality, not to say gruesome to a degree, more especially at night ultimately gained the Dock Tavern and in due course turned into Store street, famous for its C division police station. They passed under the hugecloaked Liberator’s form. They paused at the counter. They pawed their blouses, both of black satin, two and nine a yard, waiting for their teas to draw, and two and seven. They pined in depth of ocean shadow, gold by the beerpull, bronze by maraschino, thoughtful all two. They purchase four and twenty ripe plums from a girl at the foot of Nelson’s pillar to take off the thirst of the brawn. They put on their bonnets and best clothes and take their umbrellas for fear it may come on to rain. They put the bag of plums between them and eat the plums out of it, one after another, wiping off with their handkerchiefs the plumjuice that dribbles out of their mouths and spitting the plumstones slowly out between the railings. —They’re all barbers, says he, from the black country that would hang their own fathers for five quid down and travelling expenses. They’re a mixed breed. They’re gone round to the Oval for a drink. —They’re great for the cold steel, somebody who was evidently quite in the dark said for the benefit of them all. They release him. They remind one of Don Quixote and Sancho Panza. —They’re not European, says the citizen. They’re not straight men of business either. —They’re only in the hook and eye department, Myles Crawford said. They’re so particular. They’re taught that. They rose in dark and evil days. They rustle, flutter upon his garments, alight, bright giddy flecks, silvery sequins. They saluted him and were saluted. They save up three and tenpence in a red tin letterbox moneybox. —They say a man who does it is a coward, Mr Dedalus said. They say he never put on the city marshal’s uniform since he got the job. They say I killed you, mother. They say it’s healthier. They say they used to give pauper children soup to change to protestants in the time of the potato blight. —They say we are to have a literary surprise, the quaker librarian said, friendly and earnest. They say we have forgotten it. They say you can’t taste wines with your eyes shut or a cold in the head. They say you do when you shiver in the sun. They see the roofs and argue about where the different churches are: Rathmines’ blue dome, Adam and Eve’s, saint Laurence O’Toole’s. They serpented towards his feet, curling, unfurling many crests, every ninth, breaking, plashing, from far, from farther out, waves and waves. They shake out the threepenny bits and sixpences and coax out the pennies with the blade of a knife. They shine in the dark, perhaps, the tips. They sing. —They sinned against the light, Mr Deasy said gravely. They sometimes feel what a person is. They split up in groups and scattered, saluting, towards their beats. They spread foot and mouth disease too. They stick by one another like glue. They stick to you when you’re down. They stopped. They struggled up and out: and all uncovered. They swarmed loud, uncouth about the temple, their heads thickplotting under maladroit silk hats. They take advantage. They take me for a dun, peer out from a coign of vantage. They talked seriously of mocker’s seriousness. They talk excitedly. They tell me he’s round there in Dillon’s. —They tell the story, he said, that two drunks came out here one foggy evening to look for the grave of a friend of theirs. They thereupon stopped. They think it funny. They threw young heads back, bronze gigglegold, to let freefly their laughter, screaming, your other, signals to each other, high piercing notes. They tolled the hour: loud dark iron. They took the liberty of burying him this morning anyhow. They turned to the left along Abbey street. They turned to the right, following their slow thoughts. They understand what we say better than we understand them. They used to believe you could be changed into an animal or a tree, for instance. They used to call him big Ben. They used to drive a stake of wood through his heart in the grave. They waded a little way in the water and, stooping, soused their bags and, lifting them again, waded out. They wag their beards at Bloom. They waited still, their knees jogging, till they had turned and were passing along the tramtracks. They walked on towards the gates. They want it. They want special dishes to pretend they’re. —They want to see the views of Dublin from the top of Nelson’s pillar. They wash and tub and scrub. They watched the knees, legs, boots vanish. They went down Parliament street. —They went forth to battle, Mr O’Madden Burke said greyly, but they always fell. They went past the bleak pulpit of saint Mark’s, under the railway bridge, past the Queen’s theatre: in silence. They went under. They went up the steps and under Merchants’ arch. They were about him here and there, with heads still bowed in their crimson halters, waiting for it to melt in their stomachs. They were both on the way to the boat and he tried to drown..... They were dabbling in the sand with their spades and buckets, building castles as children do, or playing with their big coloured ball, happy as the day was long. They were driven out of house and home in the black 47. They were gentlemen. They were haggling over money. —They were nature’s gentlemen, J. J. O’Molloy murmured. They were never worth a roasted fart to Ireland. They were protestants in his family and of course Gerty knew Who came first and after Him the Blessed Virgin and then Saint Joseph. They were, says Mr Stephen, and the end was that the men of the island seeing no help was toward, as the ungrate women were all of one mind, made a wherry raft, loaded themselves and their bundles of chattels on shipboard, set all masts erect, manned the yards, sprang their luff, heaved to, spread three sheets in the wind, put her head between wind and water, weighed anchor, ported her helm, ran up the jolly Roger, gave three times three, let the bullgine run, pushed off in their bumboat and put to sea to recover the main of America. They were sorted in teams and Mr Deasy came away stepping over wisps of grass with gaitered feet. They were there gathered together without distinction of social class and a most edifying spectacle it was to see in that simple fane beside the waves, after the storms of this weary world, kneeling before the feet of the immaculate, reciting the litany of Our Lady of Loreto, beseeching her to intercede for them, the old familiar words, holy Mary, holy virgin of virgins. They wheeled, flapping. They wheeled flapping weakly. They wheeled lower. They whisk black masks from raw babby faces: then, chuckling, chortling, trumming, twanging, they diddle diddle cakewalk dance away. They whisper again. They will violate the secrets of your bottom drawer. They will walk on it tonight, coming here in the dark. They would be just good friends like a big brother and sister without all that other in spite of the conventions of Society with a big ess. They would hear what counsel had to say in his stirring address to the grand jury. They wouldn’t care about the smell of it. —They wouldn’t give anything on them, she said. They wouldn’t play... Thick feet that woman has in the white stockings. Thieves rob the slain. Thigh smack. Thin bread and butter she likes in the morning. Thine heart, mine love. Thing done. Thing is if you really believe in it. Thing like that spoils the effect of a night for her. Things go on same, day after day: squads of police marching out, back: trams in, out. Think he’s that way inclined a bit. Thinking of Spain. Thinking strictly prohibited. Think in my stom. Think no more about that. Think over it. Thinks he’ll cure it with pills. Thinks he’ll win in Answers, poets’ picture puzzle. Thinks I’m a tree, so blind. Think that pugnosed driver did it out of spite. Think what it means. Think you’re escaping and run into yourself. Think you’re the only pebble on the beach? Third hint. Third time. Third time is the charm. Thirsty fox. Thirtytwo feet per second per second. Thirtytwo head over heels per second. Thirtytwo workmen, wearing rosettes, from all the counties of Ireland, under the guidance of Derwan the builder, construct the new Bloomusalem. This. This. This. This ad, you see. This black makes me sad. This book tells you how to act with all descriptive particulars. This bung’s about burst. This cemetery is a treacherous place. This dogsbody to rid of vermin. This downy skin, these soft muscles, this tender flesh. This feast of pure reason. —This for me? he asked gallantly. —This gentleman? This gratuitous contribution of a humorous character occasioned a fair amount of laughter among his entourage. This is a lonehand fight. This is for shillings. This is for sovereigns. This is midsummer madness, some ghastly joke again. This is my body. This is no place for indecent levity at the expense of an erring mortal disguised in liquor. This isn’t a brothel. This isn’t a musical peepshow. —This is real Irish cream I take it, he said with forbearance. This is the age of patent medicines. This is the appearance is on me. This is the flower in question. This is the jingle that joggled and jingled. This is the most historic spot in all Dublin. This is the postcreation. —This is the riddle, Stephen said: The cock crew, The sky was blue: The bells in heaven Were striking eleven. This is the very worst hour of the day. This meanwhile this good sister stood by the door and begged them at the reverence of Jesu our alther liege Lord to leave their wassailing for there was above one quick with child, a gentle dame, whose time hied fast. —This morning Hynes put it in of course the remains of the late Mr Patrick Dignam were removed from his residence, no 9 Newbridge Avenue, Sandymount, for interment in Glasnevin. This morning the remains of the late Mr Patrick Dignam. This movement illustrates the loaf and jug of bread or wine in Omar. This moving kidney. This owner, that. This plebeian Don Juan observed me from behind a hackney car and sent me in double envelopes an obscene photograph, such as are sold after dark on Paris boulevards, insulting to any lady. This poor hardworking man! This position. This searching ordeal. This silken purse I made out of the sow’s ear of the public. This tenebrosity of the interior, he proceeded to say, hath not been illumined by the wit of the septuagint nor so much as mentioned for the Orient from on high which brake hell’s gates visited a darkness that was foraneous. This therefore was the reason why the still comparatively young though dissolute man who now addressed Stephen was spoken of by some with facetious proclivities as Lord John Corley. This verily is that. This very church. This very instant. This very moment. This vile hypocrite, bronzed with infamy, is the white bull mentioned in the Apocalypse. This was a quandary but, bringing common sense to bear on it, evidently there was nothing for it but put a good face on the matter and foot it which they accordingly did. This was it what all that company that sat there at commons in Manse of Mothers the most lusted after and if they met with this whore Bird-in-the-Hand which was within all foul plagues, monsters and a wicked devil they would strain the last but they would make at her and know her. This was scant said but all cried with one acclaim nay, by our Virgin Mother, the wife should live and the babe to die. This was so happy a conceit that it renewed the storm of mirth and threw the whole room into the most violent agitations of delight. This way... —This way, he said, walking to the right. This weather makes you dull. This wet is very unpleasant. This will end. This wind is sweeter. This would be tantamount to a cooperation one of nature’s favourite devices between the nisus formativus of the nemasperm on the one hand and on the other a happily chosen position, succubitus felix, of the passive element. Thither of the wall the quartermile flat handicappers, M. C. Green, H. Shrift, T. M. Patey, C. Scaife, J. B. Jeffs, G. N. Morphy, F. Stevenson, C. Adderly and W. C. Huggard, started in pursuit. Thither the extremely large wains bring foison of the fields, flaskets of cauliflowers, floats of spinach, pineapple chunks, Rangoon beans, strikes of tomatoes, drums of figs, drills of Swedes, spherical potatoes and tallies of iridescent kale, York and Savoy, and trays of onions, pearls of the earth, and punnets of mushrooms and custard marrows and fat vetches and bere and rape and red green yellow brown russet sweet big bitter ripe pomellated apples and chips of strawberries and sieves of gooseberries, pulpy and pelurious, and strawberries fit for princes and raspberries from their canes. Thom’s Dublin Post Office Directory, 1886. Thos. —Those are halfcrowns, man, Corley corrected him. Those are names. —Those are nice things, says the citizen, coming over here to Ireland filling the country with bugs. Those Cinghalese lobbing about in the sun in dolce far niente, not doing a hand’s turn all day. Those crawthumpers, now that’s a good name for them, there’s always something shiftylooking about them. Those farmers are always grumbling. Those girls, those girls, Those lovely seaside girls. Those girls, those girls, those lovely seaside girls. Those girls, those lovely. Those homely recipes are often the best: strawberries for the teeth: nettles and rainwater: oatmeal they say steeped in buttermilk. Those literary etherial people they are all. Those lovely curtains. Those lovely seaside girls. Those mornings in the cattlemarket, the beasts lowing in their pens, branded sheep, flop and fall of dung, the breeders in hobnailed boots trudging through the litter, slapping a palm on a ripemeated hindquarter, there’s a prime one, unpeeled switches in their hands. Those old popes keen on music, on art and statues and pictures of all kinds. Those poor birds. Those pretty little seaside gurls. Those races are on today. THOSE SLIGHTLY RAMBUNCTIOUS FEMALES —Easy all, Myles Crawford said. Those succulent bivalves may help us and the truffles of Perigord, tubers dislodged through mister omnivorous porker, were unsurpassed in cases of nervous debility or viragitis. Those that hides knows where to find. Those today. Those two loonies mooching about. Those two sluts that night in the Coombe, linked together in the rain. Those were millions of human souls created by God in His Own likeness to whom the faith had not D.V. been brought. Those were old worldish days, loyal times in joyous townlands, old times in the barony. —Those who are married, Mr Best, douce herald, said, all save one, shall live. Those who have passed on, who have gone before, are happy too as they gaze down and smile upon the touching scene. Thoth, god of libraries, a birdgod, moonycrowned. Thou art all their daddies, Theodore. Thou art, I vow, the remarkablest progenitor barring none in this chaffering allincluding most farraginous chronicle. Thou art Peter. Though a wellpreserved man of no little stamina, if a trifle prone to baldness, there was something spurious in the cut of his jib that suggested a jail delivery and it required no violent stretch of imagination to associate such a weirdlooking specimen with the oakum and treadmill fraternity. Though he was slightly hampered by an occasional stammer and his gestures being also clumsy as it was still he did his best to explain. Though it was a warm pleasant sort of a night now yet wonderfully cool for the season considering, for sunshine after storm. Though it was no concern of theirs absolutely if he regarded her with affection, carried away by a wave of folly. —Though lost to sight, Mr Dedalus said, to memory dear. Though not an implicit believer in the lurid story narrated or the eggsniping transaction for that matter despite William Tell and the Lazarillo-Don Cesar de Bazan incident depicted in Maritana on which occasion the former’s ball passed through the latter’s hat having detected a discrepancy between his name assuming he was the person he represented himself to be and not sailing under false colours after having boxed the compass on the strict q.t. somewhere and the fictitious addressee of the missive which made him nourish some suspicions of our friend’s bona fides nevertheless it reminded him in a way of a longcherished plan he meant to one day realise some Wednesday or Saturday of travelling to London via long sea not to say that he had ever travelled extensively to any great extent but he was at heart a born adventurer though by a trick of fate he had consistently remained a landlubber except you call going to Holyhead which was his longest. Though our ages. Though palpably a radically altered man he was still a commanding figure though carelessly garbed as usual with that look of settled purpose which went a long way with the shillyshallyers till they discovered to their vast discomfiture that their idol had feet of clay after placing him upon a pedestal which she, however, was the first to perceive. Though ringweight lifting had been beyond his strength and the full circle gyration beyond his courage yet as a High school scholar he had excelled in his stable and protracted execution of the half lever movement on the parallel bars in consequence of his abnormally developed abdominal muscles. Though that halfbaked Lyons ran off at a tangent in his impetuosity to get left. Thought he had a deposit of lead in his penis. Thought he was asleep first. Though they didn’t see eye to eye in everything a certain analogy there somehow was as if both their minds were travelling, so to speak, in the one train of thought. Though they stink yet they sting. Though this sort of thing went on every other night or very near it still Stephen’s feelings got the better of him in a sense though he knew that Corley’s brandnew rigmarole on a par with the others was hardly deserving of much credence. Thought is the thought of thought. Thoughts from Spinoza maroon leather. Thought so. Thought so. Thought something was wrong by the cut of her jib. Thought that Belfast would fetch him. Though unusual in the Dublin area he knew that it was not by any means unknown for desperadoes who had next to nothing to live on to be abroad waylaying and generally terrorising peaceable pedestrians by placing a pistol at their head in some secluded spot outside the city proper, famished loiterers of the Thames embankment category they might be hanging about there or simply marauders ready to decamp with whatever boodle they could in one fell swoop at a moment’s notice, your money or your life, leaving you there to point a moral, gagged and garrotted. Thou’ll no be telling me thot, Pold veg! Thou lost one. —Thousand a year, Lambert, says Crofton or Crawford. Thousand lives lost. Thousand places of entertainment to expense your evenings with lovely ladies saling gloves and other things perhaps hers heart beerchops perfect fashionable house very eccentric where lots cocottes beautiful dressed much about princesses like are dancing cancan and walking there parisian clowneries extra foolish for bachelors foreigns the same if talking a poor english how much smart they are on things love and sensations voluptuous. Thousands every hour. Thou sawest thy America, thy lifetask, and didst charge to cover like the transpontine bison. Thou thoughtest as how thou wastest invisible. Thr... Thrash the mongrel within an inch of his life. Three. Three acres and a cow for all children of nature. Three and a half. Three and eleven she paid for those stockings in Sparrow’s of George’s street on the Tuesday, no the Monday before Easter and there wasn’t a brack on them and that was what he was looking at, transparent, and not at her insignificant ones that had neither shape nor form the cheek of her! because he had eyes in his head to see the difference for himself. Three and nine? Three and six I gave for the frame. Three bob a day, walking along the gutters, street after street. Three bob I lent him in Meagher’s. —Three cheers for De Wet! Three cheers for Ikey Mo! Three cheers for Israel. Three cheers for the sister-in-law he hawked about, three fangs in her mouth. Three days. Three days! Three days imagine groaning on a bed with a vinegared handkerchief round her forehead, her belly swollen out. Three drams of usquebaugh you drank with Dan Deasy’s ducats. Three half ones, Terry. Three holes, all women. Three hundred kicked the bucket. Three Hynes owes me. Three months’ renewal. —Three, Mr Deasy said, turning his little savingsbox about in his hand. Three newlaid gallons a day. Three nooses round me here. —Threepence, please. —Three pints, Terry, says Joe. Three pounds, thirteen and six. Three pounds three. Three pounds twelve you got, two notes, one sovereign, two crowns, if youth but knew. Three Purty Maids from School. Three score and ten, sir. Three seekers of the pure truth, Moses of Egypt, Moses Maimonides, author of More Nebukim Guide of the Perplexed and Moses Mendelssohn of such eminence that from Moses of Egypt to Moses Mendelssohn there arose none like Moses Maimonides. —Three times a day, after meals, Stephen said drily. Three times now. Three times ten. —Three twelve, he said. Three weeks. Three we have. Three years old she was in front of Molly’s dressingtable, just before we left Lombard street west. Threw herself back across the bed, screaming, kicking. Thrice happy will he be whom so amiable a creature will bless with her favours. Thrilled she listened, bending in sympathy to hear. Thrill now. Throb always without you and the throb always within. Throb, a throb, a pulsing proud erect. Throstle fluted. Through a lane of clanking drums he made his way towards Nannetti’s reading closet. Through here. Through rising fog a dragon sandstrewer, travelling at caution, slews heavily down upon him, its huge red headlight winking, its trolley hissing on the wire. Through silversilent summer air the dummy of Bloom, rolled in a mummy, rolls roteatingly from the Lion’s Head cliff into the purple waiting waters. Through spaces smaller than red globules of man’s blood they creepycrawl after Blake’s buttocks into eternity of which this vegetable world is but a shadow. Through the barbacans the shafts of light are moving ever, slowly ever as my feet are sinking, creeping duskward over the dial floor. Through the drifting fog without the gramophone blares over coughs and feetshuffling. Through the hush of air a voice sang to them, low, not rain, not leaves in murmur, like no voice of strings or reeds or whatdoyoucallthem dulcimers touching their still ears with words, still hearts of their each his remembered lives. Through the open doorway the bar squirted out whiffs of ginger, teadust, biscuitmush. Through the open window of the church the fragrant incense was wafted and with it the fragrant names of her who was conceived without stain of original sin, spiritual vessel, pray for us, honourable vessel, pray for us, vessel of singular devotion, pray for us, mystical rose. Through yerd our lord, Amen. Throwaway. Throwaway, says he. —Throwaway, says he, at twenty to one. Throw flower at his feet. —Throw him out and shut the door, the editor said. Throwing them up in the air to catch them. Throw it there. Throw them the bone. Thrust syphilis down to hell and with him those other licensed spirits. Thumbed pages: read and read. Thump. Thumping. Thumping. Thumping. Thump, thump, thump. Thunderation! Thunder in the air. Thunderstorm. Thursday. Thursday. Thursday: not a good day either for a mutton kidney at Buckley’s. Thursday, of course. Thus cornered, Stephen had to make a superhuman effort of memory to try and concentrate and remember before he could say: —They tell me on the best authority it is a simple substance and therefore incorruptible. Thus, or words to that effect, saith Zarathustra, sometime regius professor of French letters to the university of Oxtail nor breathed there ever that man to whom mankind was more beholden. Thus prevailed on to at any rate taste it Stephen lifted the heavy mug from the brown puddle it clopped out of when taken up by the handle and took a sip of the offending beverage. Thus spake Zarathustra. Thy cow’s dug was tough, what? Thy will be done. Ticking. —Tickled the old ones too, Myles Crawford said, if the God Almighty’s truth was known. Ticktacktwo wouldyousetashoe? Tide comes here. Tides, myriadislanded, within her, blood not mine, oinopa ponton, a winedark sea. Tide you over. Tie a knot on your shift. Tiens, quel petit pied! Tiens, tiens, but it is well sad, that, my faith, yes. Tight. Tight as a skullpiece a tiny hat gripped his head. Tight boots? Tight collar he’ll lose his hair. Tight, dear. Tight trou. Till Mr Right comes along, then meet once in a blue moon. Till the next time. Till then they had only exchanged glances of the most casual but now under the brim of her new hat she ventured a look at him and the face that met her gaze there in the twilight, wan and strangely drawn, seemed to her the saddest she had ever seen. Time all. Timeball on the ballastoffice is down. Time enough. Time enough. —Time enough, sir, she said, taking the coin. Time enough, understand all the ways of the world. Time enough yet. Time ever passing. Time, gents! Time going on. Time has branded them and fettered they are lodged in the room of the infinite possibilities they have ousted. Time I used to try jotting down on my cuff what she said dressing. Time makes the tune. Time of the plague. Time shocked rebounds, shock by shock. Time’s livid final flame leaps and, in the following darkness, ruin of all space, shattered glass and toppling masonry. Times of the troubles. Time someone thought about it instead of gassing about the what was it the pensive bosom of the silver effulgence. Time surely would scatter all. Time they were stopping up in the City Arms pisser Burke told me there was an old one there with a cracked loodheramaun of a nephew and Bloom trying to get the soft side of her doing the mollycoddle playing bézique to come in for a bit of the wampum in her will and not eating meat of a Friday because the old one was always thumping her craw and taking the lout out for a walk. Time to be shoving. Time to get a bath round the corner. Time to get out. Time was when those brows were not so silkily seductive. Time will be gone then. Time will come. Timing her. Tim Kelly, or Kavanagh I mean. Timothy canon Gorman, P. P.; the rev. Timothy Harrington, late thrice Lord Mayor of Dublin, imposing in mayoral scarlet, gold chain and white silk tie, confers with councillor Lorcan Sherlock, locum tenens. Timothy of the battered naggin. Tinge of purple. Tink cried to bronze in pity. Tinkling. Tink to her pity cried a diner’s bell. Tiny, her tremulous fernfoils of maidenhair. Tiny roulette planets fly from his hands. Tip. Tip. Tip. Tipping her tepping her tapping her topping her. Tips, evening dress, halfnaked ladies. —Tiptop... —Tiptop. Tiptop position for a pub. Tiptop, thanks. Tired I feel now. Tired seemingly, he ceased. Tiresome kind of a job. Tiresome shapers scraping fiddles, eye on the bowend, sawing the cello, remind you of toothache. —’Tis all that. ’Tis a merry rogue. ’Tis as cheap sitting as standing. ’Tis her ninth chick to live, I hear, and Lady day bit off her last chick’s nails that was then a twelvemonth and with other three all breastfed that died written out in a fair hand in the king’s bible. ’Tis, sure. ’Tis the hour, methinks, when the winejug, metaphorically speaking, is most grateful in Ye ancient hostelry. ’Tis the last rose of summer dollard left bloom felt wind wound round inside. ’Tis the loud laugh bespeaks the vacant mind. ’Tis time for her poor soul To get out of heaven. ’Tis time for this poor soul To go to heaven. —T is viceregal lodge. T. Maher, S. J.; the very rev. To. To aid gentleman in literary. To aid gentleman in literary work. To all whom it may concern schedule pursuant to statute showing return of number of mules and jennets exported from Ballina. To a son he speaks, the son of his soul, the prince, young Hamlet and to the son of his body, Hamnet Shakespeare, who has died in Stratford that his namesake may live for ever. To attempt my virtue! To attendance on your wife. To avoid a meeting he drew nearer to the pillars of the railway bridge. Tobaccoshopgirls. To be a shoefitter in Manfield’s was my love’s young dream, the darling joys of sweet buttonhooking, to lace up crisscrossed to kneelength the dressy kid footwear satinlined, so incredibly impossibly small, of Clyde Road ladies. To be or not to be. To be or not to be. To be printed and bound at the Druiddrum press by two designing females. To be seen and heard. To be short this passage was scarce by when Master Dixon of Mary in Eccles, goodly grinning, asked young Stephen what was the reason why he had not cided to take friar’s vows and he answered him obedience in the womb, chastity in the tomb but involuntary poverty all his days. To be sure. —To be sure, he said, remembering brightly. To be sure it was a legitimate object and beyond yea or nay did a world of good, shelters such as the present one they were in run on teetotal lines for vagrants at night, concerts, dramatic evenings and useful lectures admittance free by qualified men for the lower orders. —To be sure, poor fellow. To Bloom. To Bloom. To Bloom. To Bloom: the problems of irritability, tumescence, rigidity, reactivity, dimension, sanitariness, pilosity. To breathe. To Caesar what is Caesar’s, to God what is God’s. To catch up and walk behind her if she went slowly, behind her moving hams. —To cheer a fellow up, Martin Cunningham said. To Cissy Caffrey. To come to the point at issue. To compare the various joys we each enjoy. To conclude, while from the sister’s words he had reckoned upon a speedy delivery he was, however, it must be owned, not a little alleviated by the intelligence that the issue so auspicated after an ordeal of such duress now testified once more to the mercy as well as to the bounty of the Supreme Being. To curb this inconvenient which he concluded due to a suppression of latent heat, having advised with certain counsellors of worth and inspected into this matter, he had resolved to purchase in fee simple for ever the freehold of Lambay island from its holder, lord Talbot de Malahide, a Tory gentleman of note much in favour with our ascendancy party. To cut a long story short Bloom, grasping the situation, was the first to rise from his seat so as not to outstay their welcome having first and foremost, being as good as his word that he would foot the bill for the occasion, taken the wise precaution to unobtrusively motion to mine host as a parting shot a scarcely perceptible sign when the others were not looking to the effect that the amount due was forthcoming, making a grand total of fourpence the amount he deposited unobtrusively in four coppers, literally the last of the Mohicans, he having previously spotted on the printed pricelist for all who ran to read opposite him in unmistakable figures, coffee 2d, confectionery do, and honestly well worth twice the money once in a way, as Wetherup used to remark. To Daniel Magrane and Francis Wade in 1882 during a juvenile friendship terminated by the premature emigration of the former he had advocated during nocturnal perambulations the political theory of colonial e.g. To dare address me! Today. Today. Today. Today. Today it is. Today the bards must drink and junket. To enter or not to enter. To evening lands. —... to Flora’s lips did hie. To, fro. Together she is a poor waif, a child of shame, yours and mine and of all for a bare shilling and her luckpenny, together they hear the heavy tread of the watch as two raincaped shadows pass the new royal university. To give you the idea you are eating rumpsteak. To have brought a positive gain to others. To have sustained no positive loss. To hear. To heaven by water. To hell with the bloody brutal Sassenachs and their patois. To hell with them! To hell with them all. To hell with the pope! To her nothing already then and thenceforward was anyway able to be molestful for this chiefly felt all citizens except with proliferent mothers prosperity at all not to can be and as they had received eternity gods mortals generation to befit them her beholding, when the case was so hoving itself, parturient in vehicle thereward carrying desire immense among all one another was impelling on of her to be received into that domicile. To her, old patriarch! To himself. Toil on, labour like a very bandog and let scholarment and all Malthusiasts go hang. To improve the shining hour he wondered whether he might meet with anything approaching the same luck as Mr Philip Beaufoy if taken down in writing suppose he were to pen something out of the common groove as he fully intended doing at the rate of one guinea per column. To inaugurate a course of vocal instruction, place the residence of the instructress. To inaugurate a prearranged course of Italian instruction, place the residence of the instructed. To inaugurate a series of static, semistatic and peripatetic intellectual dialogues, places the residence of both speakers if both speakers were resident in the same place, the Ship hotel and tavern, 6 Lower Abbey street W. and E. Connery, proprietors, the National Library of Ireland, 10 Kildare street, the National Maternity Hospital, 29, 30 and 31 Holles street, a public garden, the vicinity of a place of worship, a conjunction of two or more public thoroughfares, the point of bisection of a right line drawn between their residences if both speakers were resident in different places. To keep it up. To keep it up. To keep it up. To keep it up. To knock or not to knock. To lap better, all porous holes. Told her what Spinoza says in that book of poor papa’s. Told him if he didn’t patch up the pot, Jesus, he’d kick the shite out of him. To learn French? To learn one must be humble. To look younger. To make the blind see I throw dust in their eyes. Tom and Sam Bohee, coloured coons in white duck suits, scarlet socks, upstarched Sambo chokers and large scarlet asters in their buttonholes, leap out. TOM AND SAM: There’s someone in the house with Dina There’s someone in the house, I know, There’s someone in the house with Dina Playing on the old banjo. To Martha I must write. To Master Percy Apjohn at High School in 1880 he had divulged his disbelief in the tenets of the Irish protestant church to which his father Rudolf Virag later Rudolph Bloom had been converted from the Israelitic faith and communion in 1865 by the Society for promoting Christianity among the jews subsequently abjured by him in favour of Roman catholicism at the epoch of and with a view to his matrimony in 1888. —To me! To me. To me it’s all a mockery and beastly. To me, to him, to her, you too, me, us. To mind her stops. Tom Kernan strutted in. —Tom Kernan was immense last night, he said. TOM KERNAN: You deserve it, your honour. Tommy! Tommy and Jacky vanish there, there. Tommy Caffrey scrambles to a gaslamp and, clasping, climbs in spasms. Tommy on the clay! Tommy on the clay here! Tomorrow is killing day. Tomorrow will be a week that I received... it is no use Leopold to be ... with your dear mother... that is not more to stand... to her... all for me is out... be kind to Athos, Leopold... my dear son... always... of me... das Herz... Tom Rochford... TOM ROCHFORD: A hand to his breastbone, bows. Tom Rochford followed frowning, a plaining hand on his claret waistcoat. Tom Rochford nodded and drank. Tom Rochford, robinredbreasted, in cap and breeches, jumps from his twocolumned machine. Tom Rochford said. Tom Rochford, seeing the eyes of lady Dudley fixed on him, took his thumbs quickly out of the pockets of his claret waistcoat and doffed his cap to her. Tom Rochford spilt powder from a twisted paper into the water set before him. Tom Rochford took the top disk from the pile he clasped against his claret waistcoat. Tom Rochford, winner, in athlete’s singlet and breeches, arrives at the head of the national hurdle handicap and leaps into the void. Tonguetied sons of bastards’ ghosts. Tongue when she talks like the clapper of a bellows. Tonight deftly amid wild drink and talk, to pierce the polished mail of his mind. Tonight perhaps. To no end gathered; vainly then released, forthflowing, wending back: loom of the moon. Too bad! Too dear too near to home sweet home. Too far for me to lay a hand there once or lightly. Too full for words. Too full for words. Too heady. Too hot to quarrel. Took its time in coming like herself, slow but sure. Took off her hat to show her hair. Too late. Too late. Too late box. Too late for Leah, Lily of Killarney. Too late now. Too many drugs spoil the broth. Too many in the world. Too much bone in their skulls. Too much fat on the parsnips. Too much for me now. Too much John Barleycorn. Too much mystery business in it. Too much of this. Too much trouble, first gentleman said. Too much trouble to fag up the stairs to the landing. Too poetical that about the sad. —Tooraloo, Lenehan said. Too showy. Too slow for Boylan, blazes Boylan, impatience Boylan, joggled the mare. Toothless Kinch and I, the supermen. Toothless Kinch, the superman. Too tight? Tootling. Too ugly. To ourselves... new paganism... omphalos. Top and lashers going out. To pass in repose the hours intervening between Thursday proper and Friday normal on an extemporised cubicle in the apartment immediately above the kitchen and immediately adjacent to the sleeping apartment of his host and hostess. To pour o’er sluices pouring gushes. Topping! To protect him as long as possible even in the earth. To provoke the rain. To purchase waste sandy tracts from Turkish government and plant with eucalyptus trees. To read only the black ones: round o and crooked ess. To reflect that each one who enters imagines himself to be the first to enter whereas he is always the last term of a preceding series even if the first term of a succeeding one, each imagining himself to be first, last, only and alone whereas he is neither first nor last nor only nor alone in a series originating in and repeated to infinity. To remedy which our cozening dames and damsels brought him his fodder in their apronlaps and as soon as his belly was full he would rear up on his hind quarters to show their ladyships a mystery and roar and bellow out of him in bulls’ language and they all after him. To revert to Mr Bloom who, after his first entry, had been conscious of some impudent mocks which he however had borne with as being the fruits of that age upon which it is commonly charged that it knows not pity. Torn envelope. Torn strip of envelope. Torry and Alexander last year. —To seek misfortune, was Stephen’s answer. To serve or to upbraid, whether he could not tell: but scorned to beg her favour. To shave himself. To show the understudy in the title rôle how to. To show you how he hit the paper. To smell the gentle smoke of tea, fume of the pan, sizzling butter. Tossed to fat lips his chalice, drank off his chalice tiny, sucking the last fat violet syrupy drops. Toss off a glass of brandy neat while you’d say knife. To Stephen. To Stephen: the problem of the sacerdotal integrity of Jesus circumcised 1 January, holiday of obligation to hear mass and abstain from unnecessary servile work and the problem as to whether the divine prepuce, the carnal bridal ring of the holy Roman catholic apostolic church, conserved in Calcata, were deserving of simple hyperduly or of the fourth degree of latria accorded to the abscission of such divine excrescences as hair and toenails. To tell the truth he was mean in fortunes and for the most part hankered about the coffeehouses and low taverns with crimps, ostlers, bookies, Paul’s men, runners, flatcaps, waistcoateers, ladies of the bagnio and other rogues of the game or with a chanceable catchpole or a tipstaff often at nights till broad day of whom he picked up between his sackpossets much loose gossip. To the court. To the door of the bar and diningroom came bald Pat, came bothered Pat, came Pat, waiter of Ormond. To the end of the bar to him she bore lightly the spiked and winding seahorn that he, George Lidwell, solicitor, might hear. To the High Sheriff of Dublin, Dublin. To the inexpressible grief of his. To the old dingdong again. To the right. To the second watch gaily. —To the secretary of state for war, Stephen added over his shoulder. To the voice that will shrive and oil for the grave all there is of her but her woman’s unclean loins, of man’s flesh made not in God’s likeness, the serpent’s prey. To think of him house and homeless, rooked by some landlady worse than any stepmother, was really too bad at his age. To those who create themselves wits at the cost of feminine delicacy a habit of mind which he never did hold with to them he would concede neither to bear the name nor to herit the tradition of a proper breeding: while for such that, having lost all forbearance, can lose no more, there remained the sharp antidote of experience to cause their insolency to beat a precipitate and inglorious retreat. Touch. Touch and examine shis points. Touch and go with him. Touched his sense moistened remembered. Touches the spot? Touch him for a quid, will you? Touch lightly with two index fingers. Touch me. Touch me not. Touch, touch me. Touch water. Tourists over for the show. Tourists, you know, from the isle of Man. Tour the south then. To us! Tout le monde en avant! Tout le monde en place! Towards Larry O’Rourke, in shirtsleeves in his doorway, he growled unamiably: —For England... To wash his soiled hands with a partially consumed tablet of Barrington’s lemonflavoured soap, to which paper still adhered, bought thirteen hours previously for fourpence and still unpaid for, in fresh cold neverchanging everchanging water and dry them, face and hands, in a long redbordered holland cloth passed over a wooden revolving roller. Towers, Battersby, North, MacArthur: parlour windows plastered with bills. To Wexford, we are the boys of Wexford, he would. To what inconsequent polysyllabic question of his host did the guest return a monosyllabic negative answer? To where? To which absorbing piece of intelligence echo answered why. To which cold douche referring to downfall and so on the keeper concurred but nevertheless held to his main view. To which impromptu the neverfailing Bloom replied without a moment’s hesitation, saying straight off: —To sweep the floor in the morning. To which particular boosing shed...? —To whom? To whom thus Eglinton: You mean the will. To whom young Stephen had these words following: Murmur, sirs, is eke oft among lay folk. To wipe away a tear for martyrs that want to, dying to, die. Towncrier, bumbailiff. Town traveller. To write today. To yoke me as his yokefellow, our crimes our common cause. To Zoe. To Zoe. Traces of elephantiasis have been discovered among his ascendants. Trade follows the flag. Trails off there sad in minor. Trained by kindness. Trained by owner. Trained by owner to fetch and carry, basket in mouth. Train with engine behind. Traitors swing. Tram kran kran kran. Trample the trampellers. Tramp, tramp, tramp, the boys are attitudes! parching. Trams: a car of Prescott’s dyeworks: a widow in her weeds. Trams passed one another, ingoing, outgoing, clanging. Tranquil brightness. Tranquility sudden, vast, candescent: form of forms. Tranquilla convent. Tranquilla convent. Transparent stockings, stretched to breaking point. Trapeze at Hengler’s. Travel round in front of the sun, steal a day’s march on him. Travels beyond the sea and marry money. Traversé! Treats him with scorn. Trees are they? Tremendously teapot! Trenchant exponent of Shakespeare. —Trenchant, Mr Power said laughing. Tried it. Trieste-Zurich-Paris 1914-1921 Trilling, trilling: Idolores. Trinity. Trinity medicals. Tripping and sunny like the buck himself. Tritonville road. Trombone under blowing like a grampus, between the acts, other brass chap unscrewing, emptying spittle. Troops deploy. —Trouble? Trouble for nothing. Trousers. Trousers? Trousers tight as a drum on him. Troy measure. True. True as you’re there. —True for you, Nosey Flynn said. —True for you, says Joe. True for you, says Mr Vincent cross the table, and a bullseye into the bargain, says he, and a plumper and a portlier bull, says he, never shit on shamrock. True in the larger analysis. True men. —True men like you men. Truest bedthanes they twain are, for Horne holding wariest ward. True word spoken in jest. Truffles! Trumpery insanity. Trumplee. Trust? Trust me. Try. Try a bit. Try all pockets. Trying to walk. Try it. Try it. Try it anyhow. Try it anyhow. Try it on the dog first. —Try it with the glycerine, miss Kennedy advised. Try the house opposite. Tuning up. Tup. Tup. Tup. Turbaned faces going by. Turkish. Turkish. Turks. Turma circumdet. Turma circumdet. Turn about. Turn back. Turnedup trousers. Turning green and pink decomposing. Turning, he scanned the shore south, his feet sinking again slowly in new sockets. Turning his back to the sun he bent over far to a table of rock and scribbled words. Turning into Dorset street he said freshly in greeting through the doorway: —Good day, Mr O’Rourke. Turning the curve he waved his hand. Turnkey’s daughter got him out of Richmond, off from Lusk. Turn Now On. Turn Now On. —Turn over, Stephen said quietly. Turns milk, makes fiddlestrings snap. Turn up like a bad penny. Turn up with a veil and black bag. TUTTI: Encore! Tut, tut! cries Le Fécondateur, tripping in, my friend Monsieur Moore, that most accomplished traveller I have just cracked a half bottle avec lui in a circle of the best wits of the town, is my authority that in Cape Horn, ventre biche, they have a rain that will wet through any, even the stoutest cloak. Tu veux? Twang. ’Twas ever thus. ’Twas I sent you that valentine of the dear gazelle. ’Twas murmur we did for a gallus potion would rouse a friar, I’m thinking, and he limp with leching. ’Twas the prudent member gave me the wheeze. T. Waters, C. C.; the rev. —Tweedy. Twelve. Twelve and six a week. Twelve grammes one pennyweight. —Twelve quid, Buck Mulligan said. Twenty. Twentyeight. —Twentyeight... Twentyeight double four. Twentyeight it is. Twentyeight I was. Twentyfour solicitors in that one house. Twenty past eleven. Twentyseven and six. Twentyseventh I’ll be at his grave. Twenty thousand of them died in the coffinships. Twenty to one. —Twenty to one, says Lenehan. Twentytwo years ago he sixteen fell off his hobbyhorse. Twenty years asleep in Sleepy Hollow. Twenty years he dallied there between conjugial love and its chaste delights and scortatory love and its foul pleasures. Twenty years he lived in London and, during part of that time, he drew a salary equal to that of the lord chancellor of Ireland. Twenty years of it, regret them not. Twice, in Holles street and in Ontario terrace, his daughter Millicent Milly at the ages of 6 and 8 years had uttered in sleep an exclamation of terror and had replied to the interrogations of two figures in night attire with a vacant mute expression. Twice loudly a pandybat cracks, the coffin of the pianola flies open, the bald little round jack-in-the-box head of Father Dolan springs up. Twice nought makes one. Twicreakingly analysis he corantoed off. Twig? Twilight. Twilight. Twilight. Twilight phantoms are they, yet moulded in prophetic grace of structure, slim shapely haunches, a supple tendonous neck, the meek apprehensive skull. Twilight sleep idea: queen Victoria was given that. Twining, receding, with interchanging hands the night hours link each each with arching arms in a mosaic of movements. Twittering. Twittering. Twittering the bat flew here, flew there. ’Twixt me and you Caddareesh. Two. Two. Two. Two! Two. Two about here. Two and nine. Two and nine, sir. Two and six. Two and three in silver and one and seven in coppers. —Two apples a penny! Two Ardilauns. Two bar. Two bar and a wing. Two barefoot urchins, sucking long liquorice laces, halted near him, gaping at his stump with their yellowslobbered mouths. Two bar entrance, soldiers half price. Two bridegrooms laughing heartily at each other. Two carfuls of tourists passed slowly, their women sitting fore, gripping the handrests. Two commercials that were standing fizz in Jammet’s. —Two, Corny Kelleher said. Two crossed keys here. Two cyclists, with lighted paper lanterns aswing, swim by him, grazing him, their bells rattling. Two deeds are rank in that ghost’s mind: a broken vow and the dullbrained yokel on whom her favour has declined, deceased husband’s brother. Two discs on the columns wobble, eyes of nought. —Two Dublin vestals, Stephen said, elderly and pious, have lived fifty and fiftythree years in Fumbally’s lane. Two eleven. Two fellows that would suck whisky off a sore leg. Two for a penny! Two, four, six, eight, nine. —Two, he said, strapping and stowing his pocketbook away. Two houses they have. Two in the back bench whispered. Two is company. Two kindling faces watched her bend. Two left. Two letters and a card lay on the hallfloor. Two men stood at the verge of the cliff, watching: businessman, boatman. —Two mélanges, Buck Mulligan said. Two multiplied by two divided by half is twice one. Two notes in one there. Two old Dublin women on the top of Nelson’s pillar. Two old trickies, what? Two old women fresh from their whiff of the briny trudged through Irishtown along London bridge road, one with a sanded tired umbrella, one with a midwife’s bag in which eleven cockles rolled. Twopence a pint, fourpence a quart, eightpence a gallon of porter, no, one and fourpence a gallon of porter. —Twopence each, the huckster said. —Twopence, sir, the shopgirl dared to say. Two pieces of silver he lent me. Two pink faces turned in the flare of the tiny torch. Two quills project over his ears. Two raincaped watch approach, silent, vigilant. Two raincaped watch, tall, stand in the group. Two shafts of soft daylight fell across the flagged floor from the high barbacans: and at the meeting of their rays a cloud of coalsmoke and fumes of fried grease floated, turning. Two sheets cream vellum paper one reserve two envelopes when I was in Wisdom Hely’s wise Bloom in Daly’s Henry Flower bought. Two sluts of the Coombe dance rainily by, shawled, yelling flatly. —Two stouts here. Two strings to her bow. Two strong shrill whistles answered through the calm. Two, three, Mars, that’s courage. Two together nextdoor neighbours. Two topboots jog dangling on to Dublin. Typist going up Roger Greene’s stairs two at a time to show her understandings. Ubi patria, as we learned a smattering of in our classical days in Alma Mater, vita bene. Uff! Ugh, that rat’s tail wriggling! Ugly and futile: lean neck and tangled hair and a stain of ink, a snail’s bed. Ugly: no woman thinks she is. Ulster king at arms! Umpteen millions. Uncertain in his movements. Uncertainly he waited. Unclaimed money too. Unclean job. Uncle Barney said he’d get it into the paper tonight. —Uncle Richie, really... Uncle Toby’s page for tiny tots. Un coche ensablé Louis Veuillot called Gautier’s prose. Und alle Schiffe brücken. Un demi sétier! Under an arch of triumph Bloom appears, bareheaded, in a crimson velvet mantle trimmed with ermine, bearing Saint Edward’s staff, the orb and sceptre with the dove, the curtana. Under a peartree alone patio this hour in old Madrid one side in shadow Dolores shedolores. Under a row of five coiled spring housebells a curvilinear rope, stretched between two holdfasts athwart across the recess beside the chimney pier, from which hung four smallsized square handkerchiefs folded unattached consecutively in adjacent rectangles and one pair of ladies’ grey hose with Lisle suspender tops and feet in their habitual position clamped by three erect wooden pegs two at their outer extremities and the third at their point of junction. Underconstumble? Undercutting. Underfed she looks too. Underground communication. Under it lies the womancity, nude, white, still, cool, in luxury. Under its leaf he watched through peacocktwittering lashes the southing sun. Underline imposs. Undermines the constitution. Understand animals too that way. Understanding, he shifted his tomes to his left breast and saluted the second carriage. Under their dropped lids his eyes found the tiny bow of the leather headband inside his high grade ha. Under the mistletoe. Under the obituary notices they stuck it. Under the patronage of the late Father Mathew. Under the sandwichbell lay on a bier of bread one last, one lonely, last sardine of summer. Under the umbrella appears Mrs Cunningham in Merry Widow hat and kimono gown. Under the upswelling tide he saw the writhing weeds lift languidly and sway reluctant arms, hising up their petticoats, in whispering water swaying and upturning coy silver fronds. Under Tom Kernan’s ginhot words the accompanist wove music slow. Under what guidance, following what signs? Uneatable fox. Unfallen Adam rode and not rutted. Unfortunate creature! Unfortunately, I didn’t catch the latter portion. Unfortunately threw away the programme. Unfortunate people to die like that, unprepared. Ungenitive. Unhappy woman, she has been too long and too persistently denied her legitimate prerogative to listen to his objurgations with any other feeling than the derision of the desperate. Unheeded he kept by them as they came towards the drier sand, a rag of wolf’s tongue redpanting from his jaws. Uniform. Uniform that does it. Uninvited. Union of all, jew, moslem and gentile. Universal love. Universally that person’s acumen is esteemed very little perceptive concerning whatsoever matters are being held as most profitably by mortals with sapience endowed to be studied who is ignorant of that which the most in doctrine erudite and certainly by reason of that in them high mind’s ornament deserving of veneration constantly maintain when by general consent they affirm that other circumstances being equal by no exterior splendour is the prosperity of a nation more efficaciously asserted than by the measure of how far forward may have progressed the tribute of its solicitude for that proliferent continuance which of evils the original if it be absent when fortunately present constitutes the certain sign of omnipollent nature’s incorrupted benefaction. University of life. Unlawfully watching and besetting. Unless you’re in the know. Unmack I have it. Unmarried. Unmentionable. Unpaid Pat too. Unpleasant when it stops because you never know exac. Unseen brazen highland laddies blared and drumthumped after the cortège: But though she’s a factory lass And wears no fancy clothes. Unseen, one summer eve, you kissed me in four places. Unsheathe your dagger definitions. Unsightly like a clot of phlegm. Unsmiling, he heard and saw with wonder a jew’s daughter, all dressed in green. Unsolicited testimonials for Professor Waldmann’s wonderful chest exuber. Unspeakable messages he telephoned mentally to Miss Dunn at an address in D’Olier street while he presented himself indecently to the instrument in the callbox. Unusual polysyllables of foreign origin she interpreted phonetically or by false analogy or by both: metempsychosis met him pike hoses, alias a mendacious person mentioned in sacred scripture. Unwed, unfancied, ware of wiles, they fingerponder nightly each his variorum edition of The Taming of the Shrew. Unwell in his abominable regions. Unwholesome sandflats waited to suck his treading soles, breathing upward sewage breath, a pocket of seaweed smouldered in seafire under a midden of man’s ashes. Up. U. P.? U. p .... Up! Up! Up, guards, and at them! Upholding the lid he who? gazed in the coffin coffin? at the oblique triple piano! wires. Up in the Coombe with chummies and streetwalkers and then the rest of the year sober as a judge. Up King Edward! Up like a rocket, down like a stick. Upon incertitude, upon unlikelihood. Uproar and catcalls. Upset. Up stage strode Father Cowley. —Up the Boers! Up the Boers! Up the fundament. Up the quay went Lionelleopold, naughty Henry with letter for Mady, with sweets of sin with frillies for Raoul with met him pike hoses went Poldy on. Up the soldiers! Up to fifteen or so. Up to sample or your money back. Up to the present it has done so. Up to you, matey. U. p: up. U. p: up. U. P: up. U. p: up. U. p: up. U. p: up. U. p: up. U. p: up. U. p: up. U. p: up. —U. p: up, she said. Up with her on the car: wishswish. [ 9 ] Urbane, to comfort them, the quaker librarian purred: —And we have, have we not, those priceless pages of Wilhelm Meister. Urchins shout. Uropoetic. Us come right in on your invite, see? Used to change three suits in the day. Used to get good retainers from D. and T. Fitzgerald. Useful hints to the married. Useless. Useless: can’t move. Useless pain. Useless to go back. Useless to move now. Useless words. Us too: the tie he wore, his lovely socks and turnedup trousers. Usual blarney. Usual love scrimmage. IM: a press cutting from an English weekly periodical Modern Society, subject corporal chastisement in girls’ schools: a pink ribbon which had festooned an Easter egg in the year 1899: two partly uncoiled rubber preservatives with reserve pockets, purchased by post from Box 32, P. O., Charing Cross, London, W. O., Charing Cross, London, W. C.: a press cutting of recipe for renovation of old tan boots: a 1d adhesive stamp, lavender, of the reign of Queen Victoria: a chart of the measurements of Leopold Bloom compiled before, during and after 2 months’ consecutive use of Sandow-Whiteley’s pulley exerciser men’s 15/-, athlete’s 20/- viz. chest 28 in and 29 1/2 in, biceps 9 in and 10 in, forearm 8 1/2 in and 9 in, thigh 10 in and 12 in, calf 11 in and 12 in: 1 prospectus of The Wonderworker, the world’s greatest remedy for rectal complaints, direct from Wonderworker, Coventry House, South Place, London E C, addressed erroneously to Mrs L. Bloom with brief accompanying note commencing erroneously: Dear Madam. Uwantit Combined pocket twoblade penknife with corkscrew, nailfile and pipecleaner. Vagrants and daylabourers are you called: the world trembles at our name. Vain in her heart of hearts. Vain patience to heap and hoard. Vain: very. Val Dillon. Val Dillon was lord mayor. Valise I have a particular fancy for. Valise tack again. Valuation is only twentyeight. Value 1000 sovs with 3000 sovs in specie added. Valuing himself not a little upon his elegance, being indeed a proper man of person, this talkative now applied himself to his dress with animadversions of some heat upon the sudden whimsy of the atmospherics while the company lavished their encomiums upon the project he had advanced. Vampire. Vamp of her stockings. Van. Van: breadvan delivering. Vance in High school cracking his fingerjoints, teaching. Vanilla calms or? Variously. Vaseline, sir? Vast, I allow: but vile. Vats of porter wonderful. Vegetables, forsooth, and sterile cohabitation! Vehement breath of waters amid seasnakes, rearing horses, rocks. Veils fall. Vel, I ses, if that aint a sheeny nachez, vel, I vil get misha mishinnah. Venetian masts, maypoles and festal arches spring up. Venga a trovarmi e ci pensi. Ventriloquise. Venus? Venus has twisted her lips in prayer. Venus Kallipyge. Venus Pandemos. Verdict: overdose. Vere dignum et iustum est. Verfluchte Goim! Veribest Boot Blacking. Very. Very encouraging. —Very good. —Very good. Very good for the brain. Very gratefully, with grateful appreciation, with sincere appreciative gratitude, in appreciatively grateful sincerity of regret, he declined. Very hard to bargain with that sort of a woman. —Very, he stared. —Very kind of you, says Bloom. Very large and wonderful and keeps famous time. Very like her then. Very likely. —Very much so, Nosey Flynn said. —Very much so, professor MacHugh said. Very pleased to have met you. Very possibly I shall have you slaughtered and skewered in my stables and enjoy a slice of you with crisp crackling from the baking tin basted and baked like sucking pig with rice and lemon or currant sauce. Very sad thing. Very same teeth she has. —Very smart, Mr O’Madden Burke said. Very strange about my watch. Very unpleasant. Very warm morning. Very well, thank you. Very well then, I contradict myself. Vestal virgins. Veterinary surgeons. Vibrations. Vibrations: chords those are. Vico Road, Dalkey. Victoria and Albert. Victory of outsider Throwaway recalls Derby of ’92 when Capt. Vieille ogresse with the dents jaunes. Vindictive too. Vinegar hill. Vining held that the prince was a woman. Vintage wine for them, the year marked on a dusty bottle. Vintners’ sweepstake. Violets. Virag. VIRAG: A diabolic rictus of black luminosity contracting his visage, cranes his scraggy neck forward. VIRAG: Agueshaken, profuse yellow spawn foaming over his bony epileptic lips. VIRAG: Arches his eyebrows. VIRAG: Cynically, his weasel teeth bared yellow, draws down his left eye with a finger and barks hoarsely. VIRAG: Excitedly. Virag from Hungary! VIRAG: Head askew, arches his back and hunched wingshoulders, peers at the moth out of blear bulged eyes, points a horning claw and cries. VIRAG: Heels together, bows. VIRAG: His face impassive, laughs in a rich feminine key. VIRAG: His mouth projected in hard wrinkles, eyes stonily forlornly closed, psalms in outlandish monotone. VIRAG: His tongue upcurling. Virag is going to talk about amputation. VIRAG: Not unpleasantly. VIRAG: Number two on the other hand, she of the cherry rouge and coiffeuse white, whose hair owes not a little to our tribal elixir of gopherwood, is in walking costume and tightly staysed by her sit, I should opine. VIRAG: Perfectly logical from his standpoint. VIRAG: Prompts in a pig’s whisper. Virag reaches the door in two ungainly stilthops, his tail cocked, and deftly claps sideways on the wall a pusyellow flybill, butting it with his head. VIRAG: Severely, his nose hardhumped, his side eye winking. VIRAG’S HEAD: Quack! VIRAG: Sloughing his skins, his multitudinous plumage moulting. Virag truculent, his jowl set, stares at the lamp. Virag unscrews his head in a trice and holds it under his arm. VIRAG: We can do you all brands, mild, medium and strong. VIRGILIAN, SAYS PEDAGOGUE. SOPHOMORE PLUMPS FOR OLD MAN MOSES. —Call it, wait, the professor said, opening his long lips wide to reflect. Virginia creepers. Virgins go mad in the end I suppose. Virgin should say: or fingered only. Virtuous: but occasionally they were also badtempered. Visits him here on quarter days. Visit some day. Visszontlátásra! Visszontlátásra, kedvés barátom!
