Voluble, dutiful, he led the way to all the provincial papers, a bowing dark figure following his hasty heels. Voyages in China by “Viator” recovered with brown paper, red ink title. Vulcanic lake, the dead sea: no fish, weedless, sunk deep in the earth. Vyfor you no me tell? Waaaaaaalk. Wagging his ear. Wagnerian music, though confessedly grand in its way, was a bit too heavy for Bloom and hard to follow at the first go-off but the music of Mercadante’s Huguenots, Meyerbeer’s Seven Last Words on the Cross and Mozart’s Twelfth Mass he simply revelled in, the Gloria in that being, to his mind, the acme of first class music as such, literally knocking everything else into a cocked hat. Wail, Banba, with your wind: and wail, O ocean, with your whirlwind. —Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait. Wait a minute. Wait a moment. Wait a moment. Wait a second. —Wait a shake, begged Lenehan, drinking quickly. Wait awhile. Wait awhile... —Wait awhile, Mr Dedalus said threateningly. Wait, Bantam Lyons muttered. Wait before a door sometime it will open. Wait for an opportunity. Wait for her somewhere for ever. Wait for nine months, my lad! Wait in any case till it does. Waiting always for a word of help his hand moved faithfully the unsteady symbols, a faint hue of shame flickering behind his dull skin. —Waiting for the racing special, sir, the newsboy said. Waiting, guvnor? Waiting outside pubs to bring da home. Waiting she sang. Wait, I wanted to. —Wait, said Cissy, I’ll run ask my uncle Peter over there what’s the time by his conundrum. Wait till I catch you for that. Wait till I have a few pints in me first. Wait till I’m ready. Wait till I show you. Wait till I show you. Wait till I wait. Wait till you hear him, Simon, on Ben Dollard’s singing of The Croppy Boy. Wait till you see. Wait to be wooed and won. Wait, wait. Wait: was in Thom’s. Wait while you hee. Wait while you wait. Wait while you wait. Wake no more. Waken the dead. Wake this time next year. Wake up in the dead of night and see him on the wall, hanging. Wal! Walk. Walk after him now make him awkward like those newsboys me today. Walk along a strand, strange land, come to a city gate, sentry there, old ranker too, old Tweedy’s big moustaches, leaning on a long kind of a spear. Walking about with his book and pencil here’s my head and my heels are coming till Joe Cuffe gave him the order of the boot for giving lip to a grazier. Walking beside Molly in an Eton suit. Walking by Doran’s publichouse he slid his hand between his waistcoat and trousers and, pulling aside his shirt gently, felt a slack fold of his belly. Walking down by the Tolka. Walking Mackintosh of lonely canyon. Walking to Sandycove is out of the question. Walking, you know, Ben, in the moonlight with those earthquake hats. Walk like Haines now. Walk now. Walk on him! Walk on roseleaves. Walk quietly. Walks in the moonlight by the sea. Walk, walk, walk. Wallace Bros: the bottleworks: Dodder bridge. Wallop. Wallow in it. Walls have ears. Wall, tarnation strike me! Walter squints vainly for a chair. Waltzing in Stamer street with Ignatius Gallaher on a Sunday morning, the landlady’s two hats pinned on his head. Wandered far away over all the earth, captivity to captivity, multiplying, dying, being born everywhere. Wandering Ængus I call him. Wander through awned streets. Want. Want a cool head. Want a small fortune to keep him in drinks. Want a souppot as big as the Phoenix park. Want a woman who can deliver the goods. Wanted a dog to pass the time. —Wanted for the country, Mr Power said. Wanted: Jack the Ripper. Wanted live man for spirit counter. Wanted, smart lady typist to aid gentleman in literary work. Wanted to charge me for the edge he gave it. Wanted to try that often. Want pure fresh water. Wants a wash too. Wants it real bad. Wants to cross. Wants to go out. Wants to sew on buttons for me. Wants to stamp his trademark on everything. Want to. Want to be a bull for her. Want to be careful. Want to be grownups. Want to feed well, sitting in there all the morning in the gloom kicking his heels waiting for the next please. Want to fix it up. Want to get some wind off my chest first. Want to keep her mind off it to conceive at all. Want to keep your weathereye open. Want to listen sharp. Want to make good pastry, butter, best flour, Demerara sugar, or they’d taste it with the hot tea. Want to manure the whole place over, scabby soil. Want to try in the dark to see. War! War! —War! Warbling. Warbling. Warbling. War comes on: into the army helterskelter: same fellows used to. War! cried Father Cowley. Ward for incurables there. Ward of watching in Horne’s house has told its tale in that washedout pallor. Ward Union huntsmen and huntswomen live with them, hot for a kill. Ware hawks for the chap puking. Ware Sitting Bull! Warily, Malachi whispered, preserve a druid silence. Warm. Warm beds: warm fullblooded life. Warm shoe. Warm sunshine merrying over the sea. Warmth showered gently over him, cowing his flesh. Warningly. Warranted Cohen! Warring his life long upon the contransmagnificandjewbangtantiality. Warts, bunions and pimples to make it worse. Warwickshire jesuits are tried and we have a porter’s theory of equivocation. Was Du verlachst wirst Du noch dienen. Was given milk too long. Wash and shampoo. —Was he? —Was he? Washed away. Washed in the blood of the Lamb. Was he here? Was he insulting you? Was he insulting you while me and him was having a piss? —Was he insured? Was he more convinced of the esthetic value of the spectacle? Was he oysters old fish at table perhaps he young flesh in bed no June has no ar no oysters. Was he short taken? Was he there when the father? Washing child, washing corpse. Washing her teeth. Wash off his sins of the world. Was it a celestial phenomenon? Was it a daisy? Was it goodbye? Was it the little nuns taught you to be so saucy? Was it there? —Was it you did it, Alf? says Joe. —Was Mr Boylan looking for me? —Was Mr Lidwell in today? Wasn’t he in the stationery line? —Was she? Waste of money. Waste of time. Was that just when he, she? Was that not Mrs M’Guinness? Was that so? Was that then real? Was the clown Bloom’s son? Was the guest conscious of and did he acknowledge these marks of hospitality? Was the knowledge possessed by both of each of these languages, the extinct and the revived, theoretical or practical? Was the narration otherwise unaltered by modifications? Was then she him you us since knew? Was the proposal of asylum accepted? Was there one point on which their views were equal and negative? Was the young master saying anything? Was this affirmation apprehended by Bloom? Wasting time explaining it to Flynn’s mouth. Was vast wealth acquirable through industrial channels? Was washing at her ear with her back to the fire too. Watch! Watch! Watch! Watch! Watch! Watch! Watch! Watchers tway there walk, white sisters in ward sleepless. Watch him! —Watch him, he said. —Watch him, Mr Bloom said. Watching his water. Watching is his nose pointed is his jaw sinking are the soles of his feet yellow. Watch me! Watercloset. Water cold soft. Watering cart. Waterlilies. Waterloo. Water rushed roaring through the sluices. Waters: bitter death: lost. Water to water. Wavewhite wedded words shimmering on the dim tide. Way for the parson. Way he looked that. Way he sits in to it, like one together, mutual understanding. Way in. Way out. Ways of the world. Way to catch rattlesnakes. We. We. We... Weak eyes, woman. Weak joy opened his lips. Weak squeaks of laughter are heard, weaker. Weak wasting hand on mine. We all do. Wealth of the world. We are a generous people but we must also be just. We are all in the same sweepstake, Kinch and Lynch. We are all Irish, all kings’ sons. We are all looking forward anxiously. —We are a long time waiting for that day, citizen, says Ned. We are becoming important, it seems. We are considerably out of pocket over this bally pressman johnny, this jackdaw of Rheims, who has not even been to a university. We are engaged you see, sergeant. We are getting mixed. —We are going the pace, I think, Martin Cunningham said. We are going to lough Owel on Monday with a few friends to make a scrap picnic. We are liege subjects of the catholic chivalry of Europe that foundered at Trafalgar and of the empire of the spirit, not an imperium, that went under with the Athenian fleets at Aegospotami. We are means to those small creatures within us and nature has other ends than we. We are nae fou. We are not in a beargarden nor at an Oxford rag nor is this a travesty of justice. We are not speaking so much of those delightful lovesongs with which the writer who conceals his identity under the graceful pseudonym of the Little Sweet Branch has familiarised the bookloving world but rather as a contributor D. O. C. points out in an interesting communication published by an evening contemporary of the harsher and more personal note which is found in the satirical effusions of the famous Raftery and of Donal MacConsidine to say nothing of a more modern lyrist at present very much in the public eye. We are observed. We are praying now for the repose of his soul. We are standing in the historic council chamber of saint Mary’s abbey where silken Thomas proclaimed himself a rebel in 1534. We are stonecold and pure. We are the boys. We are the fat. We are their harps. We are the last. We are the last. Wear out my welcome. Wear the heart out of a stone, that. Weary? Weary they curchycurchy under veils. Weary too in sight of lovers, lascivious men, a naked woman shining in her courts, she draws a toil of waters. Weathercocks. Weave, weaver of the wind. We begin to be interested in Mrs S. Till now we had thought of her, if at all, as a patient Griselda, a Penelope stayathome. We brought them in. We call it black. —We can all supply mental pabulum, Mr O’Madden Burke said. —We can do that, he said. —We can do that, the foreman said. —We can drink it black, Stephen said thirstily. We can see from farther up. We can’t wait. We charge! We come to bury Cæsar. Weda seca whokilla farst. We did great biz yesterday. We didn’t hear. We don’t want any of your medieval abstrusiosities. We don’t want any scandal, you understand. We drive them headlong! We eat electric light. We enjoyed ourselves immensely. Weeny bones. Weeping willow. —Weep no more, Comyn said. Weep not for me, O daughters of Erin. We fall. We feel in England. We feel in England that we have treated you rather unfairly. We fought for the royal Stuarts that reneged us against the Williamites and they betrayed us. We fought for you in South Africa, Irish missile troops. We gave him that idea, he added to J. J. O’Molloy. We gave our best blood to France and Spain, the wild geese. We gave shade on languorous summer days. We give it up. We grew by Poulaphouca waterfall. We had a midnight lunch too after all the jollification and when we sallied forth it was blue o’clock the morning after the night before. —We had better look a little serious, Martin Cunningham said. We had better pay her, Mulligan, hadn’t we? We had our trade with Spain and the French and with the Flemings before those mongrels were pupped, Spanish ale in Galway, the winebark on the winedark waterway. We had to. We had to search all Holles street to find them till the chap in Keogh’s gave us the number. We hand you crisp five pound note. —We have all been there, Martin Cunningham said broadly. We have certainly... We have come here to witness a clean straight fight and we heartily wish both men the best of good luck. We have committed many errors and many sins. We have grown out of Wilde and paradoxes. We have here damning evidence, the corpus delicti, my lord, a specimen of my maturer work disfigured by the hallmark of the beast. We have him. We have King Lear: and it is immortal. We have met. We have met before. We have nothing in the house but backache pills. We haven’t got the chance of a snowball in hell. We have our greater Ireland beyond the sea. We have our meeting. We have so much correspondence. We have time. We heard the piano. We hereby nominate our faithful charger Copula Felix hereditary Grand Vizier and announce that we have this day repudiated our former spouse and have bestowed our royal hand upon the princess Selene, the splendour of night. Weighing them up perhaps to see which will go next. Weighs on his mind. Weightcarrying huntress. Weight for age. Weight off their mind. Weight or size of it, something blacker than the dark. We immortals, as you saw today, have not such a place and no hair there either. —We know him, says the citizen. We know nothing but that he lived and suffered. We know that in the castle. —We know those canters, says he, preaching and picking your pocket. We know what put English gold in his pocket. Welcome as the flowers in May. We learned that from them. We let them come in. Well? —Well? Well? Well? —Well. Well? Well... Well... Well. Well? Well and what’s cheese? Well, aren’t they? —We’ll be choked, Buck Mulligan said. We’ll bury you in our shrubbery jakes where you’ll be dead and dirty with old Cuck Cohen, my stepnephew I married, the bloody old gouty procurator and sodomite with a crick in his neck, and my other ten or eleven husbands, whatever the buggers’ names were, suffocated in the one cesspool. Well but that fellow would lose his job then? Well but then another fellow would get a job making the new invention? Well, by the living God, you’ll get the surprise of your life now, believe me, the most unmerciful hiding a man ever bargained for. Well cocks and lions do the same and stags. Wellcut frockcoat. Well, doc? Well done, thou good and faithful servant! Well educated. Well for you, you muff, if you had that weapon with knobs and lumps and warts all over it. —Well, get it into the evening edition, councillor, Hynes said. —Well, glad to see you looking fit, he said. Well, God is good, sir. —Well, good health, Jack, says Ned. —We’ll hang Joe Chamberlain on a sourapple tree. Well has it been said that whosoever prays to her with faith and constancy can never be lost or cast away: and fitly is she too a haven of refuge for the afflicted because of the seven dolours which transpierced her own heart. We’ll have a glorious drunk to astonish the druidy druids. —Well, he’s going off by the mailboat, says Joe, tonight. —Well, his uncle was a jew, says he. Well, I am here now. Well, if he couldn’t remember the dayfather’s name that he sees every day. Well: if the father who has not a son be not a father can the son who has not a father be a son? Well, I have. Well, I’ll shove along. —Well, I mean it, Haines said, still speaking to Stephen. Well, I must be. —Well, in that case, he said, I don’t see why you should expect payment for it since you don’t believe it yourself. Well, it is a long rest. —Well, it’s a fact, says John Wyse. Well, it’s a sea. Well it’s God’s acre for them. Well, it’s like a company idea, you see. Well, it’s seven mornings a pint at twopence is seven twos is a shilling and twopence over and these three mornings a quart at fourpence is three quarts is a shilling. Well, it was in the papers about Antichrist. —Well, J. J. O’Molloy said, Bushe K.C., for example. —Well, Joe, says I, your very good health and song. —Well, let me see if you can post a letter, Father Conmee said. Well, let us hear of it, good my friend, said Mr Dixon. Wellmannered fellow. We’ll manure you, Mr Flower! Wellmeaning old man. Well, meet him. Well met they were, said Master Dixon, joyed, but, harkee, young sir, better were they named Beau Mount and Lecher for, by my troth, of such a mingling much might come. —Well, Mr Bloom said, his eyes returning, if I can get the design I suppose it’s worth a short par. Well, my fault perhaps. We’ll never meet again. —Well no, Mr Bloom said. Well, now! —Well now, he mused, whatever you say yourself. —Well now I am, he mused. Well now, look at that. Well observed and those pannier pockets of the skirt and slightly pegtop effect are devised to suggest bunchiness of hip. Well of all the. Well, of course, if we knew all the things. Well, of course that’s what gives him the base barreltone. Well, of course, where there’s money going there’s always someone to pick it up. Welloff people, proud that their eldest son was in the navy. Well out of that ruck I am. —We’ll owe twopence, he said. We’ll paralyse Europe as Ignatius Gallaher used to say when he was on the shaughraun, doing billiardmarking in the Clarence. Well, perhaps it was best for him. Well preserved fat corpse, gentleman, epicure, invaluable for fruit garden. We’ll put a barleystraw in that Judas Iscariot’s ear this time. —We’ll put force against force, says the citizen. Wellread fellow. —Well, says J. J., if they’re any worse than those Belgians in the Congo Free State they must be bad. —Well, says J. J. We have Edward the peacemaker now. —Well, says John Wyse. —Well, says Martin, rapping for his glass. —Well, says the citizen, what’s the latest from the scene of action? —We’ll see you again, Haines said, turning as Stephen walked up the path and smiling at wild Irish. —Well, sir, he began. Well, sir, the husband took him by the throat. Well: slainte! Well, so it is. Well, so long. Well sung. —Well, that’s a point, says Bloom, for the wife’s admirers. Well the foreskin is not back. Well then Friday buried him. Well then, permit me to draw your attention to item number three. —Well, there’s something in that, Mr Dedalus granted. —Well, there were two children born anyhow, says Jack Power. Well, the voice, yes: gramophone. —Well, they’re still waiting for their redeemer, says Martin. Well tinned in there. Well, tolloll. Wellturned foot. Well up: it splashed yellow near his boot. Well, well. Well, well. Well, well. Well, what are you gaping at? —Well, what is it? he said, stopping. —Well, what’ll it be? Well worth the half sovereign I gave Neary for it. Well, yes: Bushe, yes. Well, you can do that and just a little par calling attention. Welsh, were they not? Welts of flesh behind on him. Welt them through life, then wallop after death. We medical men. We must be quick. We must go to Athens. We mustn’t be led away by words, by sounds of words. We must take a charitable view of it. We never speak as we pass by. Went out in a puff. Went too far last time. We obey them in the grave. We ought to have hats modelled on our heads. We’re all in a cart. —We’re always tired in the morning, Stephen said to Haines. We’re going. We’re in the archdiocese here. We’re nae tha fou. We’re nae tha fou. —We’re off again. We’re on the right lay, Bob, believe you me. Were other anapocryphal illustrious sons of the law and children of a selected or rejected race mentioned? We’re safe. We’re square. —We’re stopped. Were their views on some points divergent? Were there marks of hospitality which he contemplated but suppressed, reserving them for another and for himself on future occasions to complete the act begun? Were there no means still remaining to him to achieve the rejuvenation which these reminiscences divulged to a younger companion rendered the more desirable? Were there obverse meditations of involution increasingly less vast? Were there schemes of wider scope? Were there testimonials? We’re the same. Were these inventions principally intended for an improved scheme of kindergarten? Were they indefinitely inactive? Were those nightclouds there all the time? Were those two buttons of my waistcoat open all the time? Were you brushing the cobwebs off a few quims? Were you in a funk? Were you in the Scotch house now? —Were you robbing the poorbox, Joe? says I. —Were you round at the court? says Joe. Werf those eykes to footboden, big grand porcos of johnyellows todos covered of gravy! WE SEE THE CANVASSER AT WORK Mr Bloom laid his cutting on Mr Nannetti’s desk. We serve them. —We shall see you tonight, John Eglinton said. We should not now combine a Norse saga with an excerpt from a novel by George Meredith. We started singing glees and duets: Lo, the early beam of morning. We subjoin a specimen which has been rendered into English by an eminent scholar whose name for the moment we are not at liberty to disclose though we believe that our readers will find the topical allusion rather more than an indication. Wet bright bills for next week. We thank you from our heart, John, for this right royal welcome to green Erin, the promised land of our common ancestors. Wetherup always said that. We think of Rome, imperial, imperious, imperative. —We thought you were someone else. Wet night in the lane. We two. We two, she said, will seek the kips where shady Mary is. We two the last. We walk through ourselves, meeting robbers, ghosts, giants, old men, young men, wives, widows, brothers-in-love, but always meeting ourselves. We want no more strangers in our house. —We want to hear more, John Eglinton decided with Mr Best’s approval. We was chased by pirates one voyage. We went over to their playbox, Haines and I, the plumbers’ hall. We were in Lombard street west. We were never loyal to the successful. We were often as bad ourselves, ay or worse. We were very pleased, we others. We were weak, therefore worthless. We won every time! Whacking a carpet on the clothesline. Wha gev ye thon colt? Whale with a harpoon hairpin, alligator tickle the small of his back and he sees the joke, chalk a circle for a rooster, tiger my eagle eye. What about that, eh? —What about that leader this evening? professor MacHugh asked, coming to the editor and laying a firm hand on his shoulder. What additional attractions might the grounds contain? What additional didactic counsels did he similarly repress? What advance on two bob, gentlemen? What advantages attended shaving by night? What advantages were possessed by an occupied, as distinct from an unoccupied bed? —What age is he? queried one hearer who, by the way, seen from the side, bore a distant resemblance to Henry Campbell, the townclerk, away from the carking cares of office, unwashed of course and in a seedy getup and a strong suspicion of nosepaint about the nasal appendage. What impeded Bloom from giving Stephen counsels of hygiene and prophylactic to which should be added suggestions concerning a preliminary wetting of the head and contraction of the muscles with rapid splashing of the face and neck and thoracic and epigastric region in case of sea or river bathing, the parts of the human anatomy most sensitive to cold being the nape, stomach and thenar or sole of foot? When all is said Dumas fils or is it Dumas père? is right. Whence, disappearing from the constellation of the Northern Crown he would somehow reappear reborn above delta in the constellation of Cassiopeia and after incalculable eons of peregrination return an estranged avenger, a wreaker of justice on malefactors, a dark crusader, a sleeper awakened, with financial resources by supposition surpassing those of Rothschild or the silver king. When citybound frequent connection by train or tram from their respective intermediate station or terminal. When Conmee had passed she glanced at her lovely echo in that little mirror she carries. When coopfattened their livers reach an elephantine size. When first he saw. When first he saw that form endearing? When first I saw... —When first I saw that form endearing... When first they saw, lost Richie Poldy, mercy of beauty, heard from a person wouldn’t expect it in the least, her first merciful lovesoft oftloved word. When for Irelandear. When he had betaken himself to the women’s apartment to assist at the prescribed ceremony of the afterbirth in the presence of the secretary of state for domestic affairs and the members of the privy council, silent in unanimous exhaustion and approbation the delegates, chafing under the length and solemnity of their vigil and hoping that the joyful occurrence would palliate a licence which the simultaneous absence of abigail and obstetrician rendered the easier, broke out at once into a strife of tongues. When he had reached the schoolhouse voices again contending called to him. When in doubt persecute Bloom. When I put my face into it in the basin at Clongowes. When I said to Molly the man at the corner of Cuffe street was goodlooking, thought she might like, twigged at once he had a false arm. When is it? —When is long John going to hang that fellow in Mountjoy? says Joe. When, lo, there came about them all a great brightness and they beheld the chariot wherein He stood ascend to heaven. When love absorbs. When love absorbs my ardent soul. When my country takes her place among. When my country takes her place among the nations of the earth, then, and not till then, let my epitaph be written. When night hides her body’s flaws calling under her brown shawl from an archway where dogs have mired. When one reads these strange pages of one long gone one feels that one is at one with one who once... When Rutlandbaconsouthamptonshakespeare or another poet of the same name in the comedy of errors wrote Hamlet he was not the father of his own son merely but, being no more a son, he was and felt himself the father of all his race, the father of his own grandfather, the father of his unborn grandson who, by the same token, never was born, for nature, as Mr Magee understands her, abhors perfection. When she had gone he said, laughing: —We call it D.B.C. because they have damn bad cakes. When she lays her egg she is so glad. When she leaned back, felt an ache at the butt of my tongue. When the angel’s book comes to be opened if aught that the pensive bosom has inaugurated of soultransfigured and of soultransfiguring deserves to live I say accord the prisoner at the bar the sacred benefit of the doubt. When, then? When the sound of his boots had ceased Davy Byrne said from his book: —What is this he is? —When they have eaten the brawn and the bread and wiped their twenty fingers in the paper the bread was wrapped in they go nearer to the railings. When three it’s night. When was it I got it made up last? When was it not Atkinson his card I have somewhere. When we hid behind the tree at Crumlin. When we left Lombard street west something changed. When We Were Boys by William O’Brien M. P. green cloth, slightly faded, envelope bookmark at p. When we were hard up I washed them to save the laundry bill. When will I hear the joke? When will we meet? When you come out without your gun. When you feel like that you often meet what you feel. When you have lived as long as I have. When you hold out the fork. When you look back on it all now in a kind of retrospective arrangement. When you saw all the secrets of my bottom drawer. When you think of them all it does seem a waste of wood. When you took your seat with womanish care, lifting your billowy flounces, on the smoothworn throne. When you two begin... Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where? Where are our missing twenty millions of Irish should be here today instead of four, our lost tribes? Where are the Greek merchants that came through the pillars of Hercules, the Gibraltar now grabbed by the foe of mankind, with gold and Tyrian purple to sell in Wexford at the fair of Carmen? Where are the other two gone? Where are they? Where are those blasted keys? —Where are we? Where are we? Where are we going? Where are you from? Where are you now? Where are you off to? Where are your wits? Whereas. Whereas Leopold Bloom of no fixed abode is a wellknown dynamitard, forger, bigamist, bawd and cuckold and a public nuisance to the citizens of Dublin and whereas at this commission of assizes the most honourable... Whereas no photo could because it simply wasn’t art in a word. Whereas the simple fact of the case was it was simply a case of the husband not being up to the scratch, with nothing in common between them beyond the name, and then a real man arriving on the scene, strong to the verge of weakness, falling a victim to her siren charms and forgetting home ties, the usual sequel, to bask in the loved one’s smiles. Whereat Crotthers of Alba Longa sang young Malachi’s praise of that beast the unicorn how once in the millennium he cometh by his horn, the other all this while, pricked forward with their jibes wherewith they did malice him, witnessing all and several by saint Foutinus his engines that he was able to do any manner of thing that lay in man to do. Whereat he handed round to the company a set of pasteboard cards which he had had printed that day at Mr Quinnell’s bearing a legend printed in fair italics: Mr Malachi Mulligan. Where bronze from anear? Where Cranly led me to get rich quick, hunting his winners among the mudsplashed brakes, amid the bawls of bookies on their pitches and reek of the canteen, over the motley slush. Where did I? Where did I? Where did I put her letter after I read it in the bath? Where did I put the letter? Where did they get the plums? —Where did you get it? Where did you launch it from? —Where did you try? Where does he hang out? Where does he live at present? Where do they get that? Where do they get the money? —Where do you begin in this? —Where do you find a pressman like that now, eh? the editor cried. Where dreamy creamy gull waves o’er the waters dull. Where eat? Where fallen archangels flung the stars of their brows. Where? gold asked more eagerly. Where gold from afar? Where had previous intimations of the result, effected or projected, been received by him? Where has he disappeared to? Where have you a man now at the bar like those fellows, like Whiteside, like Isaac Butt, like silvertongued O’Hagan. Where hoofs? Where I come in. Wherein, O wretched company, were ye all deceived for that was the voice of the god that was in a very grievous rage that he would presently lift his arm up and spill their souls for their abuses and their spillings done by them contrariwise to his word which forth to bring brenningly biddeth. Where I saw his brillantined hair just when I was. —Where is he? Where is he? Where is he? Where is he now? Where is he now? —Where is he? says Lenehan. Where is his guncase? Where is it? Where is my hat, by the way? Where is now that gratitude which loyalty should have counselled? Where is poor dear Arius to try conclusions? Where is she? Where is that child’s funeral disappeared to? Where is that Parsee tower of silence? —Where is that? the professor asked. Where is the justice being born that way? Where is the spirituality? Where is this? Where is your brother? Where it took place. Where now? Where off to? Where old Mrs Riordan died. Where Pat Kinsella had his Harp theatre before Whitbred ran the Queen’s. —Where? says Alf. Where’s Dilly? Where Skin-the-Goat drove the car. Where’s Monks? Where’s my augur’s rod? Where’s my hat? Where’s my hat. Where’s my pipe, by the way? Where’s old Tweedy’s regiment? Where’s Punch? Where’s that bleeding awfur? Where’s that Goddamned cursed ashtray? Where’s the archbishop’s letter? Where’s the bloody house? Where’s the buck and Namby Amby? Where’s the red carpet spread? Where’s the sugar? Where’s the ten shillings I gave you on Monday? Where’s the third person of the Blessed Trinity? Where’s what’s his name? Where’s your configuration? Where’s your curly teapot gone to or who docked it on you, cockyolly? Where the bugger is it? Where the deuce did he pop out of? Where the foreleg of King Billy’s horse pawed the air Mrs Breen plucked her hastening husband back from under the hoofs of the outriders. Where the Henry Nevil’s sawbones and ole clo? Where then? —Where there is a reconciliation, Stephen said, there must have been first a sundering. Whereto? Wherever they gather they eat up the nation’s vital strength. Where was Moses when the candle went out? Where was that? Where was that ad some Birmingham firm the luminous crucifix. —Where was that, Myles? Where was the chap I saw in that picture somewhere? Where was the marshal, he wanted to know, to keep order in the council chamber. Where we. Where were the several members of the company which with Bloom that day at the bidding of that peal had travelled from Sandymount in the south to Glasnevin in the north? Where were they now? —Where would I get money? Where would you find anywhere the like of Irish bacon? Where you can live well, the sense is, if you work. Where you slep las nigh? Whether on the scaffold high. Whether on the scaffold high. Whether these be sins or virtues old Nobodaddy will tell us at doomsday leet. Whetstone! Whew! Whew! Whew! Which? Which. —Which air is that? asked Leopold Bloom. Which auction rooms?... Which domestic problem as much as, if not more than, any other frequently engaged his mind? Which end is his head? Which event or person emerged as the salient point of his narration? Which example did he adduce to induce Stephen to deduce that originality, though producing its own reward, does not invariably conduce to success? Which hearing young Stephen was a marvellous glad man and he averred that he who stealeth from the poor lendeth to the Lord for he was of a wild manner when he was drunken and that he was now in that taking it appeared eftsoons. Which is which? —Which of the two, Stephen asked, would have banished me from his commonwealth? Which of us did not feel his flesh creep! Which of you was playing the dead march from Saul? Which preferably? Which seemed to the host to be the predominant qualities of his guest? Which side is your knowledge bump? Which side will she get up? —Which they accordingly did do, Lenehan said. Which various features of the constellations were in turn considered? Which volume was the largest in bulk? Which was the occasion, says Mr Vincent, of the composing by a boatswain of that rollicking chanty: —Pope Peter’s but a pissabed. —Which will? gagged sweetly Buck Mulligan. While allowing him his individual opinions as everyman the keeper added he cared nothing for any empire, ours or his, and considered no Irishman worthy of his salt that served it. While big Ben Dollard talked with Simon Dedalus, lighting, who nodded as he smoked, who smoked. While Goulding talked of Barraclough’s voice production, while Tom Kernan, harking back in a retrospective sort of arrangement talked to listening Father Cowley, who played a voluntary, who nodded as he played. While he unwrapped the kidney the cat mewed hungrily against him. While he waited in Temple bar M’Coy dodged a banana peel with gentle pushes of his toe from the path to the gutter. While he was in the act of getting his bearings Mr Bloom who noticed when he stood up that he had two flasks of presumably ship’s rum sticking one out of each pocket for the private consumption of his burning interior, saw him produce a bottle and uncork it or unscrew and, applying its nozzle to his lips, take a good old delectable swig out of it with a gurgling noise. While his eyes still read blandly he took off his hat quietly inhaling his hairoil and sent his right hand with slow grace over his brow and hair. While Mr Bloom stood weighing the point and about to smile he strode on jerkily. While the kettle is boiling. While the other was reading it on page two Boom to give him for the nonce his new misnomer whiled away a few odd leisure moments in fits and starts with the account of the third event at Ascot on page three, his side. While the postmistress searched a pigeonhole he gazed at the recruiting poster with soldiers of all arms on parade: and held the tip of his baton against his nostrils, smelling freshprinted rag paper. While you wait if you wait he will wait while you wait. Whilst speaking he produced a dangerouslooking claspknife quite in keeping with his character and held it in the striking position. Whisky and water on the brain. Whisper. Whisper. Whisper. Whisper. Whispered kisses are heard in all the wood. Whispering around you. Whispering gallery walls have ears. Whispering lovewords murmur, liplapping loudly, poppysmic plopslop. Whisper, who the sooty hell’s the johnny in the black duds? Whistle brings rain they say. Whistles call and answer. White. White breast of the dim sea. Whitehatted chef like a rabbi. White horses with white frontlet plumes came round the Rotunda corner, galloping. Whitehot passion was in that face, passion silent as the grave, and it had made her his. White missionary too salty. White slip of paper. White thy fambles, red thy gan And thy quarrons dainty is. White thy fambles, red thy gan And thy quarrons dainty is. White yoghin of the gods. Whither away? Who? —Who? —Who? Who? —Who? Who? Who? Whoa! Whoa, my jewel! Who are. —Who are the letters for? —Who are you laughing at? says Bob Doran. —Who are you laughing at? says Bob Doran. Who ate or something the somethings of the reverend Mr MacTrigger. Who ate them? Who booed Joe Chamberlain? Who brought me into this world lies there, bronzelidded, under few cheap flowers. Who came to Poulaphouca with the High School excursion? —Who can answer a riddle? Who can say? Who chose this face for me? Who Cleopatra, fleshpot of Egypt, and Cressid and Venus are we may guess. Who comes through Michan’s land, bedight in sable armour? Who could count them? Who could know the truth? Who departed this life. Who did you learn that from? Who distilled first? Who drank more quickly? Who... drive... Who ever anywhere will read these written words? Whoever embarked on a policy of the sort, he said, and ventilated the matter thoroughly would confer a lasting boon on everybody concerned. Who fears to speak of nineteen four? Who found them out? Who gave it to you? Who had pity for you when you were sad among the strangers? Who had the? —Who has not? Who has passed here before me? Who has the most matches? Who has the organ here I wonder? Who has twopence? Who have you now like John Philpot Curran? Who helps to believe? —Who is he if it’s a fair question? Who is it? —Who is Junius? says J. J. —We don’t want him, says Crofter the Orangeman or presbyterian. Who is King Hamlet? Who is my neighbour? —Who is that? Who is that beside them? —Who is that chap behind with Tom Kernan? Who is the father of any son that any son should love him or he any son? Who is the ghost from limbo patrum, returning to the world that has forgotten him? —Who is the long fellow running for the mayoralty, Alf? says Joe. Who is this she was like? Who is this was telling me? Who is this wrote? Who kicked the bucket. Who knows? Who knows? —Who knows? he said. Who knows is that true about the woman he keeps? Who knows what they’re always flying for. Whole earnest. Who left his nutquesting classmates to seek our shade? Whole place gone to hell. Whole route, see? Wholesale burners and Dutch oven dealers. Who lives there? Who’ll dance? Who’ll hang Judas Iscariot? Who’ll read the book? —Who made those allegations? says Alf. —Who may he be? —Who may he be? he asked. —Whom do you suspect? he challenged. Whom were you trying to walk like? Who now exactly gave them he wondered or where was or did he buy. Whooping cough they say it cures. Who owns the bleeding tyke? Who passed away. Who profaned our silent shade? Whores in Turkish graveyards. Whores screech. Whorusalaminyourhighhohhhh... Who said four? Who’s astanding this here do? —Who? says Bloom. —Who? says I. —Who? says I. —Who? says I. —Who? says Joe. Who’s behind me? —Who’s dead? says Bob Doran. Who’s dead, when and what did he die of? Who’s dear Gerald? —Whose admirers? says Joe. —Whose God? says the citizen. Whose mother is beastly dead. Whose smile upon each feature plays with such and such replete. Who’s getting it up? Who’s getting it up? Who’s he when he’s at home? Who’s hindering you? Who’s in the corner? Who’s in the... peepofgold? Who’s making love to my sweeties? Who’s moth moth? Who’s paying here? Who’s riding her? —Who’s standing? Who’s talking about...? —Who’s that? Who’s that with you? —Who’s the best troops in the army? the grizzled old veteran irately interrogated. Who’s the old ballocks you were talking to? Who’s there?... Who’s to pay for that? Who supposes it? Who taught you palmistry? Who the deuce scrawled all over those walls with matches? —Who? the editor asked. Who the girls in The Tempest, in Pericles, in Winter’s Tale are we know. —Who? the other, whose hand by the way was hurt, said. —Who? the professor said, turning. Who to clear it? Who tore it? Who to unbelieve? —Who tried the case? says Joe. Who, upon his offer, thanked him very heartily, though preserving his proper distance, and replied that he was come there about a lady, now an inmate of Horne’s house, that was in an interesting condition, poor body, from woman’s woe and here he fetched a deep sigh to know if her happiness had yet taken place. Who wander through the world. —Who wants a dead cert for the Gold cup? he asked. Who wants your opinion? Who was he? Who was it told me his name? Who was M’Intosh? Who was telling me? Who was telling me? —Who was the letter from? he asked. Who watches me here? Who will we do it on? Who will woo you? —Who won, Mr Lenehan? says Terry. Who writes? Who wrote this? Whrrwhee! W. Hurley, C. C.; the rt rev. Whusky! W. H.: who am I? Why? Why? Why? Why? —Why? Why? Why? —Why? Why? Why? —Why? Why? Why? Why? Why? Why? Why? Why? —Why, answered the seafarer with the tartan beard, who seemingly was a bit of a literary cove in his own small way, staring out of seagreen portholes as you might well describe them as, I uses goggles reading. Why are their tongues so rough? Why, as he reflected, Irishtown strand, a locality he had not been in for quite a number of years looked different somehow since, as it happened, he went to reside on the north side. Why bring in a master of forensic eloquence like Whiteside? Why could he then support that his vigil with the greater equanimity? Why did absence of light disturb him less than presence of noise? Why did Bloom experience a sentiment of remorse? Why did Bloom refrain from stating that he had frequented the university of life? Why did he come? Why did he desist from speculation? Why did he not elaborate these calculations to a more precise result? Why did he not leave her his best bed if he wished her to snore away the rest of her nights in peace? Why did he take them rather than others? Why did I? Why did I run? Why did I smell it only now? Why didn’t you kiss the spot to make it well? Why didn’t you tell me before. Why did she me? Why did you enclose the stamps? Why did you write it then? Why does he send to one who is a buonaroba, a bay where all men ride, a maid of honour with a scandalous girlhood, a lordling to woo for him? Why do I always think Figather? —Why don’t you grow? asked Blazes Boylan. Why don’t you play them as I do? Why don’t you trust me more? Why do they call that thing they gave me nutsteak? Why do they hide their ears with seaweed hair? Why do you call me naught? Why do you not write your poetry in that language? Why, firstly and secondly, did he not consult the work in question? Why for the observer impressionability in addition to vigour, corporal proportion and commercial ability? —Why, God eternally curse your soul, Ben Dollard growled furiously, I threw out more clothes in my time than you ever saw. Why had they chosen all that part? Why hast thou done this abomination before me that thou didst spurn me for a merchant of jalaps and didst deny me to the Roman and to the Indian of dark speech with whom thy daughters did lie luxuriously? Why have women such eyes of witchery? Why, he could not but hear unless he had plugged him up the tube Understanding which he had not done. Why he fixed on me. Why he took such a rooted dislike to me. Why I bought her the violet garters. Why I left the church of Rome? Why I left the church of Rome. Why in? Why is that? Why is that, I wonder, or does it mean something perhaps? Why is the underplot of King Lear in which Edmund figures lifted out of Sidney’s Arcadia and spatchcocked on to a Celtic legend older than history? Why, I wonder. Why, look at our public life! Why, look at the man’s private life! Why me? Why might these several provisional contingencies between a guest and a hostess not necessarily preclude or be precluded by a permanent eventuality of reconciliatory union between a schoolfellow and a jew’s daughter? Why minor sad? Why Molly likes opoponax. Why more abnegation than jealousy, less envy than equanimity? Why mutable aliorelative? Why not? Why not? Why not? Why not? Why not bring in Henry Grattan and Flood and Demosthenes and Edmund Burke? Why not endless till the farthest star? —Why not? says J. J., when he’s quite sure which country it is. Why Ophelia committed suicide. Why pay more? Why she waved her hand. Why should I bring it down? Why should I not speak to him or to any human being who walks upright upon this oblate orange? Why similarly, why differently? —Why, sir? Why solitary ipsorelative? Why that highclass whore in Jammet’s wore her veil only to her nose. Why the barber in Drago’s always looked my face when I spoke his face in the glass. Why the cannibals cotton to it. —Why then not much, Father Cowley said. —Why, the sailor answered upon reflection upon it, I’ve circumnavigated a bit since I first joined on. —Why, the sailor answered with a slow puzzled utterance, my son, Danny? —Why, the sailor replied, relaxing to a certain extent under the magic influence of diamond cut diamond, it might be a matter of ten years. —Why, the sailor said, shifting his partially chewed plug. Why they call him Doughy Daw. Why they fear vermin, creeping things. Why they put tables upside down at night, I mean chairs upside down, on the tables in cafés. Why think of them? Why this infliction? Why those plainclothes men are always courting slaveys. Why was he doubly irritated? Why was the chant arrested at the conclusion of this first distich? Why was the host reluctant, unresisting still? Why was the host secret infidel silent? Why was the host victim predestined sad? Why we left the church of Rome. Why we think a deformed person or a hunchback clever if he says something we might say. —Why will you jews not accept our culture, our religion and our language? Why with satisfaction? Why would a recurrent frustration the more depress him? Why, you’re as bad as dear little Father Cantekissem, that you are! Wide brim. Widower I hate to see. Widowhood not the thing since the old queen died. —Widow woman, says Ned. Wife a good cook and washer. Wife and six children at home. Wife in every port they say. Wife in her throes. Wife ironing his back. Wife is oldish. Wife locked up at home, skeleton in the cupboard. —Wife well? —Wife well, I suppose? Wild excitement. Wild geese. Wildly I lay on her, kissed her: eyes, her lips, her stretched neck beating, woman’s breasts full in her blouse of nun’s veiling, fat nipples upright. Wild sea money. Will? Will any man love the daughter if he has not loved the mother? Will eat anything. Will happen too. Will happen, yes. —Will he not see reborn in her, with the memory of his own youth added, another image? Will I? William ✠. WILLIAM, ARCHBISHOP OF ARMAGH: In purple stock and shovel hat. D.; the rev. William Humble, earl of Dudley, and lady Dudley, accompanied by lieutenantcolonel Heseltine, drove out after luncheon from the viceregal lodge. William Shakespeare and company, limited. Will I get up? Will I give him a lift home? Will immensely splendiferous stander permit one stooder of most extreme poverty and one largesize grandacious thirst to terminate one expensive inaugurated libation? Will I tell him that horse Lenehan? —Will lift your glass with us. Will lift your tschink with tschunk. Will o’ the wisp. Will send when developed. Will she? Will she come here tomorrow? Will someone tell me where I am least likely to meet these necessary evils? Will some pleashe pershon not now impediment so catastrophics mit agitation of firstclass tablenumpkin? Will they wrest from us, from me, the palm of beauty? Will we be there by candlelight? Will write fully tomorrow. Will you be as gods? Will you come if I can get the aunt to fork out twenty quid? Will you to your power cause law and mercy to be executed in all your judgments in Ireland and territories thereunto belonging? —Will you try another, citizen? says Joe. —Will you wait in my study for a moment, Mr Deasy said, till I restore order here. —Will you write the address, sir? Willy’s hat and what the girls did with it. Wimple suited her small head. Windandwatery though. Windfall when he kicks out. Winding of his ticker. Windows open. 29 Windsor avenue. Wind their way through miles of omnivorous forest to sucksucculent her breast dry. Windy night that was I went to fetch her there was that lodge meeting on about those lottery tickets after Goodwin’s concert in the supperroom or oakroom of the Mansion house. Wine. Wine. Wine in my face. —Wine of the country, says he. Wine, peltries, Connemara marble, silver from Tipperary, second to none, our farfamed horses even today, the Irish hobbies, with king Philip of Spain offering to pay customs duties for the right to fish in our waters. Wine soaked and softened rolled pith of bread mustard a moment mawkish cheese. Winkle: cockles and periwinkles. Winner trained by Braime so that Lenehan’s version of the business was all pure buncombe. Winsomely she on Bloohimwhom smiled. Wiped his nose in curtain too. Wiping pens in their stockings. Wire in yet? Wireless intercontinental and interplanetary transmitters are set for reception of message. Wisdom while you wait. Wise Bloom eyed on the door a poster, a swaying mermaid smoking mid nice waves. Wise child that knows her father, Dedalus said. Wise men say. —Wise virgins, professor MacHugh said. Wish I could. Wish I could see his face, though. Wish I had a full length oilpainting of her then. Wish I hadn’t met that M’Coy fellow. Wish I hadn’t promised to meet. Wish she hadn’t called me sir. Wish they’d sing more. Wispish hair over her ears. Wit. With? With a belly on him like a poisoned pup. With a bewitching smile. —With a broken back, is it? With a cock with a carra. With a cock with a carra. With a cry he suddenly vanished and the panel slid back. With a cry of stormbirds. With a deft kick he sends it spinning to his crown and jauntyhatted skates in. With a dry snigger. With a gentle finger he felt ever so slowly the hair combed back above his ears. With a heart and a half if I could raise the wind anyhow. With a high ro! and a randy ro! and my galloping tearing tandy, O! Bow to the inevitable. With a keep quiet relief his eyes took note this is the street here middle of the day of Bob Doran’s bottle shoulders. With all his belongings on show. With all his faults she loved him still when he sang Tell me, Mary, how to woo thee or My love and cottage near Rochelle and they had stewed cockles and lettuce with Lazenby’s salad dressing for supper and when he sang The moon hath raised with Mr Dignam that died suddenly and was buried, God have mercy on him, from a stroke. With all the heart of her she longs to be his only, his affianced bride for riches for poor, in sickness in health, till death us two part, from this to this day forward. With an accent on the whose. With an adroit snap he catches it and bites it through with a crack. With a nervous twitch of his head. With a piercing epileptic cry she sinks on all fours, grunting, snuffling, rooting at his feet: then lies, shamming dead, with eyes shut tight, trembling eyelids, bowed upon the ground in the attitude of most excellent master. With a railway bloke. With a saffron kilt? With a slow nod Bloom conveys his gratitude as that is exactly what Stephen needs. With a squeak she flaps her bat shawl and runs. With a tear in his eye. With a touch of fear for the young man beside him whom he furtively scrutinised with an air of some consternation remembering he had just come back from Paris, the eyes more especially reminding him forcibly of father and sister, failing to throw much light on the subject, however, he brought to mind instances of cultured fellows that promised so brilliantly nipped in the bud of premature decay and nobody to blame but themselves. With a voice of whistling seawind. With a wand he beats time slowly. With awe Mr Power’s blank voice spoke: —Some say he is not in that grave at all. With beaded mitre and with crozier, stalled upon his throne, widower of a widowed see, with upstiffed omophorion, with clotted hinderparts. With bows a traitor servant. With brains, sir. With brief suspiration he reassumed the candle, reascended the stairs, reapproached the door of the front room, hallfloor, and reentered. With careful tread he passed over a hopscotch court with its forgotten pickeystone. With circumspection, as invariably when entering an abode his own or not his own: with solicitude, the snakespiral springs of the mattress being old, the brass quoits and pendent viper radii loose and tremulous under stress and strain: prudently, as entering a lair or ambush of lust or adders: lightly, the less to disturb: reverently, the bed of conception and of birth, of consummation of marriage and of breach of marriage, of sleep and of death. With clang tinkle boomhammer tallyho hornblower blue green yellow flashes Toft’s cumbersome turns with hobbyhorse riders from gilded snakes dangled, bowels fandango leaping spurn soil foot and fall again. With deep inspiration he returned, retraversing the garden, reentering the passage, reclosing the door. —With Dignam, says Alf. With envy he watched their faces: Edith, Ethel, Gerty, Lily. With faraway mourning mountain eye. With feeble vulture talons he feels the silent face of Bloom. With gaping mouth and head far back he stood still and, after an instant, sneezed loudly. With gibbering baboon’s cries he jerks his hips in the cynical spasm. With grace of alacrity towards the mirror gilt Cantrell and Cochrane’s she turned herself. With grace she tapped a measure of gold whisky from her crystal keg. With Hamilton Long’s syringe, the ladies’ friend. With hanging head he marches doggedly forward. With her weak blood and wheysour milk she had fed him and hid from sight of others his swaddling bands. With him together down... With him would he speak a word. With his bit of beard! With his mailed gauntlet he brushed away a furtive tear and was overheard, by those privileged burghers who happened to be in his immediate entourage, to murmur to himself in a faltering undertone: —God blimey if she aint a clinker, that there bleeding tart. With his name in Stubbs’s. With hoarse rude fury the yeoman cursed, swelling in apoplectic bitch’s bastard. With how many? With hungered flesh obscurely, he mutely craved to adore. With indirect and direct verbal allusions or affirmations: with subdued affection and admiration: with description: with impediment: with suggestion. Within womb won he worship. With it an abode of bliss. With it an abode of bliss. With it an abode of bliss. —With it, Simon. With J. J. O’Molloy he came forth slowly into Mary’s abbey where draymen were loading floats with sacks of carob and palmnut meal, O’Connor, Wexford. With John Wyse Nolan Mr Power followed them in. With Joseph the joiner I cannot agree. With little parted talons she captures his hand, her forefinger giving to his palm the passtouch of secret monitor, luring him to doom. With look to look. With me all or not at all. With mixed feelings. With mother’s money order, eight shillings, the banging door of the post office slammed in your face by the usher. With my eyeglass in my ocular.
