Yes, evening will find itself in me, without me. Yes, exactly. Yes, go. Yes, gold from anear by bronze from afar. Yes, he could. Yes, he does. Yes, her lips said more loudly, Mr Dollard. Yes, he said. —Yes, he said. Yes, he’s here still. —Yes, he was, he said, in Wisdom Hely’s. Yes I. Yes, I am here now. Yes, I believe it is the same objectionable person. Yes, I must. Yes, indeed. Yes, indeed. —Yes, indeed, the quaker librarian said. Yes, I remember. Yes, I saw him, Mr Bloom said. Yes, I suppose, at once. —Yes, I suppose it would be, he said. Yes, I think he has that queer thing genius. Yes, it is. Yes, it is. Yes, it is. Yes, it is true. Yes, it was Crofton met him one evening bringing her a pound of rumpsteak. Yes, it was her he was looking at, and there was meaning in his look. Yes, it was very probable that Father Bernard Vaughan would come again to preach. Yes, joy it must be. —Yes, Martin Cunningham said, fingering his beard. Yes, Menton. —Yes, Mr Best said youngly. —Yes, Mr Bloom answered. Yes, Mr Bloom crossed bridge of Yessex. —Yes, Mr Bloom said. —Yes, Mr Bloom said. —Yes, Mr Bloom said. —Yes, Mr Bloom said. —Yes, Mr Bloom said. —Yes, Mr Bloom said. —Yes, Mr Bloom said, and another thing I often thought, is to have municipal funeral trams like they have in Milan, you know. —Yes, Mr Bloom said, teasing the curling catgut line. Yes, Mr Bloom thoroughly agreed, entirely endorsing the remark, that was overwhelmingly right. —Yes, Mr Deasy said. —Yes, Mrs Breen said. —Yes, Mulligan said. Yes, must. —Yes, my love? —Yes, Ned Lambert said, with the wife’s brother. Yes now, look at it that way. —Yes, of course, he said, as they went on again. Yes: one, seven, six. Yes, Pious had told him of that land and Chaste had pointed him to the way but the reason was that in the way he fell in with a certain whore of an eyepleasing exterior whose name, she said, is Bird-in-the-Hand and she beguiled him wrongways from the true path by her flatteries that she said to him as, Ho, you pretty man, turn aside hither and I will show you a brave place, and she lay at him so flatteringly that she had him in her grot which is named Two-in-the-Bush or, by some learned, Carnal Concupiscence. Yes, puritanisme, it does though, Saint Joseph’s sovereign thievery alors Bandez! Yes, quite true. —Yes, Red Murray agreed. Yes, rendering obsolete popguns, elastic airbladders, games of hazard, catapults. —Yes, says Alf. —Yes, says Alf. —Yes, says Bloom. —Yes, says Bloom. —Yes, says J. J., and every male that’s born they think it may be their Messiah. —Yes, says J. J., but the truth of a libel is no defence to an indictment for publishing it in the eyes of the law. —Yes, says J. J. He’ll square that, Ned, says he. —Yes, says J. J. Looking for a private detective. Yes, she had known from the very first that her daydream of a marriage has been arranged and the weddingbells ringing for Mrs Reggy Wylie T. C. D. because the one who married the elder brother would be Mrs Wylie and in the fashionable intelligence Mrs Gertrude Wylie was wearing a sumptuous confection of grey trimmed with expensive blue fox was not to be. —Yes, she said. Yes, she was back. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. Yes, sir. —Yes, sir? Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. —Yes, sir. Yes, sir. Yes, sir. Yes, sir. Yes, sir. Yes, sir. Yes, sir. —Yes, sir, Ned Lambert said heartily. —Yes, sir, says he. —Yes, sir, says Terry. —Yes, sir, she said. —Yes, sir, Stephen said, turning back at the gate. —Yes, sir, the blond girl said. —Yes, sir, the chemist said. —Yes, sir, the chemist said. Yes, some spinach. —Yes, Stephen said uncertainly because he thought he felt a strange kind of flesh of a different man approach him, sinewless and wobbly and all that. Yes, Telegraph... —Yesterday! exclaimed Bloom till he remembered it was already tomorrow Friday. Yes, that. —Yes, that’s the best, he assured Stephen to whom for the matter of that Brazen Head or him or anywhere else was all more or less. —Yes, that’s the man, says J. J. Raping the women and girls and flogging the natives on the belly to squeeze all the red rubber they can out of them. —Yes? the professor said, skipping to get into step. Yes, there it, yes. Yes, there’s the light in the priest’s house. —Yes, the stripling answered. Yes: they were from Belvedere. —Yes, to be sure, Mr Bloom unaffectedly concurred. Yes: under the bridge. Yes, used to carry punched tickets to prove an alibi if they arrested you for murder somewhere. Yes, we seem to be forgetting her as Shakespeare himself forgot her. Yes, we will not. —Yes, what is it? Yes, yes. Yes, yes. —Yes, yes. Yes, yes. Yes, yes: a woman too. —Yes, yes, Mr Bloom said after a dull sigh. —Yes, yes, Mr Dedalus said dubiously. Yes, yes, will tell you. Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes, yes, yes. —Yes, your worship. Yet a chance word will call them forth suddenly and they will rise up to confront him in the most various circumstances, a vision or a dream, or while timbrel and harp soothe his senses or amid the cool silver tranquility of the evening or at the feast, at midnight, when he is now filled with wine. Yet Eve and the serpent contradicts. Yet here’s a spot. Yet he was young and perchance he might learn to love her in time. Yet if I went the whole hog, say: I want to, something like that. Yet I’ve a sort of a Yorkshire relish for My little Yorkshire rose. Yet more Bloom stretched his string. Yet someone had loved him, borne him in her arms and in her heart. Yet sometimes they repent too late. Yet still though his eyes were thick with sleep and sea air life was full of a host of things and coincidences of a terrible nature and it was quite within the bounds of possibility that it was not an entire fabrication though at first blush there was not much inherent probability in all the spoof he got off his chest being strictly accurate gospel. Yet that man’s father was his grandfather’s son. Yet they do. Yet they say, who was it told me, there is no carnal. Yet, though such criminal propensities had never been an inmate of his bosom in any shape or form, he certainly did feel and no denying it while inwardly remaining what he was a certain kind of admiration for a man who had actually brandished a knife, cold steel, with the courage of his political convictions though, personally, he would never be a party to any such thing, off the same bat as those love vendettas of the south, have her or swing for her, when the husband frequently, after some words passed between the two concerning her relations with the other lucky mortal he having had the pair watched, inflicted fatal injuries on his adored one as a result of an alternative postnuptial liaison by plunging his knife into her, until it just struck him that Fitz, nicknamed Skin-the-Goat, merely drove the car for the actual perpetrators of the outrage and so was not, if he was reliably informed, actually party to the ambush which, in point of fact, was the plea some legal luminary saved his skin on. Yet too much happy bores. Yet who knows after. Y lagging behind drew a chunk of bread from under his foreboard, crammed it into his mouth and munched as he walked. Y. M. C. A. Eating with a stopwatch, thirtytwo chews to the minute. Yo. Yogibogeybox in Dawson chambers. Yom Kippur fast spring cleaning of inside. Yook. Yooka. You? You. You abominable person! You and I are the fat in the fire. You and me, don’t you know: in the same boat. —You are a delusion, said roundly John Eglinton to Stephen. You are a necessary evil. You are a perfect stranger. You are a tribe of nomad herdsmen: we are a mighty people. You are cautioned. You are down and out and don’t you forget it, old bean. You are falling. —You are late, he spoke hoarsely, eying her with a suspicious glare. You are lovely, Gerty, it said. You are mine. You are mine. You are my guests. You are my lookingglass from night to morning. You are not fit to touch the garment of a pure woman. You are the link between nations and generations. —You are the only contributor to Dana who asks for pieces of silver. You are walking through it howsomever. You are your own master, it seems to me. You, Armstrong. —You, Armstrong, Stephen said. —You as a good catholic, he observed, talking of body and soul, believe in the soul. You ask for Carr. You bad man! You beast! —You behold in me, Stephen said with grim displeasure, a horrible example of free thought. You bitch’s bast. You bloody old Roman empire? You bore me away, framed me in oak and tinsel, set me above your marriage couch. You both belong to Ireland, the brain and the brawn. You bowed to yourself in the mirror, stepping forward to applause earnestly, striking face. You call it a festivity. You call me up by sunphone any old time. You can almost taste it, can’t you? You can apply your eye to the keyhole and play with yourself while I just go through her a few times. You can do it. “YOU CAN DO IT!” The editor laid a nervous hand on Stephen’s shoulder. You can do me a favour, Mr Dedalus, with some of your literary friends. —You can keep it, Mr Bloom said. You can make bacon of that. You cannot eat your cake and have it. You can pay all together, sir, when you come back. You can rub shoulders with a Jesus, a Gautama, an Ingersoll. You can’t. You can take it from here or from here. You can’t drink that stuff. —You can tell Barabbas from me, Ben Dollard said, that he can put that writ where Jacko put the nuts. You can’t lick ’em. [ 2 ] —You, Cochrane, what city sent for him? You coming long? You could go back perhaps, he hasarded, still thinking of the very unpleasant scene at Westland Row terminus when it was perfectly evident that the other two, Mulligan, that is, and that English tourist friend of his, who eventually euchred their third companion, were patently trying as if the whole bally station belonged to them to give Stephen the slip in the confusion, which they did. You could grow any mortal thing in Irish soil, he stated, and there was that colonel Everard down there in Navan growing tobacco. —You could have knelt down, damn it, Kinch, when your dying mother asked you, Buck Mulligan said. You could hear them in Paris and New York. You could see there was a story behind it. You could tear up a cheque for a hundred pounds in the same way. —You could try our friend, Mr Power suggested backward. You crossed her last wish in death and yet you sulk with me because I don’t whinge like some hired mute from Lalouette’s. You daren’t budge. —You did, averred Ben Dollard. You did that. You die for your country. You don’t? —You don’t grasp my point, says Bloom. You don’t know yet what money is. You don’t say so? You don’t stand for that, I suppose? You don’t want a scandal. You down here in the haunts of sin! You fee mendancers on the Riviera, I read. You fenians forget some things. You find my words dark. You flew. You found me in evil company, highkickers, coster picnicmakers, pugilists, popular generals, immoral panto boys in fleshtights and the nifty shimmy dancers, La Aurora and Karini, musical act, the hit of the century. You frittered away your time, he very sensibly maintained, and health and also character besides which, the squandermania of the thing, fast women of the demimonde ran away with a lot of £. s. d. into the bargain and the greatest danger of all was who you got drunk with though, touching the much vexed question of stimulants, he relished a glass of choice old wine in season as both nourishing and bloodmaking and possessing aperient virtues notably a good burgundy which he was a staunch believer in still never beyond a certain point where he invariably drew the line as it simply led to trouble all round to say nothing of your being at the tender mercy of others practically. You funny ass, you! You got me? —You got more than that, father, Dilly said. —You got some, Dilly said, looking in his eyes. —You had better get your stick and go out to the others, Stephen said as he followed towards the door the boy’s graceless form. You had better hand over that cash to me to take care of. You had enough. You had to come back. You had to laugh at her sometimes. You have a car?... You have broken the spell. You have brought us all this way to show us a French triangle. You have but emerged from primitive conditions: we have a literature, a priesthood, an agelong history and a polity. You have earned it. You have eaten all we left. You have eaten all we left, I suppose. You have every bit as much right to live by your pen in pursuit of your philosophy as the peasant has. You have heard of von Blum Pasha. You have lashed the dormant tigress in my nature into fury. You have made your secondbest bed and others must lie in it. You have no... You have no cities nor no wealth: our cities are hives of humanity and our galleys, trireme and quadrireme, laden with all manner merchandise furrow the waters of the known globe. You have nothing? You have said it. You have some. You have spoken of the past and its phantoms, Stephen said. You have that something within, the higher self. You have the advantage of me. You have two copies there. You hear? You hear? You heard him say he was going to Clare. You hit him without provocation. You horrid thing! You hurt? You intended to devote an entire year to the study of the religious problem and the summer months of 1886 to square the circle and win that million. You just buy one of these machines. You just shove in my name if I’m not there, will you? —You just took the words out of my mouth, he said. You kept them for the last, didn’t you? You know, councillor, the Manx parliament. You know, Dedalus, you have the real Oxford manner. You know Holohan? You know Hoppy? You know how. You know how difficult it is. You know how he made his mark? You know I had a soft corner for you. You know Jem Mullins? You know Manningham’s story of the burgher’s wife who bade Dick Burbage to her bed after she had seen him in Richard III and how Shakespeare, overhearing, without more ado about nothing, took the cow by the horns and, when Burbage came knocking at the gate, answered from the capon’s blankets: William the conqueror came before Richard III. You know me. —You know Simon Dedalus? he asked at length. You know that old joke, rose of Castile. You know that one? You know that red Carlisle girl, Lily? You know the usual. You know why? —You know yourself, councillor, just what he wants. You larn that go off of they there Frenchy bilks? —You like it? You little expected me but I’ve come to stay and make a fresh start. You little know what’s in store for you. You’ll all get a short shrift and a long day from me. You’ll be home the night! You’ll be soon over it. You’ll be taught the error of your ways. You’ll find them very handy. You’ll get curvature of the spine. You’ll get into trouble. You’ll look spiffing in them. You’ll meet with a... You’ll need to rise precious early, you sinner there, if you want to diddle the Almighty God. You’ll pull it out somewhere and lose it. You look as though you had done the deed. You look damn well when you’re dressed. You look like a fellow that had lost a bob and found a tanner. You look like communards. You love a certain person. —You make good use of the name, John Eglinton allowed. You may. You may have heard perhaps. You may mention my name. You mean that I... You mean that knockkneed mother’s darling who seems to be slightly crawsick? You met with poor old Ireland and how does she stand? You might go farther and fare worse. You might pick up a young widow here. You might put down my name at the funeral, will you? You might put in a good word for us to get me taken on there. You move a motion? You must. You must believe. You must have a certain fascination: Parnell. —You must have been a doaty, miss Douce made answer. —You must have seen a fair share of the world, the keeper remarked, leaning on the counter. You must laugh sometimes so better do it that way. You must read them in the original. You must take the will for the deed. You naughtn’t to look, missus, so you naughtn’t when a lady’s ashowing of her elemental. You naughty too? You needn’t try to hide, I says to him. You never saw him any way screwed but still and for all that she would not like him for a father because he was too old or something or on account of his face it was a palpable case of Doctor Fell or his carbuncly nose with the pimples on it and his sandy moustache a bit white under his nose. You never saw the like of it in all your born puff. You never seen me in the mantrap with a married highlander, says I. Young! Young! Young. Young Colum and Starkey. Younger than I am. Young hopeful will be christened Mortimer Edward after the influential third cousin of Mr Purefoy in the Treasury Remembrancer’s office, Dublin Castle. Young kisses: the first. Young life, her lips that gave me pouting. Young shouts of moneyed voices in Clive Kempthorpe’s rooms. Young Stephen said indeed to his best remembrance they had but the one doxy between them and she of the stews to make shift with in delights amorous for life ran very high in those days and the custom of the country approved with it. Young student. Young student. Young student. Young woman. Young woman enters. You not come? You once nobble that, congregation, and a buck joyride to heaven becomes a back number. You ought to be ducked in the horsepond, you rotter! You ought to be thoroughly well ashamed of yourself. You ought to eat. You ought to eat more solid food. You ought to make it a dialogue, don’t you know, like the Platonic dialogues Wilde wrote. You ought to see yourself! You owe it. You pay eighty marks and they plant a dunam of land for you with olives, oranges, almonds or citrons. —You pique my curiosity, Haines said amiably. You prayed to the Blessed Virgin that you might not have a red nose. You prayed to the devil in Serpentine avenue that the fubsy widow in front might lift her clothes still more from the wet street. —You pray to a local and obscure idol: our temples, majestic and mysterious, are the abodes of Isis and Osiris, of Horus and Ammon Ra. You punish me? Your absurd name, an ancient Greek! Your attention! —Your beau, is it? Your boy’s thinking of you. Your Christmas dinner for threepence. Your classic curves, beautiful immortal, I was glad to look on you, to praise you, a thing of beauty, almost to pray. Your corporosity sagaciating O K? How’s the squaws and papooses? Your dean of studies holds he was a holy Roman. You’re after hitting me. You’re a rogue and I’m another. You’re a witness. You’re blinder nor I am, you bitch’s bastard! You’re darned witty. You’re dreaming. You’re hot! —You’re in black, I see. —You’re in Dawson street, Mr Bloom said. You’re in for it this time! You’re like someone I knew once. You’re like the rest of them, are you? —You’re looking extra. —You’re looking rubicund, George Lidwell said. You’re looking splendid. You’re looking splendid. You remember me, sir Leo, when you were in number seven. You remember the Childs fratricide case. —You’re not a believer, are you? You’re not game, in fact. You’re not his father, are you? —You’re not my sister, naughty Tommy said. Your epitaph is written. You’re right, by God. —You’re right there, Nosey Flynn said. You’re scalding! You’re such a slyboots, old cocky. You’re sure? —You’re the essence of vulgarity, she in gliding said. You’re the warrior. You’re too beastly awfully weird for words! —You’re very funny, Dilly said, grinning. You’re very simple, I don’t think. —You’re welcome, sir, Ned Lambert said. Your eyes are as vapid as the glasseyes of your stuffed fox. You’re your father’s son. Your fly is open, mister! —Your friends are inside, Mr Lidwell. Your funeral’s tomorrow While you’re coming through the rye. Your God. Your God was a jew. Your god was a jew. Your governor is just gone. —Your hat is a little crushed, Mr Bloom said pointing. Your head it simply. Your head it simply swirls. Your head it simply swurls. Your head it simply swurls. Your heart perhaps but what price the fellow in the six feet by two with his toes to the daisies? Your heart you sing of. Your mother and some visitor came out of the drawingroom. Your name entered for life as owner in the book of the union. Your name on the altarlist. Your own? Your own name is strange enough. Your postprandial, do you know that word? Your reasons, pray? Yours? Yours for the asking. —Your son and heir. Yours serfdom, awe and humbleness: ours thunder and the seas. Your starving eyes and allbeplastered neck you stole my heart, O gluepot. Your strength our weakness. Your terrible loss. Your wife and my wife. —You said, Stephen answered, O, it’s only Dedalus whose mother is beastly dead. You sang that song to me. You saved men from drowning. —You saw his ghost then, says Joe, God between us and harm. You saw only your mother die. You say right, sir. —You? says Joe. You see? You see, he, Dignam, I mean, didn’t serve any notice of the assignment on the company at the time and nominally under the act the mortgagee can’t recover on the policy. You see he’s incapable. You see if you can get it into your two papers. You seem to have enjoyed yourself. —You seen queer sights, don’t be talking, put in a jarvey. You see the idea is to tour the chief towns. You shall find that these night insects follow the light. You should have seen long John’s eye. —You should see him, he said, when his body loses its balance. You simply don’t knock against those kind of women here. You, sir? Yous join uz, dear sir? You spent most of it in Georgina Johnson’s bed, clergyman’s daughter. —You suspect, Stephen retorted with a sort of a half laugh, that I may be important because I belong to the faubourg Saint Patrice called Ireland for short. —You take my breath away. Youth. —You think me an old fogey and an old tory, his thoughtful voice said. You think the ladies love you! Youth led by Experience visits Notoriety. You told the Clongowes gentry you had an uncle a judge and an uncle a general in the army. You too. You too have fought the good fight and played loyally your man’s part. You’ve a hard chancre. You wanted to. You watch them chaps. You were a lucky dog if they didn’t set the terrier at you directly you got back. You were always a favourite with the ladies. You were and a bloody sight better. You were a nicelooking Miriam when you clipped off your backgate hairs and lay swooning in the thing across the bed as Mrs Dandrade about to be violated by lieutenant Smythe-Smythe, Mr Philip Augustus Blockwell M. P., signor Laci Daremo, the robust tenor, blueeyed Bert, the liftboy, Henri Fleury of Gordon Bennett fame, Sheridan, the quadroon Croesus, the varsity wetbob eight from old Trinity, Ponto, her splendid Newfoundland and Bobs, dowager duchess of Manorhamilton. You were a student, weren’t you? You were awfully holy, weren’t you? You were going to do wonders, what? —You were making tea, Stephen said, and went across the landing to get more hot water. You were never here before, Jack, were you? You were not born to be a teacher, I think. —You were speaking of the gaseous vertebrate, if I mistake not? he asked of Stephen. You what? —You what? says Joe, throwing down the letters. You whatwhat? You which? You who hear in peace. You will be laced with cruel force into vicelike corsets of soft dove coutille with whalebone busk to the diamondtrimmed pelvis, the absolute outside edge, while your figure, plumper than when at large, will be restrained in nettight frocks, pretty two ounce petticoats and fringes and things stamped, of course, with my houseflag, creations of lovely lingerie for Alice and nice scent for Alice. You will dance attendance or I’ll lecture you on your misdeeds, Miss Ruby, and spank your bare bot right well, miss, with the hairbrush. You will fall. You will not be master of others or their slave. —You will say those names were already in the chronicles from which he took the stuff of his plays. You will see. You will see at the next outbreak they will put an embargo on Irish cattle. You will see my ghost after death. You will see who. You will shed your male garments, you understand, Ruby Cohen? and don the shot silk luxuriously rustling over head and shoulders. You won’t get a virgin in the flash houses. You would feel a different man. You would give your five wits for youth’s proud livery he pranks in. You would have a better chance of lighting it if you held the match nearer. You would have preferred the fighting parson who founded the protestant error. You would have to travel many a long mile before you found a head of hair the like of that. You would imagine that would get played out pretty quick. You wouldn’t do a less thing. You wouldn’t kneel down to pray for your mother on her deathbed when she asked you. You wouldn’t see a trace of them or their language anywhere in Europe except in a cabinet d’aisance. Yrfmstbyes. Yum. Yummyyum, Womwom! Yumyum. Yup, sartin I do. —Zinfandel is it? Zinfandel’s the favourite, Lord Howard de Walden’s, won at Epsom. Zoe! Zoe! Zoe and Bloom reach the doorway where two sister whores are seated. ZOE AND FLORRY: Laugh together. Zoe and Kitty still point right. ZOE: And more’s mother? Zoe and Stephen turn boldly with looser swing. ZOE: And you know what thought did? ZOE: Are you looking for someone? ZOE: Babby! ZOE: Before you’re twice married and once a widower. Zoe bends over the table. ZOE: Briskly. ZOE: Catches a stray hair deftly and twists it to her coil. ZOE: Clap on the back for Zoe. ZOE: Do as you’re bid. ZOE: Examining Stephen’s palm. ZOE: Explodes in laughter. ZOE: Fanning herself with the grate fan. ZOE-FANNY: I let him larrup it into me for the fun of it. ZOE: Flattered. ZOE: Forfeits, a fine thing and a superfine thing. ZOE: For Zoe? ZOE: Gaily. ZOE: Give a thing and take it back God’ll ask you where is that You’ll say you don’t know God’ll send you down below. ZOE: Glibly. ZOE: Go abroad and love a foreign lady. ZOE: Go on. ZOE: Here. ZOE: Her head perched aside in mock pride. ZOE: Her lucky hand instantly saving him. Zoe Higgins, a young whore in a sapphire slip, closed with three bronze buckles, a slim black velvet fillet round her throat, nods, trips down the steps and accosts him. ZOE: Holds up her hand. ZOE: How’s the nuts? ZOE: I feel it. ZOE: I’m giddy! ZOE: In sudden alarm. ZOE: In sudden sulks. ZOE: In the doorway. ZOE: I see, says the blind man. ZOE: Is he hungry? ZOE: It was a commercial traveller married her and took her away with him. ZOE: Ladies first, gentlemen after. ZOE: Lifting up her pettigown and folding a half sovereign into the top of her stocking. ZOE: Lightly. ZOE: Me. ZOE: More limelight, Charley. ZOE: Mount of the moon. Zoe mou sas agapo. ZOE: Murmuring singsong with the music, her odalisk lips lusciously smeared with salve of swinefat and rosewater. ZOE: No, eightyone. Zoe offers him chocolate. ZOE: Peering at Bloom’s palm. ZOE: Pointing. ZOE: Points. ZOE: Promptly. ZOE: Pulling at Florry. ZOE: Quickly. ZOE: Runs to stephen and links him. Zoe runs to the chandelier and, crooking her leg, adjusts the mantle. ZOE: Silent means consent. ZOE: Sniffs his hair briskly. ZOE: Spouts walrus smoke through her nostrils. ZOE: Stiffly, her finger in her neckfillet. ZOE: Talk away till you’re black in the face. ZOE: Tears open the silverfoil. ZOE: That’s me. ZOE: The devil is in that door. ZOE: There was a priest down here two nights ago to do his bit of business with his coat buttoned up. ZOE: Thursday’s child has far to go. ZOE: To Florry. ZOE: Tragically. ZOE: Turns. ZOE: Turns the drumhandle. ZOE: Twirling, her hand to her brow. ZOE: Twirls round herself, heeltapping. ZOE: What day were you born? Zoe whispers to Florry. Zoe whispers to her. ZOE: Who has a fag as I’m here? ZOE: Widening her slip to screen her. ZOE: Yes. ZOE: Yorkshire through and through. ZOE: You both in black. ZOE: You’ll know me the next time. Zoo. Zrads and zrads, zrads, zrads. Zut!
